verses.text: ) And again, "I went out from the Father, and am come".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:10
verses.text: ( John xvi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:11
verses.text: ) And in many places one may see this.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:12
verses.text: But Paul calls it an [eisodus or] coming in, saying, "And when again He bringeth in the First-Begotten into the world," meaning by this Bringing in, His taking on Him flesh.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:13
verses.text: Now why has he so used the expression? The things signified [thereby] are manifest, and in what respect it is [thus] said.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:14
verses.text: For Christ indeed calls it a Going out, justly; for we were out from God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:15
verses.text: For as in royal palaces, prisoners and those who have offended the king, stand without, and he who desires to reconcile them, does not bring them in, but himself going out discourses with them, until having made them meet for the king's presence, he may bring them in, so also Christ hath done.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:16
verses.text: Having gone out to us, that is, having taken flesh, and having discoursed to us of the King's matters, so He brought us in, having purged the sins, and made reconciliation.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:17
verses.text: Therefore he calls it a Going out.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:18
verses.text: But Paul names it a Coming in, from the metaphor of those who come to an inheritance and receive any portion or possession.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:19
verses.text: For the saying, "and when again He bringeth in the First-Begotten into the world," means this, "when he putteth the world into His hand".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:20
verses.text: For when He was made known, then also He obtained possession of the whole thereof, He saith not these things concerning God The Word, but concerning that which is according to the flesh.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:21
verses.text: For if according to John, "He was in the world, and the world was made by Him" ( John i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:22
verses.text: ): how is He "brought in," otherwise than in the flesh?  "And," saith he, "Let all the angels of God worship Him".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:23
verses.text: Whereas he is about to say something great and lofty, he prepares it beforehand, and makes it acceptable, in that he represents the Father as "bringing in" the Son.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:24
verses.text: He had said above, that "He spake to us not by prophets but by His Son"; that the Son is superior to angels; yea and he establishes this from the name [Son].

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:25
verses.text: And here, in what follows, from another fact also.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:26
verses.text: What then may this be? From worship.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:27
verses.text: And he shows how much greater He is, as much as a Master is than a slave; just as any one introducing another into a house straightway commands those having the care thereof to do him reverence; [so] saying in regard to the Flesh, "And let all the Angels of God worship Him".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:28
verses.text: Is it then Angels only? No; for hear what follows: "And of His Angels He saith, Which maketh His Angels spirits, and His ministers a flame of fire: but unto the Son, Thy Throne, O God, is for ever and ever".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:29
verses.text: Behold, the greatest difference! that they are created, but He uncreated.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:30
verses.text: While of His angels He saith, who "maketh"; wherefore of the Son did He not say "Who maketh"? Although he might have expressed the difference as follows: "Of His Angels He saith, Who maketh His Angels spirits, but of the Son, 'The Lord created Me': 'God hath made Him Lord and Christ.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:31
verses.text: '" ( Prov.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:32
verses.text: viii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:33
verses.text: ; Acts ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:34
verses.text: ) But neither was the one spoken concerning the Son, nor the other concerning God The Word, but concerning the flesh.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:35
verses.text: For when he desired to express the true difference, he no longer included angels only, but the whole ministering power above.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:36
verses.text: Seest thou how he distinguishes, and with how great clearness, between creatures and Creator, ministers and Lord, the Heir and true Son, and slaves?   "But unto the Son he saith, Thy throne, O God, is for ever and ever".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:37
verses.text: Behold a symbol of Kingly Office.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:38
verses.text: "A scepter of righteousness is the scepter of Thy kingdom".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:39
verses.text: Behold again another symbol of Royalty.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:40
verses.text: Then again with respect to the flesh ( ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:41
verses.text: ) "Thou hast loved righteousness and hated iniquity, therefore God, even Thy God, hath anointed Thee".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:42
verses.text: What is, "Thy God"? Why, after that he hath uttered a great word, he again qualifieth it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:43
verses.text: Here he hits both Jews, and the followers of Paul of Samosata, and the Arians, and Marcellus, and Sabellius, and Marcion.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:44
verses.text: How? The Jews, by his indicating two Persons, both God and Man; the other Jews, I mean the followers of Paul of Samosata, by thus discoursing concerning His eternal existence, and uncreated essence: for by way of distinction, against the word, "He made," he put, "Thy throne, O God, is for ever and ever".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:45
verses.text: Against the Arians there is both this same again, and also that He is not a slave; but if a creature, He is a slave.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:46
verses.text: And against Marcellus and the others, that these are two Persons, distinguished in reference to their subsistence.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:47
verses.text: And against the Marcionites, that the Godhead is not anointed, but the Manhood.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:48
verses.text: Next he saith, "Above Thy fellows".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:49
verses.text: But who are these His "fellows" other than men? that is Christ received "not the Spirit by measure".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:50
verses.text: ( John iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:51
verses.text: ) Seest thou how with the doctrine concerning His uncreated nature he always joins also that of the "Economy"? what can be clearer than this? Didst thou see how what is created and what is begotten are not the same? For otherwise he would not have made the distinction, nor in contrast to the word, "He made" [&c.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:52
verses.text: ], have added, "But unto the Son He said, Thy throne, O God, is for ever and ever".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:53
verses.text: Nor would he have called the name, "Son, a more excellent Name," if it is a sign of the same thing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:54
verses.text: For what is the excellence? For if that which is created, and that which is begotten be the same, and they [the Angels] were made, what is there [in Him] "more excellent"? Lo! again ὁ Θεὸς, "God," with the Article.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:55
verses.text: And again he saith ( ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:56
verses.text: – ): "Thou Lord in the beginning hast laid the foundation of the earth, and the heavens are the works of Thine hands.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:57
verses.text: They shall perish, but Thou remainest, and they shall all wax old as a garment, and as a vesture shalt Thou fold them up, and they shall be changed: but Thou art the same and Thy years shall not fail".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:58
verses.text: Lest hearing the words, "and when He bringeth in the First-Begotten into the world"; thou shouldest think it as it were a Gift afterwards super-added to Him; above, he both corrected this beforehand, and again further corrects, saying, "in the beginning": not now, but from the first.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:59
verses.text: See again he strikes both Paul of Samosata and also Arius a mortal blow, applying to the Son the things which relate to the Father.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:60
verses.text: And withal he has also intimated another thing by the way, greater even than this.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:61
verses.text: For surely he hath incidentally pointed out also the transfiguration of the world, saying, "they shall wax old as a garment, and as a vesture Thou shalt fold them up, and they shall be changed".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:62
verses.text: Which also he saith in the Epistle to the Romans, that he shall transfigure the world.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:63
verses.text: (See Rom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:64
verses.text: viii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:65
verses.text: ) And showing the facility thereof, he adds, as if a man should fold up a garment so shall He both fold up and change it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:66
verses.text: But if He with so much ease works the transfiguration and the creation to what is better and more perfect, needed He another for the inferior creation? How far doth your shamelessness go? At the same time too this is a very great consolation, to know that things will not be as they are, but they all shall receive change, and all shall be altered, but He Himself remaineth ever existing, and living without end: "and Thy years," he saith, "shall not fail".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:67
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:68
verses.text: "But to which of the Angels said He at any time, Sit thou on My right hand until I make thine enemies thy footstool?" Behold, again he encourages them, inasmuch as their enemies were to be worsted, and their enemies are the same also with Christ's.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:69
verses.text: This again belongs to Sovereignty, to Equal Dignity, to Honor and not weakness, that the Father should be angry for the things done to the Son.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:70
verses.text: This belongs to His great Love and honor towards the Son, as of a father towards a son.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:71
verses.text: For He that is angry in His behalf how is He a stranger to Him? Which also he saith in the second Psalm, "He that dwelleth in heaven shall laugh them to scorn, and the Lord shall have them in derision.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:72
verses.text: Then shall He speak unto them in His wrath, and vex them in His sore displeasure".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:73
verses.text: ( Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:74
verses.text: ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:76
verses.text: ) And again He Himself saith, "Those that would not that I should reign over them, bring hither before Me, and slay them".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:77
verses.text: ( Luke xix.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:78
verses.text: ) For that they are His own words, hear also what He saith in another place, "How often would I have gathered thy children together, and ye would not! Behold, your house is left desolate".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:79
verses.text: ( Luke xiii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:81
verses.text: ) And again, "The kingdom shall be taken from you, and shall be given to a nation bringing forth the fruits thereof".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:82
verses.text: ( Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:83
verses.text: xxi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:84
verses.text: ) And again, "He that falleth upon that stone shall be broken, but on whomsoever It shall fall, It will grind him to powder".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:85
verses.text: ( Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:86
verses.text: xxi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:87
verses.text: ) And besides, He who is to be their Judge in that world, much more did He Himself repay them in this.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:88
verses.text: So that the words "Till I make thine enemies thy footstool" are expressive of honor only towards the Son.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:89
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:90
verses.text: "Are they not all ministering spirits, sent forth to minister for them who shall be heirs of salvation?" What marvel (saith he) if they minister to the Son, when they minister even to our salvation? See how he lifts up their minds, and shows the great honor which God has for us, since He has assigned to Angels who are above us this ministration on our behalf.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:91
verses.text: As if one should say, for this purpose (saith he) He employs them; this is the office of Angels, to minister to God for our salvation.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:92
verses.text: So that it is an angelical work, to do all for the salvation of the brethren: or rather it is the work of Christ Himself, for He indeed saves as Lord, but they as servants.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:93
verses.text: And we, though servants are yet Angels' fellow-servants.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:94
verses.text: Why gaze ye so earnestly on the Angels (saith he)? They are servants of the Son of God, and are sent many ways for our sakes, and minister to our salvation.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:95
verses.text: And so they are partners in service with us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:96
verses.text: Consider ye how he ascribes no great difference to the kinds of creatures.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:97
verses.text: And yet the space between angels and men is great; nevertheless he brings them down near to us, all but saying, For us they labor, for our sake they run to and fro: on us, as one might say, they wait.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:98
verses.text: This is their ministry, for our sake to be sent every way.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:99
verses.text: And of these examples both the Old [Testament] is full, and the New.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:100
verses.text: For when Angels bring glad tidings to the shepherds, or to Mary, or to Joseph; when they sit at the sepulcher, when they are sent to say to the disciples, "Ye men of Galilee, why stand ye gazing up into heaven?" ( Acts i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:101
verses.text: ), when they release Peter out of the prison, when they discourse with Philip, consider how great the honor is; when God sends His Angels for ministers as to friends; when to Cornelius [an Angel] appears, when [an Angel] brings forth all the apostles from the prison, and says, "Go, stand and speak in the temple to the people the words of this life" ( Acts v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:102
verses.text: ); and to Paul himself also an Angel appears.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:103
verses.text: Dost thou see that they minister to us on God's behalf, and that they minister to us in the greatest matters? wherefore Paul saith, "All things are yours, whether life or death, or the world, or things present, or things to come".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:104
verses.text: (  Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:105
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:106
verses.text: )  Well then the Son also was sent, but not as a servant, nor as a minister, but as a Son, and Only-Begotten, and desiring the same things with the Father.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:107
verses.text: Rather indeed, He was not "sent": for He did not pass from place to place, but took on Him flesh: whereas these change their places, and leaving those in which they were before, so come to others in which they were not.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:108
verses.text: And by this again he incidentally encourages them, saying, What fear ye? Angels are ministering to us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:109
verses.text: And having spoken concerning the Son, both what related to the Economy, and what related to the Creation, and to His sovereignty, and having shown His co-equal dignity, and that as absolute Master He ruleth not men only but also the powers above, he next exhorts them, having made out his argument, that we ought to give heed to the things which have been heard.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:111
verses.text: ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:112
verses.text: ) "Wherefore we ought to give more earnest heed" (saith he) "to the things which we have heard".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:113
verses.text: Why "more earnest"? Here he meant "more earnest" than to the Law: but he suppressed the actual expression of it, and yet makes it plain in the course of reasoning, not in the way of counsel, nor of exhortation.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:114
verses.text: For so it was better.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:115
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:117
verses.text: "For if the word spoken by Angels" (saith he) "was steadfast, and every transgression and disobedience received a just recompense of reward; how shall we escape if we neglect so great salvation, which at the first began to be spoken to us by the Lord, and was confirmed unto us by them that heard Him?"  Why ought we to "give more earnest heed to the things which we have heard"? were not those former things of God, as well as these? Either then he meaneth "more earnest" than [to] the Law, or "very earnest"; not making comparison, God forbid.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:118
verses.text: For since, on account of the long space of time, they had a great opinion of the Old Covenant, but these things had been despised as yet new, he proves (more than his argument required) that we ought rather to give heed to these.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:119
verses.text: How? By saying in effect, Both these and those are of God, but not in a like manner.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:120
verses.text: And this he shows us afterwards: but for the present he treats it somewhat superficially, but afterwards more clearly, saying "For if that first covenant had been faultless" ( c.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:121
verses.text: viii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:122
verses.text: ), and many other such things: "for that which decayeth and waxeth old is ready to vanish away".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:124
verses.text: viii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:125
verses.text: ) But as yet he ventures not to say any such thing in the beginning of his discourse, nor until he shall have first occupied and possessed his hearer by his fuller [arguments].

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:126
verses.text: Why then ought we "to give more earnest heed"? "Lest at any time," saith he, "we should let them slip"—that is, lest at any time we should perish, lest we should fall away.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:127
verses.text: And here he shows the grievousness of this falling away, in that it is a difficult thing for that which hath fallen away to return again, inasmuch as it hath happened through wilful negligence.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:128
verses.text: And he took this form of speech from the Proverbs.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:129
verses.text: For, saith he, "my son [take heed] lest thou fall away" ( Prov.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:130
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:131
verses.text: , LXX.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:132
verses.text: ), showing both the easiness of the fall, and the grievousness of the ruin.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:133
verses.text: That is, our disobedience is not without danger.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:134
verses.text: And while by his mode of reasoning he shows that the chastisement is greater, yet again he leaves it in the form of a question, and not in the conclusion.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:135
verses.text: For indeed this is to make one's discourse inoffensive, when one does not in every case of one's self infer the judgment, but leaves it in the power of the hearer himself to give sentence: and this would render them more open to conviction.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:136
verses.text: And both the prophet Nathan doth the same in the Old [Testament], and in Matthew Christ, saying, "What will He do to the husbandmen" ( Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:137
verses.text: xxi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:138
verses.text: ) of that vineyard? so compelling them to give sentence themselves: for this is the greatest victory.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:139
verses.text: Next, when he had said, "For if the word which was spoken by Angels was steadfast"—he did not add, much more that by Christ: but letting this pass, he said what is less, "How shall we escape, if we neglect so great salvation?" And see how he makes the comparison.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:140
verses.text: "For if the word which was spoken by Angels," saith he.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:141
verses.text: There, "by Angels," here, "by the Lord"—and there "a word," but here, "salvation".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:142
verses.text: Then lest any man should say, Thy sayings, O Paul, are they Christ's? he proves their trustworthiness both from his having heard these things of Him, and from their being now spoken by God; since not merely a voice is wafted, as in the case of Moses, but signs are done, and facts bear witness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:143
verses.text: But what is this, "For if the word spoken by Angels was steadfast"? For in the Epistle to the Galatians also he saith to this effect, "Being ordained by angels in the hand of a Mediator".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:144
verses.text: ( Gal.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:145
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:146
verses.text: ) And again, "Ye received a law by the disposition of Angels, and have not kept it".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:147
verses.text: ( Acts vii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:148
verses.text: ) And everywhere he saith it was given by angels.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:149
verses.text: Some indeed say that Moses is signified; but without reason.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:150
verses.text: For here he says Angels in the plural: and the Angels too which he here speaks of, are those in Heaven.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:151
verses.text: What then is it? Either he means the Decalogue only (for there Moses spake, and God answered him— Ex.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:152
verses.text: xix.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:153
verses.text: ),—or that angels were present, God disposing them in order,—or that he speaks thus in regard of all things said and done in the old Covenant, as if Angels had part in them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:154
verses.text: But how is it said in another place, "The Law was given by Moses" ( John i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:155
verses.text: ), and here "by Angels"? For it is said, "And God came down in thick darkness".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:156
verses.text: ( Ex.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:157
verses.text: xix.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:159
verses.text: )  "For if the word spoken by angels was steadfast".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:160
verses.text: What is "was steadfast"? True, as one may say; and faithful in its proper season; and all the things which had been spoken came to pass.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:161
verses.text: Either this is his meaning, or that they prevailed, and the threatenings were coming to be accomplished.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:162
verses.text: Or by "the word" he means injunctions.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:163
verses.text: For apart from the Law, Angels sent from God enjoined many things: for instance at Bochim, in the Judges, in [the history of] Samson.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:164
verses.text: ( Judg.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:165
verses.text: ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:166
verses.text: ; xiii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:167
verses.text: ) For this is the cause why he said not "the Law" but "the word".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:168
verses.text: And he seems to me haply rather to mean this, viz.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:169
verses.text: , those things which are committed to the management of angels.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:170
verses.text: What shall we say then? The angels who were entrusted with the charge of the nation were then present, and they themselves made the trumpets, and the other things, the fire, the thick darkness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:171
verses.text: ( Ex.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:172
verses.text: xix.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:173
verses.text: )  "And every transgression and disobedience," saith he.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:174
verses.text: Not this one and that one, but "every" one.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:175
verses.text: Nothing, he saith, remained unavenged, but "received a just recompense of reward," instead of [saying] punishment.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:176
verses.text: Why now spake he thus? Such is the manner of Paul, not to make much account of his phrases, but indifferently to put down words of evil sound, even in matters of good meaning.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:177
verses.text: As also in another place he saith, "Bringing into captivity every thought to the obedience of Christ".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:178
verses.text: (  Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:179
verses.text: x.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:180
verses.text: ) And again he hath put "the recompense" for punishment, as here he calleth punishment "reward".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:181
verses.text: "If it be a righteous thing," he saith, "with God to recompense tribulation to them that trouble you, and to you who are troubled rest".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:182
verses.text: (  Thess.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:183
verses.text: i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:185
verses.text: ) That is, justice was not violated, but God went forth against them, and caused the penalty to come round on the sinners, though not all their sins are made manifest, but only where the express ordinances were transgressed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:186
verses.text: "How then shall we," he saith, "escape if we neglect so great salvation?" Hereby he signified, that other salvation was no great thing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:187
verses.text: Well too did he add the "So great".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:188
verses.text: For not from wars (he saith) will He now rescue us, nor bestow on us the earth and the good things that are in the earth, but it will be the dissolution of death, the destruction of the devil, the kingdom of Heaven, everlasting life.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:189
verses.text: For all these things he hath briefly expressed, by saying, "if we neglect so great salvation".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:190
verses.text: Then he subjoins what makes this worthy of belief.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:191
verses.text: "Which at the first began to be spoken by the Lord": that is, had its beginning from the fountain itself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:192
verses.text: It was not a man who brought it over into the earth, nor any created power, but the Only-Begotten Himself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:193
verses.text: "And was confirmed unto us by them that heard [Him]".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:194
verses.text: What is "confirmed"? It was believed, or, it came to pass.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:195
verses.text: For (he saith) we have the earnest; that is, it hath not been extinguished, it hath not ceased, but it is strong and prevaileth.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:196
verses.text: And the cause is, the Divine power works therein.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:197
verses.text: It means they who heard from the Lord, themselves confirmed us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:198
verses.text: This is a great thing and trustworthy: which also Luke saith in the beginning of his Gospel, "As they delivered unto us, which from the beginning were eyewitnesses and ministers of the Word".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:199
verses.text: ( Luke i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:200
verses.text: )  How then was it confirmed? What if those that heard were forgers? saith some one.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:201
verses.text: This objection then he overthrows, and shows that the grace was not human.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:202
verses.text: If they had gone astray, God would not have borne witness to them; for he subjoined ( ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:203
verses.text: ), "God also bearing witness with them".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:204
verses.text: Both they indeed bear witness, and God beareth witness too.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:205
verses.text: How doth He bear witness? not by word or by voice, (though this also would have been worthy of belief): but how? "By signs, and wonders, and divers miracles".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:206
verses.text: (Well said he, "divers miracles," declaring the abundance of the gifts: which was not so in the former dispensation, neither so great signs and so various.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:207
verses.text: ) That is, we did not believe them simply, but through signs and wonders: wherefore we believe not them, but God Himself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:208
verses.text: "And by gifts of the Holy Ghost, according to His own will".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:209
verses.text: What then, if wizards also do signs, and the Jews said that He "cast out devils through Beelzebub"? ( Luke xi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:210
verses.text: ) But they do not such kind of signs: therefore said he "divers miracles": for those others were not miracles, [or powers,] but weakness and fancy, and things altogether vain.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:211
verses.text: Wherefore he said, "by gifts of the Holy Ghost according to His own will".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:212
verses.text: Here he seems to me to intimate something further.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:213
verses.text: For it is not likely there were many there who had gifts, but that these had failed, upon their becoming more slothful.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:214
verses.text: In order then that even in this he might comfort them, and not leave them to fall away, he referred all to the will of God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:215
verses.text: He knows (he says) what is expedient, and for whom, and apportions His grace accordingly.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:216
verses.text: Which also he [Paul] does in the Epistle to the Corinthians, saying, "God hath set every one of us, as it pleased Him".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:217
verses.text: (  Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:218
verses.text: xii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:219
verses.text: ) And again, "The manifestation of the Spirit is given to every man to profit withal".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:220
verses.text: (  Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:221
verses.text: xii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:222
verses.text: )  "According to His will".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:223
verses.text: He shows that the gift is according to the will of the Father.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:224
verses.text: But oftentimes on account of their unclean and slothful life many have not received a gift, and sometimes also those whose life is good and pure have not received one.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:225
verses.text: Why, I pray you? Lest they might be made haughty, that they might not be puffed up, that they might not grow more negligent, that they might not be more excited.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:226
verses.text: For if even without a gift, the mere consciousness of a pure life be sufficient to lift a man up, much more when the grace is added also.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:227
verses.text: Wherefore to the humble, to the simple, it was rather given, and especially to the simple: for it is said, "in singleness and gladness of heart".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:228
verses.text: ( Acts ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:229
verses.text: ) Yea, and hereby also he rather urged them on, and if they were growing negligent gave them a spur.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:230
verses.text: For the humble, and he who imagines no great things concerning himself, becomes more earnest when he has received a gift, in that he has obtained what is beyond his deserts, and thinks that he is not worthy thereof.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:231
verses.text: But he who thinks he hath done well, reckoning it to be his due, is puffed up.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:232
verses.text: Wherefore God dispenseth this profitably: which one may see taking place also in the Church: for one hath the word of teaching, another hath not power to open his mouth.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:233
verses.text: Let not this man (he says) be grieved because of this.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:234
verses.text: For "the manifestation of the Spirit is given to every man to profit withal".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:235
verses.text: (  Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:236
verses.text: xii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:237
verses.text: ) For if a man that is an householder knoweth to whom he should entrust anything, much more God, who understands the mind of men, "who knoweth all things or ever they come into being".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:238
verses.text: One thing only is worthy of grief, Sin: there is nothing else.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:239
verses.text: Say not, Wherefore have I not riches? or, If I had, I would give to the poor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:240
verses.text: Thou knowest not, if thou hadst them, whether thou wouldest not the rather be covetous.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:241
verses.text: For now indeed thou sayest these things, but being put to the trial thou wouldest be different.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:242
verses.text: Since also when we are satisfied, we think that we are able to fast; but when we have gone without a little space, other thoughts come into us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:243
verses.text: Again, when we are out of the way of strong drink, we think ourselves able to master our appetite, but no longer so, when we are caught by it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:244
verses.text: Say not, Wherefore had I not the gift of teaching? or, If I had it, I should have edified innumerable souls.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:245
verses.text: Thou knowest not, if thou hadst it, whether it would not be to thy condemnation,—whether envy, whether sloth, would not have disposed thee to hide thy talent.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:246
verses.text: Now, indeed, thou art now free from all these, and though thou give not "the portion of meat" ( Luke xii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:247
verses.text: ), thou art not called to account: but then, thou wouldest have been responsible for many.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:248
verses.text: And besides, neither now art thou without the gift.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:249
verses.text: Show in the little, what thou wouldst have been, if thou hadst had the other.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:250
verses.text: "For if" (he says) "ye are not faithful in that which is little, how shall any one give you that which is great?" ( Luke xvi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:251
verses.text: ) Give such proof as did the widow; she had two farthings, and she cast in all, whatsoever she possessed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:252
verses.text: Dost thou seek riches? Prove that thou thinkest lightly of the few things, that I may trust thee also concerning the many things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:253
verses.text: But if thou dost not think lightly even of these, much less wilt thou do so of the other.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:254
verses.text: Again, in speech, prove that thou canst use fitly exhortation and counsel.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:255
verses.text: Hast thou not external eloquence? hast thou not store of thoughts? But nevertheless thou knowest these common things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:256
verses.text: Thou hast a child, thou hast a neighbor, thou hast a friend, thou hast a brother, thou hast kinsmen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:257
verses.text: And though publicly before the Church, thou art not able to draw out a long discourse, these thou canst exhort in private.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:258
verses.text: Here, there is no need of rhetoric, nor of elaborate discourse: prove in these, that if thou hadst skill of speech, thou wouldest not have neglected it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:259
verses.text: But if in the small matter thou art not in earnest, how shall I trust thee concerning the great?  For, that every man can do this, hear what Paul saith, how he charged even lay people; "Edify," he says, "one another, as also ye do".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:260
verses.text: (  Thess.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:261
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:262
verses.text: ) And, "Comfort one another with these words".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:263
verses.text: (  Thess.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:264
verses.text: iv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:265
verses.text: ) God knoweth how He should distribute to every man.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:266
verses.text: Art thou better than Moses? hear how he shrinks from the hardship.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:267
verses.text: "Am I," saith he, "able to bear them? for Thou saidst to me, Bear them up, as a nursing-father would bear up the sucking-child".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:268
verses.text: ( Num.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:269
verses.text: xi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:270
verses.text: ) What then did God? He took of his spirit and gave unto the others, showing that neither when he bare them was the gift his own, but of the Spirit.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:271
verses.text: If thou hadst had the gift, thou wouldst perchance have been lifted up, perchance wouldst thou have been turned out of the way.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:272
verses.text: Thou knowest not thyself as God knoweth thee.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:273
verses.text: Let us not say, To what end is that? on what account is this? When God dispenseth, let us not demand an account of Him: for this [is] of the uttermost impiety and folly.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:274
verses.text: We are slaves, and slaves far apart from our Master, knowing not even the things which are before us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:275
verses.text: Let us not then busy ourselves about the counsel of God, but whatsoever He hath given, this let us guard, though it be small, though it be the lowest, and we shall be altogether approved.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:276
verses.text: Or rather, none of the gifts of God is small: art thou grieved because thou hast not the gift of teaching? Then tell me, which seems to you the greater, to have the gift of teaching, or the gift of driving away diseases? Doubtless the latter.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:277
verses.text: But what? Tell me; doth it not seem to thee greater to give eyes to the blind than even to drive away diseases? But what? Tell me; doth it not seem to thee greater to raise the dead than to give eyes to the blind? What again, tell me; doth it not seem to thee greater to do this by shadows and napkins, than by a word? Tell me then, which wouldst thou? Raise the dead with shadows and napkins, or have the gift of teaching? Doubtless thou wilt say the former, to raise the dead with shadows and napkins.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:278
verses.text: If then I should show to thee, that there is another gift far greater than this, and that thou dost not receive it when it is in thy power to receive it, art not thou justly deprived of those others? And this gift not one or two, but all may have.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:279
verses.text: I know that ye open wide your mouths and are amazed, at being to hear that it is in your power to have a greater gift than raising the dead, and giving eyes to the blind, doing the same things which were done in the time of the Apostles.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:280
verses.text: And it seems to you past belief.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:281
verses.text: What then is this gift? charity.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:282
verses.text: Nay, believe me; for the word is not mine, but Christ's speaking by Paul.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:283
verses.text: For what saith he? "Covet earnestly the best gifts: and yet show I unto you a more excellent way".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:284
verses.text: (  Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:285
verses.text: xii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:286
verses.text: ) What is this, "yet more excellent"? What he means is this.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:287
verses.text: The Corinthians were proud over their gifts, and those having tongues, the least gift, were puffed up against the rest.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:288
verses.text: He saith therefore, Do ye by all means desire gifts? I show unto you a way of gifts not merely excelling but far more excellent.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:289
verses.text: Then he saith, "Though I speak with the tongues of Angels, and have not charity, I am nothing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:290
verses.text: And though I have faith so as to remove mountains, and have not charity, I am nothing".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:291
verses.text: (  Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:292
verses.text: xiii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:294
verses.text: )  Hast thou seen the gift? Covet earnestly this gift.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:295
verses.text: This is greater than raising the dead.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:296
verses.text: This is far better than all the rest.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:297
verses.text: And that it is so, hear what Christ Himself saith, discoursing with His disciples, "By this shall all men know that ye are My disciples".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:298
verses.text: ( John xiii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:299
verses.text: ) And showing how, He mentioned not the miracles, but what? "If ye have love one with another".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:300
verses.text: And again He saith to the Father, "Hereby shall they know that Thou hast sent Me, if they be one".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:301
verses.text: ( John xvii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:302
verses.text: ) And He said to His disciples, "A new commandment I give to you, that ye love one another".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:303
verses.text: ( John xiii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:304
verses.text: ) Such an one therefore is more venerable and glorious than those who raise the dead; with reason.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:305
verses.text: For that indeed is wholly of God's grace, but this, of thine own earnestness also.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:306
verses.text: This is of one who is a Christian indeed: this shows the disciple of Christ, the crucified, the man that hath nothing common with earth.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:307
verses.text: Without this, not even martyrdom can profit.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:308
verses.text: And as a proof, see this plainly.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:309
verses.text: The blessed Paul took two of the highest virtues, or rather three; namely, those which consist in miracles, in knowledge, in life.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:310
verses.text: And without this the others, he said, are nothing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:311
verses.text: And I will say how these are nothing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:312
verses.text: "Though I give my goods to feed the poor," he says, "and have not charity, I am nothing".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:313
verses.text: (  Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:314
verses.text: xiii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:315
verses.text: ) For it is possible not to be charitable even when one feeds the poor and exhausts one's means.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:316
verses.text: And indeed these things have been sufficiently declared by us, in the place concerning Charity: and thither we refer the readers.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:317
verses.text: Meanwhile, as I was saying, let us covet earnestly the Gift, let us love one another; and we shall need nothing else for the perfect acquisition of virtue, but all will be easy to us without toils and we shall do all perfectly with much diligence.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:318
verses.text: But see, even now, it is said, we love one another.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:319
verses.text: For one man hath two friends, and another three.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:320
verses.text: But this is not to love for God's sake, but for the sake of being beloved.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:321
verses.text: But to love for God's sake hath not this as its principle of Love; but such an one will be disposed towards all men as towards brethren; loving those that are of the same faith as being true brothers; heretics and Heathen and Jews, brothers indeed by nature, but vile and unprofitable,—pitying and wearing himself out and weeping for them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:322
verses.text: Herein we shall be like God if we love all men, even our enemies; not, if we work miracles.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:323
verses.text: For we regard even God with admiration when He worketh wonders, yet much more, when He showeth love towards man, when He is long-suffering.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:324
verses.text: If then even in God this is worthy of much admiration, much more in men is it evident that this rendereth us admirable.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:325
verses.text: This then let us zealously seek after: and we shall be no way inferior to Paul and Peter and those who have raised innumerable dead, though we may not be able to drive away a fever.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:326
verses.text: But without this [Love]; though we should work greater miracles even than the Apostles themselves, though we should expose ourselves to innumerable dangers for the faith: there will be to us no profit from any.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:327
verses.text: And these things it is not I that say, but he, the very nourisher of Charity, knoweth these things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 4:328
verses.text: To him then let us be obedient; for thus we shall be able to attain to the good things promised, of which may we all be made partakers, by the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ, with whom to the Father with the Holy Ghost, be the glory, now and for ever and world without end, Amen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:1
verses.text: Homily IV.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:2
verses.text: Hebrews ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:3
verses.text: –  "For unto Angels He hath not put in subjection the world to come, whereof we speak.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:4
verses.text: But one in a certain place testified, saying, What is man that Thou art mindful of him, or the son of man that Thou visitest him? Thou madest him a little lower than the Angels".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:5
verses.text: I could have wished to know for certain whether any hear with fitting earnestness the things that are said, whether we are not casting the seeds by the wayside: for in that case I should have made my instructions with more cheerfulness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:6
verses.text: For we shall speak, though no one hear, for the fear which is laid on us by our Saviour.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:7
verses.text: For, saith He, testify to this people; even if they hear not, thou shalt thyself be guiltless.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:8
verses.text: (See Ezek.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:9
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:10
verses.text: ) If however I had been persuaded of your earnestness, I should have spoken not for fear only, but should have done it with pleasure also.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:11
verses.text: For now indeed, even if no man hear, even if my work, so long as I fulfill my own part, brings no danger, still the labor is not altogether pleasant.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:12
verses.text: For what profit is it, when though I be not blamed, yet no one is benefited? But if any would give heed we shall receive advantage not so much from avoiding punishment ourselves as from your progress.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:13
verses.text: How then shall I know this? Having taken notice of some of you, who are not very attentive, I shall question them privately, when I meet them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:14
verses.text: And if I find that they retain any of the things that have been spoken (I say not all, for this would not be very easy for you), but even if [they retain] a few things out of many, it is plain I should have no further doubts about the rest.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:15
verses.text: And indeed we ought, without giving notice beforehand, to have attacked you when off your guard.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:16
verses.text: However it will suffice, if even in this way I should be able to attain my purpose.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:17
verses.text: Nay rather, even as it is, I can attack you when you are off your guard.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:18
verses.text: For that I shall question you, I have forewarned you; but when I shall question you I do not as yet make evident.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:19
verses.text: For perhaps it may be to-day; perhaps to-morrow, perhaps after twenty or thirty days, perhaps after fewer, perhaps after more.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:20
verses.text: Thus has God also made uncertain the day of our death.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:21
verses.text: Nor hath He allowed it be clear to us, whether it shall befall us to-day, or to-morrow, or after a whole year, or after many years; that through the uncertainty of the expectation we may through all time keep ourselves firm in virtue.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:22
verses.text: And that we shall indeed depart, He hath said,—but when, He hath not yet said.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:23
verses.text: Thus too I have said that I shall question you, but I have not added when, wishing you always to be thoughtful.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:24
verses.text: And let no man say, I heard these things four or five weeks ago, or more, and I cannot retain them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:25
verses.text: For I wish the hearer so to retain them as to have his recollection perpetual and not apt to fade, nor yet that he should disown what is spoken.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:26
verses.text: For I wish you to retain them, not, in order to tell them to me, but that ye may have profit; and this is of most serious interest to me.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:27
verses.text: Let no one then say this.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:28
verses.text: However, I must now begin with what follows in the epistle.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:29
verses.text: What then is set before us to speak on to-day?  "For not to angels," he says, "did He put in subjection the world to come, whereof we speak".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:30
verses.text: Is he then discoursing concerning some other world? No, but concerning this.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:31
verses.text: Therefore he added "whereof we speak," that he might not allow the mind to wander away in search of some other.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:32
verses.text: How then does he call it "the world to come"? Exactly as he also says in another place, "Who is the figure of him that was to come," ( Rom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:33
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:34
verses.text: ,) when he is speaking about Adam and Christ in the Epistle to the Romans; calling Christ according to the flesh "Him that was to come" in respect of the times of Adam, (for [then] He was to come).

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:35
verses.text: So now also, since he had said, "but when he bringeth in the First-Begotten into the world": that thou mightest not suppose that he is speaking of another world, it is made certain from many considerations and from his saying "to come".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:36
verses.text: For the world was to come, but the Son of God always was.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:37
verses.text: This world then which was about to come, He put in subjection not to Angels but to Christ.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:38
verses.text: For that this is spoken with reference to the Son (he says) is evident: for surely no one would assert the other alternative, that it had reference to Angels.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:39
verses.text: Then he brings forward another testimony also and says, "but one in a certain place testified, saying".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:40
verses.text: Wherefore did he not mention the name of the prophet, but hid it? Yea, and in other testimonies also he doth this: as when he saith, "but when He bringeth in again the First-Begotten into the world, He saith, And let all the Angels of God worship Him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:41
verses.text: And again, I will be to Him a Father.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:42
verses.text: And of the Angels He saith, Who maketh His angels spirits.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:43
verses.text: And, Thou, Lord, in the beginning hast laid the foundations of the earth" ( c.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:44
verses.text: i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:45
verses.text: , , ,  ):—so also here he saith, "but one in a certain place testified, saying".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:46
verses.text: And this very thing (I conceive) is the act of one that conceals himself, and shows that they were well skilled in the Scriptures; his not setting down him who uttered the testimony, but introducing it as familiar and obvious.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:47
verses.text: "What is man that Thou art mindful of him, or the son of man that Thou visitest him? Thou madest him a little lower than the angels: Thou crownedst him with glory and honor".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:48
verses.text: ( Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:49
verses.text: ) "Thou hast put all things in subjection under his feet".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:50
verses.text: Now although these things were spoken of human nature generally, they would nevertheless apply more properly to Christ according to the flesh.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:51
verses.text: For this, "Thou hast put all things in subjection under his feet," belongs to Him rather than to us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:52
verses.text: For the Son of God visited us when we were nothing: and after having assumed our [nature], and united it to Himself, He became higher than all.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:53
verses.text: "For," he says, "in that He hath put all things in subjection under Him, He left nothing not put under Him: but now we see not yet all things put under Him".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:54
verses.text: What he means is this:—since he had said, "Until I make Thine enemies Thy footstool" ( c.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:55
verses.text: i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:56
verses.text: ),—and it was likely that they would still be grieved,—then having inserted a few things after this parenthetically, he added this testimony in confirmation of the former.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:57
verses.text: For that they might not say, How is it that He hath put His enemies under His feet, when we have suffered so much? he sufficiently hinted at it in the former place indeed (for the word "until" showed, not what should take place immediately, but in course of time) but here he followeth it up.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:58
verses.text: For do not suppose (he says) that because they have not yet been made subject, they are not to be made subject: for that they must be made subject, is evident; for, on this account was the prophecy spoken.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:59
verses.text: "For," he says, "in that He hath put all things under Him, He left nothing not put under Him".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:60
verses.text: How then is it that all things have not been put under Him? Because they are hereafter to be put under Him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:61
verses.text: If then all things must be made subject to Him, but have not yet been made subject, do not grieve, nor trouble thyself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:62
verses.text: If indeed when the end were come, and all things were made subject, thou wert still suffering these things, with reason wouldst thou repine: "But now we see not yet all things put under Him".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:63
verses.text: The King has not yet clearly conquered.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:64
verses.text: Why then art thou troubled when suffering affliction? the preaching [of the Gospel] hath not yet prevailed over all; it is not yet time that they should be altogether made subject.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:65
verses.text: Then again there is another consolation if indeed He who is hereafter to have all put in subjection under Him, hath Himself also died and submitted to sufferings innumerable.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:66
verses.text: ( Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:67
verses.text: ) "But," he says, "we see Him who was made a little lower than the angels, even Jesus, for the suffering of death"—then the good things again,—"crowned with glory and honor".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:68
verses.text: Seest thou, how all things apply to Him? For the [expression], "a little," would rather suit Him, who was only three days in Hades, but not ourselves who are for a long time in corruption.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:69
verses.text: Likewise also the [expression] "with glory and honor" will suit Him much more than us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:70
verses.text: Again, he reminds them of the Cross, thereby effecting two things; both showing His care [for them] and persuading them to bear all things nobly, looking to the Master.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:71
verses.text: For (he would say) if He who is worshiped of Angels, for thy sake endured to have a little less than the Angels, much more oughtest thou who art inferior to the Angels, to bear all things for His sake.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:72
verses.text: Then he shows that the Cross is "glory and honor," as He Himself also always calls it, saying, "That the Son of Man might be glorified" ( John xi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:73
verses.text: ); and, "the Son of Man is glorified".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:74
verses.text: ( John xii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:75
verses.text: ) If then He calls the [sufferings] for His servants' sake "glory," much more shouldest thou the [sufferings] for the Lord.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:76
verses.text: Seest thou the fruit of the Cross, how great it is? fear not the matter: for it seemeth to thee indeed to be dismal, but it brings forth good things innumerable.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:77
verses.text: From these considerations he shows the benefit of trial.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:78
verses.text: Then he says, "That He by the grace of God should taste death for every man".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:79
verses.text: "That by the grace of God," he says.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:80
verses.text: And He indeed because of the grace of God towards us suffered these things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:81
verses.text: "He who spared not His Own Son," he says, "but delivered Him up for us all".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:82
verses.text: ( Rom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:83
verses.text: viii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:84
verses.text: ) Why? He did not owe us this, but has done it of grace.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:85
verses.text: And again in the Epistle to the Romans he says, "Much more the grace of God, and the gift by grace which is by one man Jesus Christ, hath abounded unto many".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:86
verses.text: ( Rom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:87
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:88
verses.text: )  "That by the grace of God He should taste death for every man," not for the faithful only, but even for the whole world: for He indeed died for all; But what if all have not believed? He hath fulfilled His own [part].

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:89
verses.text: Moreover he said rightly "taste death for every man," he did not say "die".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:90
verses.text: For as if He really was tasting it, when He had spent a little time therein, He immediately arose.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:91
verses.text: By saying then "for the suffering of death," he signified real death, and by saying "superior to angels," he declared the resurrection.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:92
verses.text: For as a physician though not needing to taste the food prepared for the sick man, yet in his care for him tastes first himself, that he may persuade the sick man with confidence to venture on the food, so since all men were afraid of death, in persuading them to take courage against death, He tasted it also Himself though He needed not.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:93
verses.text: "For," He says, "the prince of this world cometh and findeth nothing in Me".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:94
verses.text: ( John xiv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:95
verses.text: ) So both the words "by grace" and "should taste death for every man," establish this.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:96
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:97
verses.text: "For it became Him, for whom are all things, and by whom are all things, in bringing many sons unto glory, to make the Captain of their salvation perfect through sufferings".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:98
verses.text: He speaks here of the Father.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:99
verses.text: Seest thou how again he applies the [expression] "by whom" to Him? Which he would not have done, had it been [an expression] of inferiority, and only applicable to the Son.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:100
verses.text: And what he says is this:—He has done what is worthy of His love towards mankind, in showing His First-born to be more glorious than all, and in setting Him forth as an example to the others, like some noble wrestler that surpasses the rest.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:101
verses.text: "The Captain of their salvation," that is, the Cause of their salvation.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:102
verses.text: Seest thou how great is the space between? Both He is a Son, and we are sons; but He saves, we are saved.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:103
verses.text: Seest thou how He both brings us together and then separates us; "bringing," he says, "many sons unto glory": here he brings us together,—"the Captain of their salvation," again he separates.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:104
verses.text: "To make perfect through sufferings".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:105
verses.text: Then sufferings are a perfecting, and a cause of salvation.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:106
verses.text: Seest thou that to suffer affliction is not the portion of those who are utterly forsaken; if indeed it was by this that God first honored His Son, by leading Him through sufferings? And truly His taking flesh to suffer what He did suffer, is a far greater thing than making the world, and bringing it out of things that are not.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:107
verses.text: This indeed also is [a token] of His loving-kindness, but the other far more.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:108
verses.text: And [the Apostle] himself also pointing out this very thing, says, "That in the ages to come He might show forth the exceeding riches of His goodness, He both raised us up together, and made us sit together in the heavenly places in Christ Jesus".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:109
verses.text: ( Eph.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:110
verses.text: ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:112
verses.text: )  "For it became Him for whom are all things and by whom are all things in bringing many sons to glory, to make the Captain of their salvation perfect through sufferings".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:113
verses.text: For (he means) it became Him who taketh tender care, and brought all things into being, to give up the Son for the salvation of the rest, the One for the many.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:114
verses.text: However he did not express himself thus, but, "to make perfect through sufferings," showing the suffering for any one, not merely profits "him," but he himself also becomes more glorious and more perfect.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:115
verses.text: And this too he says in reference to the faithful, comforting them by the way: for Christ was glorified then when He suffered.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:116
verses.text: But when I say, He was glorified, do not suppose that there was an accession of glory to Him: for that which is of nature He always had, and received nothing in addition.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:117
verses.text: "For," he says, "both He that sanctifieth, and they who are sanctified, are all of one, for which cause He is not ashamed to call them brethren".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:118
verses.text: Behold again how he brings [them] together, honoring and comforting them, and making them brethren of Christ, in this respect that they are "of one".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:119
verses.text: Then again guarding himself and showing that he is speaking of that which is according to the flesh, he introduces, "For He who sanctifieth," [i-e:] Christ, "and they who are sanctified," ourselves.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:120
verses.text: Dost thou see how great is the difference? He sanctifies, we are sanctified.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:121
verses.text: And above he said, "the Captain of their salvation.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:122
verses.text: For there is one God, of whom are all things".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:123
verses.text: (  Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:124
verses.text: viii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:125
verses.text: )  "For which cause He is not ashamed to call them brethren".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:126
verses.text: Seest thou how again he shows the superiority? For by saying, "He is not ashamed," he shows that the whole comes not of the nature of the thing, but of the loving affection of Him who was "not ashamed" of anything, [yea] of His great humility.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:127
verses.text: For though we be "of one," yet He sanctifieth and we are sanctified: and great is the difference.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:128
verses.text: Moreover "He" is of the Father, as a true Son, that is, of His substance; "we," as created, that is, brought out of things that are not, so that the difference is great.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:129
verses.text: Wherefore he says, "He is not ashamed to call them brethren" ( ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:130
verses.text: ), "saying, I will declare Thy name unto My brethren".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:131
verses.text: ( Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:132
verses.text: xxii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:133
verses.text: ) For when He clothed Himself with flesh, He clothed Himself also with the brotherhood, and at the same time came in the brotherhood.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:134
verses.text: This indeed he brings forward naturally.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:135
verses.text: But this ( ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:136
verses.text: ) "I will put my trust in Him" (  Sam.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:137
verses.text: xxii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:138
verses.text: ), what does it mean? For what follows this is also [introduced] naturally.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:139
verses.text: "Behold, I and the children which God hath given Me".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:140
verses.text: ( Isa.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:141
verses.text: viii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:142
verses.text: ) For as here He shows Himself a Father, so before, a Brother.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:143
verses.text: "I will declare Thy name unto My brethren," He saith.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:144
verses.text: And again he indicates the superiority and the great interval [between us], by what follows ( ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:145
verses.text: ): "Since then the children," he saith, "are partakers of flesh and blood" (thou seest where he saith the likeness is? in reference to the flesh), "in like manner He also Himself took part of the same".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:146
verses.text: Let all the Heretics be ashamed, let those hide their faces who say that He came in appearance and not in reality.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:147
verses.text: For he did not say, "He took part of these" only, and then say no more; although had he said thus, it would have been sufficient, but he asserted something more, adding "in like manner," not in appearance, he means, or by an image (since in that case "in like manner" is not preserved) but in reality; showing the brotherhood.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:148
verses.text: Next he sets down also the cause of the economy.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:149
verses.text: "That through death," he says, "He might destroy him that had the power of death, that is, the devil".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:150
verses.text: Here he points out the wonder, that by what the devil prevailed, by that was he overcome, and the very thing which was his strong weapon against the world, [namely], Death, by this Christ smote him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:151
verses.text: In this he exhibits the greatness of the conqueror's power.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:152
verses.text: Dost thou see how great good death hath wrought?  Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:153
verses.text: "And should deliver them," he says, "who through fear of death were all their lifetime subject to bondage".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:154
verses.text: Why (he means) do ye shudder? Why do you fear him that hath been brought to nought? He is no longer terrible, but has been trodden under foot, hath been utterly despised; he is vile and of no account.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:155
verses.text: (  Tim.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:156
verses.text: i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:157
verses.text: )  But what is "through fear of death were all their life-time subject to bondage"? He either means this, that he who fears death is a slave, and submits to all things rather than die; or this, that all men were slaves of death and were held under his power, because he had not yet been done away; or that men lived in continual fear, ever expecting that they should die, and being afraid of death, could have no sense of pleasure, while this fear was present with them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:158
verses.text: For this he hinted at in saying, "All their life-time".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:159
verses.text: He here shows that the afflicted, the harassed, the persecuted, those that are deprived of country and of substance and of all other things, spend their lives more sweetly and more freely than they of old time who were in luxury, who suffered no such afflictions, who were in continual prosperity, if indeed these "all their life-time" were under this fear and were slaves; while the others have been made free and laugh at that which they shudder at.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:160
verses.text: For this is now as if, when one was being led away to a captivity leading to death, and in continual expectation of it, one should feed him up with abundant dainties (something such as this was Death of old); but now, as if some one taking away that fear together with the dainties, were to promise a contest, and propose a combat that should lead no longer to death, but to a kingdom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:161
verses.text: Of which number wouldst thou have wished to be—those who are fed up in the prison-house, while every day looking for their sentence, or those who contend much and labor willingly, that they may crown themselves with the diadem of the kingdom? Seest thou how he has raised up their soul, and made them elated? He shows too, that not death alone has been put an end to, but that thereby he also who is ever showing that war without truce against us, I mean the devil, hath been brought to nought; since he that fears not death is out of reach of the devil's tyranny.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:162
verses.text: For if "skin for skin, yea all things a man would give for his life" ( Job ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:163
verses.text: )—when any one has determined to disregard even this, of what henceforward will he be the slave? He fears no one, he is in terror of no one, he is higher than all, and more free than all.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:164
verses.text: For he that disregards his own life, much more [doth he disregard] all other things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:165
verses.text: And when the devil finds a soul such as this, he can accomplish in it none of his works.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:166
verses.text: For what? tell me, shall he threaten the loss of property, and degradation, and banishment from one's country? But these are small matters to him who "counteth not even his life dear" ( Acts xx.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:167
verses.text: ) unto him, according to the blessed Paul.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:168
verses.text: Thou seest that in casting out the tyranny of death, he also overthrew the strength of the devil.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:169
verses.text: For he who has learnt to study innumerable [truths] concerning the resurrection, how should he fear death? How should he shudder any more?   Therefore be ye not grieved, saying, why do we suffer such and such things? For so the victory becomes more glorious.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:170
verses.text: And it would not have been glorious, unless by death He had destroyed death; but the most wonderful thing is that He conquered him by the very means by which he was strong, showing in every point the abundance of His means, and the excellence of His contrivances.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:171
verses.text: Let us not then prove false to the gift bestowed on us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:172
verses.text: "For we," he says, "have received not a spirit of fear, but a spirit of power, and of love, and of a sound mind".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:173
verses.text: ( Rom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:174
verses.text: viii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:175
verses.text: ;  Tim.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:176
verses.text: i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:177
verses.text: ) Let us stand then nobly, laughing death to scorn.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:178
verses.text: But [I pause] for it comes over me to groan bitterly [at the thought of] whither Christ hath raised us up, and whither we have brought ourselves down.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:179
verses.text: For when I see the wailings in the public places, the groanings over those departing life, the howlings, the other unseemly behavior, believe me, I am ashamed before those heathen, and Jews, and heretics who see it, and before all who for this cause openly laugh us to scorn.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:180
verses.text: For whatever I may afterwards say, I shall talk to no purpose, when philosophizing concerning the resurrection.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:181
verses.text: Why? Because the heathen do not attend to what is said by me, but to what is done by you.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:182
