verses.text: For they will say at once, 'when will any of these [fellows] be able to despise death, when he is not able to see another dead?'  Beautiful things were spoken by Paul, beautiful and worthy of Heaven, and of the love of God to man.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:183
verses.text: For what does he say? "And He shall deliver them who through fear of death, were all their life-time subject to bondage".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:184
verses.text: But ye do not allow these things to be believed, fighting against them by your deeds.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:185
verses.text: And yet many things exist for this very end, God building a stronghold against it, that He might destroy this same evil custom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:186
verses.text: For tell me, what mean the bright torches? Do we not send them before as athletes? And what [mean] the hymns? Do we not glorify God, and give thanks that at last He has crowned the departed one, that He has freed him from his labors, that taking away uncertainty, He has him with Himself? Are not the Hymns for this? Is not Psalmody for this? All these are the acts of those rejoicing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:187
verses.text: "For," it is said, "is any merry? let him sing psalms".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:188
verses.text: ( Jas.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:189
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:190
verses.text: ) But to these things the heathen give no heed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:191
verses.text: For (one will say) do not tell me of him who is philosophical when out of the affliction, for this is nothing great or surprising;—show me a man who in the very affliction itself is philosophical, and then I will believe the resurrection,  And indeed, that women engaged in the affairs of this life should act thus is no way surprising.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:192
verses.text: And yet indeed this even is dreadful; for from them also is the same philosophy required.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:193
verses.text: Wherefore also Paul says, "But concerning them which are asleep, I would not have you ignorant, that ye sorrow not even as the rest who have no hope".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:194
verses.text: (  Thess.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:195
verses.text: iv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:196
verses.text: ) He wrote not this to solitaries, nor to perpetual virgins, but to women and men in the world.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:197
verses.text: But however this is not so dreadful.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:198
verses.text: But when any man or woman, professing to be crucified to the world, he tears his hair, and she shrieks violently—what can be more unseemly than this? Believe me when I say if things were done as they ought, such persons should be excluded for a long time from the thresholds of the Church.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:199
verses.text: For those who are indeed worthy of being grieved for, are these who still fear and shudder at death, who have no faith in the resurrection.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:200
verses.text: 'But I do not disbelieve the resurrection' (one says) 'but I long after his society.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:201
verses.text: ' Why then, tell me, when he goes from home, and that for a long absence, dost not thou do the same? 'Yea, but I do weep then also' (she says) 'and mourn as I long after him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:202
verses.text: ' But that is the conduct of those that really long after their associates, this that of her who despairs of his return.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:203
verses.text: Think, what thou singest on that occasion, "Return unto thy rest, O my soul, for the Lord hath dealt bountifully with thee".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:204
verses.text: ( Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:205
verses.text: cxvi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:206
verses.text: ) And again, "I will fear no evil, for Thou art with me".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:207
verses.text: ( Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:208
verses.text: xxiii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:209
verses.text: ) And again, "Thou art my refuge from the affliction which encompasseth me".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:210
verses.text: ( Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:211
verses.text: xxxii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:212
verses.text: ) Think what these Psalms mean.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:213
verses.text: But thou dost not give heed, but art drunk from grief.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:214
verses.text: Consider carefully the funeral lamentations of others that thou mayest have a remedy in thine own case.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:215
verses.text: "Return, O my soul, to thy rest, for the Lord hath dealt bountifully with thee".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:216
verses.text: Tell me, sayest thou that the Lord hath dealt bountifully with thee, and weepest? Is not this mere acting, is it not hypocrisy? For if indeed thou really believest the things thou sayest, thy sorrow is superfluous: but if thou art in sport and acting a part, and thinkest these things fables, why dost thou sing psalms? Why dost thou even endure the attendants? Why dost thou not drive away the singers? But this would be the act of madmen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:217
verses.text: And yet far more the other.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:218
verses.text: For the present, then, I advise you: but as time goes on, I shall treat the matter more seriously: for indeed I am greatly afraid that by this practice some grievous disease may make its way into the Church.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:219
verses.text: The case of the wailings then we will hereafter correct.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:220
verses.text: And meanwhile I charge and testify, both to rich and poor, both to women and men.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:221
verses.text: May God indeed grant that you all depart out of life unwailed, and according to the fitting rule fathers now grown old may be attended to their graves by sons, and mothers by daughters, and grand-children, and great grand-children, in a green old age, and that untimely death may in no case occur.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:222
verses.text: May this then be, and this I pray, and I exhort the prelates and all of you to beseech God for each other, and to make this prayer in common.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:223
verses.text: But if (which God forbid, and may it never happen) any bitter death should occur, bitter, I mean, not in its nature (for henceforth there is no bitter death, for it differs not at all from sleep), but bitter in regard of your disposition, if it should happen, and any should hire these mourning women, believe me when I say (I speak not without meaning but as I have resolved, let him who will, be angry), that person we will exclude from the Church for a long time, as we do the idolater.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:224
verses.text: For if Paul calls "the covetous man an idolater" ( Eph.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:225
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:226
verses.text: ), much more him who brings in the practices of the idolaters over a believer.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:227
verses.text: For, tell me, for what cause dost thou invite presbyters, and the singers? Is it not to afford consolation? Is it not to honor the departed? Why then dost thou insult him? And why dost thou make him a public show? And why dost thou make game as on a stage? We come, discoursing of the things concerning the resurrection, instructing all, even those who have not yet been smitten, by the honor shown to him, to bear it nobly if any such thing should happen and dost thou bring those who overthrow our [teachings] as much as in them lieth? What can be worse than this ridicule and mockery? What more grievous than this inconsistency?   Be ashamed and show reverence: but if ye will not, we cannot endure the bringing in upon the Church of practices so destructive.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:228
verses.text: For, it is said, "them that sin rebuke before all".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:229
verses.text: (  Tim.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:230
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:231
verses.text: ) And as to those miserable and wretched women, we through you forbid them ever to introduce themselves into the funerals of the faithful, lest we should oblige them in good earnest to wail over their own evils, and teach them not to do these things in the ills of others, but rather to weep for their own misfortunes.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:232
verses.text: For an affectionate father too, when he has a disorderly son, not only advises him not to draw near to the wicked, but puts them in fear also.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:233
verses.text: Behold then, I advise you, and those women through you, that you do not invite such persons, and that they do not attend.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:234
verses.text: And may God grant that my words may produce some effect, and that my threat may avail.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:235
verses.text: But if (which God forbid) we should be disregarded, we have no choice henceforward but to put our threat into execution, chastising you by the laws of the Church, and those women as befits them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:236
verses.text: Now if any man is obstinate and contemptuous, let him hear Christ saying even now, "If any one trespass against thee, go, tell him his fault between thee and him alone"; but if he will not be persuaded, "take with thee one or two".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:237
verses.text: But if even so he contradict, "tell it to the Church, but if he shall also refuse to hear the Church, let him be unto thee as a heathen man and a publican".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:238
verses.text: ( Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:239
verses.text: xviii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:241
verses.text: ) Now if when a man trespasses against me, and will not be persuaded, [the Lord] commands me thus to turn away from him, judge ye in what light I ought to hold him who trespasses against himself, and against God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:242
verses.text: For do not you yourselves condemn us when we come down so gently upon you?  If however any man disregard the bonds which we inflict, again let Christ instruct him, saying, "Whatsoever ye shall bind on earth shall be bound in heaven; and whatsoever ye shall loose on earth shall be loosed in heaven".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:243
verses.text: ( Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:244
verses.text: xviii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:245
verses.text: ) For though we ourselves be miserable and good for nothing and worthy to be despised, as indeed we are; yet are we not avenging ourselves nor warding off anger, but are caring for your salvation.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:246
verses.text: Be influenced by reverence, I beseech you, and respect.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:247
verses.text: For if a man bear with a friend when he attacks him more vehemently than he ought, ascertaining his object, and that he does it with kind intention, and not out of insolence; much more [should he bear with] a teacher when rebuking him, and a teacher who does not himself say these things as of authority, nor as one in the position of a ruler, but in that of a kindly guardian.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:248
verses.text: For we do not say these things as wishing to exhibit our authority, (for how could we, praying that we may never come to the trial of them?) but grieving and lamenting for you.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:249
verses.text: Forgive me then, and let no man disregard the bonds of the Church.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:250
verses.text: For it is not man who binds, but Christ who has given unto us this authority, and makes men lords of this so great dignity.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:251
verses.text: For we indeed wish to use this power for loosing; or rather, we wish to have no need even of that, for we wish that there should not be any bound among us—we are not so miserable and wretched [as that] even though some of us are extreme good-for-nothings.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:252
verses.text: If however we be compelled [so to act], forgive us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:253
verses.text: For it is not of our own accord, nor wishing it, but rather out of sorrow for you that are bound that we put the chains around you.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:254
verses.text: But if any man despise these chains, the time of judgment will come, which shall teach him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:255
verses.text: And what comes after I do not wish to speak of, lest I should wound your minds.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:256
verses.text: For in the first place indeed we do not wish to be brought into this necessity; but if we are so brought, we fulfill our own part, we cast around the chains.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:257
verses.text: And if any man burst through them, I have done my part, and am henceforth free from blame, and thou wilt have to give account to Him who commanded me to bind.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:258
verses.text: For neither, when a king is sitting in public, if any of the guard who stand beside him be commanded to bind one of the attendants, and to put the chains around [him], and he should not only thrust this man away, but also break the bonds in pieces, is it the guard who suffers the insult, and not much more the King who gave the order.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:259
verses.text: For if He claim as His own, the things which are done to the faithful, much more will He feel as if Himself insulted when he is insulted who has been appointed to teach.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:260
verses.text: But God grant that none of those who are over this Church should be driven to the necessity of [inflicting] these bonds.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:261
verses.text: For as it is a good thing not to sin, so is it profitable to endure reproof.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:262
verses.text: Let us then endure the rebuke, and earnestly endeavor not to sin; and if we should sin let us bear the rebuke.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:263
verses.text: For as it is an excellent thing not to be wounded, but, if this should happen, to apply the remedy to the wound, so also in this case.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:264
verses.text: But God forbid that any man should need such remedies as these.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:265
verses.text: "But we are persuaded better things of you, and things that accompany salvation, though we thus speak".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:267
verses.text: vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:268
verses.text: ) But we have discoursed more vehemently for the sake of greater security.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:269
verses.text: For it is better that I should be suspected by you of being a harsh, and severe, and self-willed person, than that you should do things not approved of God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 5:270
verses.text: But we trust in God, that this reproof will not be unserviceable to you, but that ye will be so changed, that these discourses may be devoted to encomiums on you and to praises: that we may all be counted worthy to attain to those good things, which God hath promised to them that love Him in Christ Jesus our Lord, with whom to the Father together with the Holy Ghost be glory, might, honor, now and for ever and world without end, Amen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:1
verses.text: Homily V.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:2
verses.text: Hebrews ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:3
verses.text: –  "For verily He taketh not hold of Angels, but of the seed of Abraham He taketh hold.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:4
verses.text: Wherefore in all things it behooved Him to be made like unto His brethren".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:5
verses.text: Paul wishing to show the great kindness of God towards man, and the Love which He had for the human race, after saying: "Forasmuch then as the children were partakers of blood and flesh, He also Himself likewise took part of the same" ( c.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:6
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:7
verses.text: )—follows up the subject in this passage.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:8
verses.text: For do not regard lightly what is spoken, nor think this merely a slight [matter], His taking on Him our flesh.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:9
verses.text: He granted not this to Angels; "For verily He taketh not hold of Angels, but of the seed of Abraham".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:10
verses.text: What is it that he saith? He took not on Him an Angel's nature, but man's.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:11
verses.text: But what is "He taketh hold of"? He did not (he means) grasp that nature, which belongs to Angels, but ours.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:12
verses.text: But why did he not say, "He took on Him," but used this expression, "He taketh hold of"? It is derived from the figure of persons pursuing those who turn away from them, and doing everything to overtake them as they flee, and to take hold of them as they are bounding away.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:13
verses.text: For when human nature was fleeing from Him, and fleeing far away (for we "were far off"— Eph.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:14
verses.text: ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:15
verses.text: ), He pursued after and overtook us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:16
verses.text: He showed that He has done this only out of kindness, and love, and tender care.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:17
verses.text: As then when he saith, "Are they not all ministering spirits, sent forth to minister for them who shall be heirs of salvation" ( c.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:18
verses.text: i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:19
verses.text: )—he shows His extreme interest in behalf of human nature, and that God makes great account of it, so also in this place he sets it forth much more by a comparison, for he says, "He taketh not hold of angels".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:20
verses.text: For in very deed it is a great and a wonderful thing, and full of amazement that our flesh should sit on high, and be adored by Angels and Archangels, by the Cherubim and the Seraphim.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:21
verses.text: For myself having oftentimes thought upon this, I am amazed at it, and imagine to myself great things concerning the human race.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:22
verses.text: For I see that the introductions are great and splendid, and that God has great zeal on behalf of our nature.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:23
verses.text: Moreover he said not "of men (simply) He taketh hold," but wishing to exalt them [the Hebrews] and to show that their race is great and honorable, he says, "but of the seed of Abraham He taketh hold".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:24
verses.text: "Wherefore it behooved [Him] in all things to be made like unto His brethren".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:25
verses.text: What is this, "in all things"? He was born (he means), was brought up, grew, suffered all things necessary, at last He died.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:26
verses.text: This is, "in all things to be made like unto His brethren".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:27
verses.text: For after he had discoursed much concerning His majesty and the glory on high, he then begins concerning the dispensation.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:28
verses.text: And consider with how great power [he doth this].

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:29
verses.text: How he represents Him as having great zeal "to be made like unto us": which was a sign of much care.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:30
verses.text: For having said above, "Inasmuch then as the children were partakers of flesh and blood, He also Himself in like manner took part of the same"; in this place also he says, "in all things to be made like unto His brethren".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:31
verses.text: Which is all but saying, He that is so great, He that is "the brightness of His glory," He that is "the express image of His person," He that "made the worlds," He that "sitteth on the right hand of the Father," He was willing and earnest to become our brother in all things, and for this cause did He leave the angels and the other powers, and come down to us, and took hold of us, and wrought innumerable good things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:32
verses.text: He destroyed Death, He cast out the devil from his tyranny, He freed us from bondage: not by brotherhood alone did He honor us, but also in other ways beyond number.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:33
verses.text: For He was willing also to become our High Priest with the Father: for he adds,   "That He might become a merciful and faithful High Priest in things pertaining to God".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:34
verses.text: For this cause (he means) He took on Him our flesh, only for Love to man, that He might have mercy upon us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:35
verses.text: For neither is there any other cause of the economy, but this alone.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:36
verses.text: For He saw us, cast on the ground, perishing, tyrannized over by Death, and He had compassion on us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:37
verses.text: "To make reconciliation," he says, "for the sins of the people.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:38
verses.text: That He might be a merciful and faithful High Priest".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:39
verses.text: What is "faithful"? True, able.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:40
verses.text: For the Son is a faithful High Priest, able to deliver from their sins those whose High Priest He is.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:41
verses.text: In order then that He might offer a sacrifice able to purify us, for this cause He has become man.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:42
verses.text: Accordingly he added, "in things pertaining to God,"—that is, for the sake of things in relation to God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:43
verses.text: We were become altogether enemies to God, (he would say) condemned, degraded, there was none who should offer sacrifice for us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:44
verses.text: He saw us in this condition, and had compassion on us, not appointing a High Priest for us, but Himself becoming a High Priest.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:45
verses.text: In what sense He was "faithful," he added [viz.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:46
verses.text: ], "to make reconciliation for the sins of the people".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:47
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:48
verses.text: "For," he says, "in that He hath suffered Himself being tempted, He is able to succor them that are tempted".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:49
verses.text: This is altogether low and mean, and unworthy of God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:50
verses.text: "For in that He hath suffered Himself," he says.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:51
verses.text: It is of Him who was made flesh that he here speaks, and it was said for the full assurance of the hearers, and on account of their weakness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:52
verses.text: That is (he would say) He went through the very experience of the things which we have suffered; "now" He is not ignorant of our sufferings; not only does He know them as God, but as man also He has known them, by the trial wherewith He was tried; He suffered much, He knows how to sympathize.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:53
verses.text: And yet God is incapable of suffering: but he describes here what belongs to the Incarnation, as if he had said, Even the very flesh of Christ suffered many terrible things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:54
verses.text: He knows what tribulation is; He knows what temptation is, not less than we who have suffered, for He Himself also has suffered.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:55
verses.text: (What then is this, "He is able to succor them that are tempted"? It is as if one should say, He will stretch forth His hand with great eagerness, He will be sympathizing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:56
verses.text: )   Since they wished for something great, and to have an advantage over the [converts] from the Gentiles, he shows that they have an advantage in this while he did not hurt those from the Gentiles at all.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:57
verses.text: In what respect now is this? Because of them is the salvation, because He took hold of them first, because from that race He assumed flesh.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:58
verses.text: "For," he says, "He taketh not hold of angels, but of the seed of Abraham He taketh hold".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:59
verses.text: Hereby he both gives honor to the Patriarch, and shows also what "the seed of Abraham" is.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:60
verses.text: He reminds them of the promise made to him, saying, "To thee and to thy seed will I give this land" ( Gen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:61
verses.text: xiii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:62
verses.text: ); showing by the very least thing, the nearness [of the relationship] in that they were "all of one".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:63
verses.text: But that nearness was not great: [so] he comes back to this, and thenceforward dwells upon the dispensation which was after the flesh, and says, Even the mere willing to become man was a proof of great care and love; but now it is not this alone, but there are also the undying benefits which are bestowed on us through Him, for, he says, "to make reconciliation for the sins of the people".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:64
verses.text: Why said he not, of the world, instead of "the people"? for He bare away the sins of all.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:65
verses.text: Because thus far his discourse was concerning them [the Hebrews].

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:66
verses.text: Since the Angel also said to Joseph, "Thou shalt call His name Jesus, for He shall save His people".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:67
verses.text: ( Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:68
verses.text: i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:69
verses.text: ) For this too ought to have taken place first, and for this purpose He came, to save them and then through them the rest, although the contrary came to pass.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:70
verses.text: This also the Apostles said at the first, "To you [God] having raised up His Son, sent [Him] to bless you" ( Acts iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:71
verses.text: ): and again, "To you was the word of this Salvation sent".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:72
verses.text: ( Acts xiii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:73
verses.text: ) Here he shows the noble birth of the Jews, in saying, "to make reconciliation for the sins of the people".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:74
verses.text: For a while he speaks in this way.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:75
verses.text: For that it is He who forgives the sins of all men, He declared both in the case of the paralytic, saying, "Thy sins are forgiven" ( Mark ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:76
verses.text: ); and also in that of Baptism: for He says to the disciples, "Go ye and teach all nations, baptizing them in the Name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Ghost".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:77
verses.text: ( Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:78
verses.text: xxviii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:79
verses.text: )   But when Paul has once taken in hand the flesh, he proceeds to utter all the lowly things, without any fear: for see what he says next:  C.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:80
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:82
verses.text: "Wherefore, holy brethren, partakers of the heavenly calling, consider the Apostle and High Priest of our profession, Christ Jesus, who was faithful to Him that appointed [or made] Him, as also Moses [was faithful] in all His house".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:83
verses.text: Being about to place Him before Moses in comparison, he led his discourse to the law of the high-priesthood; for they all had a high esteem for Moses: moreover, he is already beforehand casting down the seeds of the superiority.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:84
verses.text: Therefore he begins from the flesh, and goes up to the Godhead, where there was no longer any comparison.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:85
verses.text: He began from the flesh [from His Human nature], by assuming for a time the equality, and says, "as also Moses in all His house": nor does he at first show His superiority lest the hearer should start away, and straightway stop his ears.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:86
verses.text: For although they were believers, yet nevertheless they still had strong feeling of conscience as to Moses.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:87
verses.text: "Who was faithful," he says, "to Him that made Him"—made [Him] what? "Apostle and High Priest".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:88
verses.text: He is not speaking at all in this place of His Essence, nor of His Godhead; but so far concerning human dignities.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:89
verses.text: "As also Moses in all His house," that is, either among the people, or in the temple.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:90
verses.text: But here he uses the expression "in His house," just as one might say, concerning those in the household; even as some guardian and steward of a household, so was Moses to the people.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:91
verses.text: For that by "house" he means the people, he added, "whose house we are" ( c.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:92
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:93
verses.text: ); that is, we are in His creation.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:94
verses.text: Then [comes] the superiority.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:95
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:96
verses.text: "For this man was counted worthy of more glory than Moses," (Again [he is speaking] of the Flesh), "inasmuch as he who hath builded [the house] hath more honor than the house"; [Moses] himself also (he means) was of the house.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:97
verses.text: (Moreover he did not say, For this one was a servant, but the Other a master, but he covertly intimated it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:98
verses.text: ) If the people were the house and he was of the people, then he certainly was of the household.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:99
verses.text: For so also we are accustomed to say, such an one is of such an one's house.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:100
verses.text: For here he is speaking of a house, not of the temple, for the temple was not constructed by God, but by men.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:101
verses.text: But He that made him [is] God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:102
verses.text: Moses he means.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:103
verses.text: And see how he covertly shows the superiority.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:104
verses.text: "Faithful," he says, "in all His house," being himself also of the house, that is, of the people.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:105
verses.text: The builder has more honor than the house, yet he did not say "the artificer hath more honor than his works," but "he that hath builded the house, than the house".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:106
verses.text: ( Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:107
verses.text: ) "But He that built all things is God".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:108
verses.text: Thou seest that he is speaking not about the temple but about the whole people.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:109
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:110
verses.text: "And Moses verily [was] faithful in all His house, as a servant, for a testimony of those things which were to be spoken".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:111
verses.text: See also another point of superiority, that [which is derived] from the Son and the servants.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:112
verses.text: You see again that by the appellation of The Son, he intimates true relationship.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:113
verses.text: ( Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:114
verses.text: ) "But Christ as a Son over His own house".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:115
verses.text: Perceivest thou how he separates the thing made and the maker, the servant and the son? Moreover He indeed enters into His Father's property as a master, but the other as a servant.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:116
verses.text: "Whose" [i-e:] God's "house are we, if we hold fast the confidence and the rejoicing of the hope firm unto the end".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:117
verses.text: Here again he encourages them to press forward nobly, and not to fall: for we shall be the "house" of God (he says), as Moses was, "if we hold fist our confidence and our rejoicing firm unto the end".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:118
verses.text: He however (he would say) that is distressed in his trials, and who falls, doth not glory: he that is ashamed, he that hideth himself, has no confidence, he that is perplexed doth not glory.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:119
verses.text: And then he also commends them, saying, "if we hold fast the confidence and the rejoicing of the hope firm unto the end," implying that they had even made a beginning; but that there is need of the end, and not simply to stand, but to have their hope firm "in full assurance of faith," without being shaken by their trials.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:120
verses.text: And be not astonished, that the [words] "Himself being tempted" ( c.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:121
verses.text: ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:122
verses.text: ) are spoken more after the manner of men.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:123
verses.text: For if the Scripture says of the Father, who was not made flesh, "The Lord looked down from heaven, and beheld all the sons of men" ( Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:124
verses.text: xiv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:125
verses.text: ), that is, accurately acquainted Himself with all things; and again, "I will go down, and see whether they do altogether according to the cry of them" ( Gen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:126
verses.text: xviii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:127
verses.text: ); and again, "God cannot endure the evil ways of men" ( Gen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:128
verses.text: vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:129
verses.text: ?), the divine Scripture shows forth the greatness of His wrath: much more, who even suffered in the flesh, these things are said of Christ.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:130
verses.text: For since many men consider experience the most reliable means of knowledge, he wishes to show that He that has suffered knows what human nature suffers.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:131
verses.text: "Whence holy brethren" (he says "whence" instead of "for this cause"), "partakers of an heavenly calling"—(seek nothing here, if ye have been called yonder—yonder is the reward, yonder the recompense.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:132
verses.text: What then?) "Consider the Apostle and High Priest of our profession, Christ Jesus, who was faithful to Him that appointed Him, as also Moses [was faithful] in all His house".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:133
verses.text: (What is "who was faithful to Him that appointed Him?" it is, well disposed, protecting what belongs to Him, not allowing them to be lightly carried away, "as also Moses in all His house") that is, know who your High Priest is, and what He is, and ye will need no other consolation nor encouragement.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:134
verses.text: Now he calls Him "Apostle," on account of His having been "sent," and "high priest of our profession," that is of the Faith.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:135
verses.text: This One also was entrusted with a people, as the other with the leadership of a people, but a greater one and upon higher grounds.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:136
verses.text: "For a testimony of those things which shall be spoken".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:137
verses.text: What meanest thou? Doth God receive the witness of man? Yes, certainly.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:138
verses.text: For if He call to witness heaven and earth and hills (saying by the prophet, "Hear, O heaven, and give ear, O earth, for the Lord hath spoken"— Isa.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:139
verses.text: i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:140
verses.text: —and "Hear ye ravines, foundations of the earth, for the Lord hath a controversy with His people"— Mic.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:141
verses.text: vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:142
verses.text: ), much more men; that is, that they may be witnesses, when themselves [the Jews] shameless.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:143
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:144
verses.text: "But Christ as a Son".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:145
verses.text: The one takes care of the property of others, but this One of His own.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:146
verses.text: "And the rejoicing of the hope".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:147
verses.text: Well said he "of the hope".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:148
verses.text: For since the good things were all in hope, and yet we ought so "to hold it fast," as even now to glory as for things which had already come to pass: for this cause he says, "the rejoicing of the hope".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:149
verses.text: And adds, "let us hold it firm unto the end".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:150
verses.text: ( Rom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:151
verses.text: viii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:152
verses.text: ) For "by hope we are saved"; if therefore "we are saved by hope," and "are waiting with patience" ( Rom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:153
verses.text: viii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:154
verses.text: ), let us not be grieved at present things, nor seek now those that have been promised afterwards; "For" (he says) "hope which is seen is not hope".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:155
verses.text: For since the good things are great, we cannot receive them here in this transitory life.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:156
verses.text: With what object then did He even tell us of them beforehand, when He was not about to give them here? In order that by the promise He might refresh our souls, that by the engagement He might strengthen our zeal, that He might anoint [preparing us for our contests] and stir up our mind.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:157
verses.text: For this cause then all these things were done.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:158
verses.text: Let us not then be troubled, let no man be troubled, when he seeth the wicked prospering.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:159
verses.text: The recompense is not here, either of wickedness or of virtue; and if in any instance there be either of wickedness or of virtue, yet is it not according to desert, but merely as it were a taste of the judgment, that they who believe not the resurrection may yet even by things that happen here be brought to their senses.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:160
verses.text: When then we see a wicked man rich, let us not be cast down; when we see a good man suffering, let us not be troubled.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:161
verses.text: For yonder are the crowns, yonder the punishments.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:162
verses.text: Yea and in another point of view, it is not possible either that a bad man should be altogether bad, but he may have some good things also: nor again that a good man should be altogether good, but he may also have some sins.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:163
verses.text: When therefore the wicked man prospers, it is for evil on his own head, that having here received the reward of those few good things, he may hereafter be utterly punished yonder; for this cause does he receive his recompense in this life.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:164
verses.text: And happy is he most of all who is punished here, that having put away all his sins, he may depart approved, and pure, and without having to be called to account.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:165
verses.text: And this Paul teacheth us when he says, "For this cause many [are] weak and sickly among you, and many sleep".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:166
verses.text: (  Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:167
verses.text: xi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:168
verses.text: ) And again, "I have delivered such an one to Satan".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:169
verses.text: (  Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:170
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:171
verses.text: ) And the prophet says, "for she hath received of the Lord's hand her sins double" ( Isa.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:172
verses.text: xl.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:173
verses.text: ); and again David, "Behold mine enemies that they are multiplied above the hairs of my head and [with] an unjust hatred have they hated me": "and forgive Thou all my sins".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:174
verses.text: ( Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:175
verses.text: xxv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:177
verses.text: ) And again another: "O Lord, our God, give peace unto us; for Thou hast rendered all things to us again".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:178
verses.text: ( Isa.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:179
verses.text: xxvi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:180
verses.text: )  These however are [the words] of one showing that good men receive here the punishments of their sins.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:181
verses.text: But where are the wicked [mentioned] who receive their good things here, and there are utterly punished? Hear Abraham saying to the rich man, "Thou didst receive good things," and "Lazarus evil things".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:182
verses.text: ( Luke xvi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:183
verses.text: ) What good things? For in this place by saying "thou receivest," and not thou "hadst taken," he shows that it was according to what was due to him that each was treated, and that the one was in prosperity, and the other in adversity.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:184
verses.text: And he says, "Therefore he is comforted" here (for thou seest him pure from sins) "and thou art tormented".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:185
verses.text: Let us not then be perplexed when we see sinners well off here; but when we ourselves are afflicted, let us rejoice.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:186
verses.text: For this very thing is paying off the penalty  of sins.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:187
verses.text: Let us not then seek relaxation: for Christ promised tribulation to His disciples and Paul says, "All Who will live godly in Christ Jesus, shall suffer persecution".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:188
verses.text: (  Tim.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:189
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:190
verses.text: ) No noble-spirited wrestler, when in the lists, seeks for baths, and a table full of food and wine.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:191
verses.text: This is not for a wrestler, but for a sluggard.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:192
verses.text: For the wrestler contendeth with dust, with oil, with the heat of the sun's ray, with much sweat, with pressure and constraint.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:193
verses.text: This is the time for contest and for fighting, therefore also for being wounded, and for being bloody and in pain.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:194
verses.text: Hear what the blessed Paul says, "So fight I, not as one that beateth the air".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:195
verses.text: (  Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:196
verses.text: ix.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:197
verses.text: ) Let us consider that our whole life is in combats, and then we shall never seek rest, we shall never feel it strange when we are afflicted: no more than a boxer feels it strange, when he combats.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:198
verses.text: There is another season for repose.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:199
verses.text: By tribulation we must be made perfect.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:200
verses.text: And even if there be no persecution, nor tribulation, yet there are other afflictions which befall us every day.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:201
verses.text: And if we do not bear these, we should scarcely endure those.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:202
verses.text: "There hath no temptation taken you," it is said, "but such as is common to man".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:203
verses.text: (  Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:204
verses.text: x.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:205
verses.text: ) Let us then pray indeed to God that we may not come into temptation; but if we come into it, let us bear it nobly.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:206
verses.text: For that indeed is the part of prudent men, not to throw themselves upon dangers; but this of noble men and true philosophers.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:207
verses.text: Let us not then lightly cast ourselves upon [dangers], for that is rashness; nor yet, if led into them, and called by circumstances let us give in, for that is cowardice.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:208
verses.text: But if indeed the Gospel call us, let us not refuse; but in a simple case, when there is no reason, nor need, nor necessity which calls us in the fear of God, let us not rush in.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:209
verses.text: For this is mere display, and useless ambition.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:210
verses.text: But should any of those things which are injurious to religion occur, then though it be necessary to endure ten thousand deaths, let us refuse nothing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:211
verses.text: Challenge not trials, when thou findest the things that concern godliness prosper as thou desirest.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:212
verses.text: Why draw down needless dangers which bring no gain?  These things I say, because I wish you to observe the laws of Christ who commands us to "pray that we enter not into temptation" ( Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:213
verses.text: xxvi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:214
verses.text: ), and commands us to "take up the cross and follow" Him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:215
verses.text: ( Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:216
verses.text: xvi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:217
verses.text: ) For these things are not contradictory, nay they are rather exceedingly in harmony.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:218
verses.text: Do thou be so prepared as is a valiant soldier, be continually in thine armor, sober, watchful, ever looking for the enemy: do not however breed wars, for this is not [the act] of a soldier but of a mover of sedition.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:219
verses.text: But if on the other hand the trumpet of godliness call thee, go forth immediately, and make no account of thy life, and enter with great eagerness into the contests, break the phalanx of the adversaries, bruise the face of the devil, set up thy trophy.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:220
verses.text: If however godliness be in nowise harmed, and no one lay waste our doctrines (those I mean which relate to the soul), nor compel us to do anything displeasing to God, do not be officious.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:221
verses.text: The life of the Christian must be full of blood-sheddings; I say not in shedding that of others, but in readiness to shed one's own.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:222
verses.text: Let us then pour out our own blood, when it is for Christ's sake, with as great readiness as one would pour out water (for the blood which flows about the body is water), and let us put off our flesh with as much good temper, as one even would a garment.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:223
verses.text: And this shall we do, if we be not bound to riches, if not to houses, if not to affections, if we be detached from all things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:224
verses.text: For if they who live this life of [earthly] soldiers bid farewell to all things, and whithersoever war calls them there present themselves, and make journeys, and endure all things with ready mind; much more ought we, the soldiers of Christ, so to have prepared ourselves, and to set ourselves firm against the war of the passions.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:225
verses.text: There is no persecution now, and God grant there may never be: but there is another war, that of the desire of money, of envy, of the passions.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:226
verses.text: Paul, describing this war, says, "We wrestle not against flesh and blood".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:227
verses.text: ( Eph.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:228
verses.text: vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:229
verses.text: ) This war is ever at hand.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:230
verses.text: Therefore he wishes us to stand ever armed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:231
verses.text: Because he wishes us to stand ever armed, he says, "Stand, having girded yourselves about".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:232
verses.text: ( Eph.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:233
verses.text: vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:234
verses.text: ) Which itself also belongs to the time present, and expresses that we ought ever to be armed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:235
verses.text: For great is the war through the tongue, great that through the eyes; this then we must keep down—great [too] is that of the lusts.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:236
verses.text: Therefore he begins at that point to arm the soldier of Christ: for "stand," saith he, "having your loins girt about," and he added "with truth".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:237
verses.text: ( Eph.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:238
verses.text: vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:239
verses.text: ) Why "with truth"? Because lust is a mockery and a lie: wherefore the prophet says, "My loins are filled with mockings".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:240
verses.text: ( Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:241
verses.text: xxxviii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:242
verses.text: ) The thing is not pleasure, but a shadow of pleasure.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:243
verses.text: "Having your loins," he says, "girt about with truth"; that is, with true pleasure, with temperance, with orderly behavior.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:244
verses.text: For this cause he gives this advice, knowing the unreasonableness of sin, and wishing that all our members should be hedged round; for "unjust anger" it is said, "shall not be guiltless".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:245
verses.text: ( Ecclus.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:246
verses.text: i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:247
verses.text: )  Moreover he wishes us to have around us a breastplate and a buckler.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:248
verses.text: For desire is a wild beast which easily springs forth, and we shall have need of walls and fences innumerable, to overcome, and to restrain it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:249
verses.text: And for this cause God has built this part [of our body] especially with bones, as with a kind of stones, placing around it a support, so that [desire] might not at any time, having broken or cut through, easily injure the whole man.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:250
verses.text: For it is a fire (it is said) and a great tempest, and no other part of the body could endure this violence.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:251
verses.text: And the sons of the physicians too say that for this cause the lungs have been spread under the heart, so that the heart being itself [put] into something soft and tender, by beating as it were into a sort of sponge, may continually be rested, and not [by striking] against the resisting and hard sternum, receive hurt through the violence of its beatings.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:252
verses.text: We have need therefore of a strong breastplate, so as to keep this wild beast alway quiet.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:253
verses.text: We have need also of an helmet; for since the reasoning faculty is there, and from this it is possible for us either to be saved, when what is right is done, or it is possible for us to be ruined—therefore he says, "the helmet of salvation".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:254
verses.text: ( Eph.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:255
verses.text: vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:256
verses.text: ) For the brain is indeed by nature tender, and therefore is covered above with the skull, as with a kind of shell.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:257
verses.text: And it is to us the cause of all things both good and evil, knowing what is fitting, or what is not so.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:258
verses.text: Yea and our feet too and our hands need armor, not these hands, nor these feet, but as before those of the soul—the former by being employed about what is right, the latter, that they may walk where they ought.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 6:259
verses.text: Thus then let us thoroughly arm ourselves, and we shall be able to overcome our enemies, and to wreathe ourselves with the crown in Christ Jesus our Lord, with whom to the Father together with the Holy Ghost be glory, might, honor, now and for ever and world without end, Amen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:1
verses.text: Homily VI.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:2
verses.text: Hebrews iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:3
verses.text: –  "Wherefore, as the Holy Ghost saith, To-day if ye will hear His voice, harden not your hearts, as in the provocation in the day of temptation in the wilderness, when your fathers tempted Me, proved Me, and saw My works forty years.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:4
verses.text: Wherefore I was grieved with that generation, and said, They do alway err in their heart, and they have not known My ways.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:5
verses.text: So I sware in My wrath they shall not enter into My rest".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:6
verses.text: Paul, having treated of hope, and having said that "We are His house, if we hold fast the confidence and the rejoicing of the hope firm unto the end" ( c.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:7
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:8
verses.text: ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:9
verses.text: ); next shows that we ought to look forward with firmness, and he proves this from the Scriptures.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:10
verses.text: But be attentive, because he has expressed this in a manner somewhat difficult and not readily to be comprehended.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:11
verses.text: And therefore we must first make our own statements, and after we have briefly explained the whole argument, then make clear the words of the Epistle.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:12
verses.text: For you will no longer need us, if you have understood the scope of the Apostle.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:13
verses.text: His discourse was concerning Hope, and that it behooves us to hope for the things to come, and that for those who have toiled here there will assuredly be some reward and fruit and refreshment.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:14
verses.text: This then he shows from the prophet; and what says he? "Wherefore as the Holy Ghost saith, To-day if ye will hear His voice, harden not your hearts, as in the provocation, in the day of temptation in the wilderness: when your fathers tempted Me, proved Me, and saw My works forty years.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:15
verses.text: Wherefore I was grieved with that generation, and said, they do alway err in their heart, and they have not known My ways.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:16
verses.text: So I sware in My wrath, they shall not enter into My rest".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:17
verses.text: He says that there are "three" rests: one, that of the Sabbath, in which God rested from His works; the second, that of Palestine, into which when the Jews had entered they would be at rest from their hardships and labors; the third, that which is Rest indeed, the kingdom of Heaven; which those who obtain, do indeed rest from their labors and troubles.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:18
verses.text: Of these three then he makes mention here.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:19
verses.text: And why did he mention the three, when he is treating of the one only? That he might show that the prophet is speaking concerning this one.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:20
verses.text: For he did not speak (he says) concerning the first.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:21
verses.text: For how could he, when that had taken place long before? Nor yet again concerning the second, that in Palestine.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:22
verses.text: For how could he? For he says, "They shall not enter into My rest".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:23
verses.text: It remains therefore that it is this third.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:24
verses.text: But it is necessary also to unfold the history, to make the argument more clear.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:25
verses.text: For when they had come forth out of Egypt, and had accomplished a long journey, and had received innumerable proofs of the power of God, both in Egypt, and in the Red Sea (cf.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:26
verses.text: Acts vii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:27
verses.text: ), and in the wilderness, they determined to send spies to search out the nature of the land; and these went and returned, admiring indeed the country, and saying that it abounded in noble fruits, nevertheless it was a country of strong and invincible men: and the ungrateful and senseless Jews, when they ought to have called to mind the former blessings of God, and how when they were hemmed in the midst of the armies of so many Egyptians, He rescued them from their perils, and made them masters of their enemies' spoils; and again, in the wilderness He clave the rock, and bestowed on them abundance of waters, and gave them the manna, and the other wonderful things which He wrought; [when they ought, I say, to have remembered this,] and to have trusted in God, they considered none of these things, but being struck with terror, just as if nothing had been done, they said, we wish to go back again into Egypt, "for God hath brought us out thither" (it is said) "to slay us, with our children and wives".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:28
verses.text: (Cf.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:29
verses.text: Num.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:30
verses.text: xiv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:31
verses.text: ) God therefore being angry that they had so quickly cast off the memory of what had been done, sware that generation, which had said these things, should not enter into the Rest; and they all perished in the wilderness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:32
verses.text: When David then, he says, speaking at a later period, and after these events, after that generation of men, said, "To-day, if ye will hear His voice, harden not your hearts," that ye may not suffer the same things which your forefathers did, and be deprived of the Rest; he evidently [said this] as of some [future] rest.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:33
verses.text: For if they had received their Rest (he says) why does He again say to them, "To-day if ye will hear His voice harden not your hearts," as your fathers did? What other rest then is there, except the kingdom of Heaven, of which the Sabbath was an image and type?   Next having set down the whole testimony (and this is, "To-day if ye will hear His voice, harden not your hearts, as in the provocation in the day of temptation in the wilderness, when your fathers tempted Me, proved Me, and saw My works forty years.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:34
verses.text: Wherefore I was grieved with that generation, and said, They do alway err in their heart, and they have not known My ways.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:35
verses.text: So I sware in My wrath, they shall not enter into My rest"), he then adds:  Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:36
verses.text: "Take heed, brethren, lest there be in any of you an evil heart of unbelief in departing from the living God".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:37
verses.text: For from hardness unbelief ariseth: and as in bodies, the parts that have become callous and hard do not yield to the hands of the physicians, so also souls that are hardened yield not to the word of God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:38
verses.text: For it is probable besides that some even disbelieved as though the things which had been done were not true.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:39
verses.text: Therefore he says, "Take heed lest there be in any of you an evil heart of unbelief in departing from the living God".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:40
verses.text: For since the argument from the future is not so persuasive as from the past, he reminds them of the history, in which they had wanted faith.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:41
verses.text: For if your fathers (he says) because they did not hope as they ought to have hoped, suffered these things, much more will you.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:42
verses.text: Since to them also is this word addressed: for, "To-day" (he says) is "ever," so long as the world lasts.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:43
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:44
verses.text: Wherefore "exhort ye one another daily, while it is called to-day".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:45
verses.text: That is, edify one another, raise yourselves up: lest the same things should befall you.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:46
verses.text: "Lest any one of you be hardened by the deceitfulness of sin".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:47
verses.text: Seest thou that sin produces unbelief? For as unbelief brings forth an evil life, so also a soul, "when it is come into a depth of evils, becometh contemptuous"  ( Prov.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:48
verses.text: xviii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:49
verses.text: ), and having become contemptuous it endures not even to believe, in order thereby to free itself from fear.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:50
verses.text: For "they said" (one says), "The Lord shall not see, neither shall the God of Jacob regard".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:51
verses.text: ( Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:52
verses.text: xciv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:53
verses.text: ) And again, "Our lips are our own: who is Lord over us?" ( Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:54
verses.text: xii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:55
verses.text: ); and again "Wherefore hath the wicked man provoked God to wrath?" ( Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:56
verses.text: x.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:57
verses.text: ); and again, "The fool hath said in his heart, there is no God; they are corrupt and become abominable in their doings".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:58
verses.text: ( Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:59
verses.text: xiv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:60
verses.text: ) "There is no fear of God before his eyes, for he was deceitful before Him, to find out his iniquity and to hate".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:61
verses.text: ( Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:62
verses.text: xxxvi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:64
verses.text: ) Yea and Christ also says this same thing, "Every one that doeth evil, hateth the light and cometh not to the light".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:65
verses.text: ( John iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:66
verses.text: )  Then he adds ( ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:67
verses.text: ), "For we have been made partakers of Christ".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:68
verses.text: What is this, "We have been made partakers of Christ"? We partake of Him (he means); we were made One, we and He—since He is the Head and we the body, "fellow-heirs and of the same body; we are one body, of His flesh and of His bones".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:69
verses.text: ( Eph.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:70
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:71
verses.text: ; Rom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:72
verses.text: xii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:73
verses.text: ; Eph.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:74
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:75
verses.text: )  "If we hold fast the beginning of our confidence [or, the principle of our subsistence] steadfast unto the end".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:76
verses.text: What is "the principle of our subsistence"? The faith by which we stand, and have been brought into being and were made to exist, as one may say.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:77
verses.text: Then he adds ( ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:78
verses.text: ), "When it is said, To-day if ye hear His voice, harden not your hearts, as in the provocation".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:79
verses.text: This is a transposition, "when it is said, To-day if ye hear His voice, harden not your hearts".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:80
verses.text: [It must be read thus:]  ( Ch.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:81
verses.text: iv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:83
verses.text: ) "Let us fear lest a promise being left us of entering into His rest, any of you should seem to come short of it; for to us was the Gospel preached as well as unto them when it is said, To-day if ye hear His voice" (for "To-day" is "at every time").

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:84
verses.text: Then [he adds] "but the word of hearing did not profit them, as they were not mixed by faith with them that heard".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:85
verses.text: How did it not profit? Then wishing to alarm them, he shows the same thing by what he says:  ( Ch.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:86
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:88
verses.text: ) "For some when they had heard did provoke, howbeit not all that came out of Egypt by Moses: And with whom was He grieved forty years? Was it not with them that had sinned, whose carcasses fell in the wilderness? And to whom swear He that they should not enter into His rest, but to them that believed not? So we see, that they could not enter in because of unbelief".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:89
verses.text: After again repeating the testimony, he adds also the question, which makes the argument clear.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:90
verses.text: For he said (he repeats), "To-day if ye hear His voice, harden not your hearts, as in the provocation".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:91
verses.text: Of whom does he speak (he says) [as] having been hardened? Of whom [as] not believing? Is it not of the Jews?  Now what he says is to this effect.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:92
verses.text: They also heard, as we hear: but no profit came to them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:93
verses.text: Do not suppose then that by "hearing" what is proclaimed ye will be profited; seeing that they also heard, but derived no benefit because they did not believe.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:94
verses.text: Caleb then and Joshua, because they agreed not with those who did not believe, escaped the vengeance that was sent forth against them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:95
verses.text: And see how admirably he said, not, They did not agree, but, "they were not mixed"—that is, they stood apart, but not factiously when all the others had one and the same mind.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:96
verses.text: Here it seems to me that a faction too is hinted at.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:97
verses.text: ( Ch.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:98
verses.text: iv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:99
verses.text: ) For "we who have believed," he says, "do enter into rest".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:100
verses.text: From what this is evident, he adds: "as He said, as I have sworn in My wrath, if they shall enter into My rest: although the works were finished from the foundation of the world".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:101
verses.text: This indeed, is not evidence that we shall enter in, but that they did not enter in.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:102
verses.text: What then? Thus far he aims to show that as that rest does not hinder the speaking of another rest, so neither does this [exclude] that of Heaven.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:103
verses.text: Up to this point then, he wishes to show that they [the Israelites] did not attain to the rest.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:104
verses.text: For because he means this, he says ( ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:105
verses.text: ,  ), "For he spake in a certain place of the seventh day on this wise, And God did rest the seventh day from all His works.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:106
verses.text: And in this place again, If they shall enter into My rest".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:107
verses.text: Thou seest how that doth not hinder this from being a rest?  Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:109
verses.text: "Seeing therefore it remaineth" (he says) "that some must enter therein, and they to whom it was first preached entered not in because of unbelief: again he limiteth a certain day, saying in David, To-day, after so long a time; as it has been said before".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:110
verses.text: But what is it that he means? "Seeing then" (he means) that "some must" certainly "enter in," and "they did not enter in".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:111
verses.text: And that an entrance is proclaimed, and that "some must enter in," let us hear from what this is clear.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:112
verses.text: Because after so many years (he says) David again says: "To-day if ye will hear His voice, harden not your hearts" ( ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:113
verses.text: ), "For if Joshua had given them rest he would not afterward have spoken of another day".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:114
verses.text: It is evident, that he says these things, as of persons who are to attain some recompense.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:115
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:116
verses.text: "There remaineth therefore a rest for the people of God".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:117
verses.text: Whence [does this appear]? From the exhortation, "Harden not your hearts": for if there were no rest, these exhortations would not have been given.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:118
verses.text: Neither would they have been exhorted not to do the same things [with the Jews] lest they should suffer the same things, unless they were about to suffer the same.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:119
verses.text: But how were they who were in possession of Palestine about to suffer the same things [i-e: exclusion from the rest] unless there were some other rest?  And well did he conclude the argument.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:120
verses.text: For he said not rest but "Sabbath-keeping"; calling the kingdom "Sabbath-keeping," by the appropriate name, and that which they rejoiced in and were attracted by.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:121
verses.text: For as, on the Sabbath He commands to abstain from all evil things; and that those things only which relate to the Service of God should be done, which things the Priests were wont to accomplish, and whatsoever profits the soul, and nothing else; so also [will it be] then.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:122
verses.text: However it is not he who spoke thus, but what? ( Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:123
verses.text: ), "For he that is entered into his rest, he also hath ceased from his own works, as God [did] from His".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:124
verses.text: As God ceased from His works, he says, so he that hath entered into His rest [hath ceased].

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:125
verses.text: For since his discourse to them was concerning rest, and they were desirous to hear when this would be, he concluded the argument with this.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:126
verses.text: And [he said] "To-day," that they might never be without hope.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:127
verses.text: "Exhort one another daily," he says, ["while it is called today,"] that is, even if a man have sinned, as long as it is "To-day," he has hope: let no man then despair so long as he lives.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:128
verses.text: Above all things indeed, he says, "let there not be an evil heart of unbelief".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:130
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:131
verses.text: ) But even suppose there should be, let no man despair, but let him recover himself; for as long as we are in this world, the "To-day" is in season.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:132
verses.text: But here he means not unbelief only, but also murmurings: "whose carcasses," he says, "fell' in the wilderness".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:133
verses.text: Then, lest any think that they will simply be deprived of rest only, he adds also the punishment, saying ( c.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:134
verses.text: iv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:135
verses.text: ), "For the Word of God is quick, and powerful; and sharper than any two-edged sword, and pierceth even to the dividing asunder of soul and spirit, and of the joints and marrow: and is a discerner of the thoughts and intents of the heart".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:136
verses.text: Here he is speaking of Hell and of punishment.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:137
verses.text: "It pierceth" (he says) into the secrets of our heart, and cutteth asunder the soul.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:138
verses.text: Here it is not the falling of carcasses nor, as there, the being deprived of a country, but of a heavenly kingdom; and being delivered to an everlasting hell, and to undying punishment and vengeance.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:139
verses.text: ( Ch.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:140
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:141
verses.text: ) "But exhort one another".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:142
verses.text: Observe the gentleness and mildness [of the expression]: he said not "Rebuke," but "Exhort".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:143
verses.text: Thus we are required to bear ourselves towards those who are straightened by affliction.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:144
verses.text: This he says also in writing to the Thessalonians, "Warn them that are unruly" (  Thess.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:145
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:146
verses.text: ), but in speaking of the feeble-minded, not so, but what? "Comfort the feeble-minded, support the weak, be patient toward all men"; that is, do not cease to hope; do not despair.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:147
verses.text: For he that does not encourage one who is straightened by affliction, makes him more hardened.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:148
verses.text: "Lest any of you," he says, "be hardened by the deceitfulness of sin".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:149
verses.text: He means either the deceit of the devil (for it is indeed a deceit, not to look for the things to come, to think that we are without responsibility, and that we shall not pay the penalty for our deeds here, neither will there be a resurrection); or in another sense insensibility [or] despairing is deceit.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:150
verses.text: For to say, 'What is there left? I have sinned once for all, I have no hope of recovering myself,' is deceit.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:151
verses.text: Then he suggests hopes to them, saying ( ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:152
verses.text: ), "We are made partakers of Christ"; All but saying, He that so loved us, He that counted us worthy of so great things, as to make us His Body, will not suffer us to perish.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:153
verses.text: Let us consider (he says) of what we have been thought worthy: we and Christ are One: let us not then distrust Him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 7:154
