verses.text: For the strong soldier is not only able to help himself, but also to protect his comrade, and to free him from the malice of the enemy.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 9:224
verses.text: But as it is, some do not even know that there are any Scriptures.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 9:225
verses.text: Yet the Holy Spirit indeed made so many wise provisions in order that they might be safely kept.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 9:226
verses.text: And look at it from the first, that ye may learn the unspeakable love of God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 9:227
verses.text: He inspired the blessed Moses; He engraved the tables, He detained him on the mount forty days; and again as many [more] to give the Law.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 9:228
verses.text: And after this He sent prophets who suffered woes innumerable.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 9:229
verses.text: War came on; they slew them all, they cut them to pieces, the books were burned.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 9:230
verses.text: Again, He inspired another admirable man to publish them, Ezra I mean, and caused them to be put together from the remains.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 9:231
verses.text: And after this He arranged that they should be translated by the seventy.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 9:232
verses.text: They did translate them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 9:233
verses.text: Christ came, He receives them; the Apostles disperse them among men.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 9:234
verses.text: Christ wrought signs and wonders.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 9:235
verses.text: What then after so great painstaking? The Apostles also wrote, even as Paul likewise said, "they were written for our admonition, upon whom the ends of the world are come".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 9:236
verses.text: (  Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 9:237
verses.text: x.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 9:238
verses.text: ) And again Christ said, "Ye do err not knowing the Scriptures" ( Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 9:239
verses.text: xxii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 9:240
verses.text: ): and again Paul said, "That through patience and comfort of the Scriptures we may have hope".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 9:241
verses.text: ( Rom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 9:242
verses.text: xv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 9:243
verses.text: ) And again, "All Scripture is given by inspiration of God, and is profitable".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 9:244
verses.text: (  Tim.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 9:245
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 9:246
verses.text: ) And "let the word of Christ dwell in you richly".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 9:247
verses.text: ( Col.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 9:248
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 9:249
verses.text: ) And the prophet, "he shall meditate in His Law day and night" ( Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 9:250
verses.text: i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 9:251
verses.text: ), and again in another place, "Let all thy communication be in the law of the Most High".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 9:252
verses.text: ( Ecclus.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 9:253
verses.text: ix.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 9:254
verses.text: ) And again, "How sweet are Thy words unto my throat".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 9:255
verses.text: (He said not to my hearing, but to my "throat"); "more than honey and the honeycomb to my mouth".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 9:256
verses.text: ( Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 9:257
verses.text: cxix.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 9:258
verses.text: ) And Moses says, "Thou shalt meditate in them continually, when thou risest up, when thou sittest, when thou liest down".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 9:259
verses.text: ( Deut.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 9:260
verses.text: vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 9:261
verses.text: ) "Be in them" (  Tim.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 9:262
verses.text: iv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 9:263
verses.text: ), saith he.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 9:264
verses.text: And innumerable things one might say concerning them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 9:265
verses.text: But notwithstanding, after so many things there are some who do not even know that there are Scriptures at all.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 9:266
verses.text: For this cause, believe me, nothing sound, nothing profitable comes from us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 9:267
verses.text: Yet, if any one wished to learn military affairs, of necessity he must learn the military laws.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 9:268
verses.text: And if any one sought to learn navigation or carpentry or anything else, of necessity he must learn the [principles] of the art.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 9:269
verses.text: But in this case they will not do anything of the kind, although this is a science which needs much wakeful attention.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 9:270
verses.text: For that it too is an art which needs teaching, hear the prophet saying, "Come, ye children, hearken unto me, I will teach you the fear of the Lord".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 9:271
verses.text: ( Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 9:272
verses.text: xxxiv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 9:273
verses.text: ) It follows therefore certainly that the fear of God needs teaching.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 9:274
verses.text: Then he says, "What man is he that desireth life?" ( Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 9:275
verses.text: xxxiv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 9:276
verses.text: ) He means the life yonder; and again, "Keep thy tongue from evil and thy lips from speaking guile; de part from evil and do good, seek peace and pursue it".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 9:277
verses.text: ( Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 9:278
verses.text: xxxiv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 9:280
verses.text: )  Do you know indeed who said these things, a prophet or a historian, or an apostle, or an evangelist? For my own part I do not think you do, except a few.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 9:281
verses.text: Yea and these themselves again, if we bring forward a testimony from some other place, will be in the same case as the rest of you.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 9:282
verses.text: For see, I repeat the same statement expressed in other words.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 9:283
verses.text: "Wash ye, make you clean, put away your wickedness from your souls before Mine eyes, learn to do well, seek out judgment.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 9:284
verses.text: Keep thy tongue from evil, and do good: learn to do well".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 9:285
verses.text: ( Isa.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 9:286
verses.text: i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 9:288
verses.text: ) Thou seest that virtue needs to be taught? For this one says, "I will teach you the fear of the Lord," and the other, "Learn to do well".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 9:289
verses.text: Now then do you know where these words are? For myself I do not think you do, except a few.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 9:290
verses.text: And yet every week these things are read to you twice or even three times: and the reader when he goes up [to the desk] first says whose the book is, [the book] of such a prophet, and then says what he says, so that it shall be more intelligible to you and you may not only know the contents of the Book, but also the reason of the writings, and who spake these things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 9:291
verses.text: But all in vain; all to no purpose.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 9:292
verses.text: For your zeal is spent on things of this life, and of things spiritual no account is made.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 9:293
verses.text: Therefore not even those matters turn out according to your wishes, but there also are many difficulties.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 9:294
verses.text: For Christ says, "Seek ye the Kingdom of God, and all these things shall be added unto you".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 9:295
verses.text: ( Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 9:296
verses.text: vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 9:297
verses.text: ) These things He said, shall also be given in the way of addition: but we have inverted the order and seek the earth and the good things which are in the earth, as if those other [heavenly] things were to be given us in addition.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 9:298
verses.text: Therefore we have neither the one nor the other.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 9:299
verses.text: Let us then at last wake up and become coveters of the things which shall be hereafter; for so these also will follow.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 9:300
verses.text: For it is not possible that he who seeks the things that relate to God, should not also attain human [blessings].

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 9:301
verses.text: It is the declaration of the Truth itself which says this.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 9:302
verses.text: Let us not then act otherwise, but let us hold fast to the counsel of Christ, lest we fail of all.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 9:303
verses.text: But God is able to give you compunction and to make you better, in Christ Jesus our Lord, with whom to the Father together with the Holy Ghost be glory, power, honor, now and for ever and world without end, Amen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:1
verses.text: Homily IX.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:2
verses.text: Hebrews vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:3
verses.text: –  "Therefore leaving the principles of the Doctrine of Christ, let us go on unto perfection, not laying again the foundation of repentance from dead works, and of faith toward God; of the doctrine of baptisms, and of laying on of hands; and of resurrection of the dead, and of eternal judgment.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:4
verses.text: And this we will do, if God permit".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:5
verses.text: You have heard how much Paul found fault with the Hebrews for wishing to be always learning about the same things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:6
verses.text: And with good reason: "For when for the time ye ought to be teachers, ye have need again that some one teach you the elements of the first principles of the oracles of God".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:8
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:9
verses.text: )  I am afraid that this might fitly be said to you also, that "when for the time ye ought to be teachers," ye do not maintain the rank of learners, but ever hearing the same things, and on the same subjects, you are in the same condition as if you heard no one.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:10
verses.text: And if any man should question you, no one will be able to answer, except a very few who may soon be counted.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:11
verses.text: But this is no trifling loss.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:12
verses.text: For oftentimes when the teacher wishes to go on further, and to touch on higher and more mysterious themes, the want of attention in those who are to be taught prevents.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:13
verses.text: For just as in the case of a grammar-master, if a boy though hearing continually the first elements does not master them, it will be necessary for him to be continually dinning the same things into the boy, and he will not leave off teaching, until the boy has been able to learn them accurately; for it is great folly to lead him on to other things, without having put the first well into him; so too in the Church, if while we constantly say the same things you learn nothing more, we shall never cease saying the same things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:14
verses.text: For if our preaching were a matter of display and ambition, it would have been right to jump from one subject to another and change about continually, taking no thought for you, but only for your applauses.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:15
verses.text: But since we have not devoted our zeal to this, but our labors are all for your profit, we shall not cease discoursing to you on the same subjects, till you succeed in learning them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:16
verses.text: For I might have said much about Gentile superstition, and about the Manichaeans, and about the Marcionists, and by the grace of God have given them heavy blows, but this sort of discourse is out of season.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:17
verses.text: For to those who do not yet know accurately their own affairs, to those who have not yet learned that to be covetous is evil, who would utter such discourses as those, and lead them on to other subjects before the time?  We then shall not cease to say the same things, whether ye be persuaded or not.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:18
verses.text: We fear however, that by continually saying the same things, if ye hearken not, we may make the condemnation heavier for the disobedient.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:19
verses.text: I must not however say this in regard to you all; for I know many who are benefited by their coming here, who might with justice cry out against those others, as insidiously injuring them by their ignorance and inattention.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:20
verses.text: But not even so will they be injured.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:21
verses.text: For hearing the same things continually is useful even to those who know them, since by often hearing what we know we are more deeply affected.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:22
verses.text: We know, for instance, that Humility is an excellent thing, and that Christ often discoursed about it; but when we listen to the words themselves and the reflections made upon them, we are yet more affected, even if we hear them ten thousand times.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:23
verses.text: It is then a fitting time for us also to say now to you, "Wherefore leaving the beginning of the doctrine of Christ, let us go unto perfection".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:24
verses.text: What is "the beginning of the doctrine"? He goes on to state it himself, saying, "not laying again" (these are his words) "the foundation of repentance from dead works, and faith toward God, of the doctrine of baptisms and of laying on of hands, of the resurrection of the dead, and of eternal judgment".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:25
verses.text: But if this be "the Beginning," what else is our doctrine save to repent "from dead works," and through the Spirit to receive "the faith," in "the resurrection of the dead, and eternal judgment"? But what is "the Beginning"? "The Beginning," he says, is nothing else than this, when there is not a strict life.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:26
verses.text: For as it is necessary to instruct one who is entering on the study of grammar, in the Elements first, so also must the Christian know these things accurately, and have no doubt concerning them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:27
verses.text: And should he again have need of teaching, he has not yet the foundation.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:28
verses.text: For one who is firmly grounded ought to be fixed and to stand steady, and not be moved about.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:29
verses.text: But if one who has been catechised and baptized is going ten years afterwards to hear again about the Faith, and that we ought to "believe" in "the resurrection of the dead," he does not yet have the foundation, he is again seeking after the beginning of the Christian religion.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:30
verses.text: For that the Faith is the foundation, and the rest the building, hear him [the Apostle] saying; "I have laid the foundation and another buildeth thereupon".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:31
verses.text: (  Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:32
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:33
verses.text: ) "If any man build upon this foundation, gold, silver, precious stones, wood, hay, stubble".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:34
verses.text: (  Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:35
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:36
verses.text: )  "Not laying again" (he says) "the foundation of repentance from dead works".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:37
verses.text: But what is, "let us go on unto perfection"? Let us henceforth proceed (he means) even to the very roof, that is, let us have the best life.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:38
verses.text: For as in the case of the letters the Alpha involves the whole, and as the foundation, the whole building, so also does full assurance concerning the Faith involve purity of life.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:39
verses.text: And without this it is not possible to be a Christian, as without foundations there can be no building; nor skill in literature without the letters.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:40
verses.text: Still if one should be always going round about the letters, or if about the foundation, not about the building, he will never gain anything.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:41
verses.text: Do not however think that the Faith is depreciated by being called elementary: for it is indeed the whole power: for when he says, "For every one that useth milk is unskilled in the word of righteousness, for he is a babe" ( c.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:42
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:43
verses.text: ), it is not this which he calls "milk".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:44
verses.text: But to be still doubting about these things is [a sign] of a mind feeble, and needing many discourses.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:45
verses.text: For these are the wholesome doctrines.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:46
verses.text: For we call him "a perfect man" [i-e: "of full age"] who with the faith has a right life; but if any one have faith, yet does evil, and is in doubt concerning [the faith] itself, and brings disgrace on the doctrine, him we shall with reason call "a babe," in that he has gone back again to the beginning.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:47
verses.text: So that even if we have been ten thousand years in the faith, yet are not firm in it, we are babes; when we show a life not in conformity with it; when we are still laying a foundation.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:48
verses.text: But besides [their way of] life he brings another charge also against these [Hebrews], as being shaken to and fro, and needing "to lay a foundation of repentance from dead works".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:49
verses.text: For he who changes from one to another, giving up this, and choosing that, ought first to condemn this, and to be separated from the system, and then to pass to the other.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:50
verses.text: But if he intends again to lay hold on the first, how shall he touch the second?  What then of the Law (he says)? We have condemned it, and again we run back to it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:51
verses.text: This is not a shifting about, for here also [under the Gospel] we have a law.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:52
verses.text: "Do we then" (he says) "make void the law through faith? God forbid, yea we establish the Law".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:53
verses.text: ( Rom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:54
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:55
verses.text: ) I was speaking concerning evil deeds.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:56
verses.text: For he that intends to pursue virtue ought to condemn wickedness first, and then go in pursuit of it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:57
verses.text: For repentance cannot prove them clean.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:58
verses.text: For this cause they were straightway baptized, that what they were unable to accomplish by themselves, this might be effected by the grace of Christ.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:59
verses.text: Neither then does repentance suffice for purification, but men must first receive baptism.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:60
verses.text: At all events, it was necessary to come to baptism, having condemned the sins thereby and given sentence against them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:61
verses.text: But what is "the doctrine of baptisms"? Not as if there were many baptisms, but one only.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:62
verses.text: Why then did he express it in the plural? Because he had said, "not laying again a foundation of repentance".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:63
verses.text: For if he again baptized them and catechised them afresh, and having been baptized at the beginning they were again taught what things ought to be done and what ought not, they would remain perpetually incorrigible.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:64
verses.text: "And of laying on of hands".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:65
verses.text: For thus did they receive the Spirit, "when Paul had laid his hands on them" ( Acts xix.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:66
verses.text: ), it is said.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:67
verses.text: "And of the resurrection of the dead".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:68
verses.text: For this is both effected in baptism, and is affirmed in the confession.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:69
verses.text: "And of eternal judgment".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:70
verses.text: But why does he say this? Because it was likely that, having already believed, they would either be shaken [from their faith], or would lead evil and slothful lives, he says, "be wakeful".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:71
verses.text: It is not open to them to say, If we live slothfully we will be baptized again, we will be catechised again, we will again receive the Spirit; even if now we fall from the faith, we shall be able again by being baptized, to wash away our sins, and to attain to the same state as before.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:72
verses.text: Ye are deceived (he says) in supposing these things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:73
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:75
verses.text: "For it is impossible for those who were once enlightened and have tasted of the heavenly gift, and were made partakers of the Holy Ghost, and have tasted the good word of God, and the powers of the world to come, if they shall fall away, to renew them again unto repentance, crucifying to themselves the Son of God afresh, and putting Him to an open shame".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:76
verses.text: And see how putting them to shame, and forbiddingly he begins.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:77
verses.text: "Impossible".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:78
verses.text: No longer (he says) expect that which is not possible; (For he said not, It is not seemly, or, It is not expedient, or, It is not lawful, but "impossible," so as to cast [them] into despair), if ye have once been altogether enlightened.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:79
verses.text: Then he adds, "and have tasted of the heavenly gift.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:80
verses.text: If ye have tasted" (he says) "of the heavenly gift," that is, of forgiveness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:81
verses.text: "And been made partakers of the Holy Ghost, and tasted the good word of God" (he is speaking here of the doctrine) "and the powers of the world to come" (what powers is he speaking of? either the working of miracles, or "the earnest of the Spirit"—  Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:82
verses.text: i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:83
verses.text: ) "and have fallen away, to renew them again unto repentance, seeing they crucify to themselves the Son of God afresh and put Him to an open shame".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:84
verses.text: "Renew them," he says, "unto repentance," that is, by repentance, for unto repentance is by repentance.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:85
verses.text: What then, is repentance excluded? Not repentance, far from it! But the renewing again by the laver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:86
verses.text: For he did not say, "impossible" to be renewed "unto repentance," and stop, but added how "impossible, [by] crucifying afresh".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:87
verses.text: To "be renewed," that is, to be made new, for to make men new is [the work] of the laver only: for (it is said) "thy youth shall be renewed as the eagle's".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:88
verses.text: ( Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:89
verses.text: ciii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:90
verses.text: ) But it is [the work of] repentance, when those who have been made new, have afterwards become old through sins, to set them free from this old age, and to make them strong.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:91
verses.text: To bring them to that former brightness however, is not possible; for there the whole was Grace.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:92
verses.text: "Crucifying to themselves," he says, "the Son of God afresh, and putting Him to an open shame".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:93
verses.text: What he means is this.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:94
verses.text: Baptism is a Cross, and "our old man was crucified with [Him]" ( Rom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:95
verses.text: vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:96
verses.text: ), for we were "made conformable to the likeness of His death" ( Rom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:97
verses.text: vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:98
verses.text: ; Philip.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:99
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:100
verses.text: ), and again, "we were buried therefore with Him by baptism into death".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:101
verses.text: ( Rom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:102
verses.text: vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:103
verses.text: ) Wherefore, as it is not possible that Christ should be crucified a second time, for that is to "put Him to an open shame".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:104
verses.text: For "if death shall no more have dominion over Him" ( Rom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:105
verses.text: vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:106
verses.text: ), if He rose again, by His resurrection becoming superior to death; if by death He wrestled with and overcame death, and then is crucified again, all those things become a fable and a mockery.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:107
verses.text: He then that baptizeth a second time, crucifies Him again.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:108
verses.text: But what is "crucifying afresh"? [It is] crucifying over again.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:109
verses.text: For as Christ died on the cross, so do we in baptism, not as to the flesh, but as to sin.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:110
verses.text: Behold two deaths.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:111
verses.text: He died as to the flesh; in our case the old man was buried, and the new man arose, made conformable to the likeness of His death.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:112
verses.text: If therefore it is necessary to be baptized [again], it is necessary that this same [Christ] should die again.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:113
verses.text: For baptism is nothing else than the putting to death of the baptized, and his rising again.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:114
verses.text: And he well said, "crucifying afresh unto themselves".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:115
verses.text: For he that does this, as having forgotten the former grace, and ordering his own life carelessly, acts in all respects as if there were another baptism.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:116
verses.text: It behooves us therefore to take heed and to make ourselves safe.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:117
verses.text: What is, "having tasted of the heavenly gift"? it is, "of the remission of sins": for this is of God alone to bestow, and the grace is a grace once for all.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:118
verses.text: "What then? shall we continue in sin that grace may abound? Far from it!" ( Rom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:119
verses.text: vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:121
verses.text: ) But if we should be always going to be saved by grace we shall never be good.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:122
verses.text: For where there is but one grace, and we are yet so indolent, should we then cease sinning if we knew that it is possible again to have our sins washed away? For my part I think not.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:123
verses.text: He here shows that the gifts are many: and to explain it, Ye were counted worthy (he says) of so great forgiveness; for he that was sitting in darkness, he that was at enmity, he that was at open war, that was alienated, that was hated of God, that was lost, he having been suddenly enlightened, counted worthy of the Spirit, of the heavenly gift, of adoption as a son, of the kingdom of heaven, of those other good things, the unspeakable mysteries; and who does not even thus become better, but while indeed worthy of perdition, obtained salvation and honor, as if he had successfully accomplished great things; how could he be again baptized?  On two grounds then he said that the thing was impossible, and he put the stronger last: first, because he who has been deemed worthy of such [blessings], and who has betrayed all that was granted to him, is not worthy to be again renewed; neither is it possible that [Christ] should again be crucified afresh: for this is to "put Him to an open shame".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:124
verses.text: There is not then any second laver: there is not [indeed].

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:125
verses.text: And if there is, there is also a third, and a fourth; for the former one is continually disannulled by the later, and this continually by another, and so on without end.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:126
verses.text: "And tasted," he says, "the good word of God"; and he does not unfold it; "and the powers of the world to come," for to live as Angels and to have no need of earthly things, to know that this is the means of our introduction to the enjoyment of the worlds to come; this may we learn through the Spirit, and enter into those sacred recesses.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:127
verses.text: What are "the powers of the world to come"? Life eternal, angelic conversation.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:128
verses.text: Of these we have already received the earnest through our Faith from the Spirit.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:129
verses.text: Tell me then, if after having been introduced into a palace, and entrusted with all things therein, thou hadst then betrayed all, wouldest thou have been entrusted with them again?   What then (you say)? Is there no repentance? There is repentance, but there is no second baptism: but repentance there is, and it has great force, and is able to set free from the burden of his sins, if he will, even him that hath been baptized much in sins, and to establish in safety him who is in danger, even though he should have come unto the very depth of wickedness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:130
verses.text: And this is evident from many places.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:131
verses.text: "For," says one, "doth not he that falleth rise again? or he that turneth away, doth not he turn back to [God]?" ( Jer.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:132
verses.text: viii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:133
verses.text: ) It is possible, if we will, that Christ should be formed in us again: for hear Paul saying, "My little children of whom I travail in birth again, until Christ be formed in you".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:134
verses.text: ( Gal.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:135
verses.text: iv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:136
verses.text: ) Only let us lay hold on repentance.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:137
verses.text: For behold the love of God to man! We ought on every ground to have been punished at the first; in that having received the natural law, and enjoyed innumerable blessings, we have not acknowledged our Master, and have lived an unclean life.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:138
verses.text: Yet He not only has not punished us, but has even made us partakers of countless blessings, just as if we had accomplished great things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:139
verses.text: Again we fell away, and not even so does He punish us, but has given medicine of repentance, which is sufficient to put away and blot out all our sins; only if we knew the nature of the medicine, and how we ought to apply it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:140
verses.text: What then is the medicine of Repentance and how is it made up? First, of the condemnation of our own sins; "For" (it is said) "mine iniquity have I not hid" ( Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:141
verses.text: xxxii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:142
verses.text: ); and again, "I will confess against myself my lawlessness unto the Lord, and Thou forgavest the iniquity of my heart".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:143
verses.text: And "Declare thou at the first thy sins, that thou mayest be justified".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:144
verses.text: ( Isa.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:145
verses.text: xliii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:146
verses.text: ) And, "The righteous man is an accuser of himself at the first speaking".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:147
verses.text: ( Prov.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:148
verses.text: xviii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:149
verses.text: )  Secondly, of great humbleness of mind: For it is like a golden chain; if one have hold of the beginning, all will follow.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:150
verses.text: Because if thou confess thy sin as one ought to confess, the soul is humbled.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:151
verses.text: For conscience turning it on itself causeth it to be subdued.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:152
verses.text: Other things too must be added to humbleness of mind if it be such as the blessed David knew, when he said, "A broken and a contrite heart God will not despise".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:153
verses.text: ( Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:154
verses.text: li.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:155
verses.text: ) For that which is broken does not rise up, does not strike, but is ready to be ill-treated and itself riseth not up.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:156
verses.text: Such is contrition of heart: though it be insulted, though it be evil entreated, it is quiet, and is not eager for vengeance.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:157
verses.text: And after humbleness of mind, there is need of intense prayers, of many tears, tears by day, and tears by night: for, he says, "every night, will I wash my bed, I will water my couch with my tears.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:158
verses.text: I am weary with my groaning".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:159
verses.text: ( Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:160
verses.text: vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:161
verses.text: ) And again, "For I have eaten ashes as it were bread, and mingled my drink with weeping".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:162
verses.text: ( Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:163
verses.text: cii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:164
verses.text: )  And after prayer thus intense, there is need of much almsgiving: for this it is which especially gives strength to the medicine of repentance.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:165
verses.text: And as there is a medicine among the physicians' helps which receives many herbs, but one is the essential, so also in case of repentance this is the essential herb, yea, it may be everything.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:166
verses.text: For hear what the Divine Scripture says, "Give alms, and all things shall be clean".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:167
verses.text: ( Luke xi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:168
verses.text: ) And again, "By alms-giving and acts of faithfulness sins are purged away".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:169
verses.text: ( Prov.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:170
verses.text: xvi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:171
verses.text: ) And, "Water will quench a flaming fire, and alms will do away with great sins".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:172
verses.text: ( Ecclus.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:173
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:174
verses.text: )  Next not being angry with any one, not bearing malice; the forgiving all their trespasses.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:175
verses.text: For, it is said, "Man retaineth wrath against man, and yet seeketh healing from the Lord".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:176
verses.text: ( Ecclus.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:177
verses.text: xxviii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:178
verses.text: ) "Forgive that ye may be forgiven".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:179
verses.text: ( Mark xi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:180
verses.text: )  Also, the converting our brethren from their wandering.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:181
verses.text: For, it is said, "Go thou, and convert thy brethren, that thy sins may be forgiven thee".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:182
verses.text: And from one's being in close relations with the priests, "and if," it is said, "a man hath committed sins it shall be forgiven him".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:183
verses.text: ( Jas.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:184
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:185
verses.text: ) To stand forward in defense of those who are wronged.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:186
verses.text: Not to retain anger: to bear all things meekly.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:187
verses.text: Now then, before you learned that it is possible to have our sins washed away by means of repentance, were ye not in an agony, because there is no second laver, and were ye not in despair of yourselves? But now that we have learned by what means repentance and remission is brought to a successful issue, and that we shall be able entirely to escape, if we be willing to use it aright, what forgiveness can we possibly obtain, if we do not even enter on the thought of our sins? since if this were done, all would be accomplished.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:188
verses.text: For as he who enters the door, is within; so he who reckons up his own evils will also certainly come to get them cured.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:189
verses.text: But should he say, I am a sinner, without reckoning them up specifically, and saying, This and this sin have I committed, he will never leave off, confessing indeed continually, but never caring in earnest for amendment.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:190
verses.text: For should he have laid down a beginning, all the rest will unquestionably follow too, if only in one point he have shown a beginning: for in every case the beginning and the preliminaries are difficult.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:191
verses.text: This then let us lay as a foundation, and all will be smooth and easy.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:192
verses.text: Let us begin therefore, I entreat you, one with making his prayers intense: another with continual weeping: another with downcast countenance.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:193
verses.text: For not even is this, which is so small, unprofitable: for "I saw" (it is said) "that he was grieved and went downcast, and I healed his ways".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:194
verses.text: ( Isa.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:195
verses.text: lvii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:197
verses.text: )  But let us all humble our own souls by alms-giving and forgiving our neighbors their trespasses, by not remembering injuries, nor avenging ourselves.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:198
verses.text: If we continually reflect on our sins, no external circumstances can make us elated: neither riches, nor power, nor authority, nor honor; nay, even should we sit in the imperial chariot itself, we shall sigh bitterly: Since even the blessed David was a King, and yet he said, "Every night I will wash my bed," [&c.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:199
verses.text: ] ( Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:200
verses.text: vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:201
verses.text: ): and he was not at all hurt by the purple robe and the diadem: he was not puffed up; for he knew himself to be a man, and inasmuch as his heart had been made contrite, he went mourning.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:202
verses.text: For what are all things human? Ashes and dust, and as it were spray before the wind; a smoke and a shadow, and a leaf driven here and there; and a flower; a dream, and a tale, and a fable, wind and air vainly puffed out and wasting away; a feather that hath no stay, a stream flowing by, or if there be aught of more nothingness than these.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:203
verses.text: For, tell me, what dost thou esteem great? What dignity thinkest thou to be great? is it that of the Consul? For the many think no greater dignity than that.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:204
verses.text: He who is not Consul is not a whit inferior to him who is in so great splendor, who is so greatly admired.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:205
verses.text: Both one and the other are of the same dignity; both of them alike, after a little while, are no more.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:206
verses.text: When was he made [Consul]? For how long a time? tell me: for two days? Nay, this takes place even in dreams.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:207
verses.text: But that is [only] a dream, you say.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:208
verses.text: And what is this? For (tell me) what is by day, is it [therefore] not a dream? Why do we not rather call these things a dream? For as dreams when the day comes on are proved to be nothing: so these things also, when the night comes on, are proved to be nothing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:209
verses.text: For night and day have received each an equal portion of time, and have equally divided all duration.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:210
verses.text: Therefore as in the day a person rejoices not in what happened at night, so neither in the night is it possible for him to reap the fruit of what is done in the day.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:211
verses.text: Thou hast been made Consul? So was I in the night; only I in the night, thou in the day.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:212
verses.text: And what of this? Not even so hast thou any advantage over me, except haply its being said, Such an one is Consul, and the pleasure that springs from the words, gives him the advantage.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:213
verses.text: I mean something of this kind, for I will express it more plainly: if I say "Such an one is Consul," and bestow on him the name, is it not gone as soon as it is spoken? So also are the things themselves; no sooner doth the Consul appear, than he is no more.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:214
verses.text: But let us suppose [that he is Consul] for a year, or two years, or three or four years.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:215
verses.text: Where are they who were ten times Consul? Nowhere.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:216
verses.text: But Paul is not so.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:217
verses.text: For he was, and also is living continually: he did not live one day, nor two, nor ten, and twenty, nor thirty; nor ten and twenty, nor yet thirty years—and die.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:218
verses.text: Even the four hundredth year is now past, and still even yet is he illustrious, yea much more illustrious than when he was alive.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:219
verses.text: And these things indeed [are] on earth; but the glory of the saints in heaven what word could set forth?  Wherefore I entreat you, let us seek this glory; let us pursue after it, that we may attain it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:220
verses.text: For this is the true glory.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 10:221
verses.text: Let us henceforth stand aloof from the things of this life, that we may find grace and mercy in Christ Jesus our Lord: with whom to the Father, together with the Holy Ghost, be glory, power, honor and worship, now and for ever, and world without end, Amen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:1
verses.text: Homily X.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:2
verses.text: Hebrews vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:3
verses.text: ,  "For the Earth which drinketh in the rain that cometh oft upon it, and bringeth forth herbs meet for them by whom it is dressed, receiveth blessing from God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:4
verses.text: But if it bear thorns and briars it is rejected, and nigh unto cursing, whose end is to be burned".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:5
verses.text: Let us hear the oracles of God with fear, with fear and much trembling.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:6
verses.text: For (it is said) "Serve the Lord with fear, and rejoice unto Him with trembling".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:7
verses.text: ( Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:8
verses.text: ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:9
verses.text: ) But if even our joy and our exultation ought to be "with trembling," of what punishment are we not worthy, if we listen not with terror to what is said, when the things spoken, as now, are themselves fearful?  For having said that "it is impossible for those who have fallen away" to be baptized a second time, and to receive remission through the laver, and having pointed out the awfulness of the case, he goes on: "for the earth which drinketh in the rain that cometh oft upon it, and bringeth forth herbs meet for them by whom it is dressed, receiveth blessing from God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:10
verses.text: But if it bear thorns and thistles, it is rejected, and nigh unto cursing; whose end is to be burned".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:11
verses.text: Let us then fear, beloved! This threat is not Paul's, these words are not of man: they are of the Holy Ghost, of Christ that speaketh in him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:12
verses.text: Is there then any one that is clear from these thorns? And even if we were clear, not even so ought we to be confident, but to fear and tremble lest at any time thorns should spring up in us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:13
verses.text: But when we are "thorns and thistles" through and through, whence (tell me) are we confident? And are becoming supine? What is it which makes us inert? If "he that thinketh he standeth" ought to fear "lest he fall"; for (he says) "Let him that thinketh he standeth, take heed lest he fall" (  Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:14
verses.text: x.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:15
verses.text: ); he that falleth, how anxious ought he to be that he may rise up again! If Paul fears, "lest that by any means, when he had preached to others, he himself should be a castaway" (  Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:16
verses.text: ix.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:17
verses.text: ); and he who had been so approved is afraid lest he should become disapproved: what pardon shall we have who are already disapproved, if we have no fear, but fulfill our Christianity as a custom, and for form's sake.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:18
verses.text: Let us then fear, beloved: "For the wrath of God is revealed from heaven".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:19
verses.text: ( Rom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:20
verses.text: i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:21
verses.text: ) Let us fear, for it "is revealed" not "against impiety" only, but "against all unrighteousness".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:22
verses.text: What is "against all unrighteousness"? [Against all] both small and great.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:23
verses.text: In this passage he intimates the lovingkindness of God towards man: and the teaching [of the Gospel] he calls "rain": and what he said above, "when for the time ye ought to be teachers" ( c.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:24
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:25
verses.text: ), this he says here also.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:26
verses.text: Indeed in many places the Scripture calls the teaching "rain".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:27
verses.text: For (it says) "I will command the clouds that they rain no rain upon it" ( Isa.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:28
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:29
verses.text: ), speaking of "the vineyard".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:30
verses.text: The same which in another place it calls "a famine of bread, and a thirst of water".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:31
verses.text: ( Amos viii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:32
verses.text: ) And again, "The river of God is full of waters".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:33
verses.text: ( Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:34
verses.text: lxv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:35
verses.text: )  "For land," he says, "which drinketh in the rain that cometh oft upon it".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:36
verses.text: Here he shows that they received and drank in the word, yea and often enjoyed this, and yet even so they were not profited.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:37
verses.text: For if (he means) thou hadst not been tilled, if thou hadst enjoyed no rains, the evil would not have been so great.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:38
verses.text: For (it is said) "If I had not come and spoken unto them they had not had sin".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:39
verses.text: ( John xv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:40
verses.text: ) But if thou hast often drunk and received [nourishment], wherefore hast thou brought forth other things instead of fruits? For (it is said) "I waited that it should bring forth grapes, and it brought forth thorns".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:41
verses.text: ( Isa.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:42
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:43
verses.text: )  Thou seest that everywhere the Scripture calleth sins "thorns".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:44
verses.text: For David also saith, "I was turned into mourning when a thorn was fixed in me".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:45
verses.text: ( Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:46
verses.text: xxxii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:47
verses.text: , so LXX.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:48
verses.text: ) For it does not simply come on us, but is fixed in; and even if but a little of it remain in, even if we take it not out entirely, that little of itself in like manner causes pain, as in the case of a thorn.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:49
verses.text: And why do I say, 'that little of itself'? Even after it has been taken out, it leaves therein for a long time the pain of the wound.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:50
verses.text: And much care and treatment is necessary, that we may be perfectly freed from it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:51
verses.text: For it is not enough merely to take away the sin, it is necessary also to heal the wounded place.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:52
verses.text: But I fear however lest the things said apply to us more than to others.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:53
verses.text: "For," he says, "the earth which drinketh in the rain that cometh oft upon it".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:54
verses.text: We are ever drinking, ever hearing, but "when the sun is risen" ( Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:55
verses.text: xiii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:56
verses.text: ) we straightway lose our moisture, and therefore bring forth thorns.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:57
verses.text: What then are the thorns? Let us hear Christ saying, that "the care of this world, and the deceitfulness of riches, choke the word, and it becometh unfruitful".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:58
verses.text: ( Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:59
verses.text: xiii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:60
verses.text: )   "For the earth which drinketh in the rain that cometh oft upon it," he says, "and bringeth forth meet herbs".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:61
verses.text: Because nothing is so meet as purity of life, nothing so suitable as the best life, nothing so meet as virtue.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:62
verses.text: "And bringeth forth" (saith he) "herbs meet for them by whom it is dressed, receiveth blessing from God".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:63
verses.text: Here he says that God is the cause of all things, giving the heathen a blow, who ascribed the production of fruits to the power of the earth.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:64
verses.text: For (he says) it is not the hands of the husbandman which stir up the earth to bear fruits, but the command from God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:65
verses.text: Therefore he says, "receives blessing from God".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:66
verses.text: And see how in speaking of the thorns, he said not, "bringing forth thorns," nor did he use this word expressive of what is useful; but what? "Bearing" [literally "putting out"] "thorns," as if one should say, "forcing out," "throwing out".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:67
verses.text: "Rejected" (he says) "and nigh unto cursing".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:68
verses.text: Oh! how great consolation in this word! For he said "nigh unto cursing," not "a curse".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:69
verses.text: Now he that hath not yet fallen into a curse, but is come to be near [thereto], may also come to be far off [therefrom].

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:70
verses.text: And not by this only did he encourage them, but also by what follows.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:71
verses.text: For he did not say "rejected and nigh unto cursing," "which shall be burned," but what? "Whose end is to be burned," if he continue [such] (he means) unto the end.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:72
verses.text: So that, if we cut out and burn the thorns, we shall be able to enjoy those good things innumerable and to become approved, and to partake of blessing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:73
verses.text: And with good reason did he call sin "a thistle," saying "that which beareth thorns and thistles"; for on whatever side you lay hold on it, it wounds and stings, and it is unpleasant even to look at.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:74
verses.text: Having therefore sufficiently rebuked them, and alarmed and wounded them, he in turn heals them, so as not to cast them down too much, and make them supine.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:75
verses.text: For he that strikes one that is "dull," makes him more dull.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:76
verses.text: So then he neither flatters them throughout, lest he should make them supine, nor does he wound them throughout, but having inserted a little to wound them, he applies much to heal in what follows.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:77
verses.text: For what does he say? We speak not these things, as having condemned you, nor as thinking you to be full of thorns, but fearing lest this should come to pass.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:78
verses.text: For it is better to terrify you by words, that ye may not suffer by the realities.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:79
verses.text: And this is specially of Paul's wisdom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:80
verses.text: Moreover he did not say, We think, or, we conjecture, or, we expect, or, we hope, but what? ( Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:81
verses.text: ) "But beloved, we are persuaded better things of you, and things that accompany salvation, though we thus speak".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:82
verses.text: Which word he also used in writing to the Galatians: "But I am persuaded of you in the Lord, that ye will be none otherwise minded".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:83
verses.text: ( Gal.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:84
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:85
verses.text: ) For in that instance, inasmuch as they were greatly to be condemned, and he could not praise them from things present, he does it from things future ("that ye will be none otherwise minded," he says): he said not, ye are, but "ye will be none otherwise minded".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:86
verses.text: But here he encourages them from things present.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:87
verses.text: "We are persuaded better things of you, beloved, and things that accompany to salvation, though we thus speak".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:88
verses.text: And since he was not able to say so much from things present, he confirms his consolation from things past; and says,  Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:89
verses.text: "For God is not unrighteous to forget your work, and the love, which ye have showed toward His name, in that ye have ministered unto the saints and do minister".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:90
verses.text: O how did he here restore their spirit, and give them fresh strength, by reminding them of former things, and bringing them to the necessity of not supposing that God had forgotten.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:91
verses.text: (For he cannot but sin who is not fully assured concerning his hope, and says that God is unrighteous.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:92
verses.text: Accordingly he obliged them by all means to look forward to those future things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:93
verses.text: For one who despairs of present things, and has given up exerting himself, may be restored by [the prospect of] things future.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:94
verses.text: ) As he himself also said in writing to the Galatians, "Ye did run well" ( Gal.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:95
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:96
verses.text: ): and again, "Have ye suffered so many things in vain? if it be yet in vain".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:97
verses.text: ( Gal.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:98
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:99
verses.text: )  And as in this place he puts the praise with the reproof, saying, "When for the time ye ought to be teachers" ( c.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:100
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:101
verses.text: ), so also there, "I marvel that ye are so soon removed".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:102
verses.text: ( Gal.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:103
verses.text: i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:104
verses.text: ) With the reproof is the praise.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:105
verses.text: For respecting great things we marvel, when they fail.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:106
verses.text: Thou seest that praise is concealed under the accusation and the blame.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:107
verses.text: Nor does he say this concerning himself only, but also concerning all.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:108
verses.text: For he said not, I am persuaded, but "we are persuaded better things of you," even good things (he means).

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:109
verses.text: He says this either in regard to matters of conduct, or to the recompense.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:110
verses.text: In the next place, having said above, that it is "rejected and nigh unto a curse," and that it "shall be for burning," he says, we do not by any means speak this of you.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:111
verses.text: "For God is not unrighteous to forget your work, and love".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:112
verses.text: ( Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:113
verses.text: )   Why then did we say these things? ( Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:114
verses.text: ,  ) "But we desire that everyone of you do show the same diligence to the full assurance of hope unto the end; that ye be not slothful, but followers of them who through faith and patience inherit the promises".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:115
verses.text: "We desire," he says, and we do not therefore merely labor for, or even so far as words go, wish this.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:116
verses.text: But what? "We desire" that ye should hold fast to virtue, not as condemning your former conduct (he means), but fearing for the future.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:117
verses.text: And he did not say, 'not as condemning your former conduct, but your present; for ye have fainted, ye are become too indolent'; but see how gently he indicated it, and did not wound them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:118
verses.text: For what does he say? "But we desire that every one of you do show the same diligence unto the end".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:119
verses.text: For this is the admirable part of Paul's wisdom, that he does not expressly show that they "had" given in, that they "had" become negligent.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:120
verses.text: For when he says, "We desire that every one of you"—it is as if one should say, I wish thee to be always in earnest; and such as thou wert before, such to be now also, and for the time to come.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:121
verses.text: For this made his reproof more gentle and easy to be received.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:122
verses.text: And he did not say, "I will," which would have been expressive of the authority of a teacher, but what is expressive of the affection of a father, and what is more than "willing," "we desire".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:123
verses.text: All but saying, Pardon us, even if we say what is distasteful.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:124
verses.text: "We desire that every one of you do show the same diligence to the full assurance of your hope unto the end".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:125
verses.text: Hope (he means) carries us through: it recovers us again.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:126
verses.text: Be not wearied out, do not despair, lest your hope be in vain.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:127
verses.text: For he that worketh good hopeth also good, and never despairs of himself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:128
verses.text: "That ye may not become dull".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:129
verses.text: Still "become"; and yet he said above, "seeing ye are become dull of hearing".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:131
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:132
verses.text: ) Ob serve however how he limited the dullness to the hearing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:133
verses.text: And here he hints the very same thing; instead of 'that ye may not continue in it,' he says [this].

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:134
verses.text: But again he leads on to that future time for which they were not yet responsible; saying in effect "that ye may not become too slothful": since for that which is not yet come we could not be responsible.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:135
verses.text: For he who in regard to the present time is exhorted to be in earnest, as being remiss, will perhaps become even more slothful, but he who is exhorted with reference to the future, not so.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:136
verses.text: "We desire" (he says) "that every one of you".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:137
verses.text: Great is his affection for them: he cares equally for great and small; moreover he knows all, and overlooks no one, but shows the same tender care for each, and equal value for all: from which cause also he the rather persuaded them to receive what was distasteful in his words.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:138
verses.text: "That ye be not slothful," he says.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:139
verses.text: For as inactivity hurts the body, so also inactivity as to what is good renders the soul more supine and feeble.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:140
verses.text: "But followers" (he says) "of them, who through faith and patience inherit the promises".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:141
verses.text: And who they are, he tells afterwards.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:142
verses.text: He said before, "Imitate your own former well-doings".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:143
verses.text: Then, lest they should say, What? He leads them back to the Patriarch: bringing before them examples of well-doing indeed from their own history, but of the thought of being forsaken, from the Patriarch; that they might not suppose that they were disregarded and forsaken as worthy of no account, but might know that it is [the portion] of the very noblest men to make the journey of life through trials; and that God has thus dealt with great and admirable men.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:144
verses.text: Now we ought (he says) to bear all things with patience: for this also is believing: whereas if He say that He gives and thou immediately receivest, how hast thou also believed? Since in that case this is no longer of thy faith, but of Me, the Giver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:145
verses.text: But if I say that I give, and give after an hundred years, and thou hast not despaired; then hast thou accounted Me worthy to be believed, then thou hast the right opinion concerning Me.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:146
verses.text: Thou seest that oftentimes unbelief arises not from want of hope only, but also from faintheartedness, and want of patience, not from condemning him who made the promise.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:147
verses.text: "For God" (he says) "is not unrighteous to forget your love" and the zeal "which ye have showed toward His Name, in that ye have ministered unto the saints, and do minister".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:148
verses.text: He testifies great things of them, not deeds only; but deeds done with alacrity, which he says also in another place, "and not only so, but they gave themselves also to the Lord and to us".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:149
verses.text: (  Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:150
verses.text: viii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:151
verses.text: )  "Which" (he says) "ye have showed toward His Name, in that ye have ministered to the saints, and do minister".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:152
verses.text: See how again he soothes them, by adding "and do minister".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:153
verses.text: Still even at this time (he says) ye are ministering, and he raises them up by showing that they had done [what they did] not to them [the saints], but to God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:154
verses.text: "Which ye have showed" (he says); and he said not "unto the saints," but "towards God," for this is "toward His Name".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:155
verses.text: It is for His Name's sake (he means) that ye have done all.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:156
verses.text: He therefore who has the enjoyment from you of so great zeal and love, will never despise you nor forget you.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:157
verses.text: Hearing these things, let us, I beseech you, "minister to the saints".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:158
verses.text: For every believer is a saint in that he is a believer.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:159
verses.text: Though he be a person living in the world, he is a saint.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:160
verses.text: "For" (he says) "the unbelieving husband is sanctified by the wife, and the unbelieving wife by the husband".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:161
verses.text: (  Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:162
verses.text: vii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:163
verses.text: ) See how the faith makes the saintship.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:164
verses.text: If then we see even a secular person in misfortune, let us stretch out a hand [to him].

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:165
verses.text: Let us not be zealous for those only who dwell in the mountains; they are indeed saints both in manner of life and in faith; these others however are saints by their faith, and many of them also in manner of life.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:166
verses.text: Let us not, if we see a monk [cast] into prison, in that case go in; but if it be a secular person, refuse to go in.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:167
verses.text: He also is a saint and a brother.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:168
verses.text: What then (you say) if he be unclean and polluted? Listen to Christ saying, "Judge not that ye be not judged".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:169
verses.text: ( Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:170
verses.text: vii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:171
verses.text: ) Do thou act for God's sake.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:172
verses.text: Nay, what am I saying? Even if we see a heathen in misfortune, we ought to show kindness to him, and to every man without exception who is in misfortunes, and much more to a believer who is in the world.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:173
verses.text: Listen to Paul, saying, "Do good unto all men, but especially to those who are of the household of faith".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:174
verses.text: ( Gal.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:175
verses.text: vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:176
verses.text: )  But I know not whence this [notion] has been introduced, or whence this custom hath prevailed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:177
verses.text: For he that only seeks after the solitaries, and is willing to do good to them alone, and with regard to others on the contrary is over-curious in his enquiries, and says, 'unless he be worthy, unless he be righteous, unless he work miracles, I stretch out no hand'; [such an one] has taken away the greater part of charity, yea and in time he will in turn destroy the very thing itself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:178
verses.text: And yet that is charity, [which is shown] towards sinners, towards the guilty.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:179
verses.text: For this is charity, not the pitying those who have done well, but those who have done wrong.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:180
verses.text: And that thou mayest understand this, listen to the Parable: "A certain man" (it is said) "went down from Jerusalem to Jericho, and fell among thieves" ( Luke x.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:182
verses.text: ); and when they had beaten him, they left him by the way-side, having badly bruised him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:183
verses.text: A certain Levite came, and when he saw him, he passed by; A priest came, and when he saw him, he hastened past; a certain Samaritan came, and bestowed great care upon him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:184
verses.text: For he "bound up his wounds" ( Luke x.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:185
verses.text: ), dropped oil on them, set him upon his ass, "brought him to the inn, said to the host, Take care of him" ( Luke x.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:186
verses.text: ); and (observe his great liberality), "and I," he says, "will give thee whatsoever thou shalt expend".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:187
verses.text: Who then is his neighbor? "He," it is said, "that showed mercy on him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:188
verses.text: Go thou then also," He says, "and do likewise".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:189
verses.text: ( Luke x.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:190
verses.text: ) And see what a parable He spake.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:191
verses.text: He said not that a Jew did [so and so] to a Samaritan, but that a Samaritan showed all that liberality.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:192
verses.text: Having then heard these things, let us not care only for "those that are of the household of faith" ( Gal.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:193
verses.text: vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:194
verses.text: ), and neglect others.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:195
verses.text: So then also thou, if thou see any one in affliction, be not curious to enquire further.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:196
verses.text: His being in affliction involves a just claim on thy aid.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:197
verses.text: For if when thou seest an ass choking thou raisest him up, and dost not curiously enquire whose he is, much more about a man one ought not to be over-curious in enquiring whose he is.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:198
verses.text: He is God's, be he heathen or be he Jew; since even if he is an unbeliever, still he needs help.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:199
verses.text: For if indeed it had been committed to thee to enquire and to judge, thou wouldst have well said thus, but, as it is, his misfortune does not suffer thee to search out these things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:200
verses.text: For if even about men in good health it is not right to be over-curious, nor to be a busybody in other men's matters, much less about those that are in affliction.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:201
verses.text: But on another view what [shall we say]? Didst thou see him in prosperity, in high esteem, that thou shouldst say that he is wicked and worthless? But if thou seest him in affliction, do not say that he is wicked.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:202
verses.text: For when a man is in high credit, we fairly say these things; but when he is in calamity, and needs help, it is not right to say that he is wicked.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:203
verses.text: For this is cruelty, inhumanity, and arrogance.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:204
verses.text: Tell me what was ever more iniquitous than the Jews.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:205
verses.text: But nevertheless while God punished them, and that justly, yea, very justly, yet He approved of those who had compassion on them, and those who rejoiced over them He punished.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:206
verses.text: ( Amos vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:207
verses.text: ) For "they were not grieved," it is said, "at the affliction of Joseph".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:208
verses.text: And again it is said "Redeem [Ransom] those who are ready to be slain: spare not".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:209
verses.text: ( Prov.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:210
verses.text: xxiv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:211
verses.text: ) (He said not, enquire curiously, and learn who he is; and yet, for the most part, they who are led away to execution are wicked,) for this especially is charity.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:212
verses.text: For he that doeth good to a friend, doeth it not altogether for God's sake: but he that [doeth good] to one unknown, this man acts purely for God's sake.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:213
verses.text: "Do not spare" thy money, even if it be necessary to spend all, yet give.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:214
verses.text: But we, when we see persons in extreme distress, bewailing themselves, suffering things more grievous than ten thousand deaths, and oftentimes unjustly, we [I say] are sparing of our money, and unsparing of our brethren; we are careful of lifeless things, but neglect the living soul.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:215
verses.text: And yet Paul says, "in meekness instruct those that oppose themselves, if peradventure God should give them repentance to the acknowledging of the truth, and they may recover themselves out of the snare of the devil who are taken captive by him, at His will".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:216
verses.text: (  Tim.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:217
verses.text: ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:219
verses.text: ) "If peradventure," he says; thou seest of how great long-suffering the word is full.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:220
verses.text: Let us also imitate Him, and despair of no one.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:221
verses.text: For the fishermen too, when they have cast many times [suppose it], have not succeeded; but afterwards having cast again, have gained all.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:222
verses.text: So we also expect that ye will all at once show to us ripe fruit.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:223
verses.text: For the husbandman too, after he has sown, waits one day or two days, and is a long while in expectation: and all at once he sees the fruits springing up on every side.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:224
