verses.text: This we expect will take place in your case also by the grace and lovingkindness of our Lord Jesus Christ, with whom to the Father and also to the Holy Ghost be glory, might, honor, now and for ever and world without end, Amen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:225
verses.text: which may take place, as St.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:226
verses.text: Chrys.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 11:227
verses.text: implies in this passage, either here or hereafter; either for a time or for eternity.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:1
verses.text: Homily XI.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:2
verses.text: Hebrews vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:3
verses.text: –  "For when God made promise to Abraham, because He could swear by no greater, He sware by Himself, saying, Surely blessing I will bless thee, and multiplying I will multiply thee.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:4
verses.text: And so after he had patiently endured, he obtained the promise.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:5
verses.text: For men verily swear by the greater, and an oath for confirmation is to them an end of all strife".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:6
verses.text: Having boldly reflected on the faults of the Hebrews, and sufficiently alarmed them, he consoles them, first, by praises, and secondly (which also is the stronger ground), by the [thought] that they would certainly attain the object of their hope.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:7
verses.text: Moreover he draws his consolation, not from things future, but again from the past, which indeed would the rather persuade them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:8
verses.text: For as in the case of punishment, he alarms them rather by those [viz.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:9
verses.text: things future], so also in the case of the prizes [set before them], he encourages them by these [viz.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:10
verses.text: by things past], showing [herein] God's way of dealing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:11
verses.text: And that is, not to bring in what has been promised immediately, but after a long time.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:12
verses.text: And this He does, both to present the greatest proof of His power, and also to lead us to Faith, that they who are living in tribulation without having received the promises, or the rewards, may not faint under their troubles.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:13
verses.text: And omitting all [the rest], though he had many whom he might have mentioned, he brought forward Abraham both on account of the dignity of his person, and because this had occurred in a special way in his case.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:14
verses.text: And yet at the end of the Epistle he says, that "all these, having seen the promises afar off, and having embraced them, received them not, that they without us should not be made perfect".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:16
verses.text: xi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:17
verses.text: ) "For when God made promise to Abraham" (he says) "because He could swear by no greater, He sware by Himself, saying, Surely blessing I will bless thee, and multiplying I will multiply thee.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:18
verses.text: And so after he had patiently endured, he obtained the promise".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:20
verses.text: xi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:22
verses.text: ) How then does he say at the end [of the Epistle] that "he received not the promises," and here, that "after he had patiently endured he obtained the promise"? How did he not receive? How did he obtain? He is not speaking of the same things in this place and in the other, but makes the consolation twofold.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:23
verses.text: God made promises to Abraham, and after a long space of time He gave the things [spoken of] in this place, but those others not yet.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:24
verses.text: "And so after he had patiently endured, he obtained the promise".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:25
verses.text: Seest thou that the promise alone did not effect the whole, but the patient waiting as well? Here he alarms them, showing that oftentimes a promise is thwarted through faintheartedness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:26
verses.text: And this he had indeed shown through [the instance of] the [Jewish] people: for since they were faint-hearted, therefore they obtained not the promise.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:27
verses.text: But now he shows the contrary by means of Abraham.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:28
verses.text: Afterwards near the end [of the Epistle] he proves something more also: [viz.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:29
verses.text: ] that even though they had patiently endured, they did not obtain; and yet not even so are they grieved.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:30
verses.text: "For men verily swear by the greater, and an Oath for confirmation is to them an end of all strife.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:31
verses.text: But God because He could swear by no greater, sware by Himself".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:32
verses.text: Well, who then is He that sware unto Abraham? Is it not the Son ? No, one says.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:33
verses.text: Certainly indeed it was He: however, I shall not dispute [thereon].

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:34
verses.text: So when He [the Son] sweareth the same oath, "Verily, verily, I say unto you," is it not plain that it was because He could not swear by any greater? For as the Father sware, so also the Son sweareth by Himself, saying, "Verily, verily, I say unto you".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:35
verses.text: He here reminds them also of the oaths of Christ, which He was constantly uttering.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:36
verses.text: "Verily, verily, I say unto thee, he that believeth on Me shall never die".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:37
verses.text: ( John xi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:38
verses.text: )  What is, "And an oath for confirmation is to them an end of all strife"? it is instead of, "by this every doubtful question is solved": not this, or this, but every one.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:39
verses.text: God, however, ought to have been believed even without an oath: ( ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:40
verses.text: ) "wherein" (he says) "God willing more abundantly to show unto the heirs of promise the immutability of His counsel, confirmed it [lit.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:41
verses.text: "mediated"] by an oath".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:42
verses.text: In these words he comprehends also the believers, and therefore mentions this "promise" which was made to us in common [with them].

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:43
verses.text: "He mediated" (he says) "by an oath".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:44
verses.text: Here again he says that the Son was mediator between men and God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:45
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:46
verses.text: "That by two immutable things, in which it was impossible that God should lie".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:47
verses.text: What are these two? The speaking and promising; and the adding an oath to the promise.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:48
verses.text: For since among men that which is [confirmed] by an oath is thought more worthy of credit, on this account He added that also.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:49
verses.text: Seest thou that He regardeth not His own dignity, but how He may persuade men, and endures to have unworthy things said concerning Himself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:50
verses.text: That is He wishes to impart full assurance.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:51
verses.text: And in the case of Abraham indeed [the Apostle] shows that the whole was of God, not of his patient endurance, since He was even willing to add an oath, for He by whom men swear, by Him also God "sware," that is "by Himself".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:52
verses.text: They indeed as by one greater, but He not as by one greater.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:53
verses.text: And yet He did it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:54
verses.text: For it is not the same thing for man to swear by himself, as for God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:55
verses.text: For man has no power over himself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:56
verses.text: Thou seest then that this is said not more for Abraham than for ourselves: "that we" (he says) "might have strong consolation, who have fled for refuge to lay hold on the hope set before us".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:57
verses.text: Here too again, "after he had patiently endured he obtained the promise".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:58
verses.text: "Now" he means, and he did not say "when He swore".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:59
verses.text: But what the oath is, he showed, by speaking of swearing by a greater.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:60
verses.text: But since the race of men is hard of belief, He condescends to the same [things] with ourselves.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:61
verses.text: As then for our sake He swears, although it be unworthy of Him that He should not be believed, so also did [the Apostle] make that other statement: "He learned from the things which He suffered" ( c.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:62
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:63
verses.text: ), because men think the going through experience more worthy of reliance.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:64
verses.text: What is "the hope set before us"? From these [past events] (he says) we conjecture the future.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:65
verses.text: For if these came to pass after so long a time, so certainly the others will.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:66
verses.text: So that the things which happened in regard to Abraham give us confidence also concerning the things to come.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:67
verses.text: ( Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:68
verses.text: ,  ) "Which [hope] we have as an anchor of the soul both sure and steadfast, and which entereth into that within the veil: whither the forerunner is for us entered, even Jesus, made High Priest forever after the order of Melchisedec".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:69
verses.text: He shows, that while we are still in the world, and not yet departed from [this] life, we are already among the promises.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:70
verses.text: For through hope we are already in heaven.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:71
verses.text: He said, "Wait; for it shall surely be".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:72
verses.text: Afterwards giving them full assurance, he says, "nay rather by hope".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:73
verses.text: And he said not, "We are within," but 'It hath entered within,' which was more true and more persuasive.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:74
verses.text: For as the anchor, dropped from the vessel, does not allow it to be carried about, even if ten thousand winds agitate it, but being depended upon makes it steady, so also does hope.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:75
verses.text: And see how very suitable an image he has discovered: For he said not, Foundation; which was not suitable; but, "Anchor".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:76
verses.text: For that which is on the tossing sea, and seems not to be very firmly fixed, stands on the water as upon land, and is shaken and yet is not shaken.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:77
verses.text: For in regard to those who are very firm, and philosophic, Christ with good reason made that statement, saying, "Whosoever hath built his house on a rock".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:78
verses.text: ( Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:79
verses.text: vii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:80
verses.text: ) But in respect of those who are giving way, and who ought to be carried through by hope, Paul hath suitably set down this.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:81
verses.text: For the surge and the great storm toss the boat; but hope suffers it not to be carried hither and thither, although winds innumerable agitate it: so that, unless we had this [hope] we should long ago have been sunk.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:82
verses.text: Nor is it only in things spiritual, but also in the affairs of this life, that one may find the power of hope great.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:83
verses.text: Whatever it may be, in merchandise, in husbandry, in a military expedition, unless one sets this before him, he would not even touch the work.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:84
verses.text: But he said not simply "Anchor," but "sure and steadfast" [i-e:] not shaken.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:85
verses.text: "Which entereth into that within the veil"; instead of 'which reacheth through even to heaven.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:86
verses.text: '   Then after this he led on to Faith also, that there might not only be hope, but a very true [hope].

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:87
verses.text: For after the oath he lays down another thing too, even proof by facts, because "the forerunner is for us entered in, even Jesus".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:88
verses.text: But a forerunner is a forerunner of some one, as John was of Christ.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:89
verses.text: Now he did not simply say, "He is entered in," but "where He is entered in a forerunner for us," as though we also ought to attain.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:90
verses.text: For there is no great interval between the forerunner and those who follow: otherwise he would not be a forerunner; for the forerunner and those who follow ought to be in the same road, and to arrive after [each other].

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:91
verses.text: "Being made an High Priest forever after the order," he says, "of Melchisedec".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:92
verses.text: Here is also another consolation, if our High Priest is on high, and far better than those among the Jews, not in the kind [of Priesthood] only, but also in the place, and the tabernacle, and the covenant, and the person.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:93
verses.text: And this also is spoken according to the flesh.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:94
verses.text: Those then, whose High Priest He is, ought to be greatly superior.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:95
verses.text: And as great as the difference is between Aaron and Christ, so great should it be between us and the Jews.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:96
verses.text: For see, we have our victim on high, our priest on high, our sacrifice on high: let us bring such sacrifices as can be offered on that altar, no longer sheep and oxen, no longer blood and fat.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:97
verses.text: All these things have been done away; and there has been brought in their stead "the reasonable service".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:98
verses.text: ( Rom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:99
verses.text: xii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:100
verses.text: ) But what is "the reasonable service"? The [offerings made] through the soul; those made through the spirit.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:101
verses.text: ("God," it is said, "is a Spirit, and they that worship Him must worship Him in spirit and in truth"— John iv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:102
verses.text: ); things which have no need of a body, no need of instruments, nor of special places, whereof each one is himself the Priest, such as, moderation, temperance, mercifulness, enduring ill-treatment, long-suffering, humbleness of mind.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:103
verses.text: These sacrifices one may see in the Old [Testament] also, shadowed out beforehand.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:104
verses.text: "Offer to God," it is said, "a sacrifice of righteousness" ( Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:105
verses.text: iv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:106
verses.text: ); "Offer a sacrifice of praise" ( Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:107
verses.text: l.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:108
verses.text: ); and, "a sacrifice of praise shall glorify Me" ( Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:109
verses.text: l.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:110
verses.text: ), and, "the sacrifice of God is a broken spirit" ( Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:111
verses.text: li.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:112
verses.text: ); and "what doth the Lord require of thee but" to hearken to Him? ( Mic.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:113
verses.text: vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:114
verses.text: ) "Burnt-offerings and sacrifices for sin Thou hast had no pleasure in: then I said, Lo I come to do Thy will, O God!" ( Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:115
verses.text: xl.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:116
verses.text: ,  ), and again, "To what purpose do ye bring the incense from Sheba?" ( Jer.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:117
verses.text: vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:118
verses.text: ) "Take thou away from Me the noise of thy songs, for I will not hear the melody of thy viols".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:119
verses.text: ( Amos v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:120
verses.text: ) But instead of these "I will have mercy and not sacrifice".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:121
verses.text: ( Hosea vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:122
verses.text: ) Thou seest with what kind of "sacrifices God is well pleased".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:124
verses.text: xiii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:125
verses.text: ) Thou seest also that already from the first the one class have given place, and these have come in their stead.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:126
verses.text: These therefore let us bring, for the other indeed are [the offerings] of wealth and of persons who have [possessions], but these of virtue: those from without, these from within: those any chance person even might perform; these only a few.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:127
verses.text: And as much as a man is superior to a sheep, so much is this sacrifice superior to that; for here thou offerest thy soul as a victim.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:128
verses.text: And other sacrifices also there are, which are indeed whole burnt-offerings, the bodies of the martyrs: there both soul and body [are offered].

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:129
verses.text: These have a great savor of a sweet smell.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:130
verses.text: Thou also art able, if thou wilt, to bring such a sacrifice.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:131
verses.text: For what, if thou dost not burn thy body in the fire? Yet in a different fire thou canst; for instance, in that of voluntary poverty, in that of affliction.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:132
verses.text: For to have it in one's power to spend one's days in luxury and expense, and yet to take up a life of toil and bitterness, and to mortify the body, is not this a whole burnt-offering? Mortify thy body, and crucify it, and thou shalt thyself also receive the crown of this martyrdom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:133
verses.text: For what in the other case the sword accomplishes, that in this case let a willing mind effect.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:134
verses.text: Let not the love of wealth burn, or possess you, but let this unreasonable appetite itself be consumed and quenched by the fire of the Spirit; let it be cut in pieces by the sword of the Spirit.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:135
verses.text: This is an excellent sacrifice, needing no priest but him who brings it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:136
verses.text: This is an excellent sacrifice, performed indeed below but forthwith taken up on high.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:137
verses.text: Do we not wonder that of old time fire came down and consumed all? It is possible now also that fire may come down far more wonderful than that, and consume all the presented offerings: nay rather, not consume, but bear them up to heaven.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:138
verses.text: For it does not reduce them to ashes, but offers them as gifts to God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:139
verses.text: Such were the offerings of Cornelius.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:140
verses.text: For (it is said) "thy prayers and thine alms are come up for a memorial before God".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:141
verses.text: ( Acts x.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:142
verses.text: ) Thou seest a most excellent union.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:143
verses.text: Then are we heard, when we ourselves also hear the poor who come to us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:144
verses.text: "He" (it is said) "that stoppeth his ears that he may not hear the poor" ( Prov.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:145
verses.text: xxi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:146
verses.text: ), his prayer God will not hearken to.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:147
verses.text: "Blessed is he that considereth the poor and needy: the Lord will deliver him in the evil day".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:148
verses.text: ( Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:149
verses.text: xl.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:150
verses.text: ) But what day is evil except that one which is evil to sinners?  What is meant by "he that considereth"? He that understandeth what it is to be a poor man, that has thoroughly learned his affliction.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:151
verses.text: For he that has learned his affliction, will certainly and immediately have compassion on him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:152
verses.text: When thou seest a poor man, do not hurry by, but immediately reflect what thou wouldest have been, hadst thou been he.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:153
verses.text: What wouldest thou not have wished that all should do for thee? "He that considereth" (he says).

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:154
verses.text: Reflect that he is a free-man like thyself, and shares the same noble birth with thee, and possesses all things in common with thee; and yet oftentimes he is not on a level even with thy dogs.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:155
verses.text: On the contrary, while they are satiated, he oftentimes lies, sleeps, hungry, and the free-man is become less honorable than thy slaves.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:156
verses.text: But they perform needful services for thee.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:157
verses.text: What are these? Do they serve thee well? Suppose then I show that this [poor man] too performs needful services for thee far greater than they do.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:158
verses.text: For he will stand by thee in the Day of judgment, and will deliver thee from the fire.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:159
verses.text: What do all thy slaves do like this? When Tabitha died, who raised her up? The slaves who stood around or the poor? But thou art not even willing to put the free-man on an equality with thy slaves.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:160
verses.text: The frost is hard, and the poor man is cast out in rags, well-nigh dead, with his teeth chattering, both by his looks and his air fitted to move thee: and thou passeth by, warm and full of drink; and how dost thou expect that God should deliver thee when in misfortune?  And oftentimes thou sayest this too: 'If it had been myself, and I had found one that had done many wrong things, I would have forgiven him; and does not God forgive?' Say not this.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:161
verses.text: Him that has done thee no wrong, whom thou art able to deliver, him thou neglectest.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:162
verses.text: How shall He forgive thee, who art sinning against Him? Is not this deserving of hell?  And how amazing! Oftentimes thou adornest with vestments innumerable, of varied colors and wrought with gold, a dead body, insensible, no longer perceiving the honor; whilst that which is in pain, and lamenting, and tormented, and racked by hunger and frost, thou neglectest; and givest more to vainglory, than to the fear of God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:163
verses.text: And would that it stopped here; but immediately accusations are brought against the applicant.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:164
verses.text: For why does he not work (you say)? And why is he to be maintained in idleness? But (tell me) is it by working that thou hast what thou hast, didst thou not receive it as an inheritance from thy fathers? And even if thou dost work, is this a reason why thou shouldest reproach another? Hearest thou not what Paul saith? For after saying, "He that worketh not, neither let him eat" (  Thess.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:165
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:166
verses.text: ), he says, "But ye be not weary in well doing".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:167
verses.text: (  Thess.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:168
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:169
verses.text: )  But what say they? He is an impostor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:170
verses.text: What sayest thou, O man? Callest thou him an impostor, for the sake of a single loaf or of a garment? But (you say) he will sell it immediately.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:171
verses.text: And dost thou manage all thy affairs well? But what? Are all poor through idleness? Is no one so from shipwreck? None from lawsuits? None from being robbed? None from dangers? None from illness? None from any other difficulties? If however we hear any one bewailing such evils, and crying out aloud, and looking up naked toward heaven, and with long hair, and clad in rags, at once we call him, The impostor! The deceiver! The swindler! Art thou not ashamed? Whom dost thou call impostor? Give nothing, and do not accuse the man.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:172
verses.text: But (you say) he has means, and pretends.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:173
verses.text: This is a charge against thyself, not against him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:174
verses.text: He knows that he has to deal with the cruel, with wild beasts rather than with men, and that, even if he utter a pitiable story, he attracts no one's attention: and on this account he is forced to assume also a more miserable guise, that he may melt thy soul.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:175
verses.text: If we see a person coming to beg in a respectable dress, This is an impostor (you say), and he comes in this way that he may be supposed to be of good birth.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:176
verses.text: If we see one in the contrary guise, him too we reproach.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:177
verses.text: What then are they to do? O the cruelty, O the inhumanity!  And why (you say) do they expose their maimed limbs? Because of thee.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:178
verses.text: If we were compassionate, they would have no need of these artifices: if they persuaded us at the first application, they would not have contrived these devices.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:179
verses.text: Who is there so wretched, as to be willing to cry out so much, as to be willing to behave in an unseemly way, as to be willing to make public lamentations, with his wife destitute of clothing, with his children, to sprinkle ashes on [himself].

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:180
verses.text: How much worse than poverty are these things? Yet on account of them not only are they not pitied, but are even accused by us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:181
verses.text: Shall we then still be indignant, because when we pray to God, we are not heard? Shall we then still be vexed, because when we entreat we do not persuade? Do we not tremble for fear, my beloved?  But (you say) I have often given.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:182
verses.text: But dost thou not always eat? And dost thou drive away thy children often begging of thee? O the shamelessness! Dost thou call a poor man shameless? And thou indeed art not shameless when plundering, but he is shameless when begging for bread! Considerest thou not how great are the necessities of the belly? Dost not thou do all things for this? Dost thou not for this neglect things spiritual? Is not heaven set before thee and the kingdom of heaven? And thou fearing the tyranny of that [appetite] endurest all things, and thinkest lightly of that [kingdom].

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:183
verses.text: This is shamelessness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:184
verses.text: Seest thou not old men maimed? But O what trifling! 'Such an one' (you say) 'lends out so many pieces of gold, and such an one so many, and yet begs.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:185
verses.text: ' You repeat the stories and trifles of children; for they too are always hearing such stories from their nurses.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:186
verses.text: I am not persuaded of it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:187
verses.text: I do not believe this.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:188
verses.text: Far from it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:189
verses.text: Does a man lend money, and beg when he has abundance? For what purpose, tell me? And what is more disgraceful than begging? It were better to die than to beg.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:190
verses.text: Where does our inhumanity stop? What then? Do all lend money? Are all impostors? Is there no one really poor? "Yea" (you say) "and many".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:191
verses.text: Why then dost thou not assist those persons, seeing thou art a strict enquirer into their lives? This is an excuse and a pretense.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:192
verses.text: "Give to every one that asketh of thee, and from him that would borrow of thee turn not thou away".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:193
verses.text: ( Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:194
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:195
verses.text: ) Stretch out thy hand, let it not be closed up.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:196
verses.text: We have not been constituted examiners into men's lives, since so we should have compassion on no one.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:197
verses.text: When thou callest upon God why dost thou say, Remember not my sins? So then, if that person even be a great sinner, make this allowance in his case also, and do not remember his sins.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:198
verses.text: It is the season of kindness, not of strict enquiry; of mercy, not of account.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:199
verses.text: He wishes to be maintained: if thou art willing, give; but if not willing, send him away without raising doubts.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:200
verses.text: Why art thou wretched and miserable? Why dost thou not even thyself pity him, and also turnest away those who would? For when such an one hears from thee, This [fellow] is a cheat; that a hypocrite; and the other lends out money; he neither gives to the one nor to the other; for he suspects all to be such.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:201
verses.text: For you know that we easily suspect evil, but good, not [so easily].

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:202
verses.text: Let us "be merciful," not simply so, but "as our heavenly Father is".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:203
verses.text: ( Luke vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:204
verses.text: ) He feeds even adulterers, and fornicators, and sorcerers, and what shall I say? Those having every kind of wickedness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:205
verses.text: For in so large a world there must needs be many such.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:206
verses.text: But nevertheless He feeds all; He clothes all.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:207
verses.text: No one ever perished of hunger, unless one did so of his own choice.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:208
verses.text: So let us be merciful.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:209
verses.text: If one be in want and in necessity, help him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:210
verses.text: But now we are come to such a degree of unreasonableness, as to act thus not only in regard to the poor who walk up and down the alleys, but even in the case of men that live in [religious] solitude.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:211
verses.text: Such an one is an impostor, you say.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:212
verses.text: Did I not say this at first, that if we give to all indiscriminately, we shall always be compassionate; but if we begin to make over-curious enquiries, we shall never be compassionate? What dost thou mean? Is a man an impostor in order to get a loaf? If indeed he asks for talents of gold and silver, or costly clothes, or slaves, or anything else of this sort, one might with good reason call him a swindler.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:213
verses.text: But if he ask none of these things, but only food and shelter, things which are suited to a philosophic life, tell me, is this the part of a swindler? Cease we from this unseasonable fondness for meddling, which is Satanic, which is destructive.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:214
verses.text: For indeed, if a man say that he is on the list of the Clergy, or calls himself a priest, then busy thyself [to enquire], make much ado: since in that case the communicating without enquiry is not without danger.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:215
verses.text: For the danger is about matters of importance, for thou dost not give but receivest.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:216
verses.text: But if he want food, make no enquiry.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:217
verses.text: Enquire, if thou wilt, how Abraham showed hospitality towards all who came to him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:218
verses.text: If he had been over-curious about those who fled to him for refuge, he would not have "entertained angels".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:220
verses.text: xiii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:221
verses.text: ) For perhaps not thinking them to be angels, he would have thrust them too away with the rest.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:222
verses.text: But since he used to receive all, he received even angels.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:223
verses.text: What? Is it from the life of those that receive [thy bounty] that God grants thee thy reward? Nay [it is] from thine own purpose, from thy abundant liberality; from thy loving-kindness; from thy goodness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 12:224
verses.text: Let this be [found], and thou shalt attain all good things, which may we all attain, through the grace and lovingkindness of our Lord Jesus Christ, with whom to the Father and together with the Holy Ghost, be glory, power, honor, now and for ever and world without end, Amen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:1
verses.text: Homily XII.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:2
verses.text: Hebrews vii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:3
verses.text: –  "For this Melchisedec, King of Salem, Priest of the most High God, who met Abraham returning from the slaughter of the Kings, and blessed him: to whom also Abraham gave a tenth part of all; first being by interpretation King of Righteousness, and after that also King of Salem, which is, King of Peace, without father, without mother, without genealogy, having neither beginning of days, nor end of life, but made like unto the Son of God, abideth a Priest continually".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:4
verses.text: Paul wishing to show the difference between the New and Old [Covenant], scatters it everywhere; and shoots from afar, and noises it abroad, and prepares beforehand.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:5
verses.text: For at once even from the introduction, he laid down this saying, that "to them indeed He spake by prophets, but to us by the Son" ( c.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:6
verses.text: i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:7
verses.text: ,  ), and to them "at sundry times and in divers manners," but to us through the Son.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:8
verses.text: Afterwards, having discoursed concerning the Son, who He was and what He had wrought, and given an exhortation to obey Him, lest we should suffer the same things as the Jews; and having said that He is "High Priest after the order of Melchisedec" ( c.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:9
verses.text: vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:10
verses.text: ), and having oftentimes wished to enter into [the subject of] this difference, and having used much preparatory management; and having rebuked them as weak, and again soothed and restored them to confidence; then at last he introduces the discussion on the difference [of the two dispensations] to ears in their full vigor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:11
verses.text: For he who is depressed in spirits would not be a ready hearer.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:12
verses.text: And that you may understand this, hear the Scripture saying, "They hearkened not to Moses for anguish of spirit".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:13
verses.text: ( Ex.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:14
verses.text: vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:15
verses.text: ) Therefore having first cleared away their despondency by many considerations, some fearful, some more gentle, he then from this point enters upon the discussion of the difference [of the dispensations].

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:16
verses.text: And what does he say? "For this Melchisedec, King of Salem, Priest of the Most High God".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:17
verses.text: And, what is especially noteworthy, he shows the difference to be great by the Type itself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:18
verses.text: For as I said, he continually confirms the truth from the Type, from things past, on account of the weakness of the hearers.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:19
verses.text: "For" (he says) "this Melchisedec, King of Salem, Priest of the Most High God, who met Abraham returning from the slaughter of the Kings, and blessed him, to whom also Abraham gave a tenth part of all".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:20
verses.text: Having concisely set down the whole narrative, he looked at it mystically.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:21
verses.text: And first from the name.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:22
verses.text: "First" (he says) "being by interpretation King of righteousness": for Sedec means "righteousness"; and Melchi, "King": Melchisedec, "King of righteousness".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:23
verses.text: Seest thou his exactness even in the names? But who is "King of righteousness," save our Lord Jesus Christ? "King of righteousness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:24
verses.text: And after that also King of Salem," from his city, "that is, King of Peace," which again is [characteristic] of Christ.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:25
verses.text: For He has made us righteous, and has "made peace" for "things in Heaven and things on earth".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:26
verses.text: ( Col.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:27
verses.text: i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:28
verses.text: ) What man is "King of Righteousness and of Peace"? None, save only our Lord Jesus Christ.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:29
verses.text: He then adds another distinction, "Without father, without mother, without genealogy, having neither beginning of days nor end of life, but made like unto the Son of God, abideth a Priest continually".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:30
verses.text: Since then there lay in his way [as an objection] the [words] "Thou art a Priest for ever, after the order of Melchisedec," whereas he [Melchisedec] was dead, and was not "Priest for ever," see how he explained it mystically.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:31
verses.text: 'And who can say this concerning a man?' I do not assert this in fact (he says); the meaning is, we do not know when [or] what father he had, nor what mother, nor when he received his beginning, nor when he died.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:32
verses.text: And what of this (one says)? For does it follow, because we do not know it, that he did not die, [or] had no parents? Thou sayest well: he both died and had parents.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:33
verses.text: How then [was he] "without father, without mother"? How "having neither beginning of days nor end of life"? How? [Why] from its not being expressed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:34
verses.text: And what of this? That as this man is so, from his genealogy not being given, so is Christ from the very nature of the reality.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:35
verses.text: See the "without beginning"; see the "without end".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:36
verses.text: As in case of this man, we know not either "beginning of days," or "end of life," because they have not been written; so we know [them] not in the case of Jesus, not because they have not been written, but because they do not exist.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:37
verses.text: For that indeed is a type, and therefore [we say] 'because it is not written,' but this is the reality, and therefore [we say] 'because it does not exist.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:38
verses.text: ' For as in regard to the names also (for there "King of Righteousness" and "of Peace" are appellations, but here the reality) so these too are appellations in that case, in this the reality.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:39
verses.text: How then hath He a beginning? Thou seest that the Son is "without beginning," not in respect of His not having a cause; (for this is impossible: for He has a Father, otherwise how is He Son?) but in respect of His "not having beginning or end of life".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:40
verses.text: "But made like unto the Son of God".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:41
verses.text: Where is the likeness? That we know not of the one or of the other either the end or the beginning.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:42
verses.text: Of the one because they are not written; of the other, because they do not exist.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:43
verses.text: Here is the likeness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:44
verses.text: But if the likeness were to exist in all respects, there would no longer be type and reality; but both would be type.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:45
verses.text: [Here] then just as in representations [by painting or drawing], there is somewhat that is like and somewhat that is unlike.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:46
verses.text: By means of the lines indeed there is a likeness of features, but when the colors are put on, then the difference is plainly shown, both the likeness and the unlikeness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:47
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:48
verses.text: "Now consider" (saith he) "how great this man is to whom even the Patriarch Abraham gave the tenth of the spoils".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:49
verses.text: Up to this point he has been applying the type: henceforward he boldly shows him [Melchisedec] to be more glorious than the Jewish realities.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:50
verses.text: But if he who bears a type of Christ is so much better not merely than the priests, but even than the forefather himself of the priests, what should one say of the reality? Thou seest how super-abundantly he shows the superiority.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:51
verses.text: "Now consider" (he says) "how great this man is to whom even the Patriarch Abraham gave a tenth out of the choice portions".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:52
verses.text: Spoils taken in battle are called "choice portions".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:53
verses.text: And it cannot be said that he gave them to him as having a part in the war, because (he said) he met him "returning from the slaughter of the kings," for he had staid at home (he means), yet [Abraham] gave him the first-fruits of his labors.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:54
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:55
verses.text: "And verily they that are of the sons of Levi who receive the office of Priesthood, have a commandment to take tithes of the people according to the law, that is, of their brethren, though they come out of the loins of Abraham".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:56
verses.text: So great (he would say) is the superiority of the priesthood, that they who from their ancestors are of the same dignity, and have the same forefather, are yet far better than the rest.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:57
verses.text: At all events they "receive tithes" from them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:58
verses.text: When then one is found, who receives tithes from these very persons, are not they indeed in the rank of laymen, and he among the Priests?  And not only this; but neither was he of the same dignity with them, but of another race: so that he would not have given tithes to a stranger unless his dignity had been great.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:59
verses.text: Astonishing! What has he accomplished? He has made quite clear a greater point than those relating to faith which he treated in the Epistle to the Romans.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:60
verses.text: For there indeed he declares Abraham to be the forefather both of our polity and also of the Jewish.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:61
verses.text: But here he is exceeding bold against him, and shows that the uncircumcised person is far superior.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:62
verses.text: How then did he show that Levi paid tithes? Abraham (he says) paid them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:63
verses.text: 'And how does this concern us?' It especially concerns you: for you will not contend that the Levites are superior to Abraham.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:64
verses.text: ( Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:65
verses.text: ) "But he whose descent is not counted from them, received tithes of Abraham".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:66
verses.text: And after that he did not simply pass on, but added, "and blessed him that had the promises".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:67
verses.text: Inasmuch as throughout, this was regarded with reverence, he shows that [Melchisedec] was to be reverenced more than Abraham, from the common judgment of all men.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:68
verses.text: ( Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:69
verses.text: ) "And without all contradiction," he says, "the less is blessed of the better," i-e: in the opinion of all men it is the inferior that is blessed by the superior.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:70
verses.text: So then the type of Christ is superior even to "him that had the promises".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:71
verses.text: ( Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:72
verses.text: ) "And here men that die receive tithes: but there he of whom it is testified that he liveth".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:73
verses.text: But lest we should say, Tell us, why goest thou so far back? He says, ( ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:74
verses.text: ) "And as I may so say" (and he did well in softening it) "Levi also who receiveth tithes payed tithes in Abraham".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:75
verses.text: How? ( Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:76
verses.text: ) "For he was yet in his loins when Melchisedec met him," i-e: Levi was in him, although he was not yet born.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:77
verses.text: And he said not the Levites but Levi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:78
verses.text: Hast thou seen the superiority? Hast thou seen how great is the interval between Abraham and Melchisedec, who bears the type of our High Priest? And he shows that the superiority had been caused by authority, not necessity.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:79
verses.text: For the one paid the tithe, which indicates the priest: the other gave the blessing, which indicates the superior.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:80
verses.text: This superiority passes on also to the descendants.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:81
verses.text: In a marvelous and triumphant way he cast out the Jewish [system].

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:82
verses.text: On this account he said, "Ye are become dull," ( c.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:83
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:84
verses.text: ), because he wished to lay these foundations, that they might not start away.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:85
verses.text: Such is the wisdom of Paul, first preparing them well, he so leads them into what he wishes.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:86
verses.text: For the human race is hard to persuade, and needs much attention, even more than plants.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:87
verses.text: Since in that case there is [only] the nature of material bodies, and earth, which yields to the hands of the husbandmen: but in this there is will, which is liable to many alterations, and now prefers this, now that.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:88
verses.text: For it quickly turns to evil.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:89
verses.text: Wherefore we ought always to "guard" ourselves, lest at any time we should fall asleep.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:90
verses.text: For "Lo" (it is said) "he that keepeth Israel shall neither slumber nor sleep" ( Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:91
verses.text: cxxi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:92
verses.text: ), and "Do not suffer thy foot to be moved".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:93
verses.text: ( Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:94
verses.text: cxxi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:95
verses.text: ) He did not say, 'be not moved' but "do not thou suffer," &c.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:96
verses.text: The suffering depends then on ourselves, and not on any other.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:97
verses.text: For if we will stand "steadfast and unmoveable" (  Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:98
verses.text: xv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:99
verses.text: ), we shall not be shaken.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:100
verses.text: What then? Does nothing depend on God? All indeed depends on God, but not so that our free-will is hindered.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:101
verses.text: 'If then it depend on God,' (one says), 'why does He blame us?' On this account I said, 'so that our free-will is not hindered.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:102
verses.text: ' It depends then on us, and on Him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:103
verses.text: For we must first choose the good; and then He leads us to His own.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:104
verses.text: He does not anticipate our choice, lest our free-will should be outraged.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:105
verses.text: But when we have chosen, then great is the assistance he brings to us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:106
verses.text: How is it then that Paul says, "not of him that willeth," if it depend on ourselves also "nor of him that runneth, but of God that showeth mercy".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:107
verses.text: ( Rom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:108
verses.text: ix.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:109
verses.text: )  In the first place, he did not introduce it as his own opinion, but inferred it from what was before him and from what had been put forward [in the discussion].

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:110
verses.text: For after saying, "It is written, I will have mercy on whom I will have mercy, and I will have compassion on whom I will have compassion" ( Rom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:111
verses.text: ix.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:112
verses.text: ), he says, "It follows then that it is not of him that willeth, nor of him that runneth, but of God that showeth mercy".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:113
verses.text: "Thou wilt say then unto me, why doth He yet find fault?" ( Rom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:114
verses.text: ix.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:116
verses.text: )  And secondly the other explanation may be given, that he speaks of all as His, whose the greater part is.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:117
verses.text: For it is ours to choose and to wish; but God's to complete and to bring to an end.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:118
verses.text: Since therefore the greater part is of Him, he says all is of Him, speaking according to the custom of men.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:119
verses.text: For so we ourselves also do.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:120
verses.text: I mean for instance: we see a house well built, and we say the whole is the Architect's [doing], and yet certainly it is not all his, but the workmen's also, and the owner's, who supplies the materials, and many others', but nevertheless since he contributed the greatest share, we call the whole his.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:121
verses.text: So then [it is] in this case also.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:122
verses.text: Again, with respect to a number of people, where the many are, we say All are: where few, nobody.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:123
verses.text: So also Paul says, "not of him that willeth, nor of him that runneth, but of God that showeth mercy".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:124
verses.text: And herein he establishes two great truths: one, that we should not be lifted up: even shouldst thou run (he would say), even shouldst thou be very earnest, do not consider that the well doing is thine own.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:125
verses.text: For if thou obtain not the impulse that is from above, all is to no purpose.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:126
verses.text: Nevertheless that thou wilt attain that which thou earnestly strivest after is very evident; so long as thou runnest, so long as thou willest.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:127
verses.text: He did not then assert this, that we run in vain, but that, if we think the whole to be our own, if we do not assign the greater part to God, we run in vain.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:128
verses.text: For neither hath God willed that the whole should be His, lest He should appear to be crowning us without cause: nor again our's, lest we should fall away to pride.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:129
verses.text: For if when we have the smaller [share], we think much of ourselves, what should we do if the whole depended on us?   Indeed God hath done away many things for the purpose of cutting away our boastfulness, and still there is the high hand.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:130
verses.text: With how many afflictions hath He encompassed us, so as to cut away our proud spirit! With how many wild beasts hath He encircled us! For indeed when some say, 'why is this?' 'Of what use is this?' They utter these things against the will of God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:131
verses.text: He hath placed thee in the midst of so great fear, and yet not even so art thou lowly-minded; but if thou ever attain a little success, thou reachest to Heaven itself in pride.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:132
verses.text: For this cause [come] rapid changes and reverses; and yet not even so are we instructed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:133
verses.text: For this cause are there continual and untimely deaths, but are minded as if we were immortal, as if we should never die.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:134
verses.text: We plunder, we over-reach, as though we were never to give account.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:135
verses.text: We build as if we were to abide here always.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:136
verses.text: And not even the word of God daily sounded into our ears, nor the events themselves instruct us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:137
verses.text: Not a day, not an hour can be mentioned, in which we may not see continual funerals.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:138
verses.text: But all in vain: and nothing reaches our hardness [of heart]: nor are we even able to become better by the calamities of others; or rather, we are not willing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:139
verses.text: When we ourselves only are afflicted, then we are subdued, and yet if God take off His hand, we again lift up our hand: no one considers what is proper for man, no one despises the things on earth; no one looks to Heaven.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:140
verses.text: But as swine turn their heads downwards, stooping towards their belly, wallowing in the mire; so too the great body of mankind defile themselves with the most intolerable filth, without being conscious of it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:141
verses.text: For better were it to be defiled with unclean mud than with sins; for he who is defiled with the one, washes it off in a little time, and becomes like one who had never from the first fallen into that slough; but he who has fallen into the deep pit of sin has contracted a defilement that is not cleansed by water, but needs long time, and strict repentance, and tears and lamentations, and more wailing, and that more fervent, than we show over the dearest friends.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:142
verses.text: For this defilement attaches to us from without, wherefore we also speedily put it away; but the other is generated from within, wherefore also we wash it off with difficulty, and cleanse ourselves from it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:143
verses.text: "For from the heart" (it is said) "proceed evil thoughts, fornications, adulteries, thefts, false witnesses".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:144
verses.text: ( Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:145
verses.text: xv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:146
verses.text: ) Wherefore also the Prophet said, "Create in me a clean heart, O God".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:147
verses.text: ( Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:148
verses.text: li.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:149
verses.text: ) And another, "Wash thine heart from wickedness, O Jerusalem".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:150
verses.text: ( Jer.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:151
verses.text: iv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:152
verses.text: ) (Thou seest that it is both our [work] and God's.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:153
verses.text: ) And again, "Blessed are the pure in heart, for they shall see God".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:154
verses.text: ( Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:155
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:156
verses.text: )  Let us become clean to the utmost of our power.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:157
verses.text: Let us wipe away our sins.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:158
verses.text: And how to wipe them away, the prophet teaches, saying, "Wash you, make you clean, put away your wickedness from your souls, before Mine eyes".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:159
verses.text: ( Isa.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:160
verses.text: i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:161
verses.text: ) What is "before Mine eyes"? Because some seem to be free from wickedness, but only to men, while to God they are manifest as being "whited sepulchers".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:162
verses.text: Therefore He says, so put them away as I see.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:163
verses.text: "Learn to do well, seek judgment, do justice for the poor and lowly".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:164
verses.text: "Come now, and let us reason together, saith the Lord: and though your sins be as scarlet, I will make you white as snow, and if they be as crimson, I will make you white as wool".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:165
verses.text: ( Isa.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:166
verses.text: i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:168
verses.text: ) Thou seest that we must first cleanse ourselves, and then God cleanses us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:169
verses.text: For having said first, "Wash you, make you clean," He then added "I will make you white".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:170
verses.text: Let no one then, [even] of those who are come to the extremest wickedness, despair of himself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:171
verses.text: For (He says) even if thou hast passed into the habit, yea and almost into the nature of wickedness itself, be not afraid.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:172
verses.text: Therefore taking [the instance of] colors that are not superficial but almost of the substance of the materials, He said that He would bring them into the opposite state.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:173
verses.text: For He did not simply say that He would "wash" us, but that He would "make" us "white, as snow and as wool," in order to hold out good hopes before us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:174
verses.text: Great then is the power of repentance, at least if it makes us as snow, and whitens us as wool, even if sin have first got possession and dyed our souls.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:175
verses.text: Let us labor earnestly then to become clean; He has enjoined nothing burdensome.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:176
verses.text: "Judge the fatherless, and do justice for the widow".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:177
verses.text: ( Isa.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:178
verses.text: i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:179
verses.text: ) Thou seest everywhere how great account God makes of mercy, and of standing forward in behalf of those that are wronged.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 13:180
verses.text: These good deeds let us pursue after, and we shall be able also, by the grace of God, to attain to the blessings to come: which may we all be counted worthy of, in Christ Jesus our Lord, with whom to the Father together with the Holy Ghost, be glory, power, honor, now and for ever and world without end, Amen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:1
verses.text: Homily XIII.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:2
verses.text: Hebrews vii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:3
verses.text: –  "If therefore perfection were by the Levitical priesthood; (for under it the people have received the law' ) what further need was there that another priest should arise after the order of Melchisedec, and not be called after the order of Aaron? For the priesthood being changed, there is made of necessity a change also of the law.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:4
verses.text: For He of whom these things are spoken, pertained to another tribe, of which no man gave attendance at the altar.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:5
verses.text: For it is evident that our Lord sprang out of Judah, of which tribe Moses spake nothing concerning priests".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:6
verses.text: "If therefore" (he says) "perfection were by the Levitical priesthood".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:7
verses.text: Having spoken concerning Melchisedec, and shown how much superior he was to Abraham, and having set forth the great difference between them, he begins from this point forward to prove the wide difference as to the covenant itself, and how the one is imperfect and the other perfect.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:8
verses.text: However he does not even yet enter on the matters themselves, but first contends on the ground of the priesthood, and the tabernacle.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:9
verses.text: For these things would be more easily received by the unbelieving, when the proof was derived from things already allowed, and believed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:10
verses.text: He had shown that Melchisedec was greatly superior both to Levi and to Abraham, being to them in the rank of the priests.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:11
verses.text: Again he argues from a different point.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:12
verses.text: What then is this? Why (he says) did he not say, "after the order of Aaron"? And observe, I pray you, the great superiority [of his argument].

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:13
verses.text: For from the very circumstance which naturally excluded His priesthood, viz.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:14
verses.text: that He was not "after the order of Aaron," from that he establishes Him, and excludes the others.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:15
verses.text: For this is the very thing that I say (he declares); why has He "not been made after the order of Aaron"?  And the [saying] "what further need" has much emphasis.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:16
verses.text: For if Christ had been "after the order of Melchisedec" according to the flesh, and then afterwards the law had been introduced, and all that pertained to Aaron, one might reasonably say that the latter as being more perfect, annulled the former, seeing that it had come in after it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:17
verses.text: But if Christ comes later, and takes a different type, as that of His priesthood, it is evident that it is because those were imperfect.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:18
verses.text: For (he would say) let us suppose for argument's sake, that all has been fulfilled, and that there is nothing imperfect in the priesthood.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:19
verses.text: "What need" was there in that case that He should be called "after the order of Melchisedec and not after the order of Aaron"? Why did He set aside Aaron, and introduce a different priesthood, that of Melchisedec? "If then perfection," that is the perfection of the things themselves, of the doctrines, of life,  "had been by the Levitical priesthood".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:20
verses.text: And observe how he goes forward on his path.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:21
verses.text: He had said that [He was] "after the order of Melchisedec," implying that the [priesthood] "after the order of Melchisedec" is superior: for [he was] far superior.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:22
verses.text: Afterwards he shows this from the time also, in that He was after Aaron; evidently as being better.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:23
verses.text: And what is the meaning of what follows? "For" (he says) "under [or "upon"] it the people have received the Law [or "have been legislated for"]".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:24
verses.text: What is "under it" [&c.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:25
verses.text: ]? Ordereth itself by it; through it does all things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:26
verses.text: You cannot say that it was given to others, "the people under it have received the law," that is, have used it, and did use it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:27
verses.text: You cannot say indeed that it was perfect, it did not govern the people; "they have been legislated for upon it," that is, they used it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:28
verses.text: What need was there then of another priesthood? "For the priesthood being changed, there is of necessity a change of the law also".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:29
verses.text: But if there must be another priest, or rather another priesthood, there must needs be also another law.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:30
verses.text: This is for those who say, What need was there of a new Covenant? For he could indeed have alleged a testimony from prophecy also.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:31
verses.text: "This is the covenant which I made with your fathers" [&c.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:34
verses.text: viii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:35
verses.text: ) But for the present he contends on the ground of the priesthood.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:36
verses.text: And observe, how he says this from the first.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:37
verses.text: He said, "According to the order of Melchisedec".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:38
verses.text: By this he excluded the order of Aaron.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:39
verses.text: For he would not have said "After the order of Melchisedec," if the other had been better.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:40
verses.text: If therefore another priesthood has been brought in, there must be also [another] Covenant; for neither is it possible that there should be a priest, without a covenant and laws and ordinances, nor that having received a different priesthood He should use the former [covenant].

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:41
verses.text: In the next place, as to the ground of objection: "How could He be a priest if He were not a Levite?" Having overthrown this by what had been said above, he does not even think it worth answering, but introduces it in passing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:42
verses.text: I said (he means) that the priesthood was changed, therefore also the Covenant is.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:43
verses.text: And it was changed not only in its character, or in its ordinances, but also in its tribe.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:44
verses.text: For of necessity [it must be changed] in its tribe also.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:45
verses.text: How? "For the priesthood being changed [or "transferred"]," from tribe to tribe, from the sacerdotal to the regal [tribe], that the same might be both regal and sacerdotal.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:46
verses.text: And observe the mystery.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:47
verses.text: First it was royal, and then it is become sacerdotal: so therefore also in regard to Christ: for King indeed He always was, but has become Priest from the time that He assumed the Flesh, that He offered the sacrifice.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:48
verses.text: Thou seest the change, and the very things which were ground of objection these he introduces, as though the natural order of things required them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:49
verses.text: "For" (he says) "He of whom these things are spoken pertained to another tribe".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:50
verses.text: I myself also say it, I know that this tribe [of Judah] had nothing of priesthood.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:51
verses.text: For there is a transferring.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:52
verses.text: Yea and I am showing another difference also (he would say): not only from the tribe, nor yet only from the Person, nor from the character [of the Priesthood], nor from the covenant, but also from the type itself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:53
verses.text: ( Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:54
verses.text: ) "Who was made ["became" so], not according to the law of a carnal commandment, but according to the power of an endless life.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:55
verses.text: He became" (he says) "a priest not according to the law of a carnal commandment": for that law was in many respects unlawful.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:56
verses.text: What is, "of a carnal commandment"? Circumcise the flesh, it says; anoint the flesh; wash the flesh; purify the flesh; shave the flesh; bind upon the flesh; cherish the flesh; rest as to the flesh.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:57
verses.text: And again its blessings, what are they? Long life for the flesh; milk and honey for the flesh; peace for the flesh; luxury for the flesh.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:58
verses.text: From this law Aaron received the priesthood; Melchisedec however not so.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:59
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:60
verses.text: "And it is yet far more evident, if after the similitude of Melchisedec there ariseth another priest".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:61
verses.text: What is evident? The interval between the two priesthoods, the difference; how much superior He is "who was made not according to the law of a carnal commandment".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:62
verses.text: (Who? Melchisedec? Nay; but Christ.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:63
verses.text: ) "But according to the power of an endless life.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:64
verses.text: For He testifieth, Thou art a Priest for ever after the order of Melchisedec"; that is, not for a time, nor having any limit, "but according to the power of an endless life," that is, by means of power, by means of "endless life".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:65
verses.text: And yet this does not follow after, "who was made not according to the law of a carnal commandment": for what would follow would be to say, "but according to that of a spiritual one".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:66
verses.text: However by "carnal," he implied temporary.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:67
verses.text: As he says also in another place, carnal ordinances imposed until the time of reformation".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:69
verses.text: ix.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:70
verses.text: )  "According to the power of life," that is, because He lives by His own power.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:71
verses.text: He had said, that there is also a change of law, and up to this point he has shown it; henceforward he enquires into the cause, that which above all gives full assurance to men's minds, [I mean] the knowing the cause thoroughly; and it leads us more to faith when we have learned also the cause, and the principle according to which [the thing] comes to pass.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:72
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:73
verses.text: "For there is verily" (he says) "a disannulling of the commandment going before, for the weakness and unprofitableness thereof".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:74
verses.text: Here the Heretics press on.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:75
verses.text: But listen attentively.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:76
verses.text: He did not say "for the evil," nor, "for the viciousness," but "for the weakness and unprofitableness [thereof]," yea and in other places also he shows the weakness; as when he says "In that it was weak through the flesh".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:77
verses.text: ( Rom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:78
verses.text: viii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:79
verses.text: ) [The law] itself then is not weak, but we.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:80
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:81
verses.text: "For the Law made nothing perfect".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:82
verses.text: What is, "make nothing perfect"? Made no man perfect, being disobeyed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:83
verses.text: And besides, even if it had been listened to, it would not have made one perfect and virtuous.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:84
verses.text: But as yet he does not say this here, but that it had no strength: and with good reason.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:85
verses.text: For written precepts were there set down, Do this and Do not that, being enjoined only, and not giving power within.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:86
verses.text: But "the Hope" is not such.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:87
verses.text: What is "a disannulling"? A casting out.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:88
verses.text: A "disannulling" is a disannulling of things which are of force.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:89
verses.text: So that he implied, that it [once] was of force, but henceforward was of no account, since it accomplished nothing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:90
verses.text: Was the Law then of no use? It was indeed of use; and of great use: but to make men perfect it was of no use.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:91
verses.text: For in this respect he says, "The Law made nothing perfect".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:92
verses.text: All were figures, all shadows; circumcision, sacrifice, sabbath.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:93
verses.text: There fore they could not reach through the soul, wherefore they pass away and gradually withdraw.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:94
verses.text: "But the bringing in of a better hope did, by which we draw nigh unto God".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:95
verses.text: ( Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:96
verses.text: ) "And forasmuch as not without the taking of an oath".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:97
verses.text: Thou seest that the matter of the oath becomes necessary for him here.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:98
verses.text: Accordingly for this reason he previously treated much [hereon], how that God swore; and swore for the sake of [our] fuller assurance.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:99
verses.text: "But the bringing in of a better hope".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:100
verses.text: For that system also had a hope, but not such as this.
