verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:101
verses.text: For they hoped that, if they were well pleasing [to God], they should possess the land, that they should suffer nothing fearful.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:102
verses.text: But in this [dispensation] we hope that, if we are well pleasing [to God], we shall possess not earth, but heaven; or rather (which is far better than this) we hope to stand near to God, to come unto the very throne of the Father, to minister unto Him with the Angels.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:103
verses.text: And see how he introduces these things by little and little.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:104
verses.text: For above he says "which entereth into that within the veil", ( c.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:105
verses.text: vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:106
verses.text: ), but here, "by which we draw nigh unto God".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:107
verses.text: "And inasmuch as not without an oath".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:108
verses.text: What is "And inasmuch as not without an oath"? That is, Behold another difference also.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:109
verses.text: And these things were not merely promised (he says).

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:110
verses.text: "For those priests were made without an oath," ( ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:111
verses.text: ,  ) "but This with an oath, by Him that said unto Him, The Lord swore and will not repent, Thou art Priest for ever after the order of Melchisedec.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:112
verses.text: By so much was Jesus made a surety of a better covenant".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:113
verses.text: He lays down two points of difference, that it hath no end as the [covenant] of the Law had; and this he proves from [its being] Christ who exercises [the priesthood]; for he says "according to the power of an endless life".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:114
verses.text: And he proves it also from the oath, because "He swore," &c.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:115
verses.text: , and from the fact; for if the other was cast out, because it was weak, this stands firm, because it is powerful.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:116
verses.text: He proves it also from the priest.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:117
verses.text: How? Because He is One [only]; and there would not have been One [only], unless He had been immortal.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:118
verses.text: For as there were many priests, because they were mortal, so [here is] The One, because He is immortal.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:119
verses.text: "By so much was Jesus made a surety of a better covenant," inasmuch as He sware to Him that He should always be [Priest]; which He would not have done, if He were not living.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:120
verses.text: ( Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:121
verses.text: ) "Wherefore He is able also to save them to the uttermost, that come unto God by Him, seeing He ever liveth to make intercession for them".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:122
verses.text: Thou seest that he says this in respect of that which is according to the flesh.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:123
verses.text: For when He [appears] as Priest, then He also intercedes.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:124
verses.text: Wherefore also when Paul says, "who also maketh intercession for us" ( Rom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:125
verses.text: viii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:126
verses.text: ), he hints the same thing; the High Priest maketh intercession.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:127
verses.text: For He "that raiseth the dead as He will, and quickeneth them," ( John v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:128
verses.text: ), and that "even as the Father" [doth], how [is it that] when there is need to save, He "maketh intercession"? ( John v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:129
verses.text: ) He that hath "all judgment," how [is it that] He "maketh intercession"? He that "sendeth His angels" ( Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:130
verses.text: xiii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:131
verses.text: ,  ), that they may "cast" some into "the furnace," and save others, how [is it that] He "maketh intercession"? Wherefore (he says) "He is able also to save".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:132
verses.text: For this cause then He saves, because He dies not.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:133
verses.text: Inasmuch as "He ever liveth," He hath (he means) no successor: And if He have no successor, He is able to aid all men.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:134
verses.text: For there [under the Law] indeed, the High Priest although he were worthy of admiration during the time in which he was [High Priest] (as Samuel for instance, and any other such), but, after this, no longer; for they were dead.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:135
verses.text: But here it is not so, but "He" saves "to the uttermost".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:136
verses.text: What is "to the uttermost"? He hints at some mystery.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:137
verses.text: Not here only (he says) but there also He saves them that "come unto God by Him".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:138
verses.text: How does He save? "In that He ever liveth" (he says) "to make intercession for them".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:139
verses.text: Thou seest the humiliation? Thou seest the manhood? For he says not, that He obtained this, by making intercession once for all, but continually, and whensoever it may be needful to intercede for them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:140
verses.text: "To the uttermost".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:141
verses.text: What is it? Not for a time only, but there also in the future life.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:142
verses.text: 'Does He then always need to pray? Yet how can [this] be reasonable? Even righteous men have oftentimes accomplished all by one entreaty, and is He always praying? Why then is He throned with [the Father]?' Thou seest that it is a condescension.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:143
verses.text: The meaning is: Be not afraid, nor say, Yea, He loves us indeed, and He has confidence towards the Father, but He cannot live always.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:144
verses.text: For He doth live alway.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:145
verses.text: ( Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:146
verses.text: ) "For such an High Priest also became us, who is holy, harmless, unde filed, separate from the sinners".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:147
verses.text: Thou seest that the whole is said with reference to the manhood.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:148
verses.text: (But when I say 'the manhood,' I mean [the manhood] having Godhead; not dividing [one from the other], but leaving [you] to suppose what is suitable.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:149
verses.text: ) Didst thou mark the difference of the High Priest? He has summed up what was said before, "in all points tempted like as we are yet without sin".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:151
verses.text: iv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:152
verses.text: ) "For" (he says) "such an High Priest also became us, who is holy, harmless".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:153
verses.text: "Harmless": what is it? Without wickedness: that which another Prophet says: "guile was not found in His mouth" ( Isa.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:154
verses.text: liii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:155
verses.text: ), that is, [He is] not crafty.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:156
verses.text: Could any one say this concerning God? And is one not ashamed to say that God is not crafty, nor deceitful? Concerning Him, however, in respect of the Flesh, it might be reasonable [to say it].

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:157
verses.text: "Holy, undefiled".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:158
verses.text: This too would any one say concerning God? For has He a nature capable of defilement? "Separate from sinners".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:159
verses.text: Does then this alone show the difference, or does the sacrifice itself also? How? ( Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:160
verses.text: ) "He needeth not" (he says) "daily, as the High Priest, to offer up sacrifices for his sins, for this He did once for all, when He offered up Himself".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:161
verses.text: "This," what? Here what follows sounds a prelude concerning the exceeding greatness of the spiritual sacrifice and the interval [between them].

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:162
verses.text: He has mentioned the point of the priest; he has mentioned that of the faith; he has mentioned that of the Covenant; not entirely indeed, still he has mentioned it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:163
verses.text: In this place what follows is a prelude concerning the sacrifice itself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:164
verses.text: Do not then, having heard that He is a priest, suppose that He is always executing the priest's office.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:165
verses.text: For He executed it once, and thenceforward "sat down".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:167
verses.text: x.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:168
verses.text: ) Lest thou suppose that He is standing on high, and is a minister, he shows that the matter is [part] of a dispensation [or economy].

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:169
verses.text: For as He became a servant, so also [He became] a Priest and a Minister.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:170
verses.text: But as after becoming a servant, He did not continue a servant, so also, having become a Minister, He did not continue a Minister.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:171
verses.text: For it belongs not to a minister to sit, but to stand.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:172
verses.text: This then he hints at here, and also the greatness of the sacrifice, if being [but] one, and having been offered up once only, it affected that which all [the rest] were unable to do.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:173
verses.text: But he does not yet [treat] of these points.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:174
verses.text: "For this He did," he says.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:175
verses.text: "This"; what? "For" (he says) "it is of necessity that this [Man] have somewhat also to offer" ( c.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:176
verses.text: viii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:177
verses.text: ); not for Himself; for how did He offer Himself? But for the people.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:178
verses.text: What sayest thou? And is He able to do this? Yea (he says).

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:179
verses.text: "For the Law maketh men high priests, which have infirmity".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:181
verses.text: vii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:182
verses.text: ) And doth He not need to offer for Himself? No, he says.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:183
verses.text: For, that you may not suppose that the [words, "this"] "He did once for all," are said respecting Himself also, hear what he says: "For the law maketh men high priests, which have infirmity".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:184
verses.text: On this account they both offer continually, and for themselves.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:185
verses.text: He however who is mighty, He that hath no sin, why should He offer for Himself, or oftentimes for others?  "But the word of the oath which was since the Law [maketh] the Son who has been consecrated for evermore".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:186
verses.text: "Consecrated": what is that? Paul does not set down the common terms of contradistinction; for after saying "having Infirmity," he did not say "the Son" who is mighty, but "consecrated": i-e: mighty, as one might say.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:187
verses.text: Thou seest that the name Son is used in contradistinction to that of servant.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:188
verses.text: And by "infirmity" he means either sin or death.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:189
verses.text: What is, "for evermore"? Not now only without sin but always.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:190
verses.text: If then He is perfect, if He never sins, if He lives always, why shall He offer many sacrifices for us? But for the present he does not insist strongly on this point: but what he does strongly insist upon is, His not offering on His own behalf.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:191
verses.text: Since then we have such an High Priest, let us imitate Him: let us walk in His footsteps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:192
verses.text: There is no other sacrifice: one alone has cleansed us, and after this, fire and hell.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:193
verses.text: For indeed on this account he repeats it over and over, saying, "one Priest," "one Sacrifice," lest any one supposing that there are many [sacrifices] should sin without fear.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:194
verses.text: Let us then, as many as have been counted worthy of The Seal,  as many as have enjoyed The Sacrifice, as many as have partaken of the immortal Table, continue to guard our noble birth and our dignity for falling away is not without danger.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:195
verses.text: And as many as have not yet been counted worthy these [privileges], let not these either be confident on that account.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:196
verses.text: For when a person goes on in sin, with the view of receiving holy baptism at the last gasp, oftentimes he will not obtain it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:197
verses.text: And, believe me, it is not to terrify you that I say what I am going to say.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:198
verses.text: I have myself known many persons, to whom this has happened, who in expectation indeed of the enlightening sinned much, and on the day of their death went away empty.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:199
verses.text: For God gave us baptism for this cause, that He might do away our sins, not that He might increase our sins.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:200
verses.text: Whereas if any man have employed it as a security for sinning more, it becomes a cause of negligence.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:201
verses.text: For if there had been no Washing, they would have lived more warily, as not having [the means of] forgiveness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:202
verses.text: Thou seest that we are the ones who cause it to be said "Let us do evil, that good may come".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:203
verses.text: ( Rom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:204
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:205
verses.text: )  Wherefore, I exhort you also who are uninitiated, be sober.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:206
verses.text: Let no man follow after virtue as an hireling, no man as a senseless person, no man as after a heavy and burdensome thing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:207
verses.text: Let us pursue it then with a ready mind, and with joy.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:208
verses.text: For if there were no reward laid up, ought we not to be good? But however, at least with a reward, let us become good.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:209
verses.text: And how is this anything else than a disgrace and a very great condemnation? Unless thou give me a reward (says one), I do not become self-controlled.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:210
verses.text: Then am I bold to say something: thou wilt never be self-controlled, no not even when thou livest with self-control, if thou dost it for a reward.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:211
verses.text: Thou esteemest not virtue at all, if thou dost not love it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:212
verses.text: But on account of our great weakness, God was willing that for a time it should be practiced even for reward, yet not even so do we pursue it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:213
verses.text: But let us suppose, if you will, that a man dies, after having done innumerable evil things, having also been counted worthy of baptism (which however I think does not readily happen), tell me, how will he depart thither? Not indeed called to account for the deeds he had done, but yet without confidence; as is reasonable.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:214
verses.text: For when after living a hundred years, he has no good work to show, but only that he has not sinned, or rather not even this, but that he was saved by grace only, and when he sees others crowned, in splendor, and highly approved: even if he fall not into hell, tell me, will he endure his despondency?   But to make the matter clear by an example, Suppose there are two soldiers, and that one of them steals, injures, overreaches, and that the other does none of these things, but acts the part of a brave man, does important things well, sets up trophies in war, stains his right hand with blood; then when the time arrives, suppose that (from the same rank in which the thief also was) he is at once conducted to the imperial throne and the purple; but suppose that the other remains there where he was, and merely of the royal kindness does not pay the penalty of his deeds, let him however be in the last place, and let him be stationed under the King.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:215
verses.text: Tell me, will he be able to endure his despair when he sees him who was [ranked] with himself ascended even to the very highest dignities, and made thus glorious, and master of the world, while he himself still remains below, and has not even been freed from punishment with honor, but through the grace and kindness of the King? For even should the King forgive him, and release him from the charges against him, still he will live in shame; for surely not even will others admire him: since in such forgiveness, we admire not those who receive the gifts, but those who bestow them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:216
verses.text: And as much as the gifts are greater, so much the more are they ashamed who receive them, when their transgressions are great.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:217
verses.text: With what eyes then will such an one be able to look on those who are in the King's courts, when they exhibit their sweatings out of number and their wounds, whilst he has nothing to show, but has his salvation itself of the mere loving-kindness of God? For as if one were to beg off a murderer, a thief, an adulterer, when he was going to be arrested, and were to command him to stay at the porch of the King's palace, he will not afterwards be able to look any man in the face, although he has been set free from punishment: so too surely is this man's case.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:218
verses.text: For do not, I beseech you, suppose that because it is called a palace, therefore all attain the same things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:219
verses.text: For if here in Kings' courts there is the Prefect, and all who are about the King, and also those who are in very inferior stations, and occupy the place of what are called Decani (though the interval be so great between the Prefect and the Decanus) much more shall this be so in the royal court above.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:220
verses.text: And this I say not of myself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:221
verses.text: For Paul layeth down another difference greater even than these.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:222
verses.text: For (he says) as many differences as there are between the sun and the moon and the stars and the very smallest star, so many also between those in the kingdom [of Heaven].

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:223
verses.text: And that the difference between the sun and the smallest star is far greater than that between the Decanus (as he is called) and the Prefect, is evident to all.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:224
verses.text: For while the sun shines upon all the world at once, and makes it bright, and hides the moon and the stars, the other often does not appear, not even in the dark.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:225
verses.text: For there are many of the stars which we do not see.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:226
verses.text: When then we see others become suns, and we have the rank of the very smallest stars, which are not even visible, what comfort shall we have?  Let us not, I beseech you, let us not be so slothful, not so inert, let us not barter away the salvation of God for an easy life, but let us make merchandise of it, and increase it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:227
verses.text: For even if one be a Catechumen, still he knows Christ, still he understands the Faith, still he is a hearer of the divine oracles, still he is not far from the knowledge; he knows the will of his Lord.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:228
verses.text: Wherefore does he procrastinate? wherefore does he delay and postpone? Nothing is better than a good life whether here or there, whether in case of the Enlightened or of the Catechumens,   For tell me what burdensome command have we enjoined? Have a wife (it is said) and be chaste.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:229
verses.text: Is this difficult? How? when many, not Christians only but heathens also, live chastely without a wife.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:230
verses.text: That which the heathen surpasses for vainglory, thou dost not even keep for the fear of God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:231
verses.text: Give (He says) to the poor out of what thou hast.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:232
verses.text: Is this burdensome? But in this case also heathen condemn us who for vainglory only have emptied out their whole possessions.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:233
verses.text: Use not filthy communication.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:234
verses.text: Is this difficult? For if it had not been enjoined, ought we not to have done right in this, to avoid appearing degraded? For that the contrary conduct is troublesome, I mean the using filthy communication, is manifest from the fact that the soul is ashamed and blushes if it have been led to say any such thing and would not unless perhaps it were drunk.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:235
verses.text: For when sitting in a public place, even if thou doest it at home, why dost thou not do it there? Because of those that are present.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:236
verses.text: Why dost thou not readily do the same thing before thy wife? That thou mayest not insult her.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:237
verses.text: So then thou dost it not, lest thou shouldest insult thy wife; and dost thou not blush at insulting God? For He is everywhere present, and heareth all things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:238
verses.text: Be not drunken, He says.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:239
verses.text: For this very thing of itself, is it not a chastisement? He did not say, Put thy body on the rack, but what? Do not give it free rein so as to take away the authority of the mind: on the contrary "make not provision for the lusts thereof".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:240
verses.text: ( Rom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:241
verses.text: xiii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:242
verses.text: )  Do not (He says) seize by violence what is not thine own; do not overreach; do not forswear thyself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:243
verses.text: What labors do these things require! what sweatings!  Speak evil of no man (He says) nor accuse falsely.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:244
verses.text: The contrary indeed is a labor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:245
verses.text: For when thou hast spoken ill of another, immediately thou art in danger, in suspicion, [saying] Did he of whom I spake, hear? whether he be great or small.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:246
verses.text: For should he be a great man, immediately thou wilt be indeed in danger; but if small, he will requite thee with as much, or rather with what is far more grievous; for he will say evil of thee in a greater degree.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:247
verses.text: We are enjoined nothing difficult, nothing burdensome, if we have the will.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:248
verses.text: And if we have not the will, even the easiest things will appear burdensome to us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:249
verses.text: What is easier than eating? but from great effeminacy many feel disgust even at this, and I hear many say, that it is weariness even to eat.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:250
verses.text: None of these things is wearisome if thou hast but the will.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:251
verses.text: For everything depends on the will after the grace from above.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:252
verses.text: Let us will good things that we may attain also to the good things eternal, in Christ Jesus our Lord, whom to the Father together with the Holy Ghost be glory, might, honor, now and for ever, and world without end, Amen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 14:253
verses.text: The text of Savile and the Benedictines οὐχ ὕπουλος· καὶ ὅτι τοιοῦτος, ἄκουε τοῦ προφήτου λέγοντος· οὐδὲ εὑρέθη δόλος ἐν τῷ στόματι αὐτοῦ, τοῦτο οὖν ἄν τις περὶ Θεοῦ εἴποι ; ὁ δὲ οὐκ αἰσχύνεται λέγων, ὅτι ὁ θεὸς οὐκ ἔστιν ὕπουλος, οὐδὲ δολερός ; περὶ μὲν οὖν τοῦ κατὰ σάρκα ἔχοι ἂν λόγον.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:1
verses.text: Homily XIV.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:2
verses.text: Hebrews viii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:3
verses.text: ,  "Now of the things which we have spoken this is the sum: We have such an High Priest; who is set down on the right hand of the throne of the majesty in the heavens: a minister of the sanctuary and of the true tabernacle which the Lord pitched, and not man".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:4
verses.text: Paul mixes the lowly things with the lofty, ever imitating his Master, so that the lowly become the path to the lofty, and through the former we are led to the latter, and when we are amid the great things we learn that these [lowly ones] were a condescension.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:5
verses.text: This accordingly he does here also.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:6
verses.text: After declaring that "He offered up Himself," and showing Him to be a "High Priest," what does he say? "Now of the things which we have spoken this is the sum: we have such an High Priest who is set down on the right hand of the throne of the majesty".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:7
verses.text: And yet this is not [the office] of a Priest, but of Him whom the Priest should serve.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:8
verses.text: "A minister of the sanctuary," not simply a minister, but "a minister of the sanctuary.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:9
verses.text: And of the true Tabernacle, which the Lord pitched and not man".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:10
verses.text: Thou seest the condescension.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:11
verses.text: Did he not a little before make a separation, saying: "Are they not all ministering spirits?" ( supra, i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:12
verses.text: ) and therefore (he says) it is not said to them, "Sit thou on my right hand," ( supra, i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:13
verses.text: ) for He that sitteth is not a minister.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:14
verses.text: How is it then that it is here said, "a minister," and "a minister of the Sanctuary"? for he means here the Tabernacle.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:15
verses.text: See how he raised up the minds of the believing Jews.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:16
verses.text: For as they would be apt to imagine that we have no such tabernacle [as they had], see here (he says) is the Priest, Great, yea, much greater than the other, and who has offered a more wonderful sacrifice.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:17
verses.text: But is not all this mere talk? is it not a boast, and merely said to win over our minds? on this account he established it first from the oath, and afterwards also from "the tabernacle".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:18
verses.text: For this difference too was manifest: but the Apostle thinks of another also, "which" (he says) "the Lord pitched [or "made firm"] and not man".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:19
verses.text: Where are they who say that the heaven whirls around? where are they who declare that it is spherical? for both of these notions are overthrown here.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:20
verses.text: "Now" (he says) "of the things which we have spoken this is the sum".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:21
verses.text: By "the sum" is always meant what is most important.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:22
verses.text: Again he brings down his discourse; having said what is lofty, henceforward he speaks fearlessly.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:23
verses.text: In the next place that thou mayest understand that he used the word "minister" of the manhood, observe how he again indicates it: "For" ( ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:24
verses.text: ) (he says) "every high priest is ordained to offer both gifts and sacrifices, wherefore it is of necessity that this man have somewhat also to offer".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:25
verses.text: Do not now, because thou hearest that He sitteth, suppose that His being called High Priest is mere idle talk.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:26
verses.text: For the former, viz.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:27
verses.text: His sitting, belongs to the dignity of the Godhead, but this to His great lovingkindness, and His tender care for us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:28
verses.text: On this account he repeatedly urges this very thing, and dwells more upon it: for he feared lest the other [truth] should overthrow it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:29
verses.text: Therefore he again brings down his discourse to this: since some were enquiring why He died.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:30
verses.text: He was a Priest.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:31
verses.text: But there is no Priest without a sacrifice.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:32
verses.text: It is necessary then that He also should have a sacrifice.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:33
verses.text: And in another way; Having said that He is on high, he affirms and proves that He is a Priest from every consideration, from Melchisedec, from the oath, from offering sacrifice.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:34
verses.text: From this he also frames another and necessary syllogism.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:35
verses.text: "For if" (he says) "He had been on earth, He would not be a Priest, seeing that there are priests who offer the gifts according to the Law".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:36
verses.text: If then He is a Priest (as He really is), we must seek some other place for Him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:37
verses.text: "For if He were" indeed "on earth, He should not be a priest".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:38
verses.text: For how [could He be]? He offered no sacrifice, He ministered not in the Priest's office.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:39
verses.text: And with good reason, for there were the priests.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:40
verses.text: Moreover he shows, that it was impossible that [He] should be a priest upon earth.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:41
verses.text: For how [could He be]? There was no rising up against [the appointed Priests], he means.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:42
verses.text: Here we must apply our minds attentively, and consider the Apostolic wisdom; for again he shows the difference of the Priesthood.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:43
verses.text: "Who" (he says) "serve unto the example and shadow of heavenly things".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:44
verses.text: What are the heavenly things he speaks of here? The spiritual things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:45
verses.text: For although they are done on earth, yet nevertheless they are worthy of the Heavens.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:46
verses.text: For when our Lord Jesus Christ lies slain [as a sacrifice], when the Spirit is with us, when He who sitteth on the right hand of the Father is here, when sons are made by the Washing, when they are fellow-citizens of those in Heaven, when we have a country, and a city, and citizenship there, when we are strangers to things here, how can all these be other than "heavenly things"? But what! Are not our Hymns heavenly? Do not we also who are below utter in concert with them the same things which the divine choirs of bodiless powers sing above? Is not the altar also heavenly? How? It hath nothing carnal, all spiritual things become the offerings.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:47
verses.text: The sacrifice does not disperse into ashes, or into smoke, or into steamy savor, it makes the things placed there bright and splendid.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:48
verses.text: How again can the rites which we celebrate be other than heavenly? For when He says, "Whose soever sins ye retain they are retained, whose soever sins ye remit, they are remitted" ( John xx.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:49
verses.text: ) when they have the keys of heaven, how can all be other than heavenly?  "Who" (he says) "serve unto the example and shadow of heavenly things, as Moses was admonished of God, when he was about to make the tabernacle, for see, saith He, that thou make all things according to the pattern showed to thee in the mount".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:50
verses.text: Inasmuch as our hearing is less ready of apprehension than our sight (for the things which we hear we do not in such wise lay up in our soul, as those which we see with our very eyes), He showed him all.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:51
verses.text: Either then he means this by "the example and shadow," or else he [speaks] of the Temple.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:52
verses.text: For, he went on to say, "See" (His words are), that "thou make all things according to the pattern showed to thee in the mount".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:53
verses.text: Was it then only what concerned the furniture of the temple that he saw, or was it also what related to the sacrifices, and all the rest? Nay, one would not be wrong in saying even this; for The Church is heavenly, and is nothing else than Heaven.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:54
verses.text: ( Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:55
verses.text: ) "But now hath He obtained a more excellent ministry, by how much also He is the Mediator of a better covenant".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:56
verses.text: Thou seest (he means) how much better is the one ministration than the other, if one be an example and type, and the other truth [reality].

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:57
verses.text: But this did not profit the hearers, nor cheer them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:58
verses.text: Therefore he says what especially cheered them: "Which was established upon better promises".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:59
verses.text: Having raised them up by speaking of the place, and the priest, and the sacrifice, he then sets forth also the wide difference of the covenant, having also said before that it was "weak and unprofitable".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:60
verses.text: (See Heb.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:61
verses.text: vii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:62
verses.text: )  And observe what safeguards he lays down, when intending to find fault with it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:63
verses.text: For in the former place after saying, "according to the power of an endless life" ( Heb.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:64
verses.text: vii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:65
verses.text: ), he then said that "there is a disannulling of the commandment going before" ( Heb.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:66
verses.text: vii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:67
verses.text: ); and then after that, he set forth something great, saying, "by which we draw nigh unto God".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:68
verses.text: ( Heb.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:69
verses.text: vii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:70
verses.text: ) And in this place, after leading us up into Heaven, and showing that instead of the temple, we have Heaven, and that those things were types of ours, and having by these means exalted the Ministration [of the New Covenant], he then proceeds suitably to exalt the priesthood.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:71
verses.text: But (as I said) he sets down that which especially cheers them, in the words, "Which was established upon better promises".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:72
verses.text: Whence does appear? In that this the one was cast out, and the other introduced in its place: for it is therefore of force because it is better.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:73
verses.text: For as he says, "If perfection were by" it, "what further need was there, that another priest should rise, after the order of Melchisedec?" ( Heb.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:74
verses.text: vii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:75
verses.text: ); so also here he used the same syllogism, saying ( ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:76
verses.text: ) "For if that first covenant had been faultless, then should no place have been sought for the second"; that is, if it made men "faultless".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:77
verses.text: For it is because he is speaking of this that he did not say, "But finding fault with" it, but ( ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:78
verses.text: ,  ) "But finding fault with them, He saith, Behold, the days come, saith the Lord, when I will make a new covenant with the house of Israel and with the house of Judah: not according to the covenant that I made with their fathers in the day when I took them by the hand to lead them out of the land of Egypt: because they continued not in My covenant, and I regarded them not, saith the Lord".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:79
verses.text: Yea, verily.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:80
verses.text: And whence does it appear that [the first Covenant] came to an end? He showed it indeed also from the Priest, but now he shows more clearly by express words that it has been cast out.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:81
verses.text: But how is it "upon better promises"? For how, tell me, can earth and heaven be equal? But do thou consider, how he speaks of promises there [in that other covenant] also, that thou mayest not bring this charge against it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:82
verses.text: For there also, he says "a better hope, by which we draw nigh unto God" ( Heb.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:83
verses.text: vii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:84
verses.text: ), showing that a Hope was there also; and in this place "better promises," hinting that there also He had made promises.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:85
verses.text: But inasmuch as they were forever making objections, he says, "Behold! the days come, saith the Lord, when I will make a new covenant with the house of Israel and with the house of Judah".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:86
verses.text: He is not speaking of any old Covenant: for, that they might not assert this, he determined the time also.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:87
verses.text: Thus he did not say simply, "according to the covenant which I made with their fathers," lest thou shouldest say [it was] the one made with Abraham, or that with Noah: but he declares what [covenant it was], "not according to the covenant which I made with their fathers" in the Exodus.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:88
verses.text: Wherefore he added also, "in the day that I took them by the hand, to lead them out of the land of Egypt; because they continued not in My covenant, and I regarded them not, saith the Lord".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:89
verses.text: Thou seest that the evils begin first from ourselves ("they" themselves first, saith he, "continued not in [the "covenant"]") and the negligence is from ourselves, but the good things from Him; I mean the [acts] of bounty.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:90
verses.text: He here introduces, as it were, an apology showing the cause why He forsakes them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:91
verses.text: ( Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:92
verses.text: ) "For this," he says, "is the covenant that I will make with the house of Israel after those days, saith the Lord; I will put My laws into their mind, and write them in their hearts, and I will be to them a God, and they shall be to Me a people".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:93
verses.text: Thus He says this concerning the New [covenant] because His words are "not according to the covenant which I covenanted".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:94
verses.text: But what other difference is there beside this? Now if any person should say that "the difference is not in this respect, but in respect to its being put into their hearts; He makes no mention of any difference of ordinances, but points out the mode of its being given: for no longer" (he says) "shall the covenant be in writings, but in hearts;" let the Jew in that case show that this was ever carried into effect; but he could not, for it was made a second time in writings after the return from Babylon.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:95
verses.text: But I show that the Apostles received nothing in writing, but received [it] in their hearts through the Holy Ghost.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:96
verses.text: Wherefore also Christ said, "When He cometh, He will bring all things to your remembrance, and He shall teach you".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:97
verses.text: ( John xiv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:98
verses.text: )   ( Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:99
verses.text: ,  ) "And they shall not teach" (he says) "every man his neighbor, and every man his brother, saying, Know the Lord: for all shall know Me from the least to the greatest.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:100
verses.text: For I will be merciful to their unrighteousness, and their sins and their iniquities will I remember no more".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:101
verses.text: Behold also another sign.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:102
verses.text: "From the least even to the greatest of them" (he says) "they shall know Me, and they shall not say, Know the Lord".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:103
verses.text: When hath this been fulfilled save now? For our [religion] is manifest: but theirs [i-e: the Jews'] was not manifest, but had been shut up in a corner.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:104
verses.text: [A covenant] is then said to be "new," when it is different and shows some advantage over the old.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:105
verses.text: "Nay surely," says one, "it is new also when part of it has been taken away, and part not.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:106
verses.text: For instance, when an old house is ready to fall down, if a person leaving the whole, has patched up the foundation, straightway we say, he has made it new, when he has taken some parts away, and brought others into their place.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:107
verses.text: For even the heaven also is thus called 'new,' when it is no longer 'of brass,' but gives rain; and the earth likewise is new when it is not un fruitful, not when it has been changed; and the house is likewise new, when portions of it have been taken away, and portions remain.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:108
verses.text: And thus, he says, he hath well termed it 'a New Covenant.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:109
verses.text: '"  If then I show that that covenant had become "Old" in this respect, that it yielded no fruit? And that thou mayest know this exactly, read what Haggai says, what Zechariah, what the Messenger, when the return from the Captivity had not yet fully taken place; and what Esdras charges.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:110
verses.text: How then did [the people] receive him? And how no man enquired of the Lord, inasmuch as they [the priests] themselves also transgressed, and knew it not even themselves? Dost thou see how thy [interpretation] is broken down, whilst I maintain my own: that this [covenant] must be called "New" in the proper sense of the word?  And besides, I do not concede that the words "the heaven shall be new" ( Isa.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:111
verses.text: lxv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:112
verses.text: ), were spoken concerning this.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:113
verses.text: For why, when saying in Deuteronomy "the heaven shall be of brass," did he not set down this in the contrasted passage, "but if ye hearken, it shall be new".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:114
verses.text: And further on this account He says that He will give "another Covenant, because they did not continue in the first".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:115
verses.text: This I show by what he says ("For what the law could not do in that it was weak through the flesh," Rom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:116
verses.text: viii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:117
verses.text: ; and again, "Why tempt ye God, to put a yoke upon the neck of the disciples, which neither our fathers nor we were able to bear?" Acts xv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:118
verses.text: ) But "they did not continue therein," he says.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:119
verses.text: Here he shows that [God] counts us worthy of greater and of spiritual [privileges]: for it is said "their sound went out into all the earth and their words unto the ends of the world".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:120
verses.text: ( Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:121
verses.text: xix.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:122
verses.text: ; Rom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:123
verses.text: x.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:124
verses.text: ) That is [the meaning of] "they shall not say each man to his neighbor, Know the Lord".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:125
verses.text: And again, "the earth shall be filled with the knowledge of the Lord as much water to cover the seas".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:126
verses.text: ( Isa.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:127
verses.text: xi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:128
verses.text: )   "In calling it new" (he says), "He hath made the first old: but that which decayeth and waxeth old is ready to vanish away".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:129
verses.text: See what was hidden, how he hath laid open the very mind of the prophet! He honored the law, and was not willing to call it "old" in express terms: but nevertheless, this he did call it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:130
verses.text: For if the former had been new, he would not have called this which came afterwards "new" also.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:131
verses.text: So that by granting something more and different, he declares that "it was waxen old".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:132
verses.text: Therefore it is done away and is perishing, and no longer exists.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:133
verses.text: Having taken boldness from the prophet, he attacks it more suitably, showing that our [dispensation] is now flourishing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:134
verses.text: That is, he showed that [the other] was old: then taking up the word "old," and adding of himself another [circumstance], the [characteristic] of old age, he took up what was omitted by the others, and says "ready to vanish away".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:135
verses.text: The New then has not simply caused the old to cease, but because it had become aged, as it was not [any longer] useful.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:136
verses.text: On this account he said, "for the weakness and unprofitableness thereof" ( Heb.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:137
verses.text: vii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:138
verses.text: ), and, "the law made nothing perfect" ( Heb.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:139
verses.text: vii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:140
verses.text: ); and that "if the first had been faultless, then should no place have been sought for the second".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:141
verses.text: ( Heb.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:142
verses.text: viii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:143
verses.text: ) And "faultless"; that is, useful; not as though it [the old Covenant] was obnoxious to any charges, but as not being sufficient.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:144
verses.text: He used a familiar form of speech.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:145
verses.text: As if one should say, the house is not faultless, that is, it has some defect, it is decayed: the garment is not faultless, that is, it is coming to pieces.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:146
verses.text: He does not therefore here speak of it as evil, but only as having some fault and deficiency.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:147
verses.text: So then we also are new, or rather we were made new, but now are become old; therefore we are "near to vanishing away," and to destruction.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:148
verses.text: Let us scrape off this old age.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:149
verses.text: It is indeed no longer possible to do it by Washing, but by repentance it is possible here [in this life].

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:150
verses.text: If there be in us anything old, let us cast it off; if any "wrinkle," if any stain, if any "spot," let us wash it away and become fair ( Eph.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:151
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:152
verses.text: ): that "the King may desire our beauty".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:153
verses.text: ( Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:154
verses.text: xlv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:155
verses.text: )  It is possible even for him who has fallen into the extremest deformity to recover that beauty of which David says that the King shall desire thy beauty.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:156
verses.text: "Hearken, O daughter, and consider; forget also thine own people and thy father's house: so shall the King greatly desire thy beauty".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:157
verses.text: ( Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:158
verses.text: xlv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:160
verses.text: ) And yet forgetting doth not produce beauty.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:161
verses.text: Yea, beauty is of the soul.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:162
verses.text: What sort of forgetting? That of sins.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:163
verses.text: For he is speaking about the Church from among the Gentiles, exhorting her not to remember the things of her fathers, that is [of] those that sacrificed to idols; for from such was it gathered.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:164
verses.text: And he said not, "Go not after them," but what is more, Do not admit them into thy mind; which he says also in another place, "I will not mention their names through my lips".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:165
verses.text: ( Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:166
verses.text: xvi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:167
verses.text: ) And again, "That my mouth may not talk of the deeds of men".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:168
verses.text: ( Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:169
verses.text: xvii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:171
verses.text: ) As yet is this no great virtue; nay, rather, it is indeed great, but not such as this [which is here spoken of].

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:172
verses.text: For what does he say there? He says not; "Talk not of the things of men, neither speak of the things of thy fathers"; but, neither remember them, nor admit them into thy mind.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:173
verses.text: Thou seest to how great a distance he would have us keep away from wickedness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:174
verses.text: For he that remembers not [a matter] will not think of it, and he that does not think, will not speak of it: and he that does not speak of it, will not do it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:175
verses.text: Seest thou from how many paths he hath walled us off? by what great intervals he hath removed us, even to a very great [distance]?   Let us then also "hearken and forget" our own evils.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:176
verses.text: I do not say our sins, for (He says) "Remember thou first, and I will not remember".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:177
verses.text: ( Isa.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:178
verses.text: xliii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:179
verses.text: ,  , LXX.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:180
verses.text: ) I mean for instance, Let us no longer remember rapacity, but even restore the former [plunder].

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:181
verses.text: This is to forget wickedness, and to cast out the thought of rapacity, and never at any time to admit it, but to wipe away also the things already done amiss.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:182
verses.text: Whence may the forgetfulness of wickedness come to us? From the remembrance of good things, from the remembrance of God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:183
verses.text: If we continually remember God, we cannot remember those things also.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:184
verses.text: For (he says) "When I remembered Thee upon my bed, I thought upon Thee in the morning dawn".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:185
verses.text: ( Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:186
verses.text: lxiii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:187
verses.text: ) We ought then to have God always in remembrance, but then especially, when thought is undisturbed, when by means of that remembrance [a man] is able to condemn himself, when he can retain [things] in memory.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:188
verses.text: For in the daytime indeed, if we do remember, other cares and troubles entering in, drive the thought out again: but in the night it is possible to remember continually, when the soul is calm and at rest; when it is in the haven, and under a serene sky.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:189
verses.text: "The things which you say in your hearts be ye grieved for on your beds," he says.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:190
verses.text: ( Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:191
verses.text: iv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:192
verses.text: , LXX.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:193
verses.text: ) For it were indeed right to retain this remembrance through the day also.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:194
verses.text: But inasmuch as you are always full of cares, and distracted amidst the things of this life, at least then remember God on your bed; at the morning dawn meditate upon Him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:195
verses.text: If at the morning dawn we meditate on these things, we shall go forth to our business with much security.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:196
verses.text: If we have first made God propitious by prayer and supplication, going forth thus we shall have no enemy.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:197
verses.text: Or if thou shouldest, thou wilt laugh him to scorn, having God propitious.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:198
verses.text: There is war in the market place; the affairs of every day are a fight, they are a tempest and a storm.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:199
verses.text: We therefore need arms: and prayer is a great weapon.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:200
verses.text: We need favorable winds; we need to learn everything, so as to go through the length of the day without shipwrecks and without wounds.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:201
verses.text: For every single day the rocks are many, and oftentimes the boat strikes and is sunk.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:202
verses.text: Therefore have we especially need of prayer early and by night.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:203
verses.text: Many of you have often beheld the Olympic games: and not only have beheld but have been zealous partisans and admirers of the combatants, one of this [combatant], one of that.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:204
verses.text: You know then that both during the days of the contests, and during those nights, all night long the herald thinks of nothing else, has no other anxiety, than that the combatant should not disgrace himself when he goes forth.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:205
verses.text: For those who sit by the trumpeter admonish him not to speak to any one, that he may not spend his breath and get laughed at.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:206
verses.text: If therefore he who is about to strive before men, uses such forethought, much more will it befit us to be continually thoughtful, and careful, since our whole life is a contest.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:207
verses.text: Let every night then be a vigil,  and let us be careful that when we go out in the day we do not make ourselves ridiculous.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:208
verses.text: And would it were only making ourselves ridiculous.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:209
verses.text: But now the Judge of the contest is seated on the right hand of the Father, hearkening diligently that we utter not any false note, anything out of tune.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:210
verses.text: For He is not the Judge of actions only, but of words also.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:211
verses.text: Let us keep our vigil, beloved; we also have those that are eager for our success, if we will.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:212
verses.text: Near each one of us Angels are sitting; and yet we snore through the whole night.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:213
verses.text: And would it were only this.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:214
verses.text: But many do even many licentious things, some indeed going to the very brothels, and others making their own houses places of whoredom by taking courtesans thither.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:215
verses.text: Yes most certainly.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:216
verses.text: For is it not so? They care well for their contest.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:217
verses.text: Others are drunken and speak amiss; others make an uproar.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:218
verses.text: Others keep evil vigil through the night weaving, and worse than those who sleep, schemes of deceit; others by calculating usury; others by bruising themselves with cares, and doing anything rather than what is suited to the contest.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:219
verses.text: Wherefore, I exhort you, let us lay aside all [other] things, and look to one only, how we may obtain the prize, [how we may] be crowned with the Chaplet; let us do all by which we shall be able to attain to the promised blessings.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:220
verses.text: Which may we all attain in Christ Jesus our Lord, with whom to the Father and also to the Holy Ghost be glory, might, honor, now and for ever and world without end, Amen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:221
verses.text: Is there no fountain that can wash again?.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:222
verses.text: There is a fount where holy men do say He that doth look for aye He shall become like that he doth behold, Borrowing a light more pure than gold.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:223
verses.text: There is a glass whereon he that doth bend Shall see portrayed the Heaven, Till he forget what earth hath best to lend In the sweet hope that he may be forgiven.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:224
verses.text: The Rev.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:225
verses.text: Isaac Williams, Thoughts in Past Years, "The Penitent," p.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 15:226
verses.text: , ed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:1
verses.text: Homily XV.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:2
verses.text: Hebrews ix.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:3
verses.text: –  "Then verily the first [covenant] had also ordinances of divine service, and a worldly Sanctuary.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:4
verses.text: For there was a tabernacle made; the first, wherein was the Candlestick, and the Table, and the Shew-bread, which is called the Sanctuary.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:5
verses.text: And after the second veil, the tabernacle which is called the Holiest of all; which had the golden censer and the Ark of the Covenant overlaid round about with gold: wherein was the golden pot that had manna, and Aaron's rod that budded, and the tables of the covenant: and over it the Cherubim of glory, shadowing the Mercy-seat: of which we cannot now speak particularly".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:6
verses.text: He has shown from the Priest, from the Priesthood, from the Covenant, that that [dispensation] was to have an end.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:7
verses.text: From this point he shows it from the fashion of the tabernacle itself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:8
verses.text: How? This, he says, [was] the "Holy" and the "Holy of Holies".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:9
verses.text: The holy place then is a symbol of the former period (for there all things are done by means of sacrifices); but the Holy of Holies of this that is now present.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:10
verses.text: And by the Holy of Holies he means Heaven; and by the veil, Heaven, and the Flesh "entereth into that within the veil": that is to say, "through the veil of His flesh".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:11
verses.text: (Supra, vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:12
verses.text: ; Heb.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:13
verses.text: x.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:14
verses.text: )  And it were well to speak of this passage, taking it up from the beginning.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:15
verses.text: What then does he say? "Then verily the first had also" (the first what? "The Covenant").

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:16
verses.text: "Ordinances of Divine service".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:17
verses.text: What are "ordinances"? symbols or rights.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:18
verses.text: Then; as (he means) it has not now.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:19
verses.text: He shows that it had already given place, for (he says) it had at that time; so that now, although it stood, it is not.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:20
verses.text: "And the worldly Sanctuary".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:21
verses.text: He calls it "worldly," inasmuch as it was permitted to all to tread it, and in the same house the place was manifest where the priests stood, where the Jews, the Proselytes, the Grecians, the Nazarites.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:22
verses.text: Since, therefore even Gentiles were permitted to tread it, he calls it "worldly".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:23
verses.text: For surely the Jews were not "the world".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:24
verses.text: "For" (he says) "there was a tabernacle made; the first, which is called holy, wherein was the Candlestick, and the Table, and the Shew-bread".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:25
verses.text: These things are symbols of the world.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:26
verses.text: "And after the second veil" (There was then not one veil [only], but there was a veil without also) "the tabernacle, which is called holy of holies".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:27
verses.text: Observe how everywhere he calls it a tabernacle in regard of [God's] encamping there.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:28
verses.text: "Which had" (he says) "a golden Censer, and the ark of the Covenant overlaid round about with gold: wherein was the golden pot that held the manna, and Aaron's rod that budded, and the tables of the covenant".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:29
verses.text: All these things were venerable and conspicuous memorials of the Jewish obstinacy; "and the tables of the covenant" (for they brake them) "And the manna" (for they murmured; and therefore handing on the memory thereof to posterity, He commanded it to be laid up in a golden pot).

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:30
verses.text: "And Aaron's rod that budded.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:31
verses.text: And over it, the Cherubim of glory".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:32
verses.text: What is "the Cherubim of glory"? He either means "the glorious," or those which are under God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:33
verses.text: "Shadowing the mercy-seat".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:34
verses.text: But in another point of view also he extols these things in his discourse, in order to show that those which come after them are greater.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:35
verses.text: "Of which" (he says) "we cannot now speak particularly".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:36
verses.text: In these words he hints that these were not merely what was seen, but were a sort of enigmas.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:37
verses.text: "Of which" (he says) "we cannot now speak particularly," perhaps because they needed a long discourse.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:38
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:39
verses.text: "Now when these things were thus ordained, the priests went always into the first tabernacle accomplishing the service [of God]".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:40
verses.text: That is, these things indeed were [there], but the Jews did not enjoy them: they saw them not.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:41
verses.text: So that they were no more theirs than [ours] for whom they prophesied.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:42
verses.text: ( Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:43
verses.text: ) "But into the second the High Priest went alone once every year, not without blood, which he offered for himself, and for the errors of the people".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:44
verses.text: Thou seest that the types were already laid down beforehand? for, lest they should say, "how is there [but] one sacrifice?" he shows that this was so from the beginning, since at least the more holy and the awful [sacrifice] was [but] one.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:45
verses.text: And how did the High Priest offer once for all? Thus were they wont [to do] from the beginning, for then also (he says) "the High Priest" offered "once for all".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:46
verses.text: And well said he, "not without blood".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:47
verses.text: (Not indeed without blood, yet not this blood, for the business was not so great.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:48
verses.text: ) He signifies that there shall be a sacrifice, not consumed by fire, but rather distinguished by blood.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:49
verses.text: For inasmuch as he called the Cross a sacrifice, though it had neither fire, nor logs, nor was offered many times, but had been offered in blood once for all; he shows that the ancient sacrifice also was of this kind, was offered "once for all" in blood.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:50
verses.text: "Which he offers for himself;" again, "for himself; and for the errors of the people".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:51
verses.text: He said not "sins"; but "errors," that they might not be high-minded.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:52
verses.text: For even if thou hast not sinned intentionally, yet unintentionally thou hast erred, and from this no man is pure.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:53
verses.text: And everywhere [he adds] the "for himself," showing that Christ is much greater.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:54
verses.text: For if He be separated from our sins, how did He "offer for Himself"? Why then saidst thou these things (one says)? Because this is [a mark] of One that is superior.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:55
verses.text: Thus far there is no speculation.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:56
verses.text: But from this point he philosophizes and says, ( ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:57
verses.text: ) "The Holy Ghost this signifying, that the way into the Holiest of all was not yet made manifest, while as the first tabernacle was yet standing".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:58
verses.text: For this cause (he says) have these things been thus "ordained," that we might learn that "the Holy of Holies," that is, Heaven, is as yet inaccessible.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:59
verses.text: Let us not then think (he says) that because we do not enter them, they have no existence: inasmuch as neither did we enter the Most Holy [place].

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:60
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:61
verses.text: "Which" (he says) "was established as a figure for the time then present".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:62
verses.text: What does he mean by "the time present"? That before the coming of Christ: For after the coming of Christ, it is no longer a time present: For how [could it be], having arrived, and being ended?  There is too something else which he indicates, when he says this, "which [was] a figure for the time then present," that is, became the Type.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:63
verses.text: "In which were offered both gifts and sacrifices, that could not make him that did the service perfect, as pertaining to the conscience".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:64
verses.text: Thou seest now what is [the meaning of] "The Law made nothing perfect," ( Heb.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:65
verses.text: vii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:66
verses.text: ,) and "If that first [covenant] had been faultless".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:67
verses.text: ( Heb.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:68
verses.text: viii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:69
verses.text: ) How? "As pertaining to the conscience".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:70
verses.text: For the sacrifices did not put away the defilement from the soul, but still were concerned with the body: "after the law of a carnal commandment".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:71
verses.text: ( Heb.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:72
verses.text: vii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:73
verses.text: ) For certainly they could not put away adultery, nor murder, nor sacrilege.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:74
verses.text: Seest thou? Thou hast eaten this, Thou hast not eaten that, which are matters of indifference.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:75
verses.text: ["Which stood] only in meats and drinks, and divers washings".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:76
verses.text: "Thou hast drunk this," he says: and yet nothing has been ordained concerning drink, but he said this, treating them as trifles.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:77
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:78
verses.text: "And [in] divers washings, and carnal ordinances imposed on them until the time of reformation".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:79
verses.text: For this is the righteousness of the flesh.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:80
verses.text: Here he depreciates the sacrifices, showing that they had no efficacy, and that they existed "till the time of reformation," that is, they waited for the time that reformeth all things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:81
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:82
verses.text: "But Christ being come an High Priest of good things that are come by a greater and more perfect tabernacle not made with hands".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:83
verses.text: Here he means the flesh.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:84
verses.text: And well did he say, "greater and more perfect," since God The Word and all the power of The Spirit dwells therein; "For God giveth not the Spirit by measure [unto Him]".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:85
verses.text: ( John iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:86
verses.text: ) And "more perfect," as being both unblamable, and setting right greater things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:87
verses.text: "That is, not of this creation".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:88
verses.text: See how [it was] "greater".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:89
verses.text: For it would not have been "of the Spirit" ( Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:90
verses.text: i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:91
verses.text: ), if man had constructed it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:92
verses.text: Nor yet is it "of this creation"; that is, not of these created things, but spiritual, of the Holy Ghost.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:93
verses.text: Seest thou how he calls the body tabernacle and veil and heaven.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:94
verses.text: "By a greater and more perfect tabernacle.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:95
verses.text: Through the veil, that is, His flesh".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:96
verses.text: ( Heb.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:97
verses.text: x.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:98
verses.text: ) And again, "into that within the veil".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:99
verses.text: ( Heb.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:100
verses.text: vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:101
verses.text: ) And again, "entering into the Holy of Holies, to appear before the face of God".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:102
verses.text: ( Heb.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:103
verses.text: ix.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:104
verses.text: ) Why then doth he this? According as one thing or a different one is signified.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:105
verses.text: I mean for instance, the Heaven is a veil, for as a veil it walls off the Holy of Holies; the flesh [is a veil] hiding the Godhead; and the tabernacle likewise holding the Godhead.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:106
verses.text: Again, Heaven [is] a tabernacle: for the Priest is there within.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:107
verses.text: "But Christ" (he says) "being come an High Priest": he did not say, "become," but "being come," that is, having come for this very purpose, not having been successor to another.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:108
verses.text: He did not come first and then become [High Priest], but came and became at the same time.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:109
verses.text: And he did not say "being come an High Priest" of things which are sacrificed, but "of good things that are come," as if his discourse had not power to put the whole before us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:110
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:111
verses.text: "Neither by the blood," he says, "of goats and calves" (All things are changed) "but by His own Blood" (he says) "He entered in once for all into the Holy Place".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:112
verses.text: See thus he called Heaven.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:113
verses.text: "Once for all" (he says) "He entered into the Holy Place, having obtained eternal redemption".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:114
verses.text: And this [expression] "having obtained," was [expressive] of things very difficult, and that are beyond expectation, how by one entering in, He "obtained everlasting redemption".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:115
verses.text: Next [comes] that which is calculated to persuade.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:116
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:118
verses.text: "For if the blood of bulls and of goats, and the ashes of an heifer sprinkling the unclean, sanctifieth to the purifying of the flesh; how much more shall the Blood of Christ, who through the Holy Spirit offered Himself without spot to God, purge your conscience from dead works, to serve the living God".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:119
verses.text: For (he says) if "the blood of bulls" is able to purify the flesh, much rather shall the Blood of Christ wipe away the defilement of the soul.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:120
verses.text: For that thou mayest not suppose when thou hearest [the word] "sanctifieth," that it is some great thing, he marks out and shows the difference between each of these purifyings, and how the one of them is high and the other low.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:121
verses.text: And says it is [so] with good reason, since that is "the blood of bulls," and this "the Blood of Christ".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:122
verses.text: Nor was he content with the name, but he sets forth also the manner of the offering.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:123
