verses.text: "Who" (he says) "through the Holy Spirit offered Himself without spot to God," that is, the victim was without blemish, pure from sins.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:124
verses.text: For this is [the meaning of] "through the Holy Spirit," not through fire, nor through any other things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:125
verses.text: "Shall purge your conscience" (he says) "from dead works".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:126
verses.text: And well said he "from dead works"; if any man touched a dead body, he was polluted; and here, if any man touch a "dead work," he is defiled through his conscience.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:127
verses.text: "To serve" (he says) "the Living and true God".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:128
verses.text: Here he declares that it is not [possible] while one has "dead works to serve the Living and true God," for they are both dead and false; and with good reason [he says this].

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:129
verses.text: Let no man then enter in here with "dead works".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:130
verses.text: For if it was not fit that one should enter in who had touched a dead body, much more one that hath "dead works": for this is the most grievous pollution.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:131
verses.text: And "dead works" are, all which have not life, which breathe forth an ill odor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:132
verses.text: For as a dead body is useful to none of the senses, but is even annoying to those who come near it, so sin also at once strikes the reasoning faculty, and does not allow the understanding itself to be calm, but disturbs and troubles it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:133
verses.text: And it is said too that a plague at its very commencement corrupts the living bodies; such also is sin.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:134
verses.text: It differs in nothing from a plague, not [indeed] corrupting the air first, and then the bodies, but darting at once into the soul.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:135
verses.text: Seest thou not how persons affected with the plague, are inflamed: how they writhe about, how they are full of an ill scent, how disfigured are their countenances: how wholly unclean they are? Such are they also that sin, though they see it not.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:136
verses.text: For, tell me, is not he who is possessed by the desire of riches or carnal lust, worse than any one that is in a fever? Is he not more unclean than all these, when he does and submits to all shameless things?   For what is baser than a man who is in love with money? Whatever things women that are harlots or on the stage refuse not to do neither does he [refuse].

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:137
verses.text: Rather it is likely that they would refuse [to do] a thing, rather than he.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:138
verses.text: He even submits to do things fit for slaves, flattering those whom he ought not; again he is overbearing where he ought not to be, being inconsistent in every respect.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:139
verses.text: He will sit by flattering wicked people, and oftentimes depraved old men, that are of much poorer and meaner condition than himself; and will be insolent and overbearing to others that are good and in all respects virtuous.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:140
verses.text: Thou seest in both respects the baseness, the shamelessness: he is both humble beyond measure, and boastful.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:141
verses.text: Harlots however stand in front of their house, and the charge against them is that they sell their body for money: yet, one may say, poverty and hunger compel them (although at the most this is no sufficient excuse: for they might gain a livelihood by work).

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:142
verses.text: But the covetous man stands, not before his house, but before the midst of the city, making over to the devil not his body but his soul; so that he [the devil] is in his company, and goes in unto him, as verily to a harlot: and having satisfied all his lusts departs; and all the city sees it, not two or three persons only.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:143
verses.text: And this again is the peculiarity of harlots, that they are his who gives the gold.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:144
verses.text: Even if he be a slave or a gladiator, or any person whatever, yet if he offers their hire, they receive him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:145
verses.text: But the free, even should they be more noble than all, they do not accept without the money.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:146
verses.text: These men also do the same.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:147
verses.text: They turn away right thoughts when they bring no money; but they associate with the abominable, and actually with those that fight with wild beasts, for the sake of the gold, and associate with them shamelessly and destroy the beauty of the soul.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:148
verses.text: For as those women are naturally of odious appearance and black, and awkward and gross, and formless and ill-shaped, and in all respects disgusting, such do the souls of these men become, not able to conceal their deformity by their outward paintings.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:149
verses.text: For when the ill look is extreme, whatever they may devise, they cannot succeed in their feigning.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:150
verses.text: For that shamelessness makes harlots, hear the prophet saying, "Thou wert shameless towards all; thou hadst a harlot's countenance".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:151
verses.text: ( Jer.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:152
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:153
verses.text: ) This may be said to the covetous also: "Thou wert shameless towards all," not towards these or those, but "towards all".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:154
verses.text: How? Such an one respects neither father, nor son, nor wife, nor friend, nor brother, nor benefactor, nor absolutely any one.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:155
verses.text: And why do I say friend, and brother, and father? He respects not God Himself, but all [we believe] seems to him a fable; and he laughs, intoxicated by his great lust, and not even admitting into his ears any of the things which might profit him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:156
verses.text: But O! their absurdity! and then what things they say! "Woe to thee, O Mammon, and to him that has thee not".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:157
verses.text: At this I am torn to pieces with indignation: for woe to those who say these things, though they say them in jest.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:158
verses.text: For tell me, has not God uttered such a threat as this, saying, "Ye cannot serve two masters"? ( Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:159
verses.text: vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:160
verses.text: ) And dost thou set at nought the threat? Does not Paul say that it is Idolatry, and does he not call "the covetous man an Idolater"? ( Eph.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:161
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:162
verses.text: )   And thou standest laughing, raising a laugh after the manner of women of the world who are on the stage.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:163
verses.text: This has overthrown, this has cast down everything.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:164
verses.text: Our affairs, both our business and our politeness, are turned into laughing; there is nothing steady, nothing grave.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:165
verses.text: I say not these things to men of the world only; but I know those whom I am hinting at.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:166
verses.text: For the Church has been filled with laughter.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:167
verses.text: Whatever clever thing one may say, immediately there is laughter among those present: and the marvelous thing is that many do not leave off laughing even during the very time of the prayer.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:168
verses.text: Everywhere the devil leads the dance, he has entered into all, is master of all.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:169
verses.text: Christ is dishonored, is thrust aside; the Church is made no account of.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:170
verses.text: Do ye not hear Paul saying, Let "filthiness and foolish talking and jesting" ( Eph.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:171
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:172
verses.text: ) be put away from you? He places "jesting" along with "filthiness," and dost thou laugh? What is "foolish talking"? that which has nothing profitable.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:173
verses.text: And dost thou, a solitary, laugh at all and relax thy countenance? thou that art crucified? thou that art a mourner? tell me, dost thou laugh? Where dost thou hear of Christ doing this? Nowhere: but that He was sad indeed oftentimes.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:174
verses.text: For even when He looked on Jerusalem, He wept; and when He thought on the Traitor He was troubled; and when He was about to raise Lazarus, He wept; and dost thou laugh? If he who grieves not over the sins of others deserves to be accused, of what consideration will he be worthy, who is without sorrow for his own sins, yea laughs at them? This is the season of grief and tribulation, of bruising and bringing matter [the body], of conflicts and sweatings, and dost thou laugh? Dost not thou see how Sarah was rebuked? dost thou not hear Christ saying, "Woe to them that laugh, for they shall weep"? ( Luke vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:175
verses.text: ) Thou chantest these things every day, for, tell me, what dost thou say? "I have laughed?" By no means; but what? "I labored in my groaning".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:176
verses.text: ( Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:177
verses.text: vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:178
verses.text: )  But perchance there are some persons so dissolute and silly as even during this very rebuke to laugh, because forsooth we thus discourse about laughter.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:179
verses.text: For indeed such is their derangement, such their madness, that it does not feel the rebuke.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:180
verses.text: The Priest of God is Standing, offering up the prayer of all: and art thou laughing, having no fears? And while he is offering up the prayers in trembling for thee, dost thou despise all? Hearest thou not the Scripture saying, "Woe, ye despisers!" (cf.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:181
verses.text: Acts xiii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:182
verses.text: from Hab.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:183
verses.text: i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:184
verses.text: ); dost thou not shudder? dost thou not humble thyself? Even when thou enterest a royal palace, thou orderest thyself in dress, and look, and gait, and all other respects: and here where there is the true Palace, and things like those of heaven, dost thou laugh? Thou indeed, I know, seest [them] not, but hear thou that there are angels present everywhere, and in the house of God especially they stand by the King, and all is filled by those incorporeal Powers.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:185
verses.text: This my discourse is addressed to women also, who in the presence of their husbands indeed do not dare readily to do this, and even if they do it, it is not at all times, but during a season of relaxation, but here they do it always.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:186
verses.text: Tell me, O woman, dost thou cover thine head and laugh, sitting in the Church? Didst thou come in here to make confession of sins, to fall down before God, to entreat and to supplicate for the transgressions thou hast wretchedly committed, and dost thou do this with laughter? How then wilt thou be able to propitiate Him?   But (one says) what harm is there in laughter? There is no harm in laughter; the harm is when it is beyond measure, and out of season.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:187
verses.text: Laughter has been implanted in us, that when we see our friends after a long time, we may laugh; that when we see any persons downcast and fearful, we may relieve them by our smile; not that we should burst out violently and be always laughing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:188
verses.text: Laughter has been implanted in our soul, that the soul may sometimes be refreshed, not that it may be quite relaxed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:189
verses.text: For carnal desire also is implanted in us, and yet it is not by any means necessary that because it is implanted in us, therefore we should use it, or use it immoderately: but we should hold it in subjection, and not say, Because it is implanted in us, let us use it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:190
verses.text: Serve God with tears, that thou mayest be able to wash away your sins.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:191
verses.text: I know that many mock us, saying, "Tears directly".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:192
verses.text: Therefore it is a time for tears.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:193
verses.text: I know also that they are disgusted, who say, "Let us eat and drink, for to-morrow we die".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:194
verses.text: (  Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:195
verses.text: xv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:196
verses.text: ) "Vanity of vanities, all is vanity".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:197
verses.text: ( Eccles.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:198
verses.text: i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:199
verses.text: ) It is not I that say it, but he who had had the experience of all things saith thus: "I builded for me houses, I planted vineyards, I made me pools of water, [I had] men servants and women servants".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:200
verses.text: ( Eccles.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:201
verses.text: ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:203
verses.text: ) And what then after all these things? "Vanity of vanities, all is vanity".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:204
verses.text: ( Eccles.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:205
verses.text: xii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:206
verses.text: )  Let us mourn therefore, beloved, let us mourn in order that we may laugh indeed, that we may rejoice indeed in the time of unmixed joy.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:207
verses.text: For with this joy [here] grief is altogether mingled: and never is it possible to find it pure.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:208
verses.text: But that is simple and undeceiving joy: it has nothing treacherous, nor any admixture.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:209
verses.text: In that joy let us delight ourselves; that let us pursue after.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:210
verses.text: And it is not possible to obtain this in any other way, than by choosing here not what is pleasant, but what is profitable, and being willing to be afflicted a little, and bearing all things with thanksgiving.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 16:211
verses.text: For thus we shall be able to attain even to the Kingdom of Heaven, of which may we all be counted worthy, in Christ Jesus our Lord, with whom to the Father be glory, together with the Holy Ghost, now and for ever and world without end, Amen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:1
verses.text: Homily XVI.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:2
verses.text: Hebrews ix.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:3
verses.text: –  "And for this cause He is the Mediator of the New Testament, that by means of death for the redemption of the transgressions that were under the first Testament, they which are called might receive the promise of an eternal inheritance.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:4
verses.text: For where a testament is, there must also of necessity be the death of the testator.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:5
verses.text: For a testament is of force after men are dead, otherwise it is of no strength at all while the testator liveth.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:6
verses.text: Whereupon neither the first [testament] was dedicated without blood".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:7
verses.text: It was probable that many of those who were more weakly would especially distrust the promises of Christ because He had died.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:8
verses.text: Paul accordingly out of a superabundance introduced this illustration, deriving it from common custom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:9
verses.text: Of what kind is it? He says, "indeed, on this very account we ought to be of good courage".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:10
verses.text: On what account? Because testaments are established and obtain their force when those who have made them are not living, but dead.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:11
verses.text: "And for this cause," he says, "He is the Mediator of the New Testament".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:12
verses.text: A Testament is made towards the last day, [the day] of death.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:13
verses.text: And a testament is of this character: It makes some heirs, and some disinherited.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:14
verses.text: So in this case also: "I will that where I am," Christ says, "they also may be".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:15
verses.text: ( John xvii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:16
verses.text: ) And again of the disinherited, hear Him saying, "I pray not for" all, "but for them that believe on Me through their word".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:17
verses.text: ( John xvii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:18
verses.text: ) Again, a testament has relation both to the testator, and to the legatees; so that they have some things to receive, and some to do.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:19
verses.text: So also in this case.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:20
verses.text: For after having made promises innumerable, He demands also something from them, saying, "a new commandment I give unto you".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:21
verses.text: ( John xiii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:22
verses.text: ) Again, a testament ought to have witnesses.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:23
verses.text: Hear Him again saying, "I am one that bear witness of Myself, and He that sent Me beareth witness of Me".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:24
verses.text: ( John viii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:25
verses.text: ) And again, "He shall testify of Me" ( John xv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:26
verses.text: ), speaking of the Comforter.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:27
verses.text: The twelve Apostles too He sent, saying, "Bear ye witness before God".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:28
verses.text: "And for this cause" (he says) "He is the Mediator of the New Testament".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:29
verses.text: What is a "Mediator"? A mediator is not lord of the thing of which he is mediator, but the thing belongs to one person, and the mediator is another: as for instance, the mediator of a marriage is not the bridegroom, but one who aids him who is about to be married.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:30
verses.text: So then also here: The Son became Mediator between the Father and us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:31
verses.text: The Father willed not to leave us this inheritance, but was wroth against us, and was displeased [with us] as being estranged [from Him]; He accordingly became Mediator between us and Him, and prevailed with Him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:32
verses.text: And what then? How did He become Mediator? He brought words from [Him] and brought [them to us], conveying over what came from the Father to us, and adding His own death thereto.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:33
verses.text: We had offended: we ought to have died: He died for us and made us worthy of the Testament.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:34
verses.text: By this is the Testament secure, in that henceforward it is not made for the unworthy.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:35
verses.text: At the beginning indeed, He made His dispositions as a father for sons; but after we had become unworthy, there was no longer need of a testament, but of punishment.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:36
verses.text: Why then (he would say) dost thou think upon the law? For it placed us in a condition of so great sin, that we could never have been saved, if our Lord had not died for us; the law would not have had power, for it is weak.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:37
verses.text: And he established this no longer from common custom only, but also from what happened under the old [Testament]: which especially influenced them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:38
verses.text: There was no one who died there: how then could that [Testament] be firm? In the same way (he says).

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:39
verses.text: How? For blood was there also, as there is blood here.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:40
verses.text: And if it was not the blood of the Christ, do not be surprised; for it was a type.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:41
verses.text: "Whereupon," he says, "neither was the first [Testament] dedicated without blood".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:42
verses.text: What is "was dedicated"? was confirmed, was ratified.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:43
verses.text: The word "whereupon" means "for this cause".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:44
verses.text: It was needful that the symbol of the Testament should be also that of death.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:45
verses.text: For why (tell me) is the book of the testament sprinkled? ( Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:46
verses.text: ,  ) "For" (he says) "when Moses had spoken every precept to all the people according to the law, he took the blood of calves, with water, and scarlet wool, and hyssop, and sprinkled both the book itself and all the people, saying, This is the blood of the testament, which God hath enjoined unto you".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:47
verses.text: Tell me then why is the book of the testament sprinkled, and also the people, except on account of the precious blood, figured from the first? Why "with hyssop"? It is close and retentive.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:48
verses.text: And why the "water"? It shows forth also the cleansing by water.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:49
verses.text: And why the "wool"? this also [was used], that the blood might be retained.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:50
verses.text: In this place blood and water show forth the same thing, for baptism is His passion.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:51
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:53
verses.text: "Moreover he sprinkled with blood both the tabernacle and all the vessels of the ministry.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:54
verses.text: And almost all things are by the law purged with blood, and without shedding of blood is no remission".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:55
verses.text: Why the "almost"? why did he qualify it? Because those [ordinances] were not a perfect purification, nor a perfect remission, but half-complete and in a very small degree.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:56
verses.text: But in this case He says, "This is the blood of the New Testament, which is shed for you, for the remission of sins".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:57
verses.text: ( Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:58
verses.text: xxvi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:59
verses.text: )  Where then is "the book"? He purified their minds.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:60
verses.text: They themselves then were the books of the New Testament.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:61
verses.text: But where are "the vessels of the ministry"? They are themselves.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:62
verses.text: And where is "the tabernacle"? Again, they are; for "I will dwell in them," He says, "and walk in them".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:63
verses.text: (  Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:64
verses.text: vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:65
verses.text: )   But they were not sprinkled with "scarlet wool," nor yet "with hyssop".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:66
verses.text: Why was this? Because the cleansing was not bodily but spiritual, and the blood was spiritual.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:67
verses.text: How? It flowed not from the body of irrational animals, but from the Body prepared by the Spirit.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:68
verses.text: With this blood not Moses but Christ sprinkled us, through the word which was spoken; "This is the blood of the New Testament, for the remission of sins".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:69
verses.text: This word, instead of hyssop, having been dipped in the blood, sprinkles all.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:70
verses.text: And there indeed the body was cleansed outwardly, for the purifying was bodily; but here, since the purifying is spiritual, it entereth into the soul, and cleanseth it, not being simply sprinkled over, but gushing forth in our souls.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:71
verses.text: The initiated understand what is said.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:72
verses.text: And in their case indeed one sprinkled just the surface; but he who was sprinkled washed it off again; for surely he did not go about continually stained with blood.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:73
verses.text: But in the case of the soul it is not so, but the blood is mixed with its very substance, making it vigorous and pure, and leading it to the very unapproachable beauty.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:74
verses.text: Henceforward then he shows that His death is the cause not only of confirmation, but also of purification.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:75
verses.text: For inasmuch as death was thought to be an odious thing, and especially that of the cross, he says that it purified, even a precious purification, and in regard to greater things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:76
verses.text: Therefore the sacrifices preceded, because of this blood.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:77
verses.text: Therefore the lambs; everything was for this cause.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:78
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:79
verses.text: "It was therefore necessary that the Patterns" (he says) "of the things in the heavens should be purified with these, but the heavenly things themselves with better sacrifices than these".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:80
verses.text: And how are they "patterns of things in the heavens"? And what does he mean now by "the things in the heavens"? Is it Heaven? Or is it the Angels? None of these, but what is ours.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:81
verses.text: It follows then that our things are in Heaven, and heavenly things are ours, even though they be accomplished on earth; since although angels are on earth, yet they are called Heavenly.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:82
verses.text: And the Cherubim appeared on earth, but yet are heavenly.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:83
verses.text: And why do I say "appeared"? nay rather they dwell on earth, as indeed in Paradise: but this is nothing; for they are heavenly.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:84
verses.text: And, "Our conversation is in Heaven" ( Philip.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:85
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:86
verses.text: ), and yet we live here.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:87
verses.text: "But these are the heavenly things," that is, the philosophy which exists amongst us; those who have been called thereto.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:88
verses.text: "With better sacrifices than these".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:89
verses.text: What is "better" is better than something [else] that is good.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:90
verses.text: Therefore "the patterns also of things in the heavens" have become good; for not even the patterns were evil: else the things whereof they are patterns would also have been evil.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:91
verses.text: If then we are heavenly, and have obtained such a sacrifice, let us fear.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:92
verses.text: Let us no longer continue on the earth; for even now it is possible for him that wishes it, not to be on the earth.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:93
verses.text: For to be and not to be on the earth is the effect of moral disposition and choice.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:94
verses.text: For instance; God is said to be in Heaven.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:95
verses.text: Wherefore? not because He is confined by space, far from it, nor as having left the earth destitute of His presence, but by His relation to and intimacy with the Angels.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:96
verses.text: If then we also are near to God, we are in Heaven.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:97
verses.text: For what care I about Heaven when I see the Lord of Heaven, when I myself am become a Heaven? "For," He says, "We will come," I and the Father, "and will make our abode with him".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:98
verses.text: ( John xiv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:99
verses.text: )  Let us then make our soul a Heaven.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:100
verses.text: The heaven is naturally bright; for not even in a storm does it become black, for it does not itself change its appearance, but the clouds run together and cover it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:101
verses.text: Heaven has the Sun; we also have the Sun of Righteousness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:102
verses.text: I said it is possible to become a Heaven; and I see that it is possible to become even better than Heaven.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:103
verses.text: How? when we have the Lord of the Sun.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:104
verses.text: Heaven is throughout pure and without spot; it changes not either in a storm or in the night.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:105
verses.text: Neither let us then be so influenced either by tribulations or by "the wiles of the devil" ( Eph.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:106
verses.text: vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:107
verses.text: ), but let us continue spotless and pure.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:108
verses.text: Heaven is high and far from the earth.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:109
verses.text: Let us also effect this [as regards ourselves]; let us withdraw ourselves from the earth, and exalt ourselves to that height, and remove ourselves far from the earth.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:110
verses.text: Heaven is higher than the rains and the storms, and is reached by none of them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:111
verses.text: This we also can do, if we will.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:112
verses.text: It does appear to be, but is not really so affected.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:113
verses.text: Neither then let us be affected, even if we appear to be so.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:114
verses.text: For as in a storm, most men know not the beauty of [heaven,] but think that it is changed, while philosophers know that it is not affected at all, so with regard to ourselves also in afflictions; most men think that we are changed with them, and that affliction has touched our very heart, but philosophers know that it has not touched us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:115
verses.text: Let us then become heaven, let us mount up to that height, and so we shall see men differing nothing from ants.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:116
verses.text: I do not speak of the poor only, nor the many, but even if there be a general there, even if the emperor be there, we shall not distinguish the emperor, nor the private person.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:117
verses.text: We shall not know what is gold, or what is silver, or what is silken or purple raiment: we shall see all things as if they were flies, if we be seated in that height.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:118
verses.text: There is no tumult there, no disturbance, nor clamor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:119
verses.text: And how is it possible (one says) for him who walks on the earth, to be raised up to that height? I do not tell it thee in words, but I show thee in fact those who have attained to that height.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:120
verses.text: Who then are they?  I mean such as Paul, who being on earth, spent their lives in heaven.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:121
verses.text: But why do I say "in heaven"? They were higher than the Heaven, yea than the other heaven, and mounted up to God Himself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:122
verses.text: For, "who" (he says) "shall separate us from the love of Christ? shall tribulation, or distress, or persecution, or famine, or nakedness, or peril, or sword?" ( Rom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:123
verses.text: viii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:124
verses.text: ) And again, "while we look not at the things which are seen, but at the things which are not seen".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:125
verses.text: (  Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:126
verses.text: iv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:127
verses.text: ) Seest thou that he did not even see the things here? But to show thee that he was higher than the heavens, hear him saying himself, "For I am persuaded that neither death, or life, nor things present, nor things to come, nor height, nor depth, nor any other creature, shall be able to separate us from the love of Christ".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:128
verses.text: ( Rom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:129
verses.text: viii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:131
verses.text: )  Seest thou how thought, hurrying past all things, made him higher not than this creation only, not than these heavens, but even [than any other also] if any other there were? Hast thou seen the elevation of his mind? Hast thou seen what the tent-maker became, because he had the will, he who had spent his whole life in the market-place?   For there is no hindrance, no not any, but that we may rise above all men, if we have the will.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:132
verses.text: For if we are so successful in arts that are beyond the reach of the generality, much more in that which does not require so great labor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:133
verses.text: For, tell me, what is more difficult than to walk along a tight rope, as if on level ground, and when walking on high to dress and undress, as if sitting on a couch? Does not the performance seem to us to be so frightful, that we are not even willing to look at it, but are terrified and tremble at the very sight? And tell me, what is more difficult than to hold a pole upon your face, and when you have put up a child upon it, to perform innumerable feats and delight the spectators? And what is more difficult than to play at ball with swords? And tell me what is harder than thoroughly to search out the bottom of the sea? And one might mention innumerable other arts.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:134
verses.text: But easier than all these, if we have the will, is virtue, and the going up into Heaven.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:135
verses.text: For here it is only necessary to have the will, and all [the rest] follows.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:136
verses.text: For we may not say, I am unable, neither accuse the Creator.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:137
verses.text: For if He made us unable, and then commands, it is an accusation against Himself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:138
verses.text: How is it then (some one says) that many are not able? How is it then that many are not willing? For, if they be willing, all will be able.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:139
verses.text: Therefore also Paul says, "I would that all men were even as I myself" (  Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:140
verses.text: vii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:141
verses.text: ), since he knew that all were able to be as himself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:142
verses.text: For he would not have said this, if it had been impossible.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:143
verses.text: Dost thou wish to become [such]? only lay hold on the beginning.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:144
verses.text: Tell me now, in the case of any arts, when we wish to attain them, are we content with wishing, or do we also engage with the things themselves? As for instance, one wishes to become a pilot; he does not say, I wish, and content himself with that, but he also puts his hand to the work.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:145
verses.text: He wishes to become a merchant; he does not merely say, I wish, but he also puts his hand to the work.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:146
verses.text: Again he wishes to travel abroad, and he does not say, I wish, but he puts his hand to the work.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:147
verses.text: In everything then, wishing alone is not sufficient, but work must also be added; and when thou wishest to mount up to heaven, dost thou merely say, "I wish"?  How then (he says) saidst thou that willing is sufficient? [I meant] willing joined with deeds, the laying hold on the thing itself, the laboring.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:148
verses.text: For we have God working with us, and acting with us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:149
verses.text: Only let us make our choice, only let us apply ourselves to the matter as to work, only let us think earnestly about it, only let us lay it to heart, and all follows.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:150
verses.text: But if we sleep on, and as we snore expect to enter into heaven, how shall we be able to obtain the heavenly inheritance?  Let us therefore be willing, I exhort you, let us be willing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 17:151
verses.text: Why do we carry on all our traffic with reference to the present life, which to-morrow we shall leave? Let us choose then that Virtue which will suffice us through all eternity: wherein we shall be continually, and shall enjoy the everlasting good things; which may we all attain, in Christ Jesus our Lord, with whom to the Father together with the Holy Ghost be glory, power, honor, now and for ever and world without end, Amen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:1
verses.text: Homily XVII.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:2
verses.text: Hebrews ix.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:3
verses.text: –  "For Christ is not entered into the holy places made with hands, which are the figures of the true, but into Heaven itself, now to appear in the presence of God for us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:4
verses.text: Nor yet that He should offer Himself often, as the High Priest entereth into the Holy Place every year with blood of others, for then must He often have suffered since the foundation of the world.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:5
verses.text: But now, once, in the end of the world hath He appeared to put away sin by the sacrifice of Himself".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:6
verses.text: The Jews greatly prided themselves on the temple and the tabernacle.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:7
verses.text: Wherefore they said, "The temple of the Lord, The temple of the Lord, The temple of the Lord".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:8
verses.text: ( Jer.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:9
verses.text: vii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:10
verses.text: ) For nowhere else in the earth was such a temple constructed as this, either for costliness, or beauty, or anything else.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:11
verses.text: For God who ordained it, commanded that it should be made with great magnificence, because they also were more attracted and urged on by material things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:12
verses.text: For it had bricks of gold in the walls; and any one who wishes may learn this in the second [book] of Kings, and in Ezekiel, and how many talents of gold were then expended.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:13
verses.text: But the second [temple] was a more glorious building, both on account of its beauty, and in all other respects.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:14
verses.text: Nor was it reverenced for this reason only, but also from its being One.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:15
verses.text: For they were wont to resort thither from the uttermost parts of the earth, whether from Babylon or from Ethiopia.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:16
verses.text: And Luke shows this when he says in the Acts: "There were dwelling" there "Parthians, and Medes, and Elamites, and the dwellers in Mesopotamia, in Judea and Cappadocia, in Pontus and Asia, Phrygia and Pamphylia, in Egypt and in the parts of Libya about Cyrene".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:17
verses.text: ( Acts ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:19
verses.text: ) They then who lived in all parts of the world assembled there, and the fame of the temple was great.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:20
verses.text: What then does Paul do? What [he did] in regard to the sacrifices, that also he does here.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:21
verses.text: For as there he set against [them] the death of Christ, so here also he sets the whole heaven against the temple.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:22
verses.text: And not by this alone did he point out the difference, but also by adding that The Priest is nearer to God: for he says, "to appear in the presence of God".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:23
verses.text: So that he made the matter august, not only by the [consideration of] heaven, but also by [that of Christ's] entering in [there].

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:24
verses.text: For not merely through symbols as here, but He sees God Himself there.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:25
verses.text: Seest thou that condescension through the lowly things have been said throughout? Why dost thou then any longer wonder that He intercedes there, where He places Himself as a High Priest? "Nor yet, that He should offer Himself often, as the High Priest".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:26
verses.text: "For Christ is not entered into the Holy Places made with hands" (he says) "which are the figures of the True".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:27
verses.text: (These then are true; and those are figures, for the temple too has been so arranged, as the Heaven of Heavens.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:28
verses.text: )  What sayest thou? He who is everywhere present, and who filleth all things, doth not He "appear" unless He enter into Heaven? Thou seest that all these things pertain to the flesh.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:29
verses.text: "To appear," he says, "in the presence of God for us".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:30
verses.text: What is "for us"? He went up (he means) with a sacrifice which had power to propitiate the Father.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:31
verses.text: Wherefore (tell me)? Was He an enemy? The angels were enemies, He was not an enemy.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:32
verses.text: For that the Angels were enemies, hear what he says, "He made peace as to things on earth and things in Heaven".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:33
verses.text: ( Col.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:34
verses.text: i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:35
verses.text: ) So that He also "entered into Heaven, now to appear in the presence of God for us".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:36
verses.text: He "now appeareth," but "for us".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:37
verses.text: "Nor yet that He should offer Himself often, as the High Priest entereth into the Holy place every year with blood of others".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:38
verses.text: Seest Thou how many are the differences? The "often" for the "once"; "the blood of others," for "His own".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:39
verses.text: Great is the distance.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:40
verses.text: He is Himself then both victim and Priest and sacrifice.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:41
verses.text: For if it had not been so, and it had been necessary to offer many sacrifices, He must have been many times crucified.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:42
verses.text: "For then," he says, "He must often have suffered since the foundation of the world".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:43
verses.text: In this place he has also veiled over something.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:44
verses.text: "But now once more in the end of the world".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:45
verses.text: Why "at the end of the world"? After the many sins.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:46
verses.text: If therefore, it had taken place at the beginning, then no one would have believed; and He must not die a second time, all would have been useless.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:47
verses.text: But since later, there were many transgressions, with reason He then appeared: which he expresses in another place also, "Where sin abounded, grace did much more abound.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:48
verses.text: But now once in the end of the world, hath He appeared to put away sin by the sacrifice of Himself".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:49
verses.text: ( Rom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:50
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:51
verses.text: )   ( Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:52
verses.text: ) "And as it is appointed unto men once to die, but after this, the Judgment".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:53
verses.text: He next says also why He died once [only]: because He became a ransom by one death.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:54
verses.text: "It had been appointed" (he says) "unto men once to die".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:55
verses.text: This then is [the meaning of] "He died once," for all.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:56
verses.text: (What then? Do we no longer die that death? We do indeed die, but we do not continue in it: which is not to die at all.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:57
verses.text: For the tyranny of death, and death indeed, is when he who dies is never more allowed to return to life.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:58
verses.text: But when after dying is living, and that a better life, this is not death, but sleep.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:59
verses.text: ) Since then death was to have possession of all, therefore He died that He might deliver us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:60
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:61
verses.text: "So Christ was once offered".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:62
verses.text: By whom offered? evidently by Himself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:63
verses.text: Here he says that He is not Priest only, but Victim also, and what is sacrificed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:64
verses.text: On this account are [the words] "was offered".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:65
verses.text: "Was once offered" (he says) "to bear the sins of many".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:66
verses.text: Why "of many," and not "of all"? Because not all believed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:67
verses.text: For He died indeed for all, that is His part: for that death was a counterbalance against the destruction of all men.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:68
verses.text: But He did not bear the sins of all men, because they were not willing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:69
verses.text: And what is [the meaning of] "He bare the sins"? Just as in the Oblation we bear up our sins and say, "Whether we have sinned voluntarily or involuntarily, do Thou forgive," that is, we make mention of them first, and then ask for their forgiveness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:70
verses.text: So also was it done here.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:71
verses.text: Where has Christ done this? Hear Himself saying, "And for their sakes I sanctify Myself".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:72
verses.text: ( John xvii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:73
verses.text: ) Lo! He bore the sins.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:74
verses.text: He took them from men, and bore them to the Father; not that He might determine anything against them [mankind], but that He might forgive them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:75
verses.text: "Unto them that look for Him shall He appear" (he says) "the second time without sin unto salvation".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:76
verses.text: What is "without sin"? it is as much as to say, He sinneth not.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:77
verses.text: For neither did He die as owing the debt of death, nor yet because of sin.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:78
verses.text: But how "shall He appear"? To punish, you say.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:79
verses.text: He did not however say this, but what was cheering; "shall He appear unto them that look for Him, without sin unto salvation".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:80
verses.text: So that for the time to come they no longer need sacrifices to save themselves, but to do this by deeds.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:81
verses.text: ( Chap.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:82
verses.text: x.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:83
verses.text: ) "For" (he says) "the Law having a shadow of the good things to come, not the very image of the things"; i-e: not the very reality.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:84
verses.text: For as in painting, so long as one [only] draws the outlines, it is a sort of "shadow" but when one has added the bright paints and laid in the colors, then it becomes "an image".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:85
verses.text: Something of this kind also was the Law.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:86
verses.text: "For" (he says) "the Law having a shadow of the good things to come, not the very image of the things," i-e: of the sacrifice, of the remission: "can never by those sacrifices with which they offered continually make the comers thereunto perfect".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:87
verses.text: ( Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:88
verses.text: – ) "For then would they not have ceased to be offered? because that the worshipers once purged, should have had no more conscience of sins? But in those sacrifices there is a remembrance again made of sins every year.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:89
verses.text: For it is not possible that the blood of bulls and of goats should take away sins.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:90
verses.text: Wherefore when He cometh into the world, He saith, Sacrifice and offering Thou wouldest not, but a body hast Thou prepared Me.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:91
verses.text: In burnt-offerings and sacrifices for sin Thou hast had no pleasure.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:92
verses.text: Then said I, Lo! I come, in the volume of the book it is written of Me, to do Thy will, O God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:93
verses.text: Above when He said, Sacrifice, and offering, and burnt-offerings, and [offering] for sin Thou wouldest not, neither hadst pleasure therein, which are offered by the Law, then He said, Lo! I come to do Thy will, O God! He taketh away the first that He may establish the second".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:94
verses.text: Thou seest again the superabundance [of his proofs]? This sacrifice (he says) is one; whereas the others were many: therefore they had no strength, because they were many.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:95
verses.text: For, tell me, what need of many, if one had been sufficient? so that their being many, and offered "continually," proves that they [the worshipers] were never made clean.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:96
verses.text: For as a medicine, when it is powerful and productive of health, and able to remove the disease entirely, effects all after one application; as, therefore, if being once applied it accomplishes the whole, it proves its own strength in being no more applied, and this is its business, to be no more applied; whereas if it is applied continually, this is a plain proof of its not having strength.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:97
verses.text: For it is the excellence of a medicine to be applied once, and not often.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:98
verses.text: So is it in this case also.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:99
verses.text: Why forsooth are they continually cured with the "same sacrifices"? For if they were set free from all their sins, the sacrifices would not have gone on being offered every day.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:100
verses.text: For they had been appointed to be continually offered in behalf of the whole people, both in the evening and in the day.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:101
verses.text: So that there was an arraignment of sins, and not a release from sins; an arraignment of weakness, not an exhibition of strength.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:102
verses.text: For because the first had no strength, another also was offered: and since this effected nothing, again another; so that it was an evidence of sins.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:103
verses.text: The "offering" indeed then, was an evidence of sins, the "continually," an evidence of weakness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:104
verses.text: But with regard to Christ, it was the contrary: He was "once offered".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:105
verses.text: The types therefore contain the figure only, not the power; just as in images, the image has the figure of the man, not the power.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:106
verses.text: So that the reality and the type have [somewhat] in common with one another.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:107
verses.text: For the figure exists equally in both, but not the power.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:108
verses.text: So too also is it in respect of Heaven and of the tabernacle, for the figure was equal: for there was the Holy of Holies, but the power and the other things were not the same.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:109
verses.text: What is, "He hath appeared to put away sin by the sacrifice of Himself"? What is this "putting away"? it is making contemptible.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:110
verses.text: For sin has no longer any boldness; for it is made of no effect in that when it ought to have demanded punishment, it did not demand it: that is, it suffered violence: when it expected to destroy all men, then it was itself destroyed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:111
verses.text: "He hath appeared by the sacrifice of Himself" (he says), that is, "He hath appeared," unto God, and drawn near [unto Him].

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:112
verses.text: For do not [think] because the High Priest was wont to do this oftentimes in the year.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:113
verses.text: … So that henceforward this is done in vain, although it is done; for what need is there of medicines where there are no wounds? On this account He ordained offerings "continually," because of their want of power, and that a remembrance of sins might be made.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:114
verses.text: What then? do not we offer every day? We offer indeed, but making a remembrance of His death, and this [remembrance] is one and not many.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:115
verses.text: How is it one, and not many? Inasmuch as that [Sacrifice] was once for all offered, [and] carried into the Holy of Holies.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:116
verses.text: This is a figure of that [sacrifice] and this remembrance of that.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:117
verses.text: For we always offer the same, not one sheep now and to-morrow another, but always the same thing: so that the sacrifice is one.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:118
verses.text: And yet by this reasoning, since the offering is made in many places, are there many Christs? but Christ is one everywhere, being complete here and complete there also, one Body.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:119
verses.text: As then while offered in many places, He is one body and not many bodies; so also [He is] one sacrifice.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:120
verses.text: He is our High Priest, who offered the sacrifice that cleanses us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:121
verses.text: That we offer now also, which was then offered, which cannot be exhausted.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:122
verses.text: This is done in remembrance of what was then done.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:123
verses.text: For (saith He) "do this in remembrance of Me".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:124
verses.text: ( Luke xxii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:125
verses.text: ) It is not another sacrifice, as the High Priest, but we offer always the same, or rather we perform a remembrance of a Sacrifice.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:126
verses.text: But since I have mentioned this sacrifice, I wish to say a little in reference to you who have been initiated; little in quantity, but possessing great force and profit, for it is not our own, but the words of Divine Spirit.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:127
verses.text: What then is it? Many partake of this sacrifice once in the whole year, others twice; others many times.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:128
verses.text: Our word then is to all; not to those only who are here, but to those also who are settled in the desert.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:129
verses.text: For they partake once in the year, and often indeed at intervals of two years.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:130
verses.text: What then? which shall we approve? those [who receive] once [in the year]? those who [receive] many times? those who [receive] few times? Neither those [who receive] once, nor those [who receive] often, nor those [who receive] seldom, but those [who come] with a pure conscience, from a pure heart, with an irreproachable life.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:131
verses.text: Let such draw near continually; but those who are not such, not even once.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:132
verses.text: Why, you will ask? Because they receive to themselves judgment, yea and condemnation, and punishment, and vengeance.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:133
verses.text: And do not wonder.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:134
verses.text: For as food, nourishing by nature, if received by a person without appetite, ruins and corrupts all [the system], and becomes an occasion of disease, so surely is it also with respect to the awful mysteries.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:135
verses.text: Dost thou feast at a spiritual table, a royal table, and again pollute thy mouth with mire? Dost thou anoint thyself with sweet ointment, and again fill thyself with ill savors?  Tell me, I beseech thee, when after a year thou partakest of the Communion, dost thou think that the Forty Days are sufficient for thee for the purifying of the sins of all that time? And again, when a week has passed, dost thou give thyself up to the former things? Tell me now, if when thou hast been well for forty days after a long illness, thou shouldest again give thyself up to the food which caused the sickness, hast thou not lost thy former labor too? For if natural things are changed, much more those which depend on choice.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:136
verses.text: As for instance, by nature we see, and naturally we have healthy eyes; but oftentimes from a bad habit [of body] our power of vision is injured.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:137
verses.text: If then natural things are changed, much more those of choice.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:138
verses.text: Thou assignest forty days for the health of the soul, or perhaps not even forty, and dost thou expect to propitiate God? Tell me, art thou in sport?  These things I say, not as forbidding you the one and annual coming, but as wishing you to draw near continually.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:139
verses.text: These things have been given to the holy.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:140
verses.text: This the Deacon also proclaims when he calls on the holy; even by this call searching the faults of all.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:141
verses.text: For as in a flock, where many sheep indeed are in good health, but many are full of the scab, it is needful that these should be separated from the healthy; so also in the Church: since some sheep are healthy, and some diseased, by this voice he separates the one from the other, the priest [I mean] going round on all sides by this most awful cry, and calling and drawing on the holy.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:142
verses.text: For it is not possible that a man should know the things of his neighbor, (for "what man," he says, "knoweth the things of a man, save the spirit of man which is in him?"—  Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:143
verses.text: ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:144
verses.text: ): he utters this voice after the whole sacrifice has been completed, that no person should come to the spiritual fountain carelessly and in a chance way.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:145
verses.text: For in the case of the flock also (for nothing prevents us from again using the same example), the sickly ones we shut up within, and keep them in the dark, and give them different food, not permitting them to partake either of pure air, or of simple grass, or of the fountain without [the fold].

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:146
verses.text: In this case then also this voice is instead of fetters.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:147
verses.text: Thou canst not say, 'I did not know, I was not aware that danger attends the matter.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:148
verses.text: ' Nay surely Paul too especially testified this.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:149
verses.text: But wilt thou say, 'I never read it'? This is not an apology, but even an accusation.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:150
verses.text: Dost thou come into the Church every day and yet art ignorant of this?  However, that thou mayest not have even this excuse to offer, for this cause, with a loud voice, with an awful cry, like some herald lifting up his hand on high, standing aloft, conspicuous to all, and after that awful silence crying out aloud, he invites some, and some he forbids, not doing this with his hand, but with his tongue more distinctly than with his hand.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:151
verses.text: For that voice, falling on our ears, just like a hand, thrusts away and casts out some, and introduces and presents others.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:152
verses.text: Tell me then, I beseech [you], in the Olympic games does not the herald stand, calling out with loud and uplifted voice, saying, "Does any one accuse this man? Is he a slave? Is he a thief? Is he one of wicked manners?" And yet, those contests for prizes are not of the soul nor yet of good morals, but of strength and the body.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:153
verses.text: If then where there is exercise of bodies, much examination is made about character, how much rather here, where the soul is alone the combatant.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:154
verses.text: Our herald then even now stands, not holding each person by the head, and drawing him forward, but holding all together by the head within; he does not set against them other accusers, but themselves against themselves.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:155
verses.text: For he says not, "Does any one accuse this man?" but what? "If any man accuse himself".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:156
verses.text: For when he says, The Holy things for the holy, he means this: "If any is not holy, let him not draw near".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:157
verses.text: He does not simply say, "free from sins," but, "holy".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:158
verses.text: For it is not merely freedom from sins which makes a man holy, but also the presence of the Spirit, and the wealth of good works.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:159
verses.text: I do not merely wish (he says) that you should be delivered from the mire, but also that you should be bright and beautiful.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:160
verses.text: For if the Babylonian King, when he made choice of the youths from the captives, chose out those who were beautiful in form, and of fair countenance: much more is it needful that we, when we stand by the royal table, should be beautiful in form, [I mean] that of the soul, having adornment of gold, our robe pure, our shoes royal, the face of our soul well-formed, the golden ornament put around it, even the girdle of truth.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:161
verses.text: Let such an one as this draw near, and touch the royal cups.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:162
verses.text: But if any man clothed in rags, filthy, squalid, wish to enter in to the royal table, consider how much he will suffer, the forty days not being sufficient to wash away the offenses which have been committed in all the time.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:163
verses.text: For if hell is not sufficient, although it be eternal (for therefore also it is eternal), much more this short time.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:164
verses.text: For we have not shown a strong repentance, but a weak.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:165
verses.text: Eunuchs especially ought to stand by the King: by eunuchs, I mean those who are clear in their mind, having no wrinkle nor spot, lofty in mind, having the eye of the soul gentle and quick-sighted, active and sharp, not sleepy nor supine; full of much freedom, and yet far from impudence and overboldness, wakeful, healthful, neither very gloomy and downcast, nor yet dissolute and soft.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:166
verses.text: This eye we have it in our own power to create, and to make it quicksighted and beautiful.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:167
verses.text: For when we direct it, not to the smoke nor to the dust (for such are all human things), but to the delicate breeze, to the light air, to things heavenly and high, and full of much calmness and purity, and of much delight, we shall speedily restore it, and shall invigorate it, as it luxuriates in such contemplation.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:168
verses.text: Hast thou seen covetousness and great wealth? do not thou lift up thine eye thereto.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:169
verses.text: The thing is mire, it is smoke, an evil vapor, darkness, and great distress and suffocating cares.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:170
verses.text: Hast thou seen a man cultivating righteousness, content with his own, and having abundant space for recreation, having anxieties, not fixing his thoughts on things here? Set [thine eye] there, and lift [it] up on high; and thou wilt make it far the most beautiful, and more splendid, feasting it not with the flowers of the earth, but with those of virtue, with temperance, moderation, and all the rest.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:171
verses.text: For nothing so troubles the eye as an evil conscience ("Mine eye," it is said, "was troubled by reason of anger"— Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:172
verses.text: vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:173
verses.text: ); nothing so darkens it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:174
verses.text: Set it free from this injury, and thou wilt make it vigorous and strong, ever nourished with good hopes.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:175
verses.text: And may we all make both it and also the other energies of the soul, such as Christ desires, that being made worthy of the Head who is set over us, we may depart thither where He wishes.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:176
verses.text: For He saith, "I will that where I am, they also may be with Me, that they may behold My glory".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:177
verses.text: ( John xvii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 18:178
verses.text: ) Which may we all enjoy in Christ Jesus our Lord, with whom to the Father together with the Holy Ghost be glory, might, honor, now and for ever and world without end, Amen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:1
verses.text: Homily XVIII.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:2
verses.text: Hebrews x.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:3
verses.text: –  "Above when He said, Sacrifice and offering, and burnt-offerings, and [offering] for sin, Thou wouldest not, neither hadst pleasure [therein], which are offered by the Law, then said He, Lo! I come to do Thy will, O God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:4
verses.text: He taketh away the first, that He may establish the second.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:5
verses.text: By the which will we are sanctified, by the offering of the body of Jesus Christ, once for all.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:6
verses.text: And every Priest standeth daily ministering, and offering oftentimes the same sacrifices, which can never take away sins.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:7
verses.text: But this [man] after He had offered one sacrifice for sins for ever, sat down on the right hand of God, from henceforth expecting till His enemies be made His footstool".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:8
verses.text: In what has gone before he had shown that the sacrifices were unavailing for perfect purification, and were a type, and greatly defective.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:9
verses.text: Since then there was this objection to his argument, If they are types, how is it that, after the truth is come, they have not ceased, nor given place, but are still performed? he here accordingly labors at this very point, showing that they are no longer performed, even as a figure, for God does not accept them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:10
verses.text: And this again he shows not from the New [Testament], but from the prophets, bringing forward from times of old the strongest testimony, that it [the old system] comes to an end, and ceases, and that they do all in vain, "alway resisting the Holy Ghost".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:11
verses.text: ( Acts vii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:12
verses.text: )  And he shows over and above that they cease not now [only], but at the very coming of the Messiah, nay rather, even before His coming: and how it was that Christ did not abolish them at the last, but they were abolished first, and then He came; first they were made to cease, and then He appeared.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:13
verses.text: That they might not say, Even without this sacrifice, and by means of those, we could have been well pleasing unto God, He waited for these sacrifices to be convicted [of weakness], and then He appeared; for (He says) "sacrifice and offering Thou wouldest not".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:14
verses.text: Hereby He took all away; and having spoken generally, He says also particularly, "In burnt-offerings and [sacrifice] for sin Thou hadst no pleasure".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:15
verses.text: But "the offering" was everything except the sacrifice.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:16
verses.text: "Then said I, Lo! I come".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:17
verses.text: Of whom was this spoken? of none other than the Christ.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:18
verses.text: Here he does not blame those who offer, showing that it is not because of their wickednesses that He does not accept them, as He says elsewhere, but because the thing itself has been convicted for the future and shown to have no strength, nor any suitableness to the times.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:19
verses.text: What then has this to do with the "sacrifices" being offered "oftentimes"? Not only from their being "oftentimes" [offered] (he means) is it manifest that they are weak, and that they effected nothing; but also from God's not accepting them, as being unprofitable and useless.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:20
verses.text: And in another place it is said, "If Thou hadst desired sacrifice I would have given it".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:21
verses.text: ( Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:22
verses.text: li.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:23
verses.text: ) Therefore by this also he makes it plain that He does not desire it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:24
verses.text: Therefore sacrifices are not God's will, but the abolition of sacrifices.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:25
verses.text: Wherefore they sacrifice contrary to His will.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:26
verses.text: What is "To do Thy will"? To give up Myself, He means: This is the will of God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:27
verses.text: "By which Will we are sanctified".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:28
verses.text: Or he even means something still further, that the sacrifices do not make men clean, but the Will of God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:29
verses.text: Therefore to offer sacrifice is not the will of God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:30
verses.text: And why dost thou wonder that it is not the will of God now, when it was not His will even from the beginning? For "who," saith He, "hath required this at your hands?" ( Isa.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:31
verses.text: i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:32
verses.text: )  How then did He Himself enjoin it? In condescension.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:33
verses.text: For as Paul says, "I would that all men were even as I myself" (  Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:34
verses.text: vii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:35
verses.text: ), in respect of continence, and again says, "I will that the younger women marry, bear children" (  Tim.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:36
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:37
verses.text: ); and lays down two wills, yet the two are not his own, although he commands; but the one indeed is his own, and therefore he lays it down without reasons; while the other is not his own, though he wishes it, and therefore it is added with a reason.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:38
verses.text: For having previously accused them, because "they had waxed wanton against Christ" (  Tim.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:39
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:40
verses.text: ), he then says, "I will that the younger women marry, bear children".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:41
verses.text: (  Tim.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:42
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:43
verses.text: ) So in this place also it was not His leading will that the sacrifices should be offered.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:44
verses.text: For, as He says, "I wish not the death of the sinner, as that he should turn unto [Me] and live" ( Ezek.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:45
verses.text: xxxiii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:46
verses.text: ): and in another place He says that He not only wished, but even desired this: and yet these are contrary to each other: for intense wishing is desire.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:47
verses.text: How then dost Thou "not wish"? how dost Thou in another place "desire," which is a sign of vehement wishing? So is it in this case also.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:48
verses.text: "By the which will we are sanctified," he says.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:49
verses.text: How sanctified? "by the offering of the Body of Jesus Christ once for all".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:50
verses.text: "And every priest standeth daily ministering and offering oftentimes the same sacrifice".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:51
verses.text: (To stand therefore is a sign of ministering; accordingly to sit, is a sign of being ministered unto.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:52
verses.text: ) "But this [man] after He had offered one sacrifice for sins for ever, sat down on the right hand of God, from henceforth expecting till His enemies be made His footstool".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:53
verses.text: ( Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:54
verses.text: ,  ) "For by one offering He hath perfected forever them that are sanctified.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:55
verses.text: Whereof the Holy Ghost also is a witness to us".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:56
verses.text: He had said that those [sacrifices] are not offered; he reasoned from what is written, [and] from what is not written; moreover also he put forward the prophetic word which says, "sacrifice and offering Thou wouldest not".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:57
verses.text: He had said that He had forgiven their sins.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:58
