verses.text: Again this also He proves from the testimony of what is written, for "the Holy Ghost" (he says) "is a witness to us: for after that He had said," ( ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:59
verses.text: – ) "This is the covenant, that I will make with them, after those days, saith the Lord: I will put My laws into their hearts, and in their minds will I write them, and their sins and iniquities will I remember no more.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:60
verses.text: Now where remission of these is there is no more offering for sin".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:61
verses.text: So then He forgave their sins, when He gave the Covenant, and He gave the Covenant by sacrifice.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:62
verses.text: If therefore He forgave the sins through the one sacrifice, there is no longer need of a second.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:63
verses.text: "He sat down on the right hand of God, from henceforth expecting".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:64
verses.text: Why the delay? "that His enemies be put under His feet.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:65
verses.text: For by one offering He hath perfected for ever them that are sanctified".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:66
verses.text: But perhaps some one might say; Wherefore did He not put them under at once? For the sake of the faithful who should afterwards be brought forth and born.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:67
verses.text: Whence then [does it appear] that they shall be put under? By the saying "He sat down".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:68
verses.text: He called to mind again that testimony which saith, "until I put the enemies under His feet".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:69
verses.text: (See above, i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:70
verses.text: ) But His enemies are the Jews.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:71
verses.text: Then since he had said, "Till His enemies be put under His feet," and they [these enemies] were vehemently urgent, therefore he introduces all his discourse concerning faith after this.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:72
verses.text: But who are the enemies? All unbelievers: the daemons.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:73
verses.text: And intimating the greatness of their subjection, he said not "are subjected," but "are put under His feet".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:74
verses.text: Let us not therefore be of [the number of] His enemies.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:75
verses.text: For not they alone are enemies, the unbelievers and Jews, but those also who are full of unclean living.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:76
verses.text: "For the carnal mind is enmity against God: for it is not subject to the law of God, for neither can it be".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:77
verses.text: ( Rom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:78
verses.text: viii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:79
verses.text: ) What then (you say)? this is not a ground of blame.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:80
verses.text: Nay rather, it is very much a ground of blame.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:81
verses.text: For the wicked man as long as he is wicked, cannot be subject [to God's law]; he can however change and become good.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:82
verses.text: Let us then cast out carnal minds.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:83
verses.text: But what are carnal? Whatever makes the body flourish and do well, but injures the soul: as for instance, wealth, luxury, glory (all these things are of the flesh), carnal love.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:84
verses.text: Let us not then love gain, but ever follow after poverty: for this is a great good.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:85
verses.text: But (you say) it makes one humble and of little account.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:86
verses.text: [True:] for we have need of this, for it benefits us much.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:87
verses.text: "Poverty" (it is said) "humbles a man".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:88
verses.text: ( Prov.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:89
verses.text: x.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:90
verses.text: , LXX.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:91
verses.text: ) And again Christ [says], "Blessed are the poor in spirit".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:92
verses.text: ( Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:93
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:94
verses.text: ) Dost thou then grieve because thou art upon a path leading to virtue? Dost thou not know that this gives us great confidence?  But, one says, "the wisdom of the poor man is despised".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:95
verses.text: ( Eccles.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:96
verses.text: ix.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:97
verses.text: ) And again another says, "Give me neither riches nor poverty" ( Prov.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:98
verses.text: xxx.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:99
verses.text: ), and, "Deliver me from the furnace of poverty".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:100
verses.text: (See Isa.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:101
verses.text: xlviii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:102
verses.text: ) And again, if riches and poverty are from the Lord, how can either poverty or riches be an evil? Why then were these things said? They were said under the Old [Covenant], where there was much account made of wealth, where there was great contempt of poverty, where the one was a curse and the other a blessing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:103
verses.text: But now it is no longer so.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:104
verses.text: But wilt thou hear the praises of poverty? Christ sought after it, and saith, "But the Son of Man hath not where to lay His head".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:105
verses.text: ( Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:106
verses.text: viii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:107
verses.text: ) And again He said to His disciples, "Provide neither gold, nor silver, nor two coats".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:108
verses.text: ( Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:109
verses.text: x.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:111
verses.text: ) And Paul in writing said, "As having nothing and yet possessing all things".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:112
verses.text: (  Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:113
verses.text: vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:114
verses.text: ) And Peter said to him who was lame from his birth, "Silver and gold have I none".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:115
verses.text: ( Acts iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:116
verses.text: ) Yea and under the Old [Covenant] itself, where wealth was held in admiration, who were the admired? Was not Elijah, who had nothing save the sheepskin? Was not Elisha? Was not John?  Let no man then be humiliated on account of his poverty: It is not poverty which humiliates, but wealth, which compels us to have need of many, and forces us to be under obligations to many?  And what could be poorer than Jacob (tell me), who said, "If the Lord give me bread to eat, and raiment to put on"? ( Gen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:117
verses.text: xxviii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:118
verses.text: ) Were Elijah and John then wanting in boldness? Did not the one reprove Ahab, and the other Herod? The latter said, "It is not lawful for thee to have thy brother Philip's wife".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:119
verses.text: ( Mark vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:120
verses.text: ) And Elias said to Ahab with boldness, "It is not I that trouble Israel, but thou and thy father's house".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:121
verses.text: (  Kings xviii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:122
verses.text: ) Thou seest that this especially produces boldness; poverty [I mean]? For while the rich man is a slave, being subject to loss, and in the power of every one wishing to do him hurt, he who has nothing, fears not confiscation, nor fine.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:123
verses.text: So, if poverty had made men wanting in boldness Christ would not have sent His disciples with poverty to a work requiring great boldness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:124
verses.text: For the poor man is very strong, and has nothing wherefrom he may be wronged or evil entreated.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:125
verses.text: But the rich man is assailable on every side: just in the same way as one would easily catch a man who was dragging many long ropes after him, whereas one could not readily lay hold on a naked man.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:126
verses.text: So here also it falls out in the case of the rich man: slaves, gold, lands, affairs innumerable, innumerable cares, difficult circumstances, necessities, make him an easy prey to all.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:127
verses.text: Let no man then henceforth esteem poverty a cause of disgrace.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:128
verses.text: For if virtue be there, all the wealth of the world is neither clay, nor even a mote in comparison of it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:129
verses.text: This then let us follow after, if we would enter into the kingdom of heaven.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:130
verses.text: For, He saith, "Sell that thou hast, and give to the poor, and thou shalt have treasure in Heaven".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:131
verses.text: ( Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:132
verses.text: xix.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:133
verses.text: ) And again, "It is hard for a rich man to enter into the Kingdom of Heaven".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:134
verses.text: ( Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:135
verses.text: xix.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:136
verses.text: ) Dost thou see that even if we have it not, we ought to draw it to us? So great a good is Poverty.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:137
verses.text: For it guides us by the hand, as it were, on the path which leads to Heaven, it is an anointing for the combat, an exercise great and admirable, a tranquil haven.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:138
verses.text: But (you say) I have need of many [things], and am unwilling to receive a favor from any.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:139
verses.text: Nevertheless, even in this respect the rich man is inferior to thee; for thou perhaps askest the favor for thy support, but he shamelessly [asks] for ten thousand things for covetousness' sake.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:140
verses.text: So that it is the rich that are in need of many [persons], yea oftentimes those who are unworthy of them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:141
verses.text: For instance, they often stand in need of those who are in the rank of soldiers, or of slaves: but the poor man has no need even of the Emperor himself, and if he should need him, he is admired because he has brought himself down to this, when he might have been rich.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:142
verses.text: Let no man then accuse poverty as being the cause of innumerable evils, nor let him contradict Christ, who declared it to be the perfection of virtue, saying, "If thou wilt be perfect".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:143
verses.text: ( Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:144
verses.text: xix.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:145
verses.text: ) For this He both uttered in His words, and showed by His acts, and taught by His disciples.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:146
verses.text: Let us therefore follow after poverty, it is the greatest good to the sober-minded.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:147
verses.text: Perhaps some of those who hear me, avoid it as a thing of ill omen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:148
verses.text: I do not doubt it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:149
verses.text: For this disease is great among most men, and such is the tyranny of wealth, that they cannot even as far as words endure the renunciation of it, but avoid it as of ill omen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:150
verses.text: Far be this from the Christian's soul: for nothing is richer than he who chooses poverty of his own accord, and with a ready mind.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:151
verses.text: How? I will tell you, and if you please, I will prove that he who chooses poverty of his own accord is richer even than the king himself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:152
verses.text: For he indeed needs many [things], and is in anxiety, and fears lest the supplies for the army should fail him; but the other has enough of everything, and fears about nothing, and if he fears, it is not about so great matters.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:153
verses.text: Who then, tell me, is the rich man? he who is daily asking, and earnestly laboring to gather much together, and fears lest at any time he should fall short, or he who gathers nothing together, and is in great abundance and hath need of no one? For it is virtue and the fear of God, and not possessions which give confidence.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:154
verses.text: For these even enslave.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:155
verses.text: For it is said, "Gifts and presents blind the eyes of the wise, and like a muzzle on the mouth turn away reproofs".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:156
verses.text: ( Ecclus.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:157
verses.text: xx.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:158
verses.text: )  Consider how the poor man Peter chastised the rich Ananias.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:159
verses.text: Was not the one rich and the other poor? But behold the one speaking with authority and saying, "Tell me whether ye sold the land for so much" ( Acts v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:160
verses.text: ), and the other saying with submission, "Yea, for so much".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:161
verses.text: And who (you say) will grant to me to be as Peter? It is open to thee to be as Peter if thou wilt; cast away what thou hast.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:162
verses.text: "Disperse, give to the poor" ( Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:163
verses.text: cxii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:164
verses.text: ), follow Christ, and thou shalt be such as he.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:165
verses.text: How? he (you say) wrought miracles.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:166
verses.text: Is it this then, tell me, which made Peter an object of admiration, or the boldness which arose from his manner of life? Dost thou not hear Christ saying, "Rejoice not because the devils are subject unto you; If thou wilt be perfect [&c]".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:167
verses.text: ( Luke x.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:168
verses.text: ) Hear what Peter says: "Silver and gold have I none, but what I have I give thee".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:169
verses.text: ( Acts iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:170
verses.text: ) If any man have silver and gold, he hath not those other gifts.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:171
verses.text: Why is it then, you say, that many have neither the one nor the other? Because they are not voluntarily poor: since they who are voluntarily poor have all good things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:172
verses.text: For although they do not raise up the dead nor the lame, yet, what is greater than all; they have confidence towards God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:173
verses.text: They will hear in that day that blessed voice, "Come, ye blessed of My Father," (what can be better than this?) "inherit the kingdom prepared for you from the foundation of the world: for I was an hungered and ye gave Me meat: I was thirsty and ye gave Me drink: I was a stranger and ye took Me in: I was naked and ye clothed Me: I was sick and in prison and ye visited Me.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:174
verses.text: Inherit the kingdom prepared for you from the foundation of the world".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:175
verses.text: ( Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:176
verses.text: xxv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:178
verses.text: ) Let us then flee from covetousness, that we may attain to the kingdom [of Heaven].

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 19:179
verses.text: Let us feed the poor, that we may feed Christ: that we may become fellow-heirs with Him in Christ Jesus our Lord, with whom to the Father together with the Holy Ghost, be glory, power, honor, now and for ever and world without end, Amen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:1
verses.text: Homily XIX.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:2
verses.text: Hebrews x.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:3
verses.text: –  "Having therefore, brethren, boldness to enter into the holiest by the blood of Jesus, by a new and living way which He hath consecrated  for us, through the Veil, that is to say, His flesh, and having an High Priest over the house of God, let us draw near with a true heart, in full assurance of faith, having our hearts sprinkled from an evil conscience, and our bodies washed with pure water.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:4
verses.text: Let us hold fast the profession of our hope without wavering".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:5
verses.text: "Having therefore, brethren, boldness to enter into the holiest by the blood of Jesus, by a new and living way which He hath consecrated for us".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:6
verses.text: Having shown the difference of the High Priest, and of the sacrifices, and of the tabernacle, and of the Covenant, and of the promise, and that the difference is great, since those are temporal, but these eternal, those "near to vanishing away," these permanent, those powerless, these perfect, those figures, these reality, for (he says) "not according to the law of a carnal commandment, but according to the power of an endless life".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:8
verses.text: vii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:9
verses.text: ) And "Thou art a Priest for ever".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:11
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:12
verses.text: ) Behold the continuance of the Priest.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:13
verses.text: And concerning the Covenant, That (he says) is old (for "that which decayeth and waxeth old is ready to vanish away"— c.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:14
verses.text: viii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:15
verses.text: ), but this is new; and has remission of sins, while that [has] nothing of the kind: for (he says) "the Law made nothing perfect".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:17
verses.text: vii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:18
verses.text: ) And again, "sacrifice and offering Thou wouldest not".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:20
verses.text: x.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:21
verses.text: ) That is made with hands, while this is "not made with hands" ( c.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:22
verses.text: ix.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:23
verses.text: ): that "has the blood of goats" ( c.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:24
verses.text: ix.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:25
verses.text: ), this of the Lord ; that has the Priest "standing," this "sitting".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:26
verses.text: Since therefore all those are inferior and these greater, therefore he says, "Having therefore, brethren, boldness".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:27
verses.text: "Boldness": from whence? As sins (he means) produce shame, so the having all things forgiven us, and being made fellow-heirs, and enjoying so great Love, [produces] boldness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:28
verses.text: "For the entrance into the holiest".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:29
verses.text: What does he mean here by "entrance"? Heaven, and the access to spiritual things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:30
verses.text: "Which he hath inaugurated," that is, which He prepared, and which He began; for the beginning of using is thenceforth called the inaugurating; which He prepared (he means) and by which He Himself passed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:31
verses.text: "A new and living way".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:32
verses.text: Here He expresses "the full assurance of hope".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:33
verses.text: "New," he says.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:34
verses.text: He is anxious to show that we have all things greater; since now the gates of Heaven have been opened, which was not done even for Abraham.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:35
verses.text: "A new and living way," he says, for the first was a way of death, leading to Hades, but this of life.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:36
verses.text: And yet he did not say, "of life," but called it "living," (the ordinances, that is,) that which abideth.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:37
verses.text: "Through the veil" (he says) "of His flesh".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:38
verses.text: For this flesh first cut that way, by this He inaugurated it [the way] by which He walked.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:39
verses.text: And with good reason did he call [the flesh] "a veil".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:40
verses.text: For when it was lifted up on high, then the things in heaven appeared.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:41
verses.text: "Let us draw near" (he says) "with a true heart".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:42
verses.text: To what should we "draw near"? To the holy things, the faith, the spiritual service.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:43
verses.text: "With a true heart, in full assurance of faith," since nothing is seen; neither the priest henceforward, nor the sacrifice, nor the altar.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:44
verses.text: And yet neither was that priest visible, but stood within, and they all without, the whole people.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:45
verses.text: But here not only has this taken place, that the priest has entered into the holy of holies, but that we also enter in.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:46
verses.text: Therefore he says, "in full assurance of faith".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:47
verses.text: For it is possible for the doubter to believe in one way, as there are even now many who say, that of some there is a resurrection and of others not.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:48
verses.text: But this is not faith.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:49
verses.text: "In full assurance of faith" (he says); for we ought to believe as concerning things that we see, nay, even much more; for "here" it is possible to be deceived in the things that are seen, but there not: "here" we trust to the senses, but there to the Spirit.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:50
verses.text: "Having our hearts sprinkled from an evil conscience".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:51
verses.text: He shows that not faith only, but a virtuous life also is required, and the consciousness to ourselves of nothing evil.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:52
verses.text: Since the holy of holies does not receive "with full assurance" those who are not thus disposed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:53
verses.text: For they are holy, and the holy of holies; but here no profane person enters.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:54
verses.text: They were sprinkled as to the body, we as to the conscience, so that we may even now be sprinkled over with virtue itself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:55
verses.text: "And having our body washed with pure water".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:56
verses.text: Here he speaks of the Washing, which no longer cleanses the bodies, but the soul.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:57
verses.text: "For He is faithful that promised".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:58
verses.text: "That promised" what? That we are to depart thither and enter into the kingdom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:59
verses.text: Be then in nothing over-curious, nor demand reasonings.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:60
verses.text: Our [religion] needs faith.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:61
verses.text: ( Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:62
verses.text: ,  ) "And" (he says) "let us consider one another to provoke unto love and to good works.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:63
verses.text: Not forsaking the assembling of ourselves together, as the manner of some is, but exhorting one another and so much the more as ye see the day approaching".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:64
verses.text: And again in other places, "The Lord is at hand; be careful for nothing".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:65
verses.text: ( Philip.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:66
verses.text: iv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:68
verses.text: ) "For now is our salvation nearer: Henceforth the time is short".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:69
verses.text: ( Rom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:70
verses.text: xiii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:71
verses.text: )  What is, "not forsaking the assembling of ourselves together"? (  Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:72
verses.text: vii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:73
verses.text: ) He knew that much strength arises from being together and assembling together.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:74
verses.text: "For where two or three" (it is said) "are gathered together in My name, there am I in the midst of them" ( Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:75
verses.text: xviii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:76
verses.text: ); and again, "That they may be One, as we" also are ( John xvii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:77
verses.text: ); and, "They had all one heart and [one] soul".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:78
verses.text: ( Acts iv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:79
verses.text: ) And not this only, but also because love is increased by the gathering [of ourselves] together; and love being increased, of necessity the things of God must follow also.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:80
verses.text: "And earnest prayer" (it is said) was "made by" the people.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:81
verses.text: ( Acts xii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:82
verses.text: ) "As the manner of some is".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:83
verses.text: Here he not only exhorted, but also blamed [them].

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:84
verses.text: "And let us consider one another," he says, "to provoke unto love and to good works".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:85
verses.text: He knew that this also arises from "gathering together".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:86
verses.text: For as "iron sharpeneth iron" ( Prov.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:87
verses.text: xvii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:88
verses.text: ), so also association increases love.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:89
verses.text: For if a stone rubbed against a stone sends forth fire, how much more soul mingled with soul! But not unto emulation (he says) but "unto the sharpening of love".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:90
verses.text: What is "unto the sharpening of love"? Unto the loving and being loved more.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:91
verses.text: "And of good works"; that so they might acquire zeal.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:92
verses.text: For if doing has greater force for instruction than speaking, ye also have in your number many teachers, who effect this by their deeds.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:93
verses.text: What is "let us draw near with a true heart"? That is, without hypocrisy; for "woe be to a fearful heart, and faint hands" ( Ecclus.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:94
verses.text: ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:95
verses.text: ): let there be (he means) no falsehood among us; let us not say one thing and think another; for this is falsehood; neither let us be fainthearted, for this is not [a mark] of a "true heart".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:96
verses.text: Faintheartedness comes from not believing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:97
verses.text: But how shall this be? If we fully assure ourselves through faith.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:98
verses.text: "Having our hearts sprinkled": why did he not say "having been purified"? [Because] he wished to point out the difference of the sprinklings: the one he says is of God, the other our own.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:99
verses.text: For the washing and sprinkling the conscience is of God; but "the drawing near with" truth and "in full assurance of faith" is our own.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:100
verses.text: Then he also gives strength to their faith from the truth of Him that promised.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:101
verses.text: What is "and having our bodies washed with pure water"? With water which makes pure; or which has no blood.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:102
verses.text: Then he adds the perfect thing, love.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:103
verses.text: "Not forsaking the assembling of ourselves together," which some (he says) do, and divide the assemblies.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:104
verses.text: For "a brother helped by a brother is as a strong city".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:105
verses.text: ( Prov.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:106
verses.text: xviii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:107
verses.text: , LXX.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:108
verses.text: )  "But let us consider one another to provoke unto love".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:109
verses.text: What is, "let us consider one another"? For instance if any be virtuous, let us imitate him, let us look on him so as to love and to be loved.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:110
verses.text: For from Love good works proceed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:111
verses.text: For the assembling is a great good: since it makes love more warm; and out of love all good things arise.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:112
verses.text: For nothing is good which is not done through love.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:113
verses.text: This then let us "confirm" towards each other.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:114
verses.text: "For love is the fulfilling of the law".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:115
verses.text: ( Rom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:116
verses.text: xiii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:117
verses.text: ) We have no need of labors or of sweatings if we love one another.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:118
verses.text: It is a pathway leading of itself towards virtue.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:119
verses.text: For as on the highway, if any man find the beginning, he is guided by it, and has no need of one to take him by the hand; so is it also in regard to Love: only lay hold on the beginning, and at once thou art guided and directed by it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:120
verses.text: "Love worketh no ill to his neighbor" ( Rom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:121
verses.text: xiii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:122
verses.text: ); "thinketh no evil".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:123
verses.text: (  Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:124
verses.text: xiii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:125
verses.text: ) Let each man consider with himself, how he is disposed toward himself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:126
verses.text: He does not envy himself; he wishes all good things for himself; he prefers himself before all; he is willing to do all things for himself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:127
verses.text: If then we were so disposed towards others also, all grievous things are brought to an end; there is no enmity; there is no covetousness: for who would choose to overreach himself? No man; but on the contrary we shall possess all things in common, and shall not cease assembling ourselves together.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:128
verses.text: And if we do this, the remembrance of injuries would have no place: for who would choose to remember injuries against himself? Who would choose to be angry with himself? Do we not make allowances for ourselves most of all? If we were thus disposed towards our neighbors also, there will never be any remembrance of injuries.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:129
verses.text: And how is it possible (you say) that one should so love his neighbor as himself? If others had not done this, you might well think it impossible: but if they have done it, it is plain that from indolence it is not done by ourselves.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:130
verses.text: And besides, Christ enjoins nothing impossible, seeing that many have even gone beyond His commands.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:131
verses.text: Who has done this? Paul, Peter, all the company of the Saints.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:132
verses.text: Nay, indeed if I say that they loved their neighbors, I say no great matter: they so loved their enemies as no man would love those who were likeminded with himself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:133
verses.text: For who would choose for the sake of those likeminded, to go away into Hell.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:134
verses.text: when he was about to depart unto a kingdom? No man.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:135
verses.text: But Paul chose this for the sake of his enemies, for those who stoned him, those who scourged him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:136
verses.text: What pardon then will there be for us, what excuse, if we shall not show towards our friends even the very smallest portion of that love which Paul showed towards his enemies?  And before him too, the blessed Moses was willing to be blotted out of God's book for the sake of his enemies who had stoned him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:137
verses.text: David also when he saw those who had stood up against him slain, saith, "I, the shepherd, have sinned, but these, what have they done?" (See  Sam.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:138
verses.text: xxiv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:139
verses.text: ) And when he had Saul in his hands, he would not slay him, but saved him; and this when he himself would be in danger.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:140
verses.text: But if these things were done under the Old [Covenant] what excuse shall we have who live under the New, and do not attain even to the same measure with them? For if, "unless our righteousness exceed that of the Scribes and Pharisees, we shall not enter into the kingdom of Heaven" ( Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:141
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:142
verses.text: ), how shall we enter in when we have even less than they?   "Love your enemies," He says.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:143
verses.text: ( Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:144
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:145
verses.text: ) Love thou therefore thy enemy: for thou art doing good not to him, but to thyself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:146
verses.text: How? Thou art becoming like God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:147
verses.text: He, if he be beloved of thee, hath no great gain, for he is beloved by a fellow-slave; but thou, if thou love thy fellow-slave, hast gained much, for thou art becoming like God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:148
verses.text: Seest thou that thou art doing a kindness not to him but to thyself? For He appoints the prize not for him, but for thee.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:149
verses.text: What then if he be evil (you say)? So much the greater is the reward.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:150
verses.text: Even for his wickedness thou oughtest to feel grateful to him: even should he be evil after receiving ten thousand kindnesses.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:151
verses.text: For if he were not exceedingly evil, thy reward would not have been exceedingly increased; so that the reason [thou assignest] for not loving him, the saying that he is evil, is the very reason for loving him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:152
verses.text: Take away the contestant and thou takest away the opportunity for the crowns.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:153
verses.text: Seest thou not the athletes, how they exercise when they have filled the bags with sand? But there is no need for thee to practice this.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:154
verses.text: Life is full of things that exercise thee, and make thee strong.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:155
verses.text: Seest thou not the trees too, the more they are shaken by the winds, so much the more do they become stronger and firmer? We then.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:156
verses.text: if we be long-suffering, shall also become strong.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:157
verses.text: For it is said, "a man who is long-suffering abounds in wisdom, but he that is of a little soul is strongly foolish".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:158
verses.text: ( Prov.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:159
verses.text: xiv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:160
verses.text: ) Seest thou how great is his commendation of the one, seest thou how great his censure of the other? "Strongly foolish," i-e: very [foolish].

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:161
verses.text: Let us not then be faint-hearted one towards another: for this does not rise from enmity, but from having a small soul.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:162
verses.text: As if the soul be strong, it will endure all things easily, and nothing will be able to sink it, but will lead it into tranquil havens.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 20:163
verses.text: To which may we all attain, by the grace and lovingkindness of our Lord Jesus Christ, with whom to the Father together with the Holy Ghost, be glory, power, honor, now and for ever and world without end, Amen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:1
verses.text: Homily XX.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:2
verses.text: Hebrews x.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:3
verses.text: ,  "For if we sin willfully, after we have received the knowledge of the truth, there remaineth no more sacrifice for sins, but a certain fearful looking for of judgment, and fiery indignation which shall devour the adversaries".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:4
verses.text: Trees which have been planted, and have had the advantage of all other care, and the hands and the labors of the cultivator, and yet yield no return for the labors, are pulled up by the roots, and handed over to the fire.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:5
verses.text: So somewhat of this kind takes place also in the case of our Illumination.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:6
verses.text: For when Christ has planted us, and we have enjoyed the watering of the Spirit, and then show no fruit; fire, even that of Hell, awaits us, and flame unquenchable.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:7
verses.text: Paul therefore having exhorted them to love and to bringing forth the fruit of good works, and having urged them from the kindlier [considerations] (What are these? That we have an entrance into the holy of holies, "the new way which He hath inaugurated for us".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:9
verses.text: x.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:10
verses.text: ), does the same again from the more gloomy ones, speaking thus.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:11
verses.text: For having said, "not forsaking the assembling of ourselves together, as the manner of some is, but exhorting one another, and so much the more, as ye see the day approaching" ( c.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:12
verses.text: x.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:13
verses.text: ), this being sufficient for consolation, he added, "For if we sin willfully after we have received the knowledge of the truth".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:14
verses.text: There is need, he means, of good works, yea, very great need, "For if we sin willfully after we have received the knowledge of the truth, there remaineth no more sacrifice for sins".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:15
verses.text: Thou wast cleansed; thou wast set free from the charges against thee, thou hast become a son.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:16
verses.text: If then thou return to thy former vomit, there awaits thee on the other hand excommunication and fire and whatever such things there are.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:17
verses.text: For there is no second sacrifice.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:18
verses.text: At this place we are again assailed by those who take away repentance, and by those who delay to come to baptism.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:19
verses.text: The one saying, that it is not safe for them to come to baptism, since there is no second remission: And the other asserting that it is not safe to impart the mysteries to those who have sinned, if there is no second remission.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:20
verses.text: What shall we say then to them both? That he does not take away repentance, nor the propitiation through repentance, nor does he thrust away and cast down with despair the fallen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:21
verses.text: He is not thus an enemy of our salvation; but what? He takes away the second Washing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:22
verses.text: For he did not say, no more is there repentance, or no more is there remission, but "no more" is there a "sacrifice," that is, there is no more a second Cross.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:23
verses.text: For this is what he means by sacrifice.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:24
verses.text: "For by one sacrifice," he says, "He hath perfected forever them that are sanctified" ( c.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:25
verses.text: x.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:26
verses.text: ); not like the Jewish [rites.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:28
verses.text: For this reason he has treated so much throughout concerning the Sacrifice, that it is one, even one; not wishing to show this only, that herein it differed from the Jewish [rites], but also to make [men] more steadfast, so that they might no longer expect another sacrifice according to the Jewish law.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:29
verses.text: "For," saith he, "if we sin willfully".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:30
verses.text: See how he is disposed to pardon.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:31
verses.text: He says, "if we sin willfully," so that there is pardon for those [who sin] not willfully.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:32
verses.text: "After the knowledge of the truth": He either means, of Christ, or of all doctrines.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:33
verses.text: "There remaineth no more sacrifice for sins," but what? "A certain fearful looking for of judgment and fiery indignation which shall devour the adversaries".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:34
verses.text: By "Adversaries" he means not the unbelievers, but those also who do what is against virtue; or [else he means] that the same fire shall receive them of the household also, which [receives] "the adversaries".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:35
verses.text: Then expressing its devouring nature, he says, as if giving it life, "fiery indignation which shall devour the adversaries".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:36
verses.text: For as a wild beast when irritated and very fierce and savage, would not rest till it could lay hold on some one and eat him up; so also that fire, like one goaded by indignation, whatever it can lay hold of does not let go, but devours and tears it to pieces.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:37
verses.text: Next he adds also the reason of the threat, that it is on good grounds, that it is just; for this contributes to confidence, when we show that it is just.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:38
verses.text: For, he says, ( ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:39
verses.text: ) "He that hath despised Moses' law dies without mercy, under two or three witnesses".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:40
verses.text: "Without mercy," he says; so that there is no pardon, no pity there although the law is of Moses; for he ordained the most of it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:41
verses.text: What is "under two or three"? If two or three bore witness, he means, they immediately suffered punishment.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:42
verses.text: If then under the Old [Covenant], when the law of Moses is set at nought, there is so great punishment, ( ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:43
verses.text: ) "Of how much sorer punishment, suppose ye, shall he be thought worthy, who hath trodden under foot the Son of God and hath counted the blood of the covenant an unholy [a common] thing, and hath done despite unto the Spirit of grace?"  And how does a man "tread under foot the Son of God"? When partaking of Him in the mysteries (he would say) he has wrought sin, has he not trodden Him under foot? Has he not despised Him? For just as we make no account of those who are trodden under foot, so also, they who sin have made no account of Christ; and so they have sinned.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:44
verses.text: Thou art become the Body of Christ, and givest thou thyself to the devil, so that he treads thee under foot.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:45
verses.text: "And accounted the blood a common thing," he says.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:46
verses.text: What is "common"? It is "unclean," or the having nothing beyond other things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:47
verses.text: "And done despite unto the Spirit of grace".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:48
verses.text: For he that accepts not a benefit, does despite to the benefactor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:49
verses.text: He made thee a son: and thou wishest to become a slave.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:50
verses.text: He came to dwell with thee, and thou bringest in wicked imaginations to Him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:51
verses.text: Christ wished to stay with thee: and thou treadest Him down by surfeiting, by drunkenness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:52
verses.text: Let us listen, whoever partake of the mysteries unworthily: let us listen, whoever approach that Table unworthily.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:53
verses.text: "Give not" (He says) "that which is holy unto the dogs, lest in time they trample them under their feet" ( Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:54
verses.text: vii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:55
verses.text: ), that is, lest they despise, lest they repudiate [them].

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:56
verses.text: Yet he did not say this, but what was more fearful than this.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:57
verses.text: For he constrains their souls by what is fearful.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:58
verses.text: For this also is adapted to convert, no less than consolation.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:59
verses.text: And at the same time he shows both the difference, and the chastisement, and sets forth the judgment upon them, as though it were an evident matter.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:60
verses.text: "Of how much sorer punishment, suppose ye, shall he be thought worthy?" Here also he appears to me to hint at the mysteries.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:61
verses.text: Next he adds testimony, saying, ( ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:62
verses.text: ,  ) "It is a fearful thing to fall into the hands of the Living God".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:63
verses.text: "For" it is written: "Vengeance [belongeth] unto Me, I will recompense, saith the Lord.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:64
verses.text: And again, The Lord shall judge His people".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:65
verses.text: "Let us fall," it is said, "into the hands of the Lord, and not into the hands of men".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:66
verses.text: ( Ecclus.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:67
verses.text: ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:68
verses.text: ) But if ye repent not, ye shall "fall into the hands of" God: that is fearful: it is nothing, to "fall into the hands of men".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:69
verses.text: When, he means, we see any man punished here, let us not be terrified at the things present, but shudder at the things to come.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:70
verses.text: "For according to His mercy, so is His wrath".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:71
verses.text: And, "His indignation will rest upon sinners".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:72
verses.text: ( Ecclus.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:73
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:74
verses.text: )  At the same time too he hints at something else.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:75
verses.text: For "Vengeance [belongeth] unto Me," he says, "I will recompense".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:76
verses.text: This is said in regard to their enemies, who are doing evil, not to those who are suffering evil.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:77
verses.text: Here he is consoling them too, all but saying, God abideth for ever and liveth, so that even if they receive not [their reward] now, they will receive it hereafter.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:78
verses.text: They ought to groan, not we: for we indeed shall fall into their hands, but they into the hands of God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:79
verses.text: For neither is it the sufferer who suffers the ill, but he that does it; nor is it he who receives a benefit that is benefited, but the benefactor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:80
verses.text: Knowing then these things, let us be patient as to suffering evil, forward as to kindnesses.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:81
verses.text: And this will be, if we think lightly of wealth and honor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:82
verses.text: He that hath stripped himself of those affections, is of all men most generous, and more wealthy even than he who wears the purple.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:83
verses.text: Seest thou not how many evils come through money? I do not say how many through covetousness, but merely by our attachment to these things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:84
verses.text: For instance, if a man has lost his money, he leads a life more wretched than any death.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:85
verses.text: Why grievest thou, O man? why weepest thou? Because God has delivered Thee from excessive watching? Because thou dost not sit trembling and fearful? Again, if any one chain thee to a treasure, commanding thee to sit there perpetually, and to keep watch for other people's goods, thou art grieved, thou art disgusted; and dost thou, after thou hast bound thyself with most grievous chains, grieve when thou art delivered from the slavery? Truly sorrows and joys are [matters] of fancy.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:86
verses.text: For we guard them as if we had another's.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:87
verses.text: Now my discourse is for the women.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:88
verses.text: A woman often has a garment woven with gold, and this she shakes, wraps up in linen, keeps with care, trembles for it, and has no enjoyment of it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:89
verses.text: For either she dies, or she becomes a widow.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:90
verses.text: Or, even if none of these things happen, yet from fear lest wearing it out by continual use, she should deprive herself of it, she deprives herself of it in another way, by sparing it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:91
verses.text: But she passes it on [you say] to another.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:92
verses.text: But neither is this clear: and even if she should pass it on, the other again will also use it in the same way.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:93
verses.text: And if any one will search their houses, he will find that the most costly garments and other choice things, are tended with special honor, as if they were living masters.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:94
verses.text: For she does not use them habitually, but fears and trembles, driving away moths and the other things that are wont to eat them, and laying most of them in perfumes and spices, nor permitting all persons to be counted worthy of the sight of them, but oftentimes carefully putting them in order herself with her husband.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:95
verses.text: Tell me: did not Paul with reason call covetousness "idolatry"? ( Col.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:96
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:97
verses.text: ) For these show as great honor to their garments, their gold, as they to their idols.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:98
verses.text: How long shall we stir up the mire? How long shall we be fixed to the clay and the brickmaking? For as they toiled for the King of the Egyptians, so do we also toil for the devil, and are scourged with far more grievous stripes.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:99
verses.text: For by how much the soul surpasses the body, by so much does anxiety the weals of scourging.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:100
verses.text: We are scourged every day, we are full of fear, in anxiety, in trembling.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:101
verses.text: But if we will groan, if we will look up to God, He sendeth to us, not Moses, nor Aaron, but His own Word, and compunction.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:102
verses.text: When this [word] has come, and taken hold of our souls, He will free from the bitter slavery, He will bring us forth out of Egypt, from unprofitable and vain zeal, from slavery which brings no gain.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:103
verses.text: For they indeed went forth after having at least received golden [ornaments], the wages for building, but we [receive] nothing: and would it were nothing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:104
verses.text: For indeed we also receive, not golden ornaments, but the evils of Egypt, sins and chastisements and punishments.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:105
verses.text: Let us then learn to be made use of, let us learn to be spitefully treated; this is the part of a Christian.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:106
verses.text: Let us think lightly of golden raiment, let us think lightly of money, that we may not think lightly of our salvation.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:107
verses.text: Let us think lightly of money and not think lightly of the soul.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:108
verses.text: For this is chastised, this is punished: those things remain here, but the soul departeth yonder.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:109
verses.text: Why, tell me, dost thou cut thyself to pieces, without perceiving it?   These things I say to the overreaching.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:110
verses.text: And it is well to say also to those who are overreached.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:111
verses.text: Bear their overreachings generously; they are ruining themselves, not you.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:112
verses.text: You indeed they defraud of your money, but they strip themselves of the good will and help of God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:113
verses.text: And he that is stripped of that, though he clothe himself with the whole wealth of the world, is of all men most poor: and so he who is the poorest of all, if he have this, is the wealthiest of all.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:114
verses.text: For "the Lord" (it is said) "is my shepherd, and I shall lack nothing".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:115
verses.text: ( Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:116
verses.text: xxiii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:117
verses.text: )  Tell me now, if thou hadst had a husband, a great and admirable man, who thoroughly loved thee and cared for thee, and then knewest that he would live always, and not die before thee, and would give thee all things to enjoy in security, as thine own: wouldst thou then have wished to possess anything? Even if thou hadst been stripped of all, wouldst thou not have thought thyself the richer for this?  Why then dost thou grieve? Because thou hast no property? But consider that thou hast had the occasion of sin taken away.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:118
verses.text: But is it because thou hadst [property] and hast been deprived of it? But thou hast acquired the good will of God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:119
verses.text: And how have I acquired it (you say)? He has said, "Wherefore do ye not rather suffer wrong?" (  Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:120
verses.text: vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:121
verses.text: ) He hath said, "Blessed are they who bear all things with thankfulness".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:122
verses.text: Consider therefore how great good will thou wilt enjoy, if thou showest forth those things by [thy] works.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:123
verses.text: For one thing only is required from us, "in all things to give thanks" to God, and [then] we have all things in abundance.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:124
verses.text: I mean, for instance: hast thou lost ten thousand pounds of gold? Forthwith give thanks unto God, and thou hast acquired ten times ten thousand, by that word and thanksgiving.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:125
verses.text: For tell me when dost thou account Job blessed? When he had so many camels, and flocks, and herds, or when he uttered that saying: "The Lord gave, the Lord hath taken away"? ( Job i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:126
verses.text: ) Therefore also the devil causes us losses, not that he may take away our goods only, for he knows that is nothing, but that through them he may compel us to utter some blasphemy.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:127
verses.text: So in the case of the blessed Job too, he did not strive after this only, to make him poor, but also to make him a blasphemer.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:128
verses.text: At any rate, when he had stripped him of every thing, observe what he says to him through his wife, "Say some word against the Lord, and die".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:129
verses.text: ( Job ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:130
verses.text: ) And yet, O accursed one, thou hadst stripped him of everything.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:131
verses.text: 'But' (he says) 'this is not what I was striving for; for I have not yet accomplished that for which I did all.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:132
verses.text: I was striving to deprive him of God's help: for this cause I deprived him of his goods too.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:133
verses.text: This is what I wish, that other is nothing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:134
verses.text: If this be not gained, he not only has not been injured at all, but has even been benefited.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:135
verses.text: ' Thou seest that even that wicked demon knows how great is the loss in this matter?  And see him plotting the treachery through the wife.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:136
verses.text: Hear this, ye husbands, as many as have wives that are fond of money, and compel you to blaspheme God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:137
verses.text: Call Job to mind.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:138
verses.text: But let us see, if it please you, his great moderation, how he silenced her.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:139
verses.text: "Wherefore" (he says) "hast thou spoken as one of the foolish women [speaketh]?" ( Job ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:140
verses.text: ) Of a truth "evil communications corrupt good manners" (  Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:141
verses.text: xv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:142
verses.text: ), at all times indeed, but particularly in calamities: then they who give evil advice have strength.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:143
verses.text: For if the soul is even of itself prone to impatience, how much more, when there is also an adviser.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:144
verses.text: Is it not thrust into a pit? A wife is a great good, as also a great evil.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:145
verses.text: For because a wife is a great [good], observe from what point he [Satan] wishes to break through the strong wall.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:146
verses.text: 'The depriving him of his property' (he says) 'did not take him; the loss has produced no great effect.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:147
verses.text: ' Therefore he says, 'If indeed he will curse thee to thy face.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:148
verses.text: ' ( Job ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:149
verses.text: ) You see whither he was aspiring.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:150
verses.text: If then we bear [losses] thankfully, we shall recover even these things; and if we should not recover them, our reward will be greater.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:151
verses.text: For when he had wrestled nobly, then God restored to him these things also.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:152
verses.text: When He had shown the devil, that it is not for these things that he serves Him, then He restored them also to him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:153
verses.text: For such is He.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:154
verses.text: When God sees that we are not riveted to things of this life, then He gives them to us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:155
verses.text: When He sees that we set a higher value on things spiritual, then He also bestows on us things carnal.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:156
verses.text: But not first, lest we should break away from things spiritual: and to spare us He does not give carnal things, to keep us away from them, even against our will.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:157
verses.text: Not so (you say) but if I receive [them], I am satisfied, and am the more thankful.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:158
verses.text: It is false, O man, for then especially wilt thou be thoughtless.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:159
verses.text: Why then (you say) does He give [them] to many? Whence is it clear, that He gives [them]? But who else, you say, gives? Their overreaching, their plundering.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:160
verses.text: How then does He allow these things? As He also [allows] murders, thefts, and violence.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:161
verses.text: What then (you will say) as to those who receive by succession an inheritance from their fathers, being themselves full of evils innumerable? And what of this? How does God suffer them (you say) to enjoy these things? Surely just as He allows thieves, and murderers, and other evil doers.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:162
verses.text: For it is not now the time of judgment, but of the best course of life.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:163
verses.text: And what I just now said, that I repeat, that they shall suffer greater punishment, who, when they have enjoyed all good things, do not even so become better.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:164
verses.text: For all shall not be punished alike; but they who, even after His benefits, have continued evil, shall suffer a greater punishment, while they who after poverty [have done this] not so.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:165
verses.text: And that this is true, hear what He says to David, "Did I not give thee all thy master's goods?" (  Sam.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:166
verses.text: xii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:167
verses.text: ) Whenever then thou seest a young man that has received a paternal inheritance without labor and continues wicked, be assured that his punishment is increased and the vengeance is made more intense.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:168
verses.text: Let us not then emulate these; but if any man has succeeded to virtue, if any man has obtained spiritual wealth, [him let us emulate].

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:169
verses.text: For (it is said) "Woe to them that trust in their riches" (cf.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:170
verses.text: Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:171
verses.text: xlix.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:172
verses.text: ): "Blessed are they that fear the Lord".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:173
verses.text: ( Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:174
verses.text: cxxviii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:175
verses.text: ) To which of these, tell me, wouldst thou belong? Doubtless to those who are pronounced blessed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:176
verses.text: Therefore emulate these, not the other, that thou also mayest obtain the good things which are laid up for them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 21:177
verses.text: Which may we all obtain, in Christ Jesus our Lord, with whom to the Father be glory together with the Holy Ghost, now and for ever, and world without end, Amen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:1
verses.text: Homily XXI.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:2
verses.text: Hebrews x.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:3
verses.text: –  "But call to remembrance the former days, in which after ye were illuminated, ye endured a great fight of afflictions; partly, whilst ye were made a gazing stock both by reproaches and afflictions, and partly whilst ye became companions of them that were so used.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:4
verses.text: For ye had compassion on those who were in bonds, and took joyfully the spoiling of your goods, knowing that ye have for yourselves in heaven a better and an enduring substance".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:5
verses.text: The best Physicians after they have made a deep incision, and have increased the pains by the wound, soothing the afflicted part, and giving rest and refreshment to the disturbed soul, proceed not to make a second incision, but rather soothe that which has been made with gentle remedies, and such as are suited to remove the violence of the pain.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:6
verses.text: This Paul also did after he had shaken their souls, and pierced them with the recollection of Hell, and convinced then, that he must certainly perish, who does despite to the grace of God, and after he had shown from the laws of Moses, that they also shall perish, and the more [fearfully], and confirm it by other testimonies, and had said, "It is a fearful thing to fall into the hands of the Living God" ( c.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:7
verses.text: x.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:8
verses.text: ): then, lest the soul desponding through excessive fear, should be swallowed up with grief, he soothes them by commendations and exhortation, and gives them zeal derived from their own conduct.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:9
verses.text: For, he says, "call to remembrance the former days, in which after ye had been enlightened, ye endured a great fight of afflictions".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:10
verses.text: Powerful is the exhortation from deeds [already done]: for he who begins a work ought to go forward and add to it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:11
verses.text: As if he had said, when ye were brought in [to the Church], when ye were in the rank of learners, ye displayed so great readiness, so great nobleness; but now it is no longer so.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:12
verses.text: And he who encourages, does thus especially encourage them from their own example.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:13
verses.text: And he did not simply say, "ye endured a fight" but a "great" [fight].

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:14
verses.text: Moreover he did not say "temptations" but "fight," which is an expression of commendation and of very great praise.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:15
verses.text: Then he also enumerates them particularly, amplifying his discourse, and multiplying his praise.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:16
verses.text: How? "Partly" (he says) "whilst ye were made a gazing-stock by reproaches and afflictions"; for reproach is a great thing, and calculated to pervert the soul, and to darken the judgment.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:17
verses.text: For hear what the prophet says: "While they daily say unto me, Where is thy God?" ( Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:18
verses.text: xlii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:19
verses.text: ) And again, "If the enemy had reproached me, I would have borne it".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:20
verses.text: ( Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:21
verses.text: lv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:22
verses.text: ) For since the human race is exceedingly vainglorious, therefore it is easily overcome by this.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:23
verses.text: And he did not simply say "by reproaches," but that even with great intensity, being "made a gazing-stock".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:24
verses.text: For when a person is reproached alone, it is indeed painful, but far more so when in presence of all.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:25
verses.text: For tell me how great the evil was when men who had left the meanness of Judaism, and gone over, as it were, to the best course of life, and despised the customs of their fathers, were ill treated by their own people, and had no help.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:26
verses.text: I cannot say (he says) that ye suffered these things indeed and were grieved, but ye even rejoiced exceedingly.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:27
verses.text: And this he expressed by saying, "Whilst ye became companions of them that were so used," and he brings forward the Apostles themselves.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:28
verses.text: Not only (he means) were ye not ashamed of your own sufferings, but ye even shared with others who were suffering the same things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:29
verses.text: This too is the language of one who is encouraging them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:30
verses.text: He said not, 'Bear my afflictions, share with me,' but respect your own.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:31
verses.text: "Ye had compassion on them that were in bonds".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:32
verses.text: Thou seest that he is speaking concerning himself and the rest who were in prison.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:33
verses.text: Thus ye did not account "bonds" to be bonds: but as noble wrestlers so stood ye: for not only ye needed no consolation in your own [distresses], but even became a consolation to others.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:34
verses.text: And "ye took joyfully the spoiling of your goods".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:35
verses.text: O! what "full assurance of faith"! ( c.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:36
verses.text: x.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:37
verses.text: ) Then he also sets forth the motive, not only consoling them for their struggles, but also that they might not be shaken from the Faith.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:38
verses.text: When ye saw your property plundered (he means) ye endured; for already ye saw Him who is invisible, as visible: which was the effect of genuine faith, and ye showed it forth by your deeds themselves.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:39
verses.text: Well then, the plundering was perhaps from the force of the plunderers, and no man could prevent it; so that as yet it is not clear, that ye endured the plundering for the faith's sake.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:40
verses.text: (Although this too is clear.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:41
verses.text: For it was in your power if you chose, not to be plundered, by not believing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:42
verses.text: ) But ye did what is far greater than this; the enduring such things even "with joy"; which was altogether apostolical, and worthy of those noble souls, who rejoiced when scourged.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:43
verses.text: For, it says, "they departed from the presence of the council, rejoicing that they were counted worthy to suffer shame for the Name".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:44
verses.text: ( Acts v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:45
verses.text: ) But he that endures "with joy," shows that he has some reward, and that the affair is no loss but a gain.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:46
verses.text: Moreover the expression "ye took" shows their willing endurance, because, he means, ye chose and accepted.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:47
verses.text: "Knowing" (he says) "that ye have for yourselves in heaven a better and an enduring substance"; instead of saying, firm, not perishing like this.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:48
verses.text: In the next place, having praised them, he says, ( ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:49
verses.text: ) "Cast not away therefore your confidence, which hath great recompense of reward".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:50
verses.text: What meanest thou? He did not say, 'ye have cast it away, and recover it': but, which tended more to strengthen them, "ye have it," he says.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:51
verses.text: For to recover again that which has been cast away, requires more labor: but not to lose that which is held fast does not.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:52
verses.text: But to the Galatians he says the very opposite: "My children of whom I travail in birth again, till Christ be formed in you" ( Gal.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:53
verses.text: iv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:54
verses.text: ); and with reason; for they were more supine, whence they needed a sharper word; but these were more faint-hearted, so that they rather needed what was more soothing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:55
verses.text: "Cast not away therefore" (he says) "your confidence," so that they were in great confidence towards God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:56
verses.text: "Which hath" (he says) "great recompense of reward".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:57
verses.text: "And when shall we receive them (some one might say)? Behold! All things on our part have been done".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:58
verses.text: Therefore he anticipated them on their own supposition, saying in effect, If ye know that ye have in heaven a better substance, seek nothing here.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:59
verses.text: "For ye have need of patience," not of any addition [to your labors], that ye may continue in the same state, that ye may not cast away what has been put into your hands.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:60
verses.text: Ye need nothing else, but so to stand as ye have stood, that when ye come to the end, ye may receive the promise.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:61
verses.text: ( Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:62
verses.text: ) "For" (he says) "ye have need of patience, that after ye have done the will of God, ye might receive the promise".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:63
verses.text: Ye have need of one thing only, to bear with the delay; not that ye should fight again.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:64
verses.text: Ye are at the very crown (he means); ye have borne all the combats of bonds, of afflictions; your goods have been spoiled.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:65
verses.text: What then? Henceforward ye are standing to be crowned: endure this only, the delay of the crown.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:66
verses.text: O the greatness of the consolation! It is as if one should speak to an athlete who had overthrown all, and had no antagonist, and then was to be crowned, and yet endured not that time, during which the president of the games comes, and places the crown [upon him]; and he impatient, should wish to go out, and escape as though he could not bear the thirst and the heat.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:67
verses.text: He then also hinting this, what does he say? ( Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:68
verses.text: ) "Yet a little while and He that shall come will come, and will not tarry".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:69
verses.text: For lest they should say, And when will He come? He comforts them from the Scriptures.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:70
verses.text: For thus also when he says in another place, "Now is our salvation nearer" ( Rom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:71
verses.text: xiii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:72
verses.text: ), he comforts them because the remaining time is short.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:73
verses.text: And this he says not of himself but from the Scriptures.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:74
verses.text: But if from that time it was said, "Yet a little while, and He that shall come will come, and will not tarry," it is plain that now He is nearer.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:75
verses.text: Wherefore also waiting is no small reward.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:76
verses.text: ( Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:77
