verses.text: ) "Now the just" (he says) "shall live by faith, but if any man draw back, My soul shall have no pleasure in him".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:78
verses.text: This is a great encouragement when one shows that they have succeeded in the whole matter and are losing it through a little indolence.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:79
verses.text: ( Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:80
verses.text: ) "But we are not of them that draw back unto perdition, but of them that believe to the saving of the soul".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:82
verses.text: xi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:83
verses.text: ,  ) "Now faith is the substance of things hoped for, the evidence of things not seen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:84
verses.text: For by it the elders obtained a good report".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:85
verses.text: O what an expression has he used, in saying, "an evidence of things not seen".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:86
verses.text: For [we say] there is "evidence," in the case of things that are very plain.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:87
verses.text: Faith then is the seeing things not plain (he means), and brings what are not seen to the same full assurance with what are seen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:88
verses.text: So then neither is it possible to disbelieve in things which are seen, nor, on the other hand can there be faith unless a man be more fully assured with respect to things invisible, than he is with respect to things that are most clearly seen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:89
verses.text: For since the objects of hope seem to be unsubstantial, Faith gives them substantiality, or rather, does not give it, but is itself their substance.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:90
verses.text: For instance, the Resurrection has not come, nor does it exist substantially, but hope makes it substantial in our soul.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:91
verses.text: This is [the meaning of] "the substance of things".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:92
verses.text: If therefore it is an "evidence of things not seen," why forsooth do you wish to see them, so as to fall away from faith, and from being just? Since "the just shall live by faith," whereas ye, if ye wish to see these things, are no longer faithful.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:93
verses.text: Ye have labored (he says), ye have struggled: I too allow this, nevertheless, wait; for this is Faith: do not seek the whole "here".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:94
verses.text: These things were indeed said to the Hebrews, but they are a general exhortation also to many of those who are here assembled.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:95
verses.text: How and in what way? To the faint-hearted; to the mean-spirited.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:96
verses.text: For when they see the wicked prospering, and themselves faring ill, they are troubled, they bear it impatiently: while they long for the chastisement, and the inflicting vengeance on others; while they wait for the rewards of their own sufferings.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:97
verses.text: "For yet a little time, and He that shall come will come".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:98
verses.text: Let us then say this to the slothful: Doubtless there will be punishment; doubtless He will come, henceforth the events of the Resurrection are even at the doors.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:99
verses.text: Whence [does] that [appear] (you say)? I do not say, from the prophets; for neither do I now speak to Christians only; but even if a heathen be here, I am perfectly confident, and bring forward my proofs, and will instruct him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:100
verses.text: How (you say)?  Christ foretold many things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:101
verses.text: If those former things did not come to pass, then do not believe them; but if they all came to pass, why doubt concerning those that remain? And indeed, it were very unreasonable, nothing having come to pass, to believe the one, or when all has come to pass, to disbelieve the others.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:102
verses.text: But I will make the matter more plain by an example.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:103
verses.text: Christ said, that Jerusalem should be taken, and should be so taken as no city ever was before, and that it should never be raised up: and in fact this prediction came to pass.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:104
verses.text: He said, that there should be "great tribulation" ( Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:105
verses.text: xxiv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:106
verses.text: ), and it came to pass.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:107
verses.text: He said that a grain of mustard seed is sown, so should the preaching [of the Gospel] be extended: and every day we see this running over the world.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:108
verses.text: He said, that they who left father or mother, or brethren, or sisters, should have both fathers and mothers; And this we see fulfilled by facts.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:109
verses.text: He said, "in the world ye shall have tribulation, but be of good cheer, I have overcome the world" ( John xvi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:110
verses.text: ), that is, no man shall get the better of you.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:111
verses.text: And this we see by the events has come to pass.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:112
verses.text: He said that "the gates of hell shall not prevail against the Church" ( Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:113
verses.text: xvi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:114
verses.text: ), even though persecuted, and that no one shall quench the preaching [of the Gospel]: and the experience of events bears witness to this prediction also: and yet when He said these things, it was very hard to believe Him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:115
verses.text: Why? Because all these were words, and He had not as yet given proof of the things spoken.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:116
verses.text: So that they have now become far more credible.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:117
verses.text: He said that "when the Gospel should have been preached among all the nations, then the end shall come" ( Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:118
verses.text: xxiv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:119
verses.text: ); lo! now ye have arrived at the end: for the greater part of the world hath been preached to, therefore the end is now at hand.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:120
verses.text: Let us tremble, beloved.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:121
verses.text: But what, tell me? Art thou anxious about the end? It indeed is itself near, but each man's life and death is nearer.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:122
verses.text: For it is said, "the days of our years are seventy years; but if [one be] in strength, fourscore years".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:123
verses.text: ( Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:124
verses.text: xc.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:125
verses.text: ; [LXX.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:126
verses.text: lxxxix.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:128
verses.text: ) The day of judgment is near.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:129
verses.text: Let us fear.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:130
verses.text: "A brother doth not redeem; shall man redeem?" ( Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:131
verses.text: xlix.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:132
verses.text: ; [LXX.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:133
verses.text: xlviii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:135
verses.text: ) There we shall repent much, "but in death no man shall praise Him".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:136
verses.text: ( Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:137
verses.text: vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:138
verses.text: ; [LXX.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:140
verses.text: ) Wherefore he saith, "Let us come before His presence with thanksgiving" ( Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:141
verses.text: xcv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:142
verses.text: ; [LXX.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:143
verses.text: Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:144
verses.text: xciv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:145
verses.text: ]), that is, his coming.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:146
verses.text: For here [in this life] indeed, whatever we do has efficacy; but there, no longer.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:147
verses.text: Tell me, if a man placed us for a little while in a flaming furnace, should we not submit to anything in order to escape, even were it necessary to part with our money, nay to undergo slavery? How many have fallen into grievous diseases, and would gladly give up all, to be delivered from them, if the choice were offered them? If in this world then, a disease of short duration so afflicts us, what shall we do yonder, when repentance will be of no avail?   Of how many evils are we now full, without being conscious of them? We bite one another, we devour one another, in wronging, accusing, calumniating, being vexed by the credit of our neighbors.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:148
verses.text: (Cf.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:149
verses.text: Gal.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:150
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:151
verses.text: )  And see the difficulty.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:152
verses.text: When a man wishes to undermine the reputation of a neighbor, he says, 'Such an one said this of him; O God, forgive me, do not examine me strictly, I must give account of what I have heard.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:153
verses.text: ' Why then dost thou speak of it at all, if thou dost not believe it? Why dost thou speak of it? Why dost thou make it credible by much reporting? Why dost thou pass on the story which is not true? Thou dost not believe it, and thou entreatest God not to call thee to strict account? Do not say it then, but keep silence, and free thyself from all fear.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:154
verses.text: But I know not from whence this disease has fallen upon men.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:155
verses.text: We have become tattlers, nothing remains in our mind.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:156
verses.text: Hear the exhortation of a wise man who says, "Hast thou heard a word? Let it die in thee, be bold; it will not burst thee".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:157
verses.text: ( Ecclus.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:158
verses.text: xix.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:159
verses.text: ) And again, "A fool heareth a word, and travaileth, as a women in labor of a child".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:160
verses.text: ( Ecclus.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:161
verses.text: xix.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:162
verses.text: ) We are ready to make accusations, prepared for condemning.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:163
verses.text: Even if no other evil thing had been done by us, this were sufficient to ruin us, and to carry us away to Hell, this involves us in ten thousand evils.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:164
verses.text: And that thou mayest know this certainly, hear what the prophet says, "Thou satest and spakest against thy brother".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:165
verses.text: ( Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:166
verses.text: l.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:167
verses.text: )  But it is not I, you say, but the other [who told me].

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:168
verses.text: Nay rather, it is thyself; for if thou hadst not spoken, another would not have heard: or even if he should hear it, yet thou wouldest not have been to blame for the sin.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:169
verses.text: We ought to shade over and conceal the failings of neighbors, but thou paradest them under a cloak of zeal for goodness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:170
verses.text: Thou becomest, not an accuser, but a gossip, a trifler, a fool.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:171
verses.text: O what cleverness! Without being aware of it, thou bringest disgrace upon thyself as well as on him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:172
verses.text: And see what great evils which arise from this.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:173
verses.text: Thou provokest the wrath of God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:174
verses.text: Dost thou not hear Paul saying about widows, "they not only" (these are his words) "learn to be idle, but tattlers also and busybodies, wandering about from house to house, and speaking things which they ought not".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:175
verses.text: (  Tim.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:176
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:177
verses.text: ) So that even when thou believest the things which are said against thy brother, thou oughtest not even in that case to speak of them; much less, when thou dost not believe them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:178
verses.text: But thou [forsooth] lookest to thine own interest? Thou fearest to be called to account by God? Fear then, lest even for thy tattling thou be called to account.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:179
verses.text: For here, thou canst not say, 'O God, call me not to account for light talking': for the whole matter is light talking.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:180
verses.text: Why didst thou publish it? Why didst thou increase the evil? This is sufficient to destroy us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:181
verses.text: On this account Christ said, "Judge not, that ye be not judged".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:182
verses.text: ( Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:183
verses.text: vii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:184
verses.text: )  But we pay no regard to this, neither are we brought to our senses by what happened to the Pharisee.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:185
verses.text: He said what was true, "I am not as this Publican" ( Luke xviii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:186
verses.text: ), he said it too in no man's hearing; yet was he condemned.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:187
verses.text: If he were condemned when he said what was true, and uttered it in no man's hearing, what fearful [punishment] shall not they suffer, who like gossiping women, carry about everywhere lies which they do not even themselves believe? What shall they not endure?   Henceforward let us set "a door and a bolt before the mouth".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:188
verses.text: ( Ecclus.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:189
verses.text: xxviii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:190
verses.text: ) For innumerable evils have arisen from tattling; families have been ruined, friendships torn asunder, innumerable other miseries have happened.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:191
verses.text: Busy not thyself, O man, about the affairs of thy neighbor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:192
verses.text: But thou art talkative and hast a weakness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:193
verses.text: Talk of thine own [faults] to God: thus the weakness will be no longer a weakness, but an advantage.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:194
verses.text: Talk of thy own [faults] to thy friends, those who are thorough friends and righteous men, and in whom thou hast confidence, that so they may pray for thy sins.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:195
verses.text: If thou speak of the [sins] of others, thou art nowise profited, neither hast thou gained anything, but hast ruined thyself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:196
verses.text: If thou confessest thy own [sins] to the Lord, thou hast great reward: for one says, "I said, I will confess against myself mine iniquity to the Lord, and Thou forgavest the impiety of my heart".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:197
verses.text: ( Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:198
verses.text: xxxii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:199
verses.text: )  Dost thou wish to judge? Judge thine own [sins].

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:200
verses.text: No one will accuse thee, if thou condemn thyself: but he will accuse if thou do not condemn; he will accuse thee, unless thou convict thyself; will accuse thee of insensibility.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:201
verses.text: Thou hast seen such an one angry, irritated, doing something else out of place? Think at once, even thou on thy own [faults]: and thus thou wilt not greatly condemn him, and wilt free thyself from the load of thy past transgressions.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 22:202
verses.text: If we thus regulate our own conduct, if we thus manage our own life, if we condemn ourselves, we shall probably not commit many sins, and we shall do many good things, being fair and moderate; and shall enjoy all the promises to them that love God: to which may all attain, by the grace and lovingkindness of our Lord Jesus Christ, with whom to the Father together with the Holy Ghost, be glory, power, honor, now and for ever and world with end, Amen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:1
verses.text: Homily XXII.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:2
verses.text: Hebrews xi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:3
verses.text: ,  "Through faith we understand that the worlds were framed by the word of God; so that things which are seen were not made of things which do appear.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:4
verses.text: By faith Abel offered unto God a more excellent sacrifice than Cain, by which he obtained witness that he was righteous, God testifying of his gifts: and by it he being dead yet speaketh".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:5
verses.text: {{small-caps|Faith needs a generous and vigorous soul, and one rising above all things of sense, and passing beyond the weakness of human reasonings.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:6
verses.text: For it is not possible to become a believer, otherwise than by raising one's self above the common customs [of the world].

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:7
verses.text: Inasmuch then as the souls of the Hebrews were thoroughly weakened, and though they had begun from faith, yet from circumstances, I mean sufferings, afflictions, they had afterwards become faint-hearted, and of little spirit, and were shaken from [their position], he encouraged them first indeed from these very things, saying, "Call to remembrance the former days" ( c.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:8
verses.text: x.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:9
verses.text: ); next from the Scripture saying, "But the just shall live by faith" ( c.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:10
verses.text: x.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:11
verses.text: ); afterwards from arguments, saying, "But Faith is the substance of things hoped for, the evidence of things not seen".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:13
verses.text: xi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:14
verses.text: ) And now again from their forefathers, those great and admirable men, as much as saying; If where the good things were close at hand, all were saved by faith, much more are we.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:15
verses.text: For when a soul finds one that shares the same sufferings with itself, it is refreshed and recovers breath.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:16
verses.text: This we may see both in the case of Faith, and in the case of affliction: "that there may be comfort for you it is said through our mutual faith".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:17
verses.text: ( Rom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:18
verses.text: i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:19
verses.text: ) For mankind are very distrustful, and cannot place confidence in themselves, are fearful about whatever things they think they possess, and have great regard for the opinion of the many.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:20
verses.text: What then does Paul do? He encourages them by the fathers; and before that by the common notions [of mankind].

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:21
verses.text: For tell me, he says, since Faith is calumniated as being a thing without demonstration and rather a matter of deceit, therefore he shows that the greatest things are attained through faith and not through reasonings.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:22
verses.text: And how does he show this, tell me? It is manifest, he saith, that God made the things which are, out of things which are not, things which appear, out of things which appear not, things which subsist, out of things which subsist not.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:23
verses.text: But whence [is it shown] that He did this even "by a Word"? For reason suggests nothing of this kind; but on the contrary, that the things which appear are [formed] out of things which appear.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:24
verses.text: Therefore the philosophers expressly say that 'nothing comes out of things that are not' being "sensual" ( Jude  ), and trusting nothing to Faith.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:25
verses.text: And yet these same men, when they happen to say anything great and noble, are caught entrusting it to Faith.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:26
verses.text: For instance, that "God is without beginning, and unborn" ; for reason does not suggest this, but the contrary.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:27
verses.text: And consider, I beseech you, their great folly.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:28
verses.text: They say that God is without beginning; and yet this is far more wonderful than the [creation] out of things that are not.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:29
verses.text: For to say, that He is without beginning, that He is unborn, neither begotten by Himself nor by another is more full of difficulties, than to say that God made the things which are, out of things which are not.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:30
verses.text: For here there are many things uncertain: as, that some one made it, that what was made had a beginning, that, in a word, it was made.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:31
verses.text: But in the other case, what? He is self-existing, unborn, He neither had beginning nor time; tell me, do not these things require faith? But he did not assert this, which was far greater, but the lesser.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:32
verses.text: Whence [does it appear], he would say, that God made these things? Reason does not suggest it; no one was present when it was done.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:33
verses.text: Whence is it shown? It is plainly the result of faith.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:34
verses.text: "Through faith we understand that the worlds were made".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:35
verses.text: Why "through faith"? Because "the things that are seen were not made of things which do appear".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:36
verses.text: For this is Faith.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:37
verses.text: Having thus stated the general [princi ple], he afterwards tests it by individuals.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:38
verses.text: For a man of note is equivalent to the world.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:39
verses.text: This at all events he afterwards hinted.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:40
verses.text: For when he had matched it against one or two hundred persons, and then saw the smallness of the number, he afterwards says, "by whom the world was outweighed in worth".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:42
verses.text: xi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:43
verses.text: )  And observe whom he puts first, him who was ill-treated, and that by a brother.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:44
verses.text: It was their own affliction, "For you also" (he says) "have suffered like things of your own countrymen".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:45
verses.text: (  Thess.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:46
verses.text: ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:47
verses.text: ) And by a brother who had been nothing wronged, but who envied him on God's account; showing that they also are looked on with an evil eye and envied.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:48
verses.text: He honored God, and died because he honored Him: and has not yet attained to a resurrection.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:49
verses.text: But his readiness is manifest, and his part has been done, but God's part has not yet been carried out towards him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:50
verses.text: And by a "more excellent sacrifice" in this place, he means that which is more honorable, more splendid, more necessary.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:51
verses.text: And we cannot say (he says) that it was not accepted.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:52
verses.text: He did accept it, and said unto Cain, ["Hast thou] not [sinned], if thou rightly offer, but dost not rightly divide?" ( Gen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:53
verses.text: iv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:54
verses.text: , LXX.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:55
verses.text: ) So then Abel both rightly offered, and rightly divided.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:56
verses.text: Nevertheless for this, what recompense did he receive? He was slain by his brother's hand: and that sentence which his father endured on account of sin, this he first received who was upright.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:57
verses.text: And he suffered so much the more grievously because it was from a brother, and he was the first [to suffer].

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:58
verses.text: And he did these things rightly looking to no man.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:59
verses.text: For to whom could he look, when he so honored God? To his father and his mother? But they had outraged Him in return for His benefits.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:60
verses.text: To his brother then? But he also had dishonored [God].

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:61
verses.text: So that by himself he sought out what was good.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:62
verses.text: And he that is worthy of so great honor, what does he suffer? He is put to death.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:63
verses.text: And how too was he otherwise "testified of that he was righteous"? It is said, that fire came down and consumed the sacrifices.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:64
verses.text: For instead of ["And the Lord] had respect to Abel and to his sacrifices" ( Gen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:65
verses.text: iv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:66
verses.text: ), the Syriac said, "And He set them on fire".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:67
verses.text: He therefore who both by word and deed bare witness to the righteous man and sees him slain for His sake, did not avenge him, but left him to suffer.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:68
verses.text: But your case is not such: for how could it be? You who have both prophets and examples, and encouragements innumerable, and signs and miracles accomplished? Hence that was faith indeed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:69
verses.text: For what miracles did he see, that he might believe he should have any recompense of good things? Did he not choose virtue from Faith alone?  What is, "and by it he being dead yet speaketh"? That he might not cast them into great despondency, he shows that he has in part obtained a recompense.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:70
verses.text: How? 'The influence coming from him is great, he means, "and he yet speaketh"; that is, [Cain] slew him, but he did not with him slay his glory and memory.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:71
verses.text: He is not dead; therefore neither shall ye die.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:72
verses.text: For by how much the more grievous a man's sufferings are, so much the greater is his glory.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:73
verses.text: '  How does he "yet speak"? This is a sign both of his being alive, and of his being by all celebrated, admired, counted blessed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:74
verses.text: For he who encourages others to be righteous, speaks.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:75
verses.text: For no speech avails so much, as that man's suffering.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:76
verses.text: As then heaven by its mere appearance speaks, so also does he by being had in remembrance.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:77
verses.text: Not if he had made proclamation of himself, not if he had ten thousand tongues, and were alive, would he have been so admired as now.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:78
verses.text: That is, these things do not take place with impunity, nor lightly, neither do they pass away.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:79
verses.text: ( Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:80
verses.text: ) "By faith Enoch was translated, that he should not see death, and was not found, because God had translated him".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:81
verses.text: This man displayed greater faith than Abel.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:82
verses.text: How (you ask)? Because, although be came after him, yet what befell [Abel] was sufficient to guide him back.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:83
verses.text: How? God foreknew that [Abel] would be killed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:84
verses.text: For He said to Cain: "Thou hast sinned: do not add thereto".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:85
verses.text: Honored by him, He did not protect him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:86
verses.text: And yet neither did this throw him [Enoch] into indifference.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:87
verses.text: He said not to himself, 'What need of toils and dangers? Abel honored God, yet He did not protect him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:88
verses.text: For what advantage had he that was departed, from the punishment of his brother? And what benefit could he reap therefrom? Let us allow that he suffers severe punishment: what is that to him who has been slain?' He neither said nor thought anything of this kind, but passing beyond all these things, he knew that if there is a God, certainly there is a Rewarder also: although as yet they knew nothing of a resurrection.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:89
verses.text: But if they who as yet know nothing of a resurrection, and see contradictory things here, thus pleased [God], how much more should we? For they neither knew of a resurrection, nor had they any examples to look to.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:90
verses.text: This same thing then made [Enoch] well-pleasing [to God], namely, that he received nothing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:91
verses.text: For he knew that [God] "is a rewarder".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:92
verses.text: Whence [knew he this]? "For He recompensed Abel," do you say? So that reason suggested other things, but faith the opposite of what was seen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:93
verses.text: Even then (he would say) if you see that you receive nothing here, be not troubled.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:94
verses.text: How was it "by faith" that "Enoch was translated"? Because his pleasing [God] was the cause of his translation, and faith [the cause] of his pleasing [Him].

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:95
verses.text: For if he had not known that he should receive a reward, how could he have pleased [Him]? "But without faith it is impossible to please" Him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:96
verses.text: How? If a man believe that there is a God and a retribution, he will have the reward.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:97
verses.text: Whence then is the well-pleasing?   It is necessary to "believe that He is," not 'what He is.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:98
verses.text: ' If "that He is" needs Faith, and not reasonings; it is impossible to comprehend by reasoning 'what He is.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:99
verses.text: ' If that "He is a rewarder" needs Faith and not reasonings, how is it possible by Reasoning to compass His essence? For what Reasoning can reach this? For some persons say that the things that exist are self-caused.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:100
verses.text: Seest thou that unless we have Faith in regard to all things, not only in regard to retribution, but also in regard to the very being of God, all is lost to us?  But many ask whither Enoch was translated, and why he was translated, and why he did not die, neither he nor Elijah, and, if they are still alive, how they live, and in what form.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:101
verses.text: But to ask these things is superfluous.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:102
verses.text: For that the one was translated, and that the other was taken up, the Scriptures have said; but where they are, and how they are, they have not added: For they say nothing more than is necessary.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:103
verses.text: For this indeed took place, I mean his translation, immediately at the beginning, the human soul [thereby] receiving a hope of the destruction of death, and of the overthrow of the devil's tyranny, and that death will be done away; for he was translated, not dead, but "that he should not see death".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:104
verses.text: Therefore he added, he was translated alive, because he was well-pleasing [unto God].

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:105
verses.text: For just as a Father when he has threatened his son, wishes indeed immediately after he has threatened, to relax his threat, but endures and continues resolute, that for a time he may chasten and correct him, allowing the threat to remain firm; so also God, to speak as it were after the manner of men, did not continue resolute, but immediately showed that death is done away.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:106
verses.text: And first He allows death to happen, wishing to terrify the father through the son: For wishing to show that the sentence is verily fixed, He subjected to this punishment not wicked men at once, but him even who was well-pleasing, I mean, the blessed Abel; and almost immediately after him, He translated Enoch.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:107
verses.text: Moreover, He did not raise the former, lest they should immediately grow bold; but He translated the other being yet alive: having excited fear by Abel, but by this latter giving zeal to be well-pleasing unto Him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:108
verses.text: Wherefore they who say that all things are ruled and governed of themselves, and do not expect a reward, are not well-pleasing; as neither are the heathen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:109
verses.text: For "He becomes a rewarder of them that diligently seek Him" by works and by knowledge.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:110
verses.text: Since then we have "a rewarder," let us do all things that we may not be deprived of the rewards of virtue.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:111
verses.text: For indeed the neglecting such a recompense, the scorning such a reward, is worthy of many tears.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:112
verses.text: For as to "those who diligently seek Him," He is a rewarder, so to those who seek Him not, the contrary.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:113
verses.text: "Seek" (He says) "and ye shall find" ( Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:114
verses.text: vii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:115
verses.text: ): but how can we find the Lord? Consider how gold is found; with much labor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:116
verses.text: ["I sought the Lord] with my hands" (it is said) "by night before Him, and I was not deceived" ( Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:117
verses.text: lxxvii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:118
verses.text: See LXX [Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:119
verses.text: lxxvi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:120
verses.text: ]), that is, just as we seek what is lost, so let us seek God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:121
verses.text: Do we not concentrate our mind thereon? Do we not enquire of every one? Do we not travel from home? Do we not promise money?  For instance, suppose that any among us has lost his son, what do we not do? What land, what sea do we not make the circuit of? Do we not reckon money, and houses, and everything else as secondary to the finding him? And should we find him, we cling to him, we hold him fast, we do not let him go.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:122
verses.text: And when we are going to seek anything whatever, we busy ourselves in all ways to find what is sought.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:123
verses.text: How much more ought we to do this in regard to God, as seeking what is indispensable; nay rather, not in the same way, but much more! But since we are weak, at least seek God as thou seekest thy money or thy son.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:124
verses.text: Wilt thou not leave thy home for Him? Hast thou never left thy home for money? Dost thou not busy thyself in all ways? When thou hast found [it], art thou not full of confidence?   "Seek" (He says) "and ye shall find".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:125
verses.text: For things sought after need much care, especially in regard of God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:126
verses.text: For many are the hindrances, many the things that darken, many that impede our perception.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:127
verses.text: For as the sun is manifest, and set forth publicly before all, and we have no need to seek it; but if on the other hand we bury ourselves and turn everything upside down, we need much labor to look at the sun; so truly here also, if we bury ourselves in the depth of evil desires, in the darkness of passions and of the affairs of this life, with difficulty do we look up, with difficulty do we raise our heads, with difficulty do we see clearly.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:128
verses.text: He that is buried underground, in whatever degree he sees upwards, in that degree does he come towards the sun.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:129
verses.text: Let us therefore shake off the earth, let us break through the mist which lies upon us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:130
verses.text: It is thick, and close, and does not allow us to see clearly.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:131
verses.text: And how, you say, is this cloud broken through? If we draw to ourselves the beams of "the sun of righteousness".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:132
verses.text: "The lifting up of my hands" (it is said) "is an evening sacrifice".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:133
verses.text: ( Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:134
verses.text: cxli.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:135
verses.text: ) With our hands let us also lift up our mind: ye who have been initiated know what I mean, perhaps too ye recognize the expression, and see at a glance what I have hinted at.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:136
verses.text: Let us raise up our thoughts on high.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:137
verses.text: I myself know many men almost suspended apart from the earth, and beyond measure stretching up their hands, and out of heart because it is not possible to be lifted into the air, and thus praying with earnestness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:138
verses.text: Thus I would have you always, and if not always, at least very often; and if not very often, at least now and then, at least in the morning, at least in the evening prayers.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:139
verses.text: For, tell me, canst thou not stretch forth the hands? Stretch forth the will, stretch forth as far as thou wilt, yea even to heaven itself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:140
verses.text: Even shouldst thou wish to touch the very summit, even if thou wouldst ascend higher and walk thereon, it is open to thee.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:141
verses.text: For our mind is lighter, and higher than any winged creature.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:142
verses.text: And when it receives grace from the Spirit, O! how swift is it! How quick is it! How does it compass all things! How does it never sink down or fall to the ground! These wings let us provide for ourselves: by means of them shall we be able to fly even across the tempestuous sea of this present life.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:143
verses.text: The swiftest birds fly unhurt over mountains, and woods, and seas, and rocks, in a brief moment of time.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:144
verses.text: Such also is the mind; when it is winged, when it is separated from the things of this life, nothing can lay hold of it, it is higher than all things, even than the fiery darts of the devil.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:145
verses.text: The devil is not so good a marksman, as to be able to reach this height; he sends forth his darts indeed, for he is void of all shame, yet he does not hit the mark; the dart returns to him without effect, and not without effect only, but it [falls] upon his own head.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:146
verses.text: For what is sent forth by him must of necessity strike [something].

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:147
verses.text: As then, that which has been shot out by men, either strikes the person against whom it is directed, or pierces bird, or fence, or garment, or wood, or the mere air, so does the dart of the devil also.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:148
verses.text: It must of necessity strike; and if it strike not him that is shot at, it necessarily strikes him that shoots it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:149
verses.text: And we may learn from many instances, that when we are not hit, without doubt he is hit himself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:150
verses.text: For instance, he plotted against Job: he did not hit him, but was struck himself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:151
verses.text: He plotted against Paul, he did not hit him, but was struck himself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:152
verses.text: If we watch, we may see this happening everywhere.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:153
verses.text: For even when he strikes, he is hit; much more then [when he does not hit].

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:154
verses.text: Let us turn his weapons then against himself, and having armed and fortified ourselves with the shield of faith, let us keep guard with steadfastness, so as to be impregnable.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:155
verses.text: Now the dart of the devil is evil concupiscence.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:156
verses.text: Anger especially is a fire, a flame; it catches, destroys, consumes; let us quench it, by longsuffering, by forbearance.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:157
verses.text: For as red-hot iron dipped into water, loses its fire, so an angry man filling in with a patient one does no harm to the patient man, but rather benefits him, and is himself more thoroughly subdued.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:158
verses.text: For nothing is equal to longsuffering.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:159
verses.text: Such a man is never insulted; but as bodies of adamant are not wounded, so neither are such souls.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:160
verses.text: For they are above the reach of the darts.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:161
verses.text: The longsuffering man is high, and so high as not to receive a wound from the shot.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:162
verses.text: When one is furious, laugh; but do not laugh openly, lest thou irritate him: but laugh mentally on his account.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:163
verses.text: For in the case of children, when they strike us passionately, as though forsooth they were avenging themselves, we laugh.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:164
verses.text: If then thou laugh, there will be as great difference between thee and him, as between a child and a man: but if thou art furious thou hast made thyself a child.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:165
verses.text: For the angry are more senseless than children.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:166
verses.text: If one look at a furious child, does he not laugh at him? "The poor-spirited" (it is said) "is mightily simple".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:167
verses.text: ( Prov.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:168
verses.text: xiv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:169
verses.text: ) The simple then is a child: and "he who is longsuffering" (it is said) "is abundant in wisdom".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 23:170
verses.text: This "abundant wisdom" then let us follow after, that we may attain to the good things promised us in Christ Jesus our Lord, with whom to the Father together with the Holy Ghost, be glory, power, honor, now and for ever and world without end, Amen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:1
verses.text: Homily XXIII.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:2
verses.text: Hebrews xi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:3
verses.text: "By faith Noah, being warned of God of things not seen as yet, moved with fear, prepared an ark to the saving of his house; by the which he condemned the world, and became heir of the righteousness which is by Faith".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:4
verses.text: "By faith" (he says) "Noah being warned of God".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:5
verses.text: As the Son of God, speaking of His own coming, said, "In the days of Noah they married and were given in marriage" ( Luke xvii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:6
verses.text: ,  ), therefore the Apostle also recalled to their mind an appropriate image.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:7
verses.text: For the example of Enoch, was an example only of Faith; that of Noah, on the other hand, of unbelief also.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:8
verses.text: And this is a complete consolation and exhortation, when not only believers are found approved, but also unbelievers suffer the opposite.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:9
verses.text: For what does he say? "By faith being warned of God".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:10
verses.text: What is "being warned of God"? It is, "It having been foretold to him".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:11
verses.text: But why is the expression "divine communication" ( Luke ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:12
verses.text: ) used? for in another place also it is said, "and it was communicated to him by the Spirit," and again, "and what saith the divine communication?" ( Rom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:13
verses.text: xi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:14
verses.text: ) Seest thou the equal dignity of the Spirit? For as God reveals, so also does the Holy Spirit.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:15
verses.text: But why did he speak thus? The prophecy is called "a divine communication".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:16
verses.text: "Of things not seen as yet," he says, that is of the rain.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:17
verses.text: "Moved with fear, prepared an ark".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:18
verses.text: Reason indeed suggested nothing of this sort; For "they were marrying and being given in marriage"; the air was clear, there were no signs [of change]: but nevertheless he feared: "By faith" (he says) "Noah being warned of God of things not seen as yet, moved with fear, prepared an ark to the saving of his house".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:19
verses.text: How is it, "By the which he condemned the world"? He showed them to be worthy of punishment, since they were not brought to their senses even by the preparation.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:20
verses.text: "And he became" (he says) "heir of the righteousness which is by Faith": that is, by his believing God he was shown to be righteous.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:21
verses.text: For this is the [part] of a soul sincerely disposed towards Him and judging nothing more reliable than His words, just as Unbelief is the very contrary.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:22
verses.text: Faith, it is manifest, works righteousness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:23
verses.text: For as we have been warned of God respecting Hell, so was he also: and yet at that time he was laughed at; he was reviled and ridiculed; but he regarded none of these things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:24
verses.text: ( Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:25
verses.text: ,  ) "By faith Abraham when he was called to go out into a place which he should after receive for an inheritance, obeyed; and he went out not knowing whither he went.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:26
verses.text: By faith he sojourned in the land of promise, as in a strange country, dwelling in tabernacles, with Isaac and Jacob, the heirs with him of the same promise".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:27
verses.text: ["By faith"]: for (tell me) whom did he see to emulate?  He had for father a Gentile, and an idolater; he had heard no prophets; he knew not whither he was going.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:28
verses.text: For as they of the Hebrews who believed, looked to these [patriarchs] as having enjoyed blessings innumerable, he shows that none of them obtained anything as yet; all are unrewarded; no one as yet received his reward.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:29
verses.text: "He" escaped from his country and his home, and "went out not knowing whither he went".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:30
verses.text: And what marvel, if he himself [were so], when his seed also dwelt in this same way? For seeing the promise disproved (since He had said, "To thee will I give this land, and to thy seed"— Gen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:31
verses.text: xii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:32
verses.text: ; xiii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:33
verses.text: ), he saw his son dwelling there; and again his grandson saw himself dwelling in a land not his own; yet was he nowise troubled.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:34
verses.text: For the affairs of Abraham happened as we might have expected, since the promise was to be accomplished afterwards in his family (although it is said even to himself, "To thee, and to thy seed," not, "to thee through thy seed," but "to thee and to thy seed"): still neither he, nor Isaac, nor Jacob, enjoyed the promise.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:35
verses.text: For one of them served for hire, and the other was driven out: and he himself even was failing through fear: and while he took some things indeed in war, others, unless he had had the aid of God, would have been destroyed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:36
verses.text: On this account [the Apostle] says, "with the heirs of the same promise"; not himself alone, he means; but the heirs also.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:37
verses.text: ( Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:38
verses.text: ) "These all died in faith," he says, "not having obtained the promises".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:39
verses.text: At this place it is worth while to make two enquiries; how, after saying that [God] "translated Enoch, and he was not found, so that he did not see death," does he say, "These all died in Faith".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:40
verses.text: And again, after saying, "they not having obtained the promises," he declares that Noah had received a reward, "to the saving of his house," and that Enoch had been "translated," and that Abel "yet speaks," and that Abraham had gained a hold on the land, and yet he says, "These all died in Faith, not having obtained the promises".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:41
verses.text: What then is [meant]?  It is necessary to solve the first [difficulty], and then the second.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:42
verses.text: "These all" (he says) "died in faith".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:43
verses.text: The word "all" is used here not because all had died, but because with that one exception "all these had died," whom we know to be dead.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:44
verses.text: And the [statement] "not having obtained the promises," is true: for surely the promise to Noah was not to be this [which is here spoken of].

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:45
verses.text: But further, of what kind of "promises" is he speaking? For Isaac and Jacob received the promises of the land; but as to Noah and Abel and Enoch, what kind of promises did they receive? Either then he is speaking concerning these three; or if concerning those others also, the promise was not this, that Abel should be admired, nor that Enoch should be translated, nor that Noah should be preserved; but these things came to them for their virtue's sake, and were a sort of foretaste of things to come.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:46
verses.text: For God from the beginning, knowing that the human race needs much condescension, bestows on us not only the things in the world to come, but also those here; as for instance, Christ said even to the disciples, "Whosoever hath left houses, or brethren, or sisters, or father, or mother, shall receive an hundredfold and shall inherit everlasting life".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:47
verses.text: ( Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:48
verses.text: xix.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:49
verses.text: ) And again, "Seek ye the kingdom of God, and all these things shall be added unto you".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:50
verses.text: ( Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:51
verses.text: vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:52
verses.text: ) Seest thou that these things are given by Him in the way of addition, that we might not faint? For as the athletes have the benefit of careful attention, even when engaged in the combat, but do not then enjoy entire ease, living under rules, yet afterwards they enjoy it entire: so God also does not grant us here to partake of "entire" ease.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:53
verses.text: For even here He does give [some].

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:54
verses.text: "But having seen them afar off," he says, "and embraced them".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:55
verses.text: Here he hints at something mystical: that they received beforehand all the things which have been spoken concerning things to come; concerning the resurrection, concerning the Kingdom of Heaven, concerning the other things, which Christ proclaimed when He came, for these are "the promises" of which he speaks.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:56
verses.text: Either then he means this, or, that they did not indeed receive them, but died in confidence respecting them, and they were [thus] confident through Faith only.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:57
verses.text: "Having seen them afar off": four generations before; for after so many [generations], they went up out of Egypt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:58
verses.text: "And embraced them," saith he, and were glad.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:59
verses.text: They were so persuaded of them as even to "embrace [or "salute"] them," from the metaphor of persons on ship-board seeing from afar the longed-for cities: which, before they enter them, they take and occupy by words of greeting.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:60
verses.text: ( Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:61
verses.text: ) "For they looked" (he says) "for the city which hath foundations, whose builder and maker is God".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:62
verses.text: Seest thou that they received them in this sense, in their already accepting them and being confident respecting them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:63
verses.text: If then to be confident is to receive, it is in your power also to receive.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:64
verses.text: For these, although they enjoyed not those [blessings], yet still saw them by their longing desire.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:65
verses.text: Why now do these things happen? That we might be put to shame, in that they indeed, when things on earth were promised them, regarded them not, but sought the future "city": whereas God again and again speaks to us of the city which is above, and yet we seek that which is here.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:66
verses.text: He said to them, I will give you the things of the present [world].

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:67
verses.text: But when He saw, or rather, when they showed themselves worthy of greater things, then He no longer suffers them to receive these, but those greater ones; wishing to show us that they are worthy of greater things, being unwilling to be bound to these.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:68
verses.text: As if one should promise playthings to an intelligent child, not that he might receive them, but by way of exhibiting his philosophy, when he asks for things more important.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:69
verses.text: For this is to show, that they held off from the land with so great earnestness, that they did not even accept what was given.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:70
verses.text: Wherefore their posterity receive it on this account, for themselves were worthy of the land.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:71
verses.text: What is, "the city which hath foundations"? For are not these [which are visible] "foundations"? In comparison of the other, they are not.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:72
verses.text: "Whose Builder and Maker is God".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:73
verses.text: O! What an encomium on that city!   ( Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:74
verses.text: ) "By faith also Sarah herself," he says.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:75
verses.text: Here he began [speaking] in a way to put them to shame, in case, that is, they should show themselves more faint-hearted than a woman.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:76
verses.text: But possibly some one might say, How "by faith," when she laughed? Nay, while her laughter indeed was from unbelief, her fear [was] from Faith, for to say, "I laughed not" ( Gen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:77
verses.text: xviii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:78
verses.text: ), arose from Faith.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:79
verses.text: From this then it appears that when unbelief had been cleared out, Faith came in its place.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:80
verses.text: "By faith also Sarah received strength to conceive seed even when she was past age".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:81
verses.text: What is, "to conceive seed"? She who was become dead, who was barren, received power for the retaining of seed, for conception.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:82
verses.text: For her imperfection was two-fold; first from her time of life for she was really old; secondly from nature, for she was barren.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:83
verses.text: ( Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:84
verses.text: ) "Wherefore even from one they" all "sprang, as the stars of the sky, and as the sand which is by the sea-shore".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:85
verses.text: "Wherefore" (he says) "even from one they" all "sprang".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:86
verses.text: Here he not only says that she bare [a child], but that she also became mother of so many as not even fruitful wombs [are mothers of].

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:87
verses.text: "As the stars," He says.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:88
verses.text: How then is it that He often numbers them, although He said, "As the stars of the heaven shall not be numbered, so neither shall your seed"? ( Gen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:89
verses.text: xv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:90
verses.text: ) He either means the excess, or else [speaks of] those who are continually being born.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:91
verses.text: For is it possible, tell me, to number their forefathers of one family as, such an one son of such an one, and such an one son of such an one? But here such are the promises of God, so skillfully arranged are His undertakings.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:92
verses.text: But if the things which He promised as additional, are so admirable, so beyond expectation, so magnificent, what will those be, to which these are an addition, to which these are somewhat over and above? What then can be more blessed than they who attain them? What more wretched than those who miss them? For if a man when driven out from his native country, is pitied by all; and when he has lost an inheritance is considered by all as an object of compassion, with what tears ought he to be bewailed, who fails of Heaven, and of the good things there stored up? Or rather, he is not even to be wept for: for one is wept for, when he suffers something of which he is not himself the cause; but when of his own choice he has entangled himself in evil, he is not worthy of tears, but of wailings; or rather then of mourning; since even our Lord Jesus Christ mourned and wept for Jerusalem, impious as it was.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:93
verses.text: Truly we are worthy of weepings innumerable, of wailings innumerable.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:94
verses.text: If the whole world should receive a voice, both stones, and wood, and trees, and wild beasts, and birds, and fishes, and in a word, the whole world, if receiving a voice it should bewail us who have failed of those good things, it would not bewail and lament enough.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:95
verses.text: For what language, what intellect, can represent that blessedness and virtue, that pleasure, that glory, that happiness, that splendor? "What eye hath not seen, and ear hath not heard, and what hath not entered into the heart of man" (  Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:96
verses.text: ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:97
verses.text: ), (he did not say, that they simply surpass [what we imagine]; but none hath ever conceived) "the things which God hath prepared for them that love Him".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:98
verses.text: For of what kind are those good things likely to be, of which God is the Preparer and Establisher? For if immediately after He had made us, when we had not yet done anything, He freely bestowed so great [favors], Paradise, familiar intercourse with Himself, promised us immortality, a life happy and freed from cares; what will He not bestow on those who have labored and struggled so greatly, and endured on His behalf? For us He spared not His Only Begotten, for us when we were enemies He gave up His own Son to death; of what will He not count us worthy, having become His friends? what will He not impart to us, having reconciled us to Himself?   He both is abundantly and infinitely rich; and He desires and earnestly endeavors to obtain our friendship; we do not thus earnestly endeavor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:99
verses.text: What am I saying, 'do not earnestly endeavor'? We do not wish to obtain the good things as He wishes it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:100
verses.text: And what He has done shows that He wishes it more [than we].

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:101
verses.text: For while, for our own sake, we with difficulty think lightly of a little gold: He, for our sake, gave even the Son who was His own.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:102
verses.text: Let us make use of the love of God as we ought; let us reap the fruits of His friendship.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:103
verses.text: For "ye are My friends" (he says) "if ye do what I say to you".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:104
verses.text: ( John xv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:105
verses.text: ) How wonderful! His enemies, who were at an infinite distance from Him, whom in all respects He excels by an incomparable superiority, these He has made His friends and calls them friends.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:106
verses.text: What then should not one choose to suffer for the sake of this friendship? For the friendship of men we often incur danger, but for that of God, we do not even give up money.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:107
verses.text: Our [condition] does indeed call for mourning, for mourning and tears and wailings, and loud lamentation and beating of the breast.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:108
verses.text: We have fallen from our hope, we are humbled from our high estate, we have shown ourselves unworthy of the honor of God; even after His benefits we are become unfeeling, and ungrateful.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:109
verses.text: The devil has stripped us of all our good things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:110
verses.text: We who were counted worthy to be sons; we His brethren and fellow-heirs are come to differ nothing from His enemies that insult Him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:111
verses.text: Henceforward, what consolation shall there be for us? He called us to Heaven, and we have thrust ourselves down to hell.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:112
verses.text: "Swearing and lying and stealing and adultery, are poured out upon the earth".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:113
verses.text: ( Hos.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:114
verses.text: iv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:115
verses.text: ) Some "mingle blood upon blood"; and others do deeds worse than blood-shedding.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:116
verses.text: Many of those that are wronged, many of those that are defrauded prefer ten thousand deaths to the suffering such things: and except they had feared God, would even have killed themselves, being so murderously disposed against themselves.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:117
verses.text: Are not these things then worse than blood-shedding?   "Woe is me, my soul! For the godly man is perished from the earth, and there is none upright among men" ( Mic.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:118
verses.text: vii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:119
verses.text: ,  , LXX.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:120
verses.text: ); let us also now cry out, first about our own selves: but aid me in my lamentation.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:121
verses.text: Perhaps some are even disgusted and laugh.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:122
verses.text: For this very cause ought we to make our lamentations the more intense, because we are so mad and beside ourselves, that we do not know that we are mad, but laugh at things for which we ought to groan.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:123
verses.text: O man! "There is wrath revealed from heaven against all ungodliness and unrighteousness of men" ( Rom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:124
verses.text: i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:125
verses.text: ); "God will come manifestly: a fire will burn before Him, and round about Him will be a mighty tempest".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:126
verses.text: ( Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:127
verses.text: l.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:128
verses.text: ) "A fire will burn before Him, and consume His enemies on every side".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:129
verses.text: ( Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:130
verses.text: xcvii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:131
verses.text: ) "The day of the Lord is as a burning oven".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:132
verses.text: ( Mal.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:133
verses.text: iv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:134
verses.text: ) And no man lays up these things in his mind, but these tremendous and fearful doctrines are more despised than fables, and are trodden under foot.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:135
verses.text: He that heareth,—there is no one: while they who laugh and make sport are—all.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:136
verses.text: What resource will there be for us? Whence shall we find safety? "We are undone, we are utterly consumed" ( Num.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:137
verses.text: xvii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:138
verses.text: ), we are become the laughingstock of our enemies, and a mockery for the heathen and the Demons.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:139
verses.text: Now is the devil greatly elated; he glories and is glad.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:140
verses.text: The angels to whom we had been entrusted are all ashamed and in sadness: there is no man to convert [you]: all means have been used by us in vain, and we seem to you as idle talkers.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:141
verses.text: It is seasonable even now to call on the heaven, because there is no man that heareth; to take to witness the elements: "Hear, O heaven! and give ear, O earth! for the Lord hath spoken".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:142
verses.text: ( Isa.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:143
verses.text: i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:144
verses.text: )  Give a hand, stretch it forth, O ye who have not yet been overwhelmed, to them who are undone through their drunkenness: ye that are whole to them that are sick, ye that are sober-minded to them that are mad, that are giddily whirling round.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:145
verses.text: Let no man, I beseech you, prefer the favor of his friend to his salvation; and let violence and rebuke look to one thing only,—his benefit.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:146
verses.text: When one has been seized by a fever, even slaves lay hold of their Masters.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:147
verses.text: For when that is pressing on him, throwing his mind into confusion, and a swarm of slaves are standing by, they recognize not the law of Master and Servant, in the calamity of the Master.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:148
verses.text: Let us collect ourselves, I exhort you: there are daily wars, submersions [of towns], destructions innumerable all around us, and on every side the wrath of God is enclosing us as in a net.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:149
verses.text: And we, as though we were well-pleasing to Him, are in security.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:150
verses.text: We all make our hands ready for unjust gains, none for helping others: all for plundering, none for protecting: each one is in earnest as to how he shall increase his possessions; no one as to how he shall aid the needy: each one has much anxiety how he may add to his wealth; no one how he may save his own soul.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:151
verses.text: One fear possesses all, lest (you say) we should become poor; no man is in anguish and trembling lest we should fall into hell.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:152
verses.text: These things call for lamentations, these call for accusation, these call for reprobation.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:153
verses.text: But I do not wish to speak of these things, but I am constrained by my grief.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:154
verses.text: Forgive me: I am forced by sorrow to utter many things, even those which I do not wish.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:155
verses.text: I see that our wound is grievous, that our calamity is beyond comfort, that woes have overtaken us greater than the consolation.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:156
verses.text: We are undone.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:157
verses.text: "O that my head were waters and mine eyes a fountain of tears" ( Jer.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:158
verses.text: ix.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:159
verses.text: ), that I might lament.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:160
verses.text: Let us weep, beloved, let us weep, let us groan.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:161
verses.text: Possibly there may be some here who say, He talks to us of nothing but lamentation, nothing but tears.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:162
verses.text: It was not my wish, believe me, it was not my wish, but rather to go through a course of commendations and praises: but now it is not the season for these.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:163
verses.text: Beloved, it is not lamenting which is grievous, but the doing things which call for lamentations.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:164
verses.text: Sorrow is not the thing to shrink from, but the committing things that call for sorrow.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:165
verses.text: Do not thou be punished, and I will not mourn.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:166
verses.text: Do not die, and I will not weep.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:167
verses.text: If the body indeed lies dead, thou callest on all to grieve with thee, and thinkest those without sympathy who do not mourn: And when the soul is perishing, dost thou tell us not to mourn?  But I cannot be a father, if I do not weep.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:168
verses.text: I am a father full of affection.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:169
verses.text: Hear how Paul exclaims, "My little children, of whom I travail in birth again" ( Gal.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:170
verses.text: iv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:171
verses.text: ): what mother in child-birth utters cries so bitter as he! Would that it were possible for thee to see the very fire that is in my heart, and thou wouldest know, that I burn [with grief] more intense than any woman, or gift that suffers untimely widowhood.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:172
verses.text: She does not so mourn over her husband, nor any father over his son, as I do over this multitude that is here with us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:173
verses.text: I see no progress.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:174
verses.text: Everything turns to calumnies and accusations.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:175
verses.text: No man makes it his business to please God; but (he says) 'let us speak evil of such an one or such an one.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:176
verses.text: ' 'Such an one is unfit to be among the Clergy.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:177
verses.text: ' 'Such an one does not lead a respectable life.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:178
verses.text: ' When we ought to be grieving for our own evils, we judge others, whereas we ought not to do this, even when we are pure from sins.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:179
verses.text: "For who maketh thee to differ" (he says) "and what hast thou which thou didst not receive? But if thou hast received it, why dost thou glory, as though thou hadst not received it?" (  Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:180
verses.text: iv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:181
verses.text: ) "And thou, why dost thou judge thy brother" ( Rom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:182
verses.text: xiv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:183
verses.text: ), being thyself full of innumerable evils? When thou sayest, Such an one is a bad man, and a spendthrift, and vicious, think of thyself, and examine strictly thy own [condition], and thou wilt repent of what thou hast said.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:184
verses.text: For there is no, no not any, such powerful stimulus to virtue, as the recollecting of our sins.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:185
verses.text: If we turn over these two things in our minds, we shall be enabled to attain the promised blessings, we shall be enabled to cleanse ourselves and wipe away [what is amiss].

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:186
verses.text: Only let us take serious thought sometime; let us be anxious about the matter, beloved.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:187
verses.text: Let us grieve here in reflection, that we may not grieve yonder in punishment, but may enjoy the everlasting blessings, where "pain and sorrow and sighing are fled away" ( Isa.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:188
verses.text: xxxv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 24:189
verses.text: ), that we may attain to the good things which surpass man's understanding, in Christ Jesus our Lord, for to Him is glory and power for ever and ever, Amen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 25:1
verses.text: Homily XXIV.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 25:2
verses.text: Hebrews xi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 25:3
verses.text: –  "These all died in faith, not having received the promises, but having seen them afar off, and embraced them, and confessed that they were strangers and pilgrims on the earth.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 25:4
verses.text: For they that say such things, declare plainly that they seek a country.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 25:5
verses.text: And truly if they had been mindful of that country from whence they came out, they might have had opportunity to have returned.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 25:6
verses.text: But now they desire a better country, that is, an heavenly; wherefore God is not ashamed to be called their God, for He hath prepared for them a city".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 25:7
verses.text: The first virtue, yea the whole of virtue, is to be a stranger to this world, and a sojourner, and to have nothing in common with things here, but to hang loose from them, as from things strange to us; As those blessed disciples did, of whom he says, "They wandered about in sheepskins, and in goat-skins, being destitute, afflicted, tormented: of whom the world was not worthy".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 25:9
verses.text: xi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 25:11
