verses.text: "Lest there be any fornicator," he says, then, "follow after holiness: lest there be any, as Esau, profane": that is, gluttonous, without self-control, worldly, selling away things spiritual.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:41
verses.text: "Who for one morsel of meat sold his birthright," who through his own slothfulness sold this honor which he had from God, and for a little pleasure, lost the greatest honor and glory.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:42
verses.text: This was suitable to them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:43
verses.text: This [was the conduct] of an abominable, of an unclean person.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:44
verses.text: So that not only is the fornicator unclean, but also the glutton, the slave of his belly.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:45
verses.text: For he also is a slave of a different pleasure.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:46
verses.text: He is forced to be overreaching, he is forced to be rapacious, to behave himself unseemly in ten thousand ways, being the slave of that passion, and oftentimes he blasphemes.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:47
verses.text: So he accounted "his birthright" to be nothing worth.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:48
verses.text: That is, providing for temporary refreshment, he went even to the [sacrifice of his] "birthright".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:49
verses.text: So henceforth "the birthright" belongs to us, not to the Jews.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:50
verses.text: And at the same time also this is added to their calamity, that the first is become last, and the second, first: the one, for courageous endurance; the other last for indolence.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:51
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:52
verses.text: "For ye know" (he says) "how that afterward, when he would have inherited the blessing, he was rejected.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:53
verses.text: For he found no place of repentance, though he sought it carefully with tears".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:54
verses.text: What now is this? Doth he indeed exclude repentance? By no means.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:55
verses.text: 'But how, you say, was it that "he found no place of repentance"?' For if he condemned himself, if he made a great wailing, why did he "find no place of repentance"? Because it was not really a case of repentance.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:56
verses.text: For as the grief of Cain was not of repentance, and the murder proved it; so also in this case, his words were not those of repentance, and the murder afterwards proved it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:57
verses.text: For even he also in intention slew Jacob.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:58
verses.text: For "The days of mourning for my father," he said, "are at hand; then will I slay my brother Jacob".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:59
verses.text: ( Gen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:60
verses.text: xxvii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:61
verses.text: ) "Tears" had not power to give him "repentance".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:62
verses.text: And [the Apostle] did not say "by repentance" simply, but even "with tears, he found no place of repentance".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:63
verses.text: Why now? Because he did not repent as he ought, for this is repentance; he repented not as it behoved him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:64
verses.text: For how is it that he [the Apostle] said this? How did he exhort them again after they had become "sluggish" ( c.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:65
verses.text: vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:66
verses.text: )? How, when they were become "lame"? How, when they were "paralyzed" ( ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:67
verses.text: )? How, when they were "relaxed" ( ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:68
verses.text: )? For this is the beginning of a fall.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:69
verses.text: He seems to me to hint at some fornicators amongst them, but not to wish at that time to correct them: but feigns ignorance that they might correct themselves.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:70
verses.text: For it is right at first indeed to pretend ignorance: but afterwards, when they continue [in sin], then to add reproof also, that so they may not become shameless.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:71
verses.text: Which Moses also did in the case of Zimri and the daughter of Cosbi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:72
verses.text: "For he found" (he says) "no place of repentance," he found not repentance; or that he sinned beyond repentance.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:73
verses.text: There are then sins beyond repentance.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:74
verses.text: His meaning is, Let us not fall by an incurable fall.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:75
verses.text: So long as it is a matter of lameness, it is easy to become upright: but if we turn out of the way, what will be left? For it is to those who have not yet fallen that he thus discourses, striking them with terror, and says that it is not possible for him who is fallen to obtain consolation; but to those who have fallen, that they may not fall into despair, he says the contrary, speaking thus, "My little children, of whom I travail in birth again, until Christ he formed in you".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:76
verses.text: ( Gal.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:77
verses.text: iv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:78
verses.text: ) And again, "Whosoever of you are justified by the Law, are fallen from Grace".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:79
verses.text: ( Gal.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:80
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:81
verses.text: ) Lo! he testifies that they had fallen away.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:82
verses.text: For he that standeth, hearing that it is not possible to obtain pardon after having fallen, will be more zealous, and more cautious about his standing: if however thou use the same violence towards one also who is fallen, he will never rise again.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:83
verses.text: For by what hope will he show forth the change?  But he not only wept (you say), but also "sought earnestly".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:84
verses.text: He does not then exclude repentance; but makes them careful not to fall.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:85
verses.text: As many then as do not believe in Hell, let them call these things to mind: as many as think to sin without being punished, let them take account of these things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:86
verses.text: Why did Esau not obtain pardon? Because he repented not as he ought.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:87
verses.text: Wouldest thou see perfect repentance? Hear of the repentance of Peter after his denial.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:88
verses.text: For the Evangelist in relating to us the things concerning him, says, "And he went out and wept bitterly".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:89
verses.text: ( Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:90
verses.text: xxvi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:91
verses.text: ) Therefore even such a sin was forgiven him, because he repented as he ought.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:92
verses.text: Although the Victim had not yet been offered, nor had The Sacrifice as yet been made, nor was sin as yet-taken away, it still had the rule and sovereignty.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:93
verses.text: And that thou mayest learn, that this denial [arose] not so much from sloth, as from His being forsaken of God, who was teaching him to know the measures of man and not to contradict the sayings of the Master, nor to be more high-minded than the rest, but to know that nothing can be done without God, and that "Except the Lord build the house, they labor in vain who build it" ( Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:94
verses.text: cxxvii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:95
verses.text: ): therefore also Christ said to him alone, "Satan desired to sift thee as wheat," and I allowed it not, "that thy faith may not fail".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:96
verses.text: ( Luke xxii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:98
verses.text: ) For since it was likely that he would be high-minded, being conscious to himself that he loved Christ more than they all, therefore "he wept bitterly"; and he did other things after his weeping, of the same character.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:99
verses.text: For what did he do? After this he exposed himself to dangers innumerable, and by many means showed his manliness and courage.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:100
verses.text: Judas also repented, but in an evil way: for he hanged himself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:101
verses.text: Esau too repented; as I said; or rather, he did not even repent; for his tears were not [tears] of repentance, but rather of pride and wrath.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:102
verses.text: And what followed proved this.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:103
verses.text: The blessed David repented, thus saying, "Every night will I wash my bed: I will water my couch with my tears".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:104
verses.text: ( Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:105
verses.text: vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:106
verses.text: ) And the sin which had been committed long ago, after so many years, after so many generations he bewailed, as if it had recently occurred.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:107
verses.text: For he who repents ought not to be angry, nor to be fierce, but to be contrite, as one condemned, as not having boldness, as one on whom sentence has been passed, as one who ought to be saved by mercy alone, as one who has shown himself ungrateful toward his Benefactor, as unthankful, as reprobate, as worthy of punishments innumerable.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:108
verses.text: If he considers these things, he will not be angry, he will not be indignant, but will mourn, will weep, will groan, and lament night and day.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:109
verses.text: He that is penitent ought never to forget his sin, but on the one hand, to beseech God not to remember it; while on the other, he himself never forgets it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:110
verses.text: If we remember it, God will forget it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:111
verses.text: Let us exact punishment from ourselves; let us accuse ourselves; thus shall we propitiate the Judge.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:112
verses.text: For sin confessed becomes less, but not confessed worse.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:113
verses.text: For if sin add to itself shamelessness and ingratitude, how will he who does not know that he sinned before be at all able to guard himself from falling again into the same [evils]?  Let us then not deny [our sins], I beseech you, nor be shameless, that we may not unwillingly pay the penalty.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:114
verses.text: Cain heard God say, "Where is Abel thy brother? And he said, I know not; am I my brother's keeper?" ( Gen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:115
verses.text: iv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:116
verses.text: ) Seest thou how this made his sin more grievous? But his father did not act thus.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:117
verses.text: What then? When he heard, "Adam, where art thou?" ( Gen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:118
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:119
verses.text: ), he said, "I heard Thy voice, and I was afraid, because I am naked, and I hid myself".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:120
verses.text: ( Gen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:121
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:122
verses.text: ) It is a great good to acknowledge our sins, and to bear them in mind continually.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:123
verses.text: Nothing so effectually cures a fault, as a continual remembrance of it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:124
verses.text: Nothing makes a man so slow to wickedness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:125
verses.text: I know that conscience starts back, and endures not to be scourged by the remembrance of evil deeds; but hold tight thy soul and place a muzzle on it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:126
verses.text: For like an ill-broken horse, so it bears impatiently [what is put upon it], and is unwilling to persuade itself that it has sinned: but all this is the work of Satan.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:127
verses.text: But let us persuade it that it has sinned; let us persuade it that it has sinned, that it may also repent, in order that having repented it may escape torment.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:128
verses.text: How dost thou think to obtain pardon for thy sins, tell me, when thou hast not yet confessed them? Assuredly he is worthy of compassion and kindness who has sinned.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:129
verses.text: But thou who hast not yet persuaded thyself [that thou hast sinned], how dost thou think to be pitied, when thou art thus without shame for some things?  Let us persuade ourselves that we have sinned.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:130
verses.text: Let us say it not with the tongue only, but also with the mind.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:131
verses.text: Let us not call ourselves sinners, but also count over our sins, going over them each specifically.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:132
verses.text: I do not say to thee, Make a parade of thyself, nor accuse thyself before others: but be persuaded by the prophet when he saith, "Reveal thy way unto the Lord".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:133
verses.text: ( Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:134
verses.text: xxxvii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:135
verses.text: ) Confess these things before God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:136
verses.text: Confess before the Judge thy sins with prayer; if not with tongue, yet in memory, and be worthy of mercy.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:137
verses.text: If thou keep thy sins continually in remembrance, thou wilt never bear in mind the wrongs of thy neighbor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:138
verses.text: I do not say, if thou art persuaded that thou art thyself a sinner; this does not avail so to humble the soul, as sins themselves [taken] by themselves, and examined specifically.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:139
verses.text: Thou wilt have no remembrance of wrongs [done thee], if thou hast these things continually in remembrance; thou wilt feel no anger, thou wilt not revile, thou wilt have no high thoughts, thou wilt not fall again into the same [sins], thou wilt be more earnest towards good things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:140
verses.text: Seest thou how many excellent [effects] are produced from the remembrance of our sins? Let us then write them in our minds.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:141
verses.text: I know that the soul does not endure a recollection which is so bitter: but let us constrain and force it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:142
verses.text: It is better that it should be gnawed with the remembrance now, than at that time with vengeance.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:143
verses.text: Now, if thou remember them, and continually present them before God (see p.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:144
verses.text: ), and pray for them, thou wilt speedily blot them out; but if thou forget them now, thou wilt then be reminded of them even against thy will, when they are brought out publicly before the whole world, displayed before all, both friends and enemies, and Angels.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:145
verses.text: For surely He did not say to David only, "What thou didst secretly, I will make manifest to" (  Sam.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:146
verses.text: xii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:147
verses.text: ) all, but even to us all.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:148
verses.text: Thou wert afraid of men (he said) and respected them more than God; and God seeing thee, thou caredst not, but wert ashamed before men.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:149
verses.text: For it says, "the eyes of men, this is their fear".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:150
verses.text: Therefore thou shalt suffer punishment in that very point; for I will reprove thee, setting thy sins before the eyes of all.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:151
verses.text: For that this is true, and that in that day the sins of us all are [to be] publicly displayed, unless we now do them away by continual remembrance, hear how cruelty and inhumanity are publicly exposed, "I was an hungered" (He says) "and ye gave Me no meat".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:152
verses.text: ( Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:153
verses.text: xxv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:154
verses.text: ) When are these things said? Is it in a corner? Is it in a secret place? By no means.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:155
verses.text: When then? "When the Son of Man shall come in His glory" ( Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:156
verses.text: xxv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:157
verses.text: ,  ), and "all the nations" are gathered together, when He has separated the one from the other, then will He speak in the audience of all, and will "set" them "on His right hand" and "on" His "left" ( Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:158
verses.text: xxv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:159
verses.text: ): "I was an hungered and ye gave Me no meat".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:160
verses.text: See again the five virgins also, hearing before all, "I know you not".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:161
verses.text: ( Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:162
verses.text: xxv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:163
verses.text: ) For the five and five do not set forth the number of five only, but those virgins who are wicked and cruel and inhuman, and those who are not such.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:164
verses.text: So also he that buried his one talent, heard before all, even of those who had brought the five and the two, "Thou wicked and slothful servant".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:165
verses.text: ( Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:166
verses.text: xxv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:167
verses.text: ) But not by words alone, but by deeds also does He then convict them: even as the Evangelist also says, "They shall look on Him whom they pierced".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:168
verses.text: ( John xix.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:169
verses.text: ) For the resurrection shall be of all at the same time, of sinners and of the righteous.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:170
verses.text: At the same time shall He be present to all in the judgment.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:171
verses.text: Consider therefore who they are who shall then be in dismay, who in grief, who dragged away to the fire, while the others are crowned.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:172
verses.text: "Come" (He says), "ye blessed of My Father, inherit the kingdom which hath been prepared for you from the foundation of the world".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:173
verses.text: ( Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:174
verses.text: xxv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:175
verses.text: ) And again, "Depart from Me into the fire which hath been prepared for the devil and his angels".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:176
verses.text: ( Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:177
verses.text: xxv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:178
verses.text: )  Let us not merely hear the words but write them also before our sight, and let us imagine Him to be now present and saying these things, and that we are led away to that fire.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:179
verses.text: What heart shall we have? What consolation? And what, when we are cut asunder? And what when we are accused of rapacity? What excuse shall we have to utter? What specious argument? None: but of necessity bound, bending down, we must be dragged to the mouths of the furnace, to the river of fire, to the darkness, to then ever-dying punishments, and entreat no one.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:180
verses.text: For it is not, it is not possible, He says, to pass across from this side to that: for "there is a great gulf betwixt us and you" ( Luke xvi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:181
verses.text: ),and it is not possible even for those who wish it to go across, and stretch out a helping hand: but we must needs burn continually, no one aiding us, even should it be father or mother, or any whosoever, yea though he have much boldness toward God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:182
verses.text: For, it says, "A brother doth not redeem; shall man redeem?" ( Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:183
verses.text: xlix.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:184
verses.text: )  Since then it is not possible to have one's hopes of salvation in another, but [it must be] in one's self after the lovingkindness of God, let us do all things, I entreat you, so that our conduct may be pure, and our course of life the best, and that it may not receive any stain even from the beginning.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:185
verses.text: But if not, at all events, let us not sleep after the stain, but continue always washing away the pollution by repentance, by tears, by prayers, by works of mercy.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:186
verses.text: What then, you say, if I cannot do works of mercy? But thou hast "a cup of cold water" ( Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:187
verses.text: x.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:188
verses.text: ), however poor thou art.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:189
verses.text: But thou hast "two mites" ( Mark xii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:190
verses.text: ), in whatever poverty thou art; but thou hast feet, so as to visit the sick, so as to enter into a prison; but thou hast a roof, so as to receive strangers.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:191
verses.text: For there is no pardon, no, none for him who does not do works of mercy.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:192
verses.text: These things we say to you continually, that we may effect if it be but a little by the continued repetition: these things we say, not caring so much for those who receive the benefits, as for yourselves.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 32:193
verses.text: For ye give to them indeed things here, but in return you receive heavenly things: which may we all obtain, in Christ Jesus our Lord, with whom to the Father be glory, together with the Holy Ghost, now and ever, and world without end, Amen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:1
verses.text: Homily XXXII.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:2
verses.text: Hebrews xii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:3
verses.text: –  "For ye are not come unto a fire that might be touched and that burned, and unto blackness, and darkness, and tempest, and the sound of a trumpet, and the voice of words, which voice they that heard entreated that the word should not be spoken to them any more.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:4
verses.text: (For they could not endure that which was commanded, And if so much as a beast touch the mountain, it shall be stoned.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:5
verses.text: And so terrible was the sight, that Moses said, I exceedingly fear and quake.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:6
verses.text: ) But ye are come unto Mount Sion, and unto the city of the living God, the Heavenly Jerusalem; and to an innumerable company of Angels, to the general assembly, and Church of the first-born which are written in Heaven; and to God the Judge of all; and to the spirits of just men made perfect: and to Jesus the Mediator of the New Covenant: and to the blood of sprinkling that speaketh better things than that of Abel".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:7
verses.text: Wonderful indeed were the things in the Temple, the Holy of Holies; and again awful were those things also that were done at Mount Sina, "the fire, the darkness, the blackness, the tempest".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:8
verses.text: (Cf.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:9
verses.text: Deut.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:10
verses.text: xxxiii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:11
verses.text: ) For, it says, "God appeared in Sina," and long ago were these things celebrated.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:12
verses.text: The New Covenant, however, was not given with any of these things, but has been given in simple discourse by God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:13
verses.text: See then how he makes the comparison in these points also.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:14
verses.text: And with good reason has he put them afterwards.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:15
verses.text: For when he had persuaded them by innumerable [arguments], when he had also shown the difference between each covenant, then afterwards, the one having been already condemned, he easily enters on these points also.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:16
verses.text: And what says he? "For ye are not come unto a fire that might be touched, and that burned, and unto blackness, and darkness, and tempest, and the sound of a trumpet, and the voice of words; which they that heard entreated that the word should not be spoken to them any more".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:17
verses.text: These things, he means, are terrible; and so terrible that they could not even bear to hear them, that not even "a beast" dared to go up.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:18
verses.text: (But things that come hereafter are not such.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:19
verses.text: For what is Sina to Heaven? And what the "fire which might be touched" to God who cannot be touched? For "God is a consuming fire".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:21
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:22
verses.text: ) For it is said, "Let not God speak, but let Moses speak unto us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:23
verses.text: And so fearful was that which was commanded, Though even a beast touch the mountain, it shall be stoned; Moses said, I exceedingly fear and quake".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:24
verses.text: ( Ex.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:25
verses.text: xx.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:26
verses.text: ) What wonder as respects the people? He himself who entered into "the darkness where God was," saith, "I exceedingly fear and quake".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:27
verses.text: ( Ex.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:28
verses.text: xx.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:29
verses.text: )   "But ye are come unto Mount Sion and unto the city of the living God, the heavenly Jerusalem: and to an innumerable company of angels and to the general assembly and Church of the first-born which are written in Heaven, and to God the Judge of all, and to the spirits of just men made perfect, and to Jesus the Mediator of the New Covenant, and to the blood of sprinkling, that speaketh better [things] than that of Abel".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:30
verses.text: Instead of "Moses," Jesus.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:31
verses.text: Instead of the people, "myriads of angels".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:32
verses.text: Of what "first-born" does he speak? Of the faithful.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:33
verses.text: "And to the spirits of just men made perfect".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:34
verses.text: With these shall ye be, he says.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:35
verses.text: "And to Jesus the mediator of the New Covenant, and to the blood of sprinkling that speaketh better [things] than that of Abel".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:36
verses.text: Did then the [blood] "of Abel" speak? "Yea," he saith, "and by it he being dead yet speaketh".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:38
verses.text: xi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:39
verses.text: ) And again God says, "The voice of thy brother's blood crieth unto Me".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:40
verses.text: ( Gen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:41
verses.text: iv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:42
verses.text: ) Either this [meaning] or that; because it is still even now celebrated: but not in such way as that of Christ.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:43
verses.text: For this has cleansed all men, and sends forth a voice more clear and more distinct, in proportion as it has greater testimony, namely that by facts.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:44
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:46
verses.text: "See that ye refuse not Him that speaketh.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:47
verses.text: For if they escaped not, who refused him that spake on earth, much more shall not we escape, if we turn away from Him that speaketh from heaven.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:48
verses.text: Whose voice then shook the earth: but now hath He promised, saying, Yet once more I shake not the earth only, but also heaven.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:49
verses.text: And this word, Yet once more, signifieth the removing of those things that are shaken, as of things that are made, that those which cannot be shaken may remain.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:50
verses.text: Wherefore we receiving a kingdom which cannot be moved, let us have grace whereby we serve God acceptably with reverence and godly fear.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:51
verses.text: For our God is a consuming fire".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:52
verses.text: Fearful were those things, but these are far more admirable and glorious.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:53
verses.text: For here there is not "darkness," nor "blackness," nor "tempest".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:54
verses.text: It seems to me that by these words he hints at the obscurity of the Old [Testament], and the overshadowed and veiled character of the Law.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:55
verses.text: And besides the Giver of the Law appears in fire terrible, and apt to punish those who transgress.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:56
verses.text: But what are "the sounds of the trumpet"? Probably it is as though some King were coming.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:57
verses.text: This at all events will also be at the second coming.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:58
verses.text: "At the last trump" (  Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:59
verses.text: xv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:60
verses.text: ) all must be raised.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:61
verses.text: But it is the trumpet of His voice which effects this.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:62
verses.text: At that time then all things were objects of sense, and sights, and sounds; now all are objects of understanding, and invisible.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:63
verses.text: And, it says, "there was much smoke".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:64
verses.text: (See Ex.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:65
verses.text: xix.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:66
verses.text: ) For since God is said to be fire, and appeared thus in the bush, He indicates the fire even by the smoke.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:67
verses.text: And what is "the blackness and the darkness"? He again expresses its fearfulness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:68
verses.text: Thus Isaiah also says; "And the house was filled with smoke".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:69
verses.text: ( Isa.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:70
verses.text: vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:71
verses.text: ) And what is the object of "the tempest"? The human race was careless.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:72
verses.text: It was therefore needful that they should be aroused by these things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:73
verses.text: For no one was so dull as not to have had his thoughts raised up, when these things were done, and the Law ordained.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:74
verses.text: "Moses spake, and God answered him by a voice" ( Ex.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:75
verses.text: xix.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:76
verses.text: ): for it was necessary that the voice of God should be uttered.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:77
verses.text: Inasmuch as He was about to promulgate His Law through Moses, therefore He makes him worthy of confidence.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:78
verses.text: They saw him not, because of the thick darkness: they heard him not, because of the weakness of his voice.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:79
verses.text: What then? "God answered by a voice," addressing the multitude: yea and his name shall be called.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:80
verses.text: "They entreated" (he says) "that the word should not be spoken to them any more".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:81
verses.text: From the first therefore they were themselves the cause of God's being manifested through the Flesh.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:82
verses.text: Let Moses speak with us, and "Let not God speak with us".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:83
verses.text: ( Ex.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:84
verses.text: xx.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:85
verses.text: ) They who make comparisons elevate the one side the more, that they may show the other to be far greater.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:86
verses.text: In this respect also our [privileges] are more gentle and more admirable.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:87
verses.text: For they are great in a twofold respect: because while they are glorious and greater, they are more accessible.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:88
verses.text: This he says also in the Epistle to the Corinthians: "with unveiled countenance" (  Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:89
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:90
verses.text: ), and, "not as Moses put a veil over his face".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:91
verses.text: (  Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:92
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:93
verses.text: ) They, he means, were not counted worthy of what we [are].

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:94
verses.text: For of what were they thought worthy? They saw "darkness, blackness"; they heard "a voice".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:95
verses.text: But thou also hast heard a voice, not through darkness, but through flesh.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:96
verses.text: Thou hast not been disturbed, neither troubled, but thou hast stood and held discourse with the Mediator.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:97
verses.text: And in another way, by the "darkness" he shows the invisibleness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:98
verses.text: "And darkness" (it says) "was under His feet".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:99
verses.text: ( Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:100
verses.text: xviii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:101
verses.text: )  Then even Moses feared, but now no one.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:102
verses.text: As the people then stood below, so also do we.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:103
verses.text: They were not below, but below Heaven.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:104
verses.text: The Son is near to God, but not as Moses.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:105
verses.text: There was a wilderness, here a city.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:106
verses.text: "And to an innumerable company of angels".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:107
verses.text: Here he shows the joy, the delight, in place of the "blackness" and "darkness" and "tempest".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:108
verses.text: "And to the general assembly and church of the first-born which are written in Heaven, and to God the Judge of all".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:109
verses.text: They did not draw near, but stood afar off, even Moses: but "ye are come near".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:110
verses.text: Here he makes them fear, by saying, "And to God the Judge of all"; not of the Jews alone, and the faithful, but even of the whole world.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:111
verses.text: "And to the spirits of just men made perfect".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:112
verses.text: He means the souls of those who are approved.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:113
verses.text: "And to Jesus the Mediator of the New Covenant: and to the blood of sprinkling," that is, of purification, "which speaketh better things than that of Abel".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:114
verses.text: And if the blood speaks, much more does He who, having been slain, lives.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:115
verses.text: But what does it speak? "The Spirit also" (he says) "speaketh with groanings which cannot be uttered".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:116
verses.text: ( Rom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:117
verses.text: viii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:118
verses.text: ) How does He speak? Whenever He falls into a sincere mind, He raises it up and makes it speak.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:119
verses.text: "See that ye refuse not Him that speaketh"; that is, that ye reject [Him] not.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:120
verses.text: "For if they escaped not who refused Him that spake on earth".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:121
verses.text: Whom does he mean? Moses, I suppose.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:122
verses.text: But what he says is this: if they, having "refused Him" when He gave laws "on earth, did not escape," how shall we refuse Him, when He gives laws from Heaven? He declares here not that He is another; far from it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:123
verses.text: He does not set forth One and Another, but He appears terrible, when uttering His Voice "from Heaven".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:124
verses.text: It is He Himself then, both the one and the other: but the One is terrible.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:125
verses.text: For he expresses not a difference of Persons but of the gift.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:126
verses.text: Whence does this appear? "For if they escaped not," he says, "who refused Him that spake on earth, much more shall not we escape, if we turn away from Him that speaketh from heaven".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:127
verses.text: What then? Is this one different from the other? How then does he say, "whose voice then shook the earth"? For it was the "voice" of Him who "then" gave the Law, which "shook the earth.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:128
verses.text: But now hath He promised, saying, Yet once more I shake not the earth only, but also heaven.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:129
verses.text: And this word Yet once more, signifieth the removing of those things which are shaken, as of things that are made".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:130
verses.text: All things therefore will be taken away, and will be compacted anew for the better.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:131
verses.text: For this is what he suggests here.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:132
verses.text: Why then dost thou grieve when thou sufferest in a world that abideth not; when thou art afflicted in a world which will very shortly have passed away? If our rest were [to be] in the latter period of the world, then one ought to be afflicted in looking to the end.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:133
verses.text: "That" (he says) "those which cannot be shaken may remain".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:134
verses.text: But of what sort are "those things which cannot be shaken"? The things to come.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:135
verses.text: Let us then do all for this, that we may attain that [rest], that we may enjoy those good things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:136
verses.text: Yea, I pray and beseech you, let us be earnest for this.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:137
verses.text: No one builds in a city which is going to fall down.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:138
verses.text: Tell me, I pray you, if any one said that after a year, this city would fall, but such a city not at all, wouldest thou have built in that which was about to fall? So I also now say this, Let us not build in this world; it will fall after a little, and all will be destroyed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:139
verses.text: But why do I say, It will fall? Before its fall we shall be destroyed, and suffer what is fearful; we shall be removed from them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:140
verses.text: Why build we upon the sand? Let us build upon the rock: for whatsoever may happen, that building remains impregnable, nothing will be able to destroy it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:141
verses.text: With good reason.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:142
verses.text: For to all such attacks that region is inaccessible, just as this is accessible.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:143
verses.text: For earthquakes, and fires, and inroad of enemies, take it away from us even while we are alive: and oftentimes destroy us with it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:144
verses.text: And even in case it remains, disease speedily removes us, or if we stay, suffers us not to enjoy it fairly.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:145
verses.text: For what pleasure [is there], where there are sicknesses, and false accusations, and envy, and intrigues? Or should there be none of these things, yet oftentimes if we have no children, we are disquieted, we are impatient, not having any to whom we may leave houses and all other things; and thenceforward we pine away as laboring for others.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:146
verses.text: Yea oftentimes too the inheritance passes away to our enemies, not only after we are gone, but even while we live.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:147
verses.text: What is more miserable then than to toil for enemies, and ourselves to be gathering sins together in order that they may have rest? And many are the instances of this that are seen in our cities.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:148
verses.text: And yet [I say no more] lest I should grieve those who have been despoiled.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:149
verses.text: For I could have mentioned some of them even by name, and have had many histories to tell, and many houses to show you, which have received for masters the enemies of those who labored for them: nay not houses only, but slaves also and the whole inheritance have oftentimes come round to enemies.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:150
verses.text: For such are things human.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:151
verses.text: But in Heaven there is nothing of this to fear,—lest after a man is dead, his enemy should come, and succeed to his inheritance.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:152
verses.text: For there there is neither death nor enmity; the tabernacles of the saints are permanent abodes; and among those saints is exultation, joy, gladness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:153
verses.text: For "the voice of rejoicing" (it is said) is "in the tabernacles of the righteous".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:154
verses.text: ( Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:155
verses.text: cxviii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:156
verses.text: ) They are eternal, having no end.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:157
verses.text: They do not fall down through age, they do not change their owners, but stand continually in their best estate.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:158
verses.text: With good reason.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:159
verses.text: For there is nothing corruptible, nor perishable there, but all is immortal, and undefiled.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:160
verses.text: On this building let us exhaust all our wealth.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:161
verses.text: We have no need of carpenters nor of laborers.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:162
verses.text: The hands of the poor build such houses; the lame, the blind, the maimed, they build those houses.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:163
verses.text: And wonder not, since they procure even a kingdom for us, and give us confidence towards God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:164
verses.text: For mercifulness is as it were a most excellent art, and a protector of those who labor at it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:165
verses.text: For it is dear to God, and ever stands near Him readily asking favor for whomsoever it will, if only it be not wronged by us; And it is wronged, when we do it by extortion.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:166
verses.text: (See p.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:167
verses.text: ) So, if it be pure, it gives great confidence to those who offer it up.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:168
verses.text: It intercedes even for those who have offended, so great is its power, even for those who have sinned.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:169
verses.text: It breaks the chains, disperses the darkness, quenches the fire, kills the worm, drives away the gnashing of teeth.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:170
verses.text: The gates of heaven open to it with great security: And as when a Queen is entering, no one of the guards stationed at the doors dares to inquire who she is, and whence, but all straightway receive her; so also indeed with mercifulness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:171
verses.text: For she is truly a queen indeed, making men like God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:172
verses.text: For, he says, "ye shall be merciful, as your Heavenly Father is merciful".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:173
verses.text: ( Luke vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:174
verses.text: )  She is winged and buoyant, having golden pinions, with a flight which greatly delights the angels.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:175
verses.text: There, it is said, are "the wings of a dove covered with silver, and her back with the yellowness of gold".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:176
verses.text: ( Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:177
verses.text: lxviii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:178
verses.text: ) As some dove golden and living, she flies, with gentle look, and mild eye.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:179
verses.text: Nothing is better than that eye.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:180
verses.text: The peacock is beautiful, but in comparison of her, is a jackdaw.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:181
verses.text: So beautiful and worthy of admiration is this bird.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:182
verses.text: She continually looks upwards; she is surrounded abundantly with God's glory: she is a virgin with golden wings, decked out, with a fair and mild countenance.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:183
verses.text: She is winged, and buoyant, standing by the royal throne.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:184
verses.text: When we are judged, she suddenly flies in, and shows herself, and rescues us from punishment, sheltering us with her own wings.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:185
verses.text: God would have her rather than sacrifices.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:186
verses.text: Much does He discourse concerning her: so He loves her.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:187
verses.text: "He will relieve" (it is said) "the widow" and "the fatherless" ( Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:188
verses.text: cxlvi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:189
verses.text: ) and the poor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:190
verses.text: God wishes to be called from her.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:191
verses.text: "The Lord is pitiful and merciful, long-suffering, and of great mercy" ( Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:192
verses.text: cxlv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:193
verses.text: ), and true.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:194
verses.text: The mercy of God is over all the earth.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:195
verses.text: She hath saved the race of mankind (see Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:196
verses.text: cxlv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:197
verses.text: ): For unless she had pitied us, all things would have perished.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:198
verses.text: "When we were enemies" (see Rom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:199
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:200
verses.text: ), she "reconciled" us, she wrought innumerable blessings; she persuaded the Son of God to become a slave, and to empty Himself [of His glory].

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:201
verses.text: ( Phil.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:202
verses.text: ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:203
verses.text: )  Let us earnestly emulate her by whom we have been saved; let us love her, let us prize her before wealth, and apart from wealth, let us have a merciful soul.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:204
verses.text: Nothing is so characteristic of a Christian, as mercy.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:205
verses.text: There is nothing which both unbelievers and all men so admire, as when we are merciful.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:206
verses.text: For oftentimes we are ourselves also in need of this mercy, and say to God "Have mercy upon us, after Thy great goodness".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:207
verses.text: ( Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:208
verses.text: li.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:209
verses.text: ) Let us begin first ourselves: or rather it is not we that begin first.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:210
verses.text: For He has Himself already shown His mercy towards us: yet at least let us follow second.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:211
verses.text: For if men have mercy on a merciful man, even if he has done innumerable wrongs, much more does God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:212
verses.text: Hear the prophet saying, "But I" (his words are) "am like a fruitful olive tree in the house of God".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:213
verses.text: ( Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:214
verses.text: lii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:215
verses.text: ) Let us become such: let us become "as an olive tree": let us be laden on every side with the commandments.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:216
verses.text: For it is not enough to be as an olive tree, but also to be fruitful.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:217
verses.text: For there are persons who in doing alms give little, [only once] in the course of the whole year, or in each week, or who give away a mere chance matter.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:218
verses.text: These are indeed olive trees, but not fruitful ones, but even withered.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:219
verses.text: For because they show compassion they are olive trees, but because they do it not liberally, they are not fruitful olive trees.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:220
verses.text: But let us be fruitful.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:221
verses.text: I have often said and I say now also: the greatness of the charity is not shown by the measure of what is given, but by the disposition of the giver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:222
verses.text: You know the case of the widow.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:223
verses.text: It is well continually to bring this example [forward], that not even the poor man may despair of himself, when he looks on her who threw in the two mites.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:224
verses.text: Some contributed even hair in the fitting up of the temple, and not even these were rejected.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:225
verses.text: ( Ex.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:226
verses.text: xxxv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:227
verses.text: ) But if when they had gold, they had brought hair, they [would have been] accursed: but if, having this only, they brought it, they were accepted.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:228
verses.text: For this cause Cain also was blamed, not because he offered worthless things, but because they were the most worthless he had.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:229
verses.text: "Accursed" (it is said) "is he which hath a male, and sacrificeth unto God a corrupt thing".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:230
verses.text: ( Mal.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:231
verses.text: i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:232
verses.text: ) He did not speak absolutely, but, "he that hath" (he says) and spareth [it].

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:233
verses.text: If then a man have nothing, he is freed from blame, or rather he has a reward.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:234
verses.text: For what is of less value than two farthings, or more worthless than hair? What than a pint of meal? But nevertheless these were approved equally with the calves and the gold.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:235
verses.text: For "a man is accepted according to that he hath, not according to that he hath not".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:236
verses.text: (  Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:237
verses.text: viii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:238
verses.text: ) And, it says, "according as thy hand hath, do good".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:239
verses.text: ( Prov.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:240
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:241
verses.text: )  Wherefore, I entreat you, let us readily empty out what we have for the poor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:242
verses.text: Even if it be little we shall receive the same reward with them who have cast the most; or rather, more than those who cast in ten thousand talents.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:243
verses.text: If we do these things we shall obtain the unspeakable treasures of God; if we not only hear, but practice also, if we do not praise [charity], but also show [it] by our deeds.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 33:244
verses.text: Which may we all attain, in Christ Jesus our Lord, with whom to the Father together with the Holy Ghost, be glory, might, honor, now and for ever and world without end, Amen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:1
verses.text: Homily XXXIII.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:2
verses.text: Hebrews xii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:3
verses.text: ,  "Wherefore we receiving a kingdom which cannot be moved, let us have grace [or gratitude,] whereby we serve God acceptably with reverence and godly fear.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:4
verses.text: For our God is a consuming fire".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:5
verses.text: In another place he says the same, "for the things which are seen are temporal, but the things which are not seen are eternal" (.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:6
verses.text: Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:7
verses.text: iv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:8
verses.text: ); and from this makes an exhortation with regard to the evils which we endure in this present life; and here he does this, and says, let us continue steadfast; "let us have thankfulness," i-e:, let us give thanks unto God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:9
verses.text: For not only we ought not to be discouraged at present things, but even to show the greatest gratitude to Him, for those to come.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:10
verses.text: "Whereby we serve God acceptably," that is to say, 'for thus is it possible to serve God acceptably,' by giving him thanks in all things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:11
verses.text: "Do all things" (he says) "without murmurings and disputings".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:12
verses.text: ( Phil.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:13
verses.text: ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:14
verses.text: ) For whatever work a man does with murmuring, he cuts away and loses his reward; as the Israelites—how great a penalty they paid for their murmurings.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:15
verses.text: Wherefore he says, "Neither murmur ye".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:16
verses.text: (  Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:17
verses.text: x.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:18
verses.text: ) It is not therefore possible to "serve" Him "acceptably" without a sense of gratitude to Him for all things, both for our trials, and the alleviations of them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:19
verses.text: That is, let us utter nothing hasty, nothing disrespectful, but let us humble ourselves that we may be reverential.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:20
verses.text: For this is "with reverence and godly fear".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:21
verses.text: C.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:22
verses.text: xiii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:24
verses.text: "Let brotherly love continue.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:25
verses.text: Be not forgetful of hospitality, for hereby some have entertained angels unawares".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:26
verses.text: See how he enjoins them to preserve what they had: he does not add other things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:27
verses.text: He did not say, "Be loving as brethren," but, "Let brotherly love continue".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:28
verses.text: And again, he did not say, "Be hospitable," as if they were not, but, "Be not forgetful of hospitality," for this was likely to happen owing to their afflictions.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:29
verses.text: Therefore (he says) "some have entertained angels unawares".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:30
verses.text: Seest thou how great was the honor, how great the gain!  What is "unawares"? They entertained them without knowing it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:31
verses.text: Therefore the reward also was great, because he entertained them, not knowing that they were Angels.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:32
verses.text: For if he had known it, it would have been nothing wonderful.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:33
verses.text: Some say that he here alludes to Lot also.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:34
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:36
verses.text: "Remember them that are in bonds, as bound with them, them which suffer adversity as being yourselves also in the body.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:37
verses.text: Marriage is honorable in all, and the bed undefiled; but whoremongers and adulterers God will judge.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:38
verses.text: Let your conversation be without covetousness: being content with such things as ye have".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:39
verses.text: See how large is his discourse concerning chastity.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:40
verses.text: "Follow peace," he said, "and holiness; Lest there be any fornicator or profane person" ( c.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:41
verses.text: xii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:42
verses.text: ); and again, "Fornicators and adulterers God will judge".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:44
verses.text: xii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:45
verses.text: ) In every case, the prohibition is with a penalty.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:46
verses.text: "Follow peace with all men," he says, "and holiness, without which no man shall see the Lord: But fornicators and adulterers God will judge".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:47
verses.text: And having first set down "Marriage is honorable in all men, and the bed undefiled," he shows that he rightly added what follows.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:48
verses.text: For if marriage has been conceded, justly is the fornicator punished, justly does the adulterer suffer vengeance.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:49
verses.text: Here he strips for the heretics.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:50
verses.text: He did not say again, Let no one be a fornicator; but having said it once for all, he then went on as with a general exhortation, and not as directing himself against them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:51
verses.text: "Let your conversation be without covetousness," he says.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:52
verses.text: He did not say, Possess nothing, but, "Let your conversation be without covetousness": that is, let it show forth the philosophical character of your mind.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:53
verses.text: [And it will show it, if we do not seek superfluities, if we keep only to what is necessary.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:54
verses.text: ] For he says above also, "And ye took joyfully the spoiling of your goods".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:56
verses.text: x.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:57
verses.text: ) He gives these exhortations, that they might not be covetous.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:58
verses.text: "Being content" (he says) "with such things as ye have".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:59
verses.text: Then here also the consolation; ( ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:60
verses.text: ) "For He" (he says) "hath said, I will never leave thee nor forsake thee"; ( ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:61
verses.text: ) "so that we may boldly say, the Lord is my helper, and I will not fear what man shall do unto me".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:62
verses.text: Again consolation in their trials.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:63
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:64
verses.text: "Remember them which have the rule over you".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:65
verses.text: This he was laboring to say above: therefore "Follow peace with all men".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:67
verses.text: xii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:68
verses.text: ) He gave this exhortation also to the Thessalonians, to "hold them in honor exceedingly".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:69
verses.text: (  Thess.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:70
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:71
verses.text: )  "Remember" (he says) "them which have the rule over you, who have spoken unto you the word of God, whose faith follow, considering the end of their conversation".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:72
verses.text: What kind of following is this? Truly the best: for he says, beholding their life, "follow their faith".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:73
verses.text: For from a pure life [cometh] faith.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:74
verses.text: Or else by "faith," he means steadfastness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:75
verses.text: How so? Because they believe in the things to come.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:76
verses.text: For they would not have shown forth a pure life, if they had questioned about the things to come, if they had doubted.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:77
verses.text: So that here also he is applying a remedy to the same [evil].

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:78
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:80
verses.text: "Jesus Christ the same yesterday and to-day and for ever.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:81
verses.text: Be not carried about with divers and strange doctrines.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:82
verses.text: For it is good that the heart be established with grace, not with meats, which have not profited them that have been occupied therein".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:83
verses.text: In these words, "Jesus Christ the same yesterday and to-day and for ever," "yesterday" means all the time that is past: "to-day," the present: "for ever," the endless which is to come.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:84
verses.text: That is to say: Ye have heard of an High Priest, but not an High Priest who fails.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:85
verses.text: He is always the same.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:86
verses.text: As though there were some who said, 'He is not, another will come,' he says this, that He who was "yesterday and to-day," is "the same also for ever".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:87
verses.text: For even now the Jews say, that another will come; and having deprived themselves of Him that is will fall into the hands of Antichrist.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:88
verses.text: "Be not carried about with divers and strange doctrines".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:89
verses.text: Not "with strange doctrines" only, but neither with "divers ones".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:90
verses.text: "For it is a good thing that the heart be established with grace, not with meats which have not profited them that have been occupied therein".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:91
verses.text: Here he gently hints at those who introduce the observance of "meats".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:92
verses.text: For by Faith all things are pure.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:93
verses.text: There is need then of Faith, not of "meats".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:94
verses.text: For ( ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:95
verses.text: ) "we have an altar whereof they have no right to eat which serve the Tabernacle".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:96
verses.text: Not as the Jewish [ordinances], are those among us, as it is not lawful even for the High Priest to partake of them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:97
verses.text: So that since he had said, "Do not observe," and this seemed to be [the language] of one who is throwing down his own building, he again turns it round.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:98
verses.text: What, have not we then observances as well (he says)? [Yea we have], and we observe them very earnestly too, not sharing them even with the priests themselves.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:99
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:101
verses.text: "For the bodies of those beasts whose blood is brought into the sanctuary by the High Priest for sin, are burned without the camp.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:102
verses.text: Wherefore Jesus also, that He might sanctify the people with His own blood, suffered" (he says) "without the gate".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:103
verses.text: Seest thou the type shining forth? "For sin," he says, and "suffered without the gate".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:104
verses.text: ( Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:105
verses.text: ) "Let us go forth therefore to Him without the camp, bearing His reproach," that is, suffering the same things; having communion with Him in His sufferings.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:106
verses.text: He was crucified without as a condemned person: neither let us then be ashamed to "go forth out" [of the world].

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:107
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:109
verses.text: "For we have here no continuing city" (he says) "but we seek one to come.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:110
verses.text: By Him therefore let us offer the sacrifice of praise to God continually, that is, the fruit of our lips giving thanks to His Name".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:111
verses.text: "By Him," as by an High Priest, according to the flesh.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:112
verses.text: "Giving thanks" (he says) "to His Name".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:113
verses.text: (See p.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:114
verses.text: ) Let us utter nothing blasphemous, nothing hasty, nothing bold, nothing presumptuous, nothing desperate.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:115
verses.text: This is "with reverence and godly fear".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:117
verses.text: xii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:118
verses.text: ) For a soul in tribulations becomes desponding, and reckless.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:119
verses.text: But let not us [be so].

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:120
verses.text: See here he again says the same thing which he said before, "not forsaking the assembling of ourselves together," for so shall we be able to do all things with reverence.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:121
verses.text: For oftentimes even out of respect for men, we refrain from doing many evil things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:122
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:123
verses.text: "But to do good and to communicate forget not".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:124
verses.text: I speak not [merely] with reference to the brethren present, but to those absent also.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:125
verses.text: But if others have plundered your property, display your hospitality out of such things as ye have.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:126
verses.text: What excuse then shall we have henceforward, when they, even after the spoiling of their goods, were thus admonished?   And he did not say, "Be not forgetful" of the entertaining of strangers, but "of hospitality": that is, do not merely entertain strangers, but [do it] with love for the strangers.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:127
verses.text: Moreover he did not speak of the recompense that is future, and in store for us, lest he should make them more supine, but of that already given.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:128
verses.text: For "thereby some" (he says) "have entertained angels unawares".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:129
verses.text: But let us see in what sense "Marriage is honorable in all and the bed undefiled".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:130
verses.text: Because (he means) it preserves the believer in chastity.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:131
verses.text: Here he also alludes to the Jews, because they accounted the woman after childbirth polluted: and "whosoever comes from the bed," it is said, "is not clean".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:132
verses.text: Those things are not polluted which arise from nature, O ungrateful and senseless Jew, but those which arise from choice.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:133
verses.text: For if "marriage is honorable" and pure, why forsooth dost thou think that one is even polluted by it?  "Let your conversation" (he says) "be without covetousness": since many after having exhausted their property, afterwards wish to recover it again under the guise of alms, therefore he says, "Let your conversation be without covetousness"; that is, that we should be [desirous only] of what is necessary and indispensable.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:134
verses.text: What then (you say) if we should not have a supply even of these? This is not possible; indeed it is not.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:135
verses.text: "For He hath said," and He doth not lie, "I will never leave thee, nor forsake thee.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:136
verses.text: So that we boldly say, The Lord is my Helper, and I will not fear what man shall do unto me".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:137
verses.text: Thou hast the promise from Himself: do not doubt henceforward.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:138
verses.text: He has promised; make no question.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:139
verses.text: But this, "I will never leave thee," he says not concerning money only, but concerning all other things also.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:140
verses.text: "The Lord is my Helper, and I will not fear what man shall do unto me"; with good reason.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:141
verses.text: This then also let us say in all temptations; let us laugh at human things, so long as we have God favorable to us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:142
verses.text: For as, when He is our enemy, it is no gain, though all men should be our friends, so when He is our friend, though all men together war against us, there is no harm.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:143
verses.text: "I will not fear what man shall do unto me".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:144
verses.text: "Remember them which have the rule over you, who have spoken unto you the word of God".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:145
verses.text: In this place I think that he is speaking about assistance also.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:146
verses.text: For this is [implied in the words] "who have spoken unto you the word of God".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:147
verses.text: "Whose faith follow considering the end of their conversation".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:148
verses.text: What is, "considering"? Continually revolving, examining it by yourselves, reasoning, investigating accurately, testing it as you choose.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:149
verses.text: "The end of their conversation," that is, their conversation to the end: for "their conversation" had a good end.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:150
verses.text: "Jesus Christ the same yesterday and to-day and for ever".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:151
verses.text: Do not think that then indeed He wrought wonders, but now works no wonders.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:152
verses.text: He is the same.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:153
verses.text: This is, "remember them that have the rule over you".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:154
verses.text: "Be not carried about with divers and strange doctrines".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:155
verses.text: "Strange," that is, different from those ye heard from us; ["Divers"] that is, of all sorts: for they have no stability, but are different [one from another].

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:156
verses.text: For especially manifold is the doctrine of meats.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:157
verses.text: "For it is a good thing that the heart be established with grace; not with meats".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:158
verses.text: These are the "divers," these the "strange" [doctrines]: especially as Christ has said, "not that which entereth into the mouth defileth the man, but that which cometh out".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:159
verses.text: ( Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:160
verses.text: xv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:161
verses.text: ) And observe that he does not make bold to say this openly, but as it were by a hint.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:162
verses.text: "For it is a good thing that the heart be established with grace, not with meats".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:163
verses.text: Faith is all.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:164
verses.text: If that establishes [it], the heart stands in security.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:165
verses.text: It follows that Faith establishes: consequently reasonings shake.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:166
verses.text: For Faith is contrary to reasoning.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:167
verses.text: "Which" (he says) "have not profited them that have been occupied therein".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:168
verses.text: For what is the gain from the observance [of them], tell me.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:169
verses.text: Does it not rather destroy? Does it not make such an one to be under sin? If it be necessary to observe [them], we must guard ourselves.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:170
verses.text: "Which" (he says) "have not profited them that have been occupied therein".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:171
verses.text: That is, who have always diligently kept them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:172
verses.text: There is one observance, abstaining from sin.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:173
verses.text: For what profit is it, when some are so polluted, as not to be able to partake of the sacrifices? So that it did not save them at all; although they were zealous about the observances.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:174
verses.text: But because they had not faith, even thus they profited nothing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:175
verses.text: In the next place he takes away the sacrifice from the type, and directs his discourse to the prototype, saying, "The bodies of those beasts whose blood is brought into the sanctuary by the High Priest, are burned without the camp".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:176
verses.text: Then those things were a type of these and thus Christ, suffering "without," fulfilled all.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:177
verses.text: Here he makes it plain too that He suffered voluntarily, showing that those things were not accidental, but even the [Divine] arrangement itself was of a suffering "without".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:178
verses.text: [He suffered] without, but His Blood was borne up into Heaven.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:179
verses.text: Thou seest then that we partake of Blood which has been carried into the Holy Place, the True Holy Place; of the Sacrifice of which the Priest alone had the privilege.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:180
verses.text: We therefore partake of the Truth [the Reality].

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:181
