verses.text: If then we partake not of "reproach" [only] but of sanctification,  the "reproach" is the cause of the sanctification.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:182
verses.text: For as He was reproached, so also are we.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:183
verses.text: If we go forth "without" therefore, we have fellowship with Him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:184
verses.text: But what is, "Let us go forth to Him"? Let us have fellowship with Him in His sufferings; let us bear His reproach.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:185
verses.text: For He did not simply bid us dwell "outside the gate," but as He was reproached as a condemned person, so also we.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:186
verses.text: And "by Him let us offer a sacrifice to God".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:187
verses.text: Of what kind of sacrifice does he speak? "The fruit of lips giving thanks to His Name".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:188
verses.text: They [the Jews] brought sheep, and calves, and gave them to the Priest: let "us" bring none of these things, but thanksgiving.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:189
verses.text: This "fruit" let "our lips" put forth.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:190
verses.text: "For with such sacrifices God is well pleased".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:191
verses.text: Let us give such a sacrifice to Him, that He may offer [it] to The Father.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:192
verses.text: For in no other way it is offered except through the Son, or rather also through a contrite mind.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:193
verses.text: All these things [are said] for the weak.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:194
verses.text: For that the thanks belong to the Son is evident: since otherwise, how is the honor equal? "That all men" (He says) "should honor the Son even as they honor the Father".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:195
verses.text: ( John v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:196
verses.text: ) Wherein is the honor equal? "The fruit of our lips giving thanks to His Name".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:197
verses.text: Let us bear all things thankfully, be it poverty, be it disease, be it anything else whatever: for He alone knows the things expedient for us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:198
verses.text: "For we know not what we should pray for as we ought".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:199
verses.text: ( Rom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:200
verses.text: viii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:201
verses.text: ) We then who do not know even how to ask for what is fitting, unless we have received of the Spirit, let us take care to offer up thanksgiving for all things, and let us bear all things nobly.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:202
verses.text: Are we in poverty? Let us give thanks.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:203
verses.text: Are we in sickness? Let us give thanks.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:204
verses.text: Are we falsely accused? Let us give thanks: when we suffer affliction, let us give thanks.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:205
verses.text: This brings us near to God: then we even have God for our debtor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:206
verses.text: But when we are in prosperity, it is we who are debtors and liable to be called to account.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:207
verses.text: For when we are in prosperity, we are debtors to God: and oftentimes these things bring a judgment upon us, while those are for a payment of sins.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:208
verses.text: Those [afflictions] draw down mercy, they draw down kindness: while these on the other hand lift up even to an insane pride, and lead also to slothfulness, and dispose a man to fancy great things concerning himself; they puff up.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:209
verses.text: Therefore the prophet also said, "It is good for me, Lord, that Thou hast afflicted me; that I may learn Thy statutes".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:210
verses.text: ( Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:211
verses.text: cxix.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:212
verses.text: ) When Hezekiah had received blessings and been freed from calamities, his heart was lifted up on high; when he fell sick, then was he humbled, then he became near to God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:213
verses.text: "When He slew them," it says, "then they sought Him diligently, and turned, and were early in coming to God".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:214
verses.text: ( Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:215
verses.text: lxxviii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:216
verses.text: ) And again, "When the beloved waxed gross and fat, then he kicked".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:217
verses.text: ( Deut.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:218
verses.text: xxxii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:219
verses.text: ) For "the Lord is known when He executeth judgments".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:220
verses.text: ( Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:221
verses.text: ix.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:222
verses.text: )   Affliction is a great good.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:223
verses.text: "Narrow is the way" ( Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:224
verses.text: vii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:225
verses.text: ), so that affliction thrusts us into the narrow [way].

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:226
verses.text: He who is not pressed by affliction cannot enter.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:227
verses.text: For he who afflicts himself in the narrow [way], is he who also enjoys ease; but he that spreads himself out, does not enter in, and suffers from being so to say wedged in.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:228
verses.text: See how Paul enters into this narrow way.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:229
verses.text: He "keeps under" his "body" (  Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:230
verses.text: ix.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:231
verses.text: ), so as to be able to enter.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:232
verses.text: Therefore, in all his afflictions, he continued giving thanks unto God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:233
verses.text: Hast thou lost thy property? This hath lightened thee of the most of thy wideness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:234
verses.text: Hast thou fallen from glory? This is another sort of wideness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:235
verses.text: Hast thou been falsely accused? Have the things said against thee, of which thou art nowise conscious to thyself been believed? "Rejoice and leap for joy".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:236
verses.text: For "blessed are ye" (He says) "when men reproach you, and say all manner of evil against you, falsely, for My sake.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:237
verses.text: Rejoice and be exceeding glad, for great is your reward in Heaven".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:238
verses.text: ( Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:239
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:241
verses.text: )  Why dost thou marvel, if thou art grieved, and wish to be set free from temptations? Paul wished to be set free, and oftentimes entreated God, and did not obtain.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:242
verses.text: For the "thrice for this I besought the Lord," is oftentimes; "and He said unto me, My grace is sufficient for thee, for My strength is made perfect in weakness".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:243
verses.text: (  Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:244
verses.text: xii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:246
verses.text: ) By "weakness," he here means "afflictions".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:247
verses.text: What then? When he heard this he received it thankfully, and says, "Wherefore I take pleasure in infirmities" (  Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:248
verses.text: xii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:249
verses.text: ); that is, I am pleased, I rest in my afflictions.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:250
verses.text: For all things then let us give thanks, both for comfort, and for affliction.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:251
verses.text: Let us not murmur: let us not be unthankful.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:252
verses.text: "Naked came I out of my mother's womb, naked also shall I depart".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:253
verses.text: ( Job i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:254
verses.text: ) Thou didst not come forth glorious, do not seek glory.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:255
verses.text: Thou wast brought into life naked, not of money alone, but also of glory, and of honorable name.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:256
verses.text: Consider how great evils have oftentimes arisen from wealth.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:257
verses.text: For "It is easier" (it is said) "for a camel to go through the eye of a needle, than for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of Heaven".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:258
verses.text: ( Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:259
verses.text: xix.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:260
verses.text: ) Seest thou to how many good things wealth is a hindrance, and dost thou seek to be rich? Dost thou not rejoice that the hindrance has been overthrown? So narrow is the way which leadeth into the Kingdom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:261
verses.text: So broad is wealth, and full of bulk and swelling out.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:262
verses.text: Therefore He says, "Sell that thou hast" ( Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:263
verses.text: xix.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:264
verses.text: ), that that way may receive thee.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:265
verses.text: Why dost thou yearn after wealth? For this cause He took it away from thee, that He might free thee from slavery.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:266
verses.text: For true fathers also, when a son is corrupted by some mistress, and having given him much exhortation they do not persuade him to part from her, send the mistress into banishment.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:267
verses.text: Such also is abundance of wealth.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:268
verses.text: Because the Lord cares for us, and delivers us from the harm [which arises] therefrom, He takes away wealth from us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:269
verses.text: Let us not then think poverty an evil: sin is the only evil.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:270
verses.text: For neither is wealth a good thing by itself: to be well-pleasing to God is the only good.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:271
verses.text: Poverty then let us seek, this let us pursue: so shall we lay hold on heaven, so shall we attain to the other good things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 34:272
verses.text: Which may we all attain by the grace and lovingkindness of our Lord Jesus Christ, with whom to the Father together with the Holy Ghost be glory, power, honor, now and ever and world without end, Amen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:1
verses.text: Homily XXXIV.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:2
verses.text: Hebrews xiii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:3
verses.text: "Obey them that have the rule over you, and submit yourselves.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:4
verses.text: For they watch for your souls, as they that must give account, that they may do it with joy, and not with grief, for this is unprofitable for you".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:5
verses.text: {{small-caps|Anarchy is an evil, and the occasion of many calamities, and the source of disorder and confusion.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:6
verses.text: For as, if thou take away the leader from a chorus, the chorus will not be in tune and in order; and if from a phalanx of an army thou remove the commander, the evolutions will no longer be made in time and order, and if from a ship thou take away the helmsman, thou wilt sink the vessel; so too if from a flock thou remove the shepherd, thou hast overthrown and destroyed all.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:7
verses.text: Anarchy then is an evil, and a cause of ruin.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:8
verses.text: But no less an evil also is the disobedience to rulers.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:9
verses.text: For it comes again to the same.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:10
verses.text: For a people not obeying a ruler, is like one which has none; and perhaps even worse.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:11
verses.text: For in the former case they have at least an excuse for disorder, but no longer in the latter, but are punished.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:12
verses.text: But perhaps some one will say, there is also a third evil, when the ruler is bad.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:13
verses.text: I myself too know it, and no small evil it is, but even a far worse evil than anarchy.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:14
verses.text: For it is better to be led by no one, than to be led by one who is evil.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:15
verses.text: For the former indeed are oftentimes saved, and oftentimes are in peril, but the latter will be altogether in peril, being led into the pit [of destruction].

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:16
verses.text: How then does Paul say, "Obey them that have the rule over you, and submit yourselves"? Having said above, "whose faith follow, considering the end of their conversation" ( c.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:17
verses.text: ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:18
verses.text: ), he then said, "Obey them that have the rule over you, and submit yourselves".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:19
verses.text: What then (you say), when he is wicked should we obey?  Wicked? In what sense? If indeed in regard to Faith, flee and avoid him; not only if he be a man, but even if he be an angel come down from Heaven; but if in regard to life, be not over-curious.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:20
verses.text: And this instance I do not allege from my own mind, but from the Divine Scripture.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:21
verses.text: For hear Christ saying, "The Scribes and the Pharisees sit on Moses' seat".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:22
verses.text: ( Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:23
verses.text: xxiii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:24
verses.text: ) Having previously spoken many fearful things concerning them, He then says, "They sit on Moses' seat: all therefore whatsoever they tell you observe, do; but do not ye after their works".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:25
verses.text: ( Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:26
verses.text: xxiii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:28
verses.text: ) They have (He means) the dignity of office, but are of unclean life.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:29
verses.text: Do thou however attend, not to their life, but to their words.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:30
verses.text: For as regards their characters, no one would be harmed [thereby].

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:31
verses.text: How is this? Both because their characters are manifest to all, and also because though he were ten thousand times as wicked, he will never teach what is wicked.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:32
verses.text: But as respects Faith, [the evil] is not manifest to all, and the wicked [ruler] will not shrink from teaching it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:33
verses.text: Moreover, "Judge not that ye be not judged" ( Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:34
verses.text: vii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:35
verses.text: ) concerns life, not faith: surely what follows makes this plain.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:36
verses.text: For "why" (He says) "beholdest thou the mote that is in thy brother's eye, but considerest not the beam that is in thine own eye?" ( Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:37
verses.text: vii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:38
verses.text: )  "All things therefore" (He says) "which they bid you observe, do ye" (now to "do" belongs to works not to Faith) "but do not ye after their works".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:39
verses.text: Seest thou that [the discourse] is not concerning doctrines, but concerning life and works?   Paul however previously commended them, and then says, "Obey them that have the rule over you, and submit yourselves, for they watch for your souls, as they that shall give account".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:40
verses.text: Let those who rule also hear, and not only those who are under their rule; that as the subjects ought to be obedient, so also the rulers ought to be watchful and sober.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:41
verses.text: What sayest thou? He watches; he imperils his own head; he is subject to the punishments of thy sins, and for thy sake is amenable to what is so fearful, and art thou slothful, and affectedly indifferent, and at ease? Therefore he says, "That they may do this with joy, and not with grief:  for this is unprofitable for you".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:42
verses.text: Seest thou that the despised ruler ought not to avenge himself, but his great revenge is to weep and lament? For neither is it possible for the physician, despised by his patient, to avenge himself, but to weep and lament.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:43
verses.text: But if [the ruler] lament (he means), God inflicts vengeance on thee.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:44
verses.text: For if when we lament for our own sins we draw God to us, shall we not much rather [do this], when we lament for the arrogance and scornfulness of others? Seest thou that he does not suffer him to be led on to reproaches? Seest thou how great is his philosophy? He ought to lament who is despised, is trodden under foot, is spit upon.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:45
verses.text: Be not confident because he does not avenge himself on thee, for lamenting is worse than any revenge.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:46
verses.text: For when of himself he profits nothing by lamenting, he calls on the Lord: and as in the case of a teacher and nurse, when the child does not listen to him, one is called in who will treat him more severely, so also in this case.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:47
verses.text: Oh! how great the danger! What should one say to those wretched men, who throw themselves upon so great an abyss of punishments? Thou hast to give account of all over whom thou rulest, women and children and men; into so great a fire dost thou put thy head.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:48
verses.text: I marvel if any of the rulers can be saved, when in the face of such a threat, and of the present indifference, I see some still even running on, and casting themselves upon so great a burden of authority.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:49
verses.text: For if they who are dragged by force have no refuge or defense, if they discharge duty ill and are negligent; since even Aaron was dragged by force, and yet was imperiled; and Moses again was imperiled, although he had oftentimes declined; and Saul having been entrusted with another kind of rule, after he had declined it, was in peril, because he managed it amiss; how much more they who take so great pains to obtain it, and cast themselves upon it? Such an one much more deprives himself of all excuse.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:50
verses.text: For men ought to fear and to tremble, both because of conscience, and because of the burden of the office; and neither when dragged to it should they once for all decline, nor, when not dragged cast themselves upon it, but should even flee, foreseeing the greatness of the dignity; and when they have been seized, they ought again to show their godly fear.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:51
verses.text: Let there be nothing out of measure.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:52
verses.text: If thou hast perceived it beforehand, retire; convince thyself that thou art unworthy of the office.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:53
verses.text: Again, if thou hast been seized, in like manner be thou reverential, always showing rightmindedness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:54
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:55
verses.text: "Pray for us" (he says); "for we trust we have a good conscience among all, willing to live honestly".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:56
verses.text: Thou seest that he used these apologies, as writing to persons grieved with him, as to those who turned away, who were disposed as towards a transgressor, not enduring even to hear his name? Inasmuch then as he asked from those who hated him what all others ask from those who love them [their prayers for him], therefore he here introduces this; saying, "We trust that we have a good conscience".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:57
verses.text: For do not tell me of accusations; our conscience, he says, in nothing hurts us; nor are we conscious to ourselves that we have plotted against you.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:58
verses.text: "For we trust," he says, "that we have a good conscience among all," not among the Gentiles only, but also among you.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:59
verses.text: We have done nothing with deceitfulness, nothing with hypocrisy: for it was probable that these [calumnies] were reported respecting him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:60
verses.text: "For they have been informed concerning thee" (it is said) "that thou teachest apostasy".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:61
verses.text: ( Acts xxi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:62
verses.text: ) Not as an enemy, he means, nor as an adversary I write these things, but as a friend.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:63
verses.text: And this he shows also by what follows.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:64
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:65
verses.text: "But I beseech you the rather to do this, that I may be restored to you the sooner".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:66
verses.text: His thus praying was [the act] of one who loved them greatly, and that not simply, but with all earnestness, that so, he says, I may come to you speedily.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:67
verses.text: The earnest desire to come to them is [the mark] of one conscious to himself of nothing [wrong], also the entreating them to pray for him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:68
verses.text: Therefore having first asked their prayers, he then himself also prays for all good things on them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:69
verses.text: ( Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:70
verses.text: ) "Now the God of peace," he says (be ye not therefore at variance one with another), "that brought again from the earth the Shepherd of the sheep" (this is said concerning the resurrection) "the Great [Shepherd]" (another addition: here again he confirms to them even to the end, his discourse concerning the Resurrection) "through the blood of the everlasting covenant, our Lord Jesus Christ," ( ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:71
verses.text: ) "make you perfect in every good work, to do His will, working in you that which is well-pleasing in His sight".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:72
verses.text: Again he bears high testimony to them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:73
verses.text: For that is made "perfect" which having a beginning is afterwards completed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:74
verses.text: And he prays for them which is the act of one who yearns for them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:75
verses.text: And while in the other Epistles, he prays in the prefaces, here he does it at the end.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:76
verses.text: "Working in you," he says, "that which is well-pleasing in His sight through Jesus Christ, to whom be glory for ever and ever, Amen".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:77
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:78
verses.text: "And I beseech you, brethren, suffer the word of exhortation, for indeed I have written a letter unto you in few words".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:79
verses.text: Seest thou that what he wrote to no one [else], he writes to them? For (he means) I do not even trouble you with long discourse.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:80
verses.text: I suppose that they were not at all unfavorably disposed towards Timothy: wherefore he also put him forward.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:81
verses.text: For ( ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:82
verses.text: ) "know ye," he says, "that our brother Timothy is set at liberty, with whom, if he come shortly, I will see you".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:83
verses.text: "Set at liberty," he says; from whence? I suppose he had been cast into prison: or if not this, that he was sent away from Athens.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:84
verses.text: For this also is mentioned in the Acts.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:85
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:87
verses.text: "Salute all them that have the rule over you, and all the saints.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:88
verses.text: They of Italy salute you.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:89
verses.text: Grace be with you all, Amen".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:90
verses.text: Seest thou how he shows that virtue is born neither wholly from God, nor yet from ourselves alone? First by saying, "make you perfect in every good work"; Ye have virtue indeed, he means, but need to be made complete.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:91
verses.text: What is "good work and word"? So as to have both life and doctrines right.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:92
verses.text: "According to His will, working in you that which is well-pleasing in His sight".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:93
verses.text: "In His sight," he says.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:94
verses.text: For this is the highest virtue, to do that which is well-pleasing in the sight of God, as the Prophet also says, "And according to the cleanness of my hands in His eye-sight".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:95
verses.text: ( Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:96
verses.text: xviii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:97
verses.text: )  And having written thus much, he said this was little, in comparison with what he was going to say.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:98
verses.text: As he says also in another place, "As I wrote to you in few words: whereby when ye read, ye may understand my knowledge in the mystery of Christ".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:99
verses.text: ( Eph.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:100
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:102
verses.text: )  And observe his wisdom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:103
verses.text: He says not, "I beseech you, suffer the word of" admonition, but "the word of exhortation," that is, of consolation, of encouragement.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:104
verses.text: No one, he means, can be wearied at the length of what has been said (Did this then make them turn away from him? By no means: he does not indeed wish to express this): that is, even if ye be of little spirit, for it is the peculiarity of such persons not to endure a long discourse.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:105
verses.text: "Know ye that our brother Timothy is set at liberty, with whom if he come shortly I will see you".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:106
verses.text: This is enough to persuade them to submit themselves, if he is ready to come with his disciple.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:107
verses.text: "Salute them that have the rule over you, and all the saints".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:108
verses.text: See how he honored them, since he wrote to them instead of to those [their rulers].

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:109
verses.text: "They of Italy salute you.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:110
verses.text: Grace be with you all, Amen".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:111
verses.text: Which was for them all in common.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:112
verses.text: But how does "Grace" come to be "with" us? If we do not do despite to the benefit, if we do not become indolent in regard to the Gift.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:113
verses.text: And what is "the grace"? Remission of sins, Cleansing: this is "with" us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:114
verses.text: For who (he means) can keep the Grace despitefully, and not destroy it? For instance; He freely forgave thee thy sins.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:115
verses.text: How then shall the "Grace be with" thee, whether it be the good favor or the effectual working of the Spirit ? If thou draw it to thee by good deeds.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:116
verses.text: For the cause of all good things is this, the continual abiding with us of the "grace" of the Spirit.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:117
verses.text: For this guides us to all [good things], just as when it flies away from us, it ruins us, and leaves us desolate.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:118
verses.text: Let us not then drive it from us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:119
verses.text: For on ourselves depends, both its remaining, and its departing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:120
verses.text: For the one results, when we mind heavenly things; the other, when [we mind] the things of this life.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:121
verses.text: "Which the world" (He says) "cannot receive because it seeth Him not, neither knoweth Him".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:122
verses.text: ( John xiv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:123
verses.text: ) Seest thou that a worldly soul cannot have Him? We need great earnestness that so there He may be held fast by us, so as to direct all our affairs, and do them in security, and in much peace.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:124
verses.text: For as a ship sailing with favorable winds is neither to be hindered nor sunk, so long as it enjoys a prosperous and steady breeze, but also causes great admiration according to the march of its progress both to the mariners, and to the passengers, giving rest to the one, and not forcing them to toil on at their oars, and setting the others free from all fear, and giving them the most delightful view of her course; so too a soul strengthened by the Divine Spirit, is far above all the billows of this life, and more strongly than the ship, cuts the way bearing on to Heaven, since it is not sent along by wind, but has all the pure sails filled by the Paraclete Himself: and He casts out of our minds all that is slackened and relaxed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:125
verses.text: For as the wind if it fall upon a slackened sail, would have no effect; so neither does the Spirit endure to continue in a slack soul; but there is need of much tension, of much vehemence, so that our mind may be on fire, and our conduct under all circumstances on the stretch, and braced up.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:126
verses.text: For instance when we pray, we ought to do it with much intentness, stretching forth the soul toward Heaven, not with cords, but with great earnestness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:127
verses.text: Again when we do works of mercy, we have need of intentness, lest by any means, thought for our household, and care for children, and anxiety about wife, and fear of poverty entering in, should slacken our sail.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:128
verses.text: For if we put it on the stretch on all sides by the hope of the things to come, it receives well the energy of the Spirit ; and none of those perishable and wretched things will fall upon it, yea, and if any of them should fall, it does it no harm, but is quickly thrown back by the tightness, and is shaken off and fails down.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:129
verses.text: Therefore we have need of much intentness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:130
verses.text: For we too are sailing over a great and wide sea, full of many monsters, and of many rocks, and bringing forth for us many storms, and from the midst of serene weather raising up a most violent tempest.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:131
verses.text: It is necessary then if we would sail with ease, and without danger, to stretch the sails, that is, our determination: for this is sufficient for us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:132
verses.text: For Abraham also, when he had stretched forth his affections towards God and set before Him his fixed resolution, what else had he need of? Nothing: but "he believed God, and it was counted unto him for righteousness".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:133
verses.text: ( Gen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:134
verses.text: xv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:135
verses.text: ) But Faith [comes] of a sincere will.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:136
verses.text: He offered up his son, and though he did not slay him, he received a recompense as if he had slain him, and though the work was not done the reward was given.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:137
verses.text: Let our sails then be in good order, not grown old (for everything "that is decayed and waxen old is nigh to vanishing away") ( c.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:138
verses.text: viii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:139
verses.text: ), not worn into holes, that so they may bear the energy of the Spirit.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:140
verses.text: "For the natural man," it is said, "receiveth not the things of the Spirit".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:141
verses.text: (  Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:142
verses.text: ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:143
verses.text: ) For as the webs of spiders could not receive a blast of wind, so neither will the soul devoted to this life, nor the natural man ever be able to receive the grace of the Spirit: for our reasonings differ nothing from them, preserving a connection in appearance only but destitute of all power.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:144
verses.text: Our condition, however, is not such, if we are watchful: but whatever may fall upon [the Christian], he bears all, and is above all, stronger than any whirlpool.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:145
verses.text: For suppose there be a spiritual man, and that innumerable calamities befall him, yet is he overcome by none of them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:146
verses.text: And what do I say? Let poverty come upon him, disease, insults, revilings, mockings, stripes, every sort of infliction, every sort of mocking, and slanders, and insults: yet, as though he were outside the world, and set free from the feelings of the body, so will he laugh all to scorn.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:147
verses.text: And that my words are not mere boasting, I think many [such] exist even now; for instance, of those who have embraced the life of the desert.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:148
verses.text: This however, you say, is nothing wonderful.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:149
verses.text: But I say that of those also who live in cities, there are such men unsuspected.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:150
verses.text: If thou wish however, I shall be able to exhibit some among those of old.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:151
verses.text: And that thou mayest learn, consider Paul, I pray thee.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:152
verses.text: What is there fearful that he did not suffer, and that he did not submit to? But he bore all nobly.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:153
verses.text: Let us imitate him, for so shall we be able to land in the tranquil havens with much merchandise.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:154
verses.text: Let us then stretch our mind towards Heaven, let us be held fast by that desire, let us clothe ourselves with spiritual fire, let us gird ourselves with its flame.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:155
verses.text: No man who bears flame fears those who meet him; be it wild beast, be it man, be it snares innumerable, so long as he is armed with fire, all things stand out of his way, all things retire.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:156
verses.text: The flame is intolerable, the fire cannot be endured, it consumes all.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:157
verses.text: With this fire let us clothe ourselves, offering up glory to our Lord Jesus Christ, with whom to the Father, together with the Holy Ghost, be glory, might, honor, now and ever and world without end, Amen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Hebrews 35:158
verses.text: Thanks be to God.
